Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: shooz1Va
Reviews.Content: Location, rooms and food all great. Did not like location of room 1 (right next to hotel desk) so if you want more privacy make sure you book a room on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “C'mon -- You know you want to!”
Reviews.Author: chip161
Reviews.Content: I have little to add to the already wonderful things said about this place, its owners and its staff. (Except, perhaps, where did TripAdvisor get this lobby "photo" -- doesn't look at all like this Hotel.) Practicalities: The rear entrance (straightforward to reach but easy to miss) is less than 90 seconds' walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop (Linea 1 only!). It is also a tricky 12-14 minutes' walk -- with luggage -- from the main rail station (Venezia Sta. Lucia). Get the route and directions from Google Maps. NOTE that it's a long hike getting your luggage up and over the Scalzi Bridge across the Grand Canal, just past the rail station. 10 minutes walk to Rialto (if you don't dawdle, which is almost impossible), and another 10 min. to San Marco. 15 minutes to the Frari Church, and a few minutes more to the Scuola di San Rocco (spectacular, but you gotta love Tintoretto, or it's not worth it). A nice "neighborhood," with a small campo ("campiale") a few meters away and several local-feeling restaurants. Bottom line: A great home in Venice -- we'd be delighted to go back any time, and it would be our first choice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were all fantastic in their level of helpfulness and knowledge of the area. The breakfast was good making a good start to the day and the balcony and it's view were an excellent way to pass the time.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sgrenter
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from our second stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo, as ever an excellent stay, lovely room in the annexe, delicious breakfasts and friendly staff. Best of all is the location very close to the St. Stae valporetto stop on the grand canal, but in a fairly quiet part of the city. We bought 2 actv 72 hour travel cards from the helo Venezia website including the airport hotel transfers (on the no.5 bus), it all worked perfectly and proved a very easy way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Our first taste of Italy”
Reviews.Author: MissBossyBoots
Reviews.Content: Such a memorable place. Our room was a superior double decorated in typical Venetian style. We loved being able to look out on the little canal. It was ideally located near the San stae vaporetto stop and close walking distance to the Rialto and St marks. We went to a concert in a church nearby due to advertisement from the hotel - interpreti veneziana and their version of vivaldis four seasons amongst others - wonderful. Breakfast was fine. Donatello and Walter were incredibly helpful. We loved it so much that we are staying again at the end of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Gem unearthered”
Reviews.Author: Alis0n1968
Reviews.Content: Lovely ,friendly hotel in a great location right on the vaporetto stop. Nothing is too much trouble for the owners and staff, the rooms are quite small but elegantly furnished, and really excellent value for money. I would definately stay again .

Reviews.Title: “High expectations - delivered”
Reviews.Author: madhavi
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice along with my wife and daughter. Stayed at Al Ponte Mocenigo, We had 2 large suite cases plus 2 pieces of hand luggage. We had very clear directions from the hotel on how to get there. We took the Line #1 from Piazzale Roma and got down at St. Stae. It is just 100 yards away from the boat station. And no bridges - that is the easy part. Most hotels in Venice will require you to climb over bridges with luggage to get there if you use public transport. We had a room at the annex. This was informed right the day after the booking. Our room was very tastefully furnished, Very clean. We actually had a 2-room suite type accommodation with a sofa bed, TV, safe, table with 2 chairs, in the living room. Double bed and another TV, fridge, etc in the bed room. Small, yet very functional bathroom. Again very clean. Wi-fi was free and super fast. The front desk staff were helpful. Breakfast was simple and good. Very cheerful staff to help at the breakfast room. The housekeeping staff were the best we have seen - they not only do good cleaning but also tidy up everything in the room including the toiletries left on the basin, etc. I had read quite few reviews before and had high expectations. They just live up to it. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Jennie G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over new years eve in the room with the balcony. Lovely to be away from the crowds but rather walk there and back. The management recommended good restuaraunts and even secured us a table at a renowned restuaraunt on NYE by advancing the cash deposit. The staff were friendly and the facilities clean. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Venice,really”
Reviews.Author: RolandToth
Reviews.Content: Thank you my dear Tripadvisor friends. I booked the hotel, because of the great reviews. I paid 95 EUR for a DBL superior room! The location is just perfect, romantic, i had a room with a little balcony. It was just superb! nice receptionist, very good croissants for a breakfest (yes, not too much things, but really nice atmosfere) the hotel has a nice garden, for summer this is a PLUS. very nice, calm locations, just 50m from the vaporetto stop, its visavie the famous Wagner villa (where Wagner died) I WILL COME BACK FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Topatntails
Reviews.Content: An ideal place to stay, in a quiet location but within walking distance of everything you'd want. Nice clean rooms, good food, friendly staff and fairly priced. Couldn't fault it and fully intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Forget Our Time in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Shannan P
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor to plan our Italian vacation and I was not disappointed! We loved Al Ponte Mocenigo for its charm, authentic Venetian experience, and friendly staff! It was also nice to get away from the bustle of St. Mark's Plaza into a quieter, cozy neighborhood. They had a fantastic breakfast and we had the ability to walk from any location in Venice. We had some trouble finding it because we got in to the city with major jet lag and late at night, but it is very accessible by public transport and right next to the San Stae stop. We're already planning our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great family room”
Reviews.Author: joereddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few years ago in their family room, spacious, clean and furnished in stylish manner.

Reviews.Title: “stylish warm and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: despina t
Reviews.Content: After a trip to Russia we came to Venice to see our Daughter who is studying there . From the moment we arrived to this cosy stylish imaculate boutique hotel we felt very comfortable . We had 8 nights and our daughter was given a room next to ours it was so nice the way they looked after us !!Walter and Sandro really run a very personel service together with their friendly staff the breakfast was delicous with warm pastries and great coffee. We would highley recomend this hotel !! Despina and Brian

Reviews.Title: “Some suggestions on enjoying Venice...”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: While it's difficult to add much to the reviews, here is a guide to planning your visit to Venice. 1. Make a reservation at Al Ponte Mocenigo as soon as you decide to go to Venice. It is a small hotel and fills up quickly. 2. Go to www.veniceconnected.com and buy a Vaparetto Pass. You can buy them online at a 25% discount. You hand your receipt in to any ticket booth and they give you a pass. The pass makes staying at Al Ponte Mocenigo even more convenient. We found this by accident, but it is legitimate and saves you a few dollars. 3. Go to www.veniceurbanadventures.com and book the Cichette tour with Cecilia for the first night you arrive. It leaves from directly across the Grand Canal from Al Ponte Mocenigo and is a wonderful and delicious way to learn your way around Venice. You can read the reviews for the tour on TA. 4. The map that Sandro and Walter give you has the main walking routes in Venice highlighted in yellow. These routes are very helpful for getting around. I agree that Al Ponte Mocenigo should be at 3 star hotel. Our room, Annex 44, was as nice as any room in a 5 star hotel, and probably larger! The staff could not have been nicer. The fresh baked croissants were wonderful. I also agree with the comments about the firm bedding, but we found that in a number of hotels in Italy. Before arriving we were concerned about the hotel location in Santa Croce. After a couple of days we learned the shortcuts and how close the hotel is to almost everything. If you get a Vaparetto pass you think nothing of jumping on to cross the Canal to get to Cannaregio and a number of good restaurants. A 3 or 4 stop trip takes you to the Rialto Bridge, which is a 5 minute walk from St. Marks Square (look on the map for Mercerie dell Orologio). This route is much faster than taking the Vaparetto to St. Marks, which can take 40 minutes from San Stae. There are also a number of good restaurants near the hotel. We enjoyed Al Ponte del Megio, a short walk from the hotel. La Zucca gets very good reviews, but book early, as we could not get in during our visit. Sandro and Walter were very help with recommendations and reservations. Enjoy Al Ponte Mocenigo and Venice!

Reviews.Title: “a real gem”
Reviews.Author: madch82
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with my mother - who had hurt herself and had to walk with crutches. We we're given the room next to the reception, so that she wouldn't have to climb any stairs. So thoughtful. From the minute we arrived, the staff we're so helpful and pleasant. More than willing to help reserve a place for dinner or show us how to get from one spot to the next. Even before we arrived they were fantastic - patiently answering all my mother's endless queries. By accident we paid twice for a concert - they realised the mix up and had the refund ready before we even had time to ask! Very honest. Great location, great rooms, great breakfast with fantastic staff. it deserves it's first spot on trip advisor 100%

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with charming hosts.”
Reviews.Author: QuoVadis2008
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi from the airport in pouring rain and the taxi 'driver' let us off at the first set of steps along the side canal to the hotel. In fact, we found out from Walter at the hotel that the taxi could have got right next to the hotel and saved us a 100 metres walk in the rain! The 'driver' was in a great hurry, and we knew no better. Let others be warned ! The hotel is in a very quiet area of the city - many people still live there, and the shops and restaurants reflected this (our best meal was in the Osteria Mocenigo restaurant which was 1 minute from the hotel). Yet the hotel is only 2 minutes from S Stae water bus stop on the Grand Canal, where the Number 1 service stops, and also the orange Allilaguna service to/from the airport. Our room (33) was in the annexe, and was spacious and comfortably furnished in traditional Venetian style. We got a good nights sleep in the comfortable bed. The room was up 4 flights of stairs (no lift), and was at the rear of the building overlooking a small courtyard. It got the morning sun and was very quiet. Sandro and Walter were charming hosts, and full of useful information about the city. All the staff were likewise very friendly and helpful. All in all, an outstanding hotel for a reasonable price in a city where there are lots of average, expensive hotels! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: 945mac007
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel: very pleasant, friendly and helpful staff, from the owners (who work on Reception in the morning,several days a week) to the cheery staff who serve breakfast. Spotlessly clean and, good breakfast supplied and good location. No views however but top notch apart from that!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hordes, yet very convenient”
Reviews.Author: DublinFlyer
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel, in a quiet and untouristy area, yet really convenient for the main vaparetto Line 1 at San Stae. I got the 72 hour vaporetto pass and it covered my 3 night stay, and I had the freedom to hop on-hop off as I felt like. My room was spacious, comfortable and well decorated, with lovely old beams from which hung a Murano glass chandelier. Being such a historical building the window was really small and allowed very little daylight in, but there were plenty of lights. Staff were friendly and I enjoyed the continetal breakfast with croissants, bread, cheese, cereal, fresh fruit salad and coffee. Standards of cleanliness were exellent. It is very quiet at night, and in spite of the narrow alleys it is a very safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the gate, this hotel was a lovely surprise. We were a little dubious as the price was so reasonable and we had been disappointed before. But we were met with friendly, helpful service, a beautifully appointed and very clean room, a comfortable bed, loads of space/storage, a substantial breakfast including croissants, cereal, cappuccinos and fresh fruit; but best of all - the location was superb. The only negative was that we didn't spend enough time in Venice. We hope to be back and spend longer in this very special hotel and city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Tricia0763
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights in Venice staying in this lovely hotel. It was easily found thanks to someone's helpful tips on here and the hotel's website. We were welcomed by Sandro who was very obliging and recommended retaurants for two of our nights and made the bookings there and then. We were not disappointed by either- one was La Zucca and the other was on the opposite of the the little canal to it - name eludes me. Our room was in the annexe, about a minute's walk way if that, and was delightfully Venetian - it even came with a true Venetian glass chadelier that would look out of place anywhere but Venice! The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom likewise.My only critcism after three nights, and it is a personal one, is that the bed was a bit too hard and I would have liked the air conditioning to have been provided: we slept with the windows open as I always do at home where we have no air con but it did mean that i was woken each morning by people going about their business or children going to school. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is in a very quiet part of Venice and leaving the windows open in other parts of the city would have meant no sleep at all! Breakfast was lovely - choice of hot drinks and warm filled fresh croissants amongst the offerings. All the staff were very friendly too. We met the other partner, Walter, and he was equally helpfully. As I write this it again occurs to me why has it only been awarded a 2 star? It is surely a 3 at least! So, go, enjoy a lovely stay in this incredible and unique city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Sheffield1980
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo on the strength of it's Tripadvisor reviews for a special trip for my girlfriend's 30th birthday. In short, it was fantastic. The staff were all friendly and couldn't do enough for us - they recommended restaurants and even booked them for us. Rooms were fab - old school Venetian splendour, spotless and well cleaned on a daily basis. Breakfast was great, nice pastries and fruit - just what you need to start the day. All the ladies in the breakfast room were super friendly. We even turned up 20 minutes early for breakfast one day due to me messing up the clocks changing and the owner on reception insisted we sit down and personally prepared our tea. Nice location near San Stae vaprotto stop, it's quiet and you don't need to be in the thick of it as nowhere is difficult to get to in Venice. Prices are very reasonable as well - especially compared to other Venice hotels. I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else now if we return to Venice and hugely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlemissn99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in this lovely little hotel, having been recommended it by friends. We had room 3, which is on the ground floor, near the breakfast room. We thought the noise of breakfast etc may disturb us early in the morning, but it didnt at all. All the staff here were really welcoming, helpful and friendly, and really couldn't do enough for guests. We liked the fact that the hotel is about a minutes walk from the vaporetto stop, very convenient. Breakfasts were amazing - warm croissants - Yum! The only thing I would say is that the matress in the room was REALLY firm - even for those with a prefernce for firm matresses, I would say this was at the limit! But this did not detract form our enjoyment of the stay and hotel. Definitely would go back, and defintiely would recommend. A perfect find.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tankster
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our third trip to Venice- a city unlike any other. We love it, and have stayed a week each time we have gone, however this is our first trip to Al Ponte Mocenigo. What a wonderful find- the price is right, the location is perfect (especially if you are prone to getting alittle lost, being right at the San Stae stop makes sure you make it back). Location is only part however, the owners and the staff have just the right touch in managing a small hotel, they are present, helpful and always friendly, but not overly so, which can sometimes happen in small hotels. The beds are great (not always true in Venice), the room decor is fun and colorful, and the price is reasonable. I would recommend this hotel if you like charm and a home-like atmosphere. It is not the Four Seasons, it is not glitzy, they do not have an elevator, and while breakfast is plentiful and fresh, it is not the huge/multicourse affair in larger hotels. If you go, take a bottle of wine and some glasses and sit on the steps at the San Stae stop... you get the full effect of the Grand Canal at half the price of the hotels with fancy decks!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MimG1
Reviews.Content: All you read about this hotel is true! Its a wonderful place to stay, the staff, from the owners to the most junior member are great. The rooms, service, location is brilliant, there is nothing bad to say about this hotel, even the cost for Venice was very reasonable. We would certainly stay again next time we go. Everything you want is provided, nothing lacking at all - wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4th visit....need we say more!”
Reviews.Author: Moka
Reviews.Content: Another perfect stay at our favourite Venice hotel.First class throughout from the friendliness of Walter and Sandro and their amazing team of staff,the ideal situation of the hotel,the size and cleanliness of the rooms and the delightful breakfast.Nothing is too much trouble for any of them and they make you feel comfortable and at home and always make time to have a chat with you.We stayed in the annexe for the first time and enjoyed a lovely large room-32-with a spotlessly clean bathroom which had a bath and a superb large headed shower attachment aswell as a separate smaller room with large single bed,table,chairs and tv all furnished to the highest standard.We particularly enjoy eating out at Al Nonos not far from the hotel and Restaurant San Trovaso just behind The Accademia on the right hand side- the hotel staff will happily phone and make a reservation for you.One of the high lights of the trip was meeting and having our photo taken with Francesco Da Mosto in Campo San Polo as he was being interviewed for his new tv show!!! We love Venice and we love Al Ponte Mocenigo and hope to return soon.Many thanks to all the staff.A and S Moon.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: CandSLincoln
Reviews.Content: Well run, well situated, comfortable, spotlessly clean with friendly and efficient staff. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lindsay a
Reviews.Content: I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Venice. The location is perfect. It's near a vaparetto stop, so you don't have to drag your luggage over a bunch of bridges. It is only a short walk to most attractions but also in a quieter area of Venice. We arrived early, and our room was already ready for us. We stayed in the main building, and the room was clean, decorated in beautiful Venetian furnishings, but also had modern amenities. The breakfast was wonderful and the service superb. I can't believe this is only a two start hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: astra02
Reviews.Content: we stayed with my husband for 3 nights in a room with canal view at the new(!) building. the size of the room( really big), the decoration( high quality venetian style), the daily cleanliness, the breakfast, the staff, all were perfect. i definetely recomend it to everyone!!!!!!as for the stars (2**) ,this lovely hotel must be at least awarded 4*

Reviews.Title: “Official rating 2* but worth 5*”
Reviews.Author: Maureen R
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel very close to S Stae vaparetto/Alilaguna stop on the Grand Canal. External appearance and entrance belies it's beautifully restored interior. We spent 5 nights in a large room (no. 32) on the second floor in the annex just round the corner with a small balcony overlooking the quiet street. The room and particularly the bathroom was spotlessly clean. The owners and staff were very pleasant and helpful and happy to give good advice on getting around. Trip Advisor was right, this hotel is well worth it's no. 1 rating. We arrived home on 10th March and have already recommended it to interested friends. We took the Alilaguna boat service from the airport(7 minute walk from terminal) to S Stae. May not be the cheapest option at 25 euros return but straightforward, especially with luggage. Many of the supposedly more upmarket hotels are not this convenient. You will see people all over Venice trailing cases over bridges! The hotel is only a 10 minute stroll from the Rialto (take one of the hotel's maps) and 20 minutes from St Mark's Square or take the vaparetto from S Stae down the Grand Canal. Official rating is 2* but in our opinion we heartily agree with the overwhelming majority of the other reviewers that this hotel cannot be faulted. We grant it 5* s.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jacqrenee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel during our holiday in Venice. We were very happy with the service we received both before we arrived and upon arrival. The rooms are very neat and clean. Not far from the train station, plenty of restaurants nearby. Would definately recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: LBC3691
Reviews.Content: Another happy traveler. This hotel is consistent in offering excellent customer service and all staff is always ready to help with any requests. Breakfast was excellent, typical Italian and the hotel's location was also great, less than 3 minutes from the S. Stae vaporetto station so it was very easy to travel with heavy luggage. Our room was located in the new annex and was quite large with separate bathroom/shower, large bedroom and a kitchenette/dining room. All Venice sites are easily accessible by walking and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “CONSISTANTLY HIGH STANDARD”
Reviews.Author: TREFANEL
Reviews.Content: Following another visit to this charming hotel, I feel I must comment on how it never changes, the staff are friendly and efficient, the hotel is spotless, nothing is too much trouble. It is located in " real " Venice and yet just a 10 min walk away from the main tourist sights. Charming restaurants are close by , and it doesn't matter if you are in the hotel or the annexe the standards are just the same. Well done Sandro and Walter what a team!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surely, the best choice!”
Reviews.Author: Felipe O
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice! in a very good location. Near Central station and Rialto Bridge! Not far from S. MarcoÂ´s square!!!! The san stae VaporettoÂ´s station is in its door. The rooms are amazing, 17th/18th century stile.... almost a palace....the receptionists are friendly! good breakfast included.. Unforgetable carnival days.... thereÂ´s a very good restaurant few steps from there... called "MURO"...

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: katharinej
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel based around the great reviews and it did not disappoint! Lovely Venetian style room (we stayed in the new section). Close location to San Stae vaparetto stop and not far from Rialto. Friendly, helpful staff, really clean rooms, delicious pastries at breakfast and a nice quiet area. Our room was too warm when we first arrived but after getting to grips with the heating system and getting a fan in the room, this was resolved. Tea/coffee facilities in the room would be a great addition. The hairdryer in the bathroom is useless, so I would bring your own. These are only small things and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We had a wonderful stay in Venice and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, location and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: CatherineDevon66
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. On arrival we were shown up to our room (Room 9 - the Red Room), it was beautiful, with an extra bed made up for our three year old daughter, and spotlessly clean. Very spacious with a lovely bathroom too. Breakfast was delicious, the croissants were amazing and my daughter especially enjoyed the very chocolatey hot chocolate. The staff were all very hospitable and helpful, advising us about various boats and timetables. The location was perfect for us - very close to a vaporetto stop if you need it and in a quiet location yet very easy to walk to Rialto and the more popular attractions of Venice. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Venice. Would recommend a visit to the Rialto Fish Market and the Fruit & Veg Market - the produce is mouthwatering!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, charming location”
Reviews.Author: Adjii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last three days of our honeymoon. It was cute, clean, and was a good price for a good sized room. We didn't get any extraordinay honeymoon treatment but the staff was warm and helpful none the less. Like others have said, the croissants are unbelievable. The breakfast is great. We loved the location because it was away from the crowds and made for wonderful romantic strolls but still wasn't far from the main attractions. I highly recommend eating at Alla Zucca, in the area. Have whomever is at the reception desk make a reservation for you. If you are a foodie, you will LOVE it. Way better than any tourist trap next to the Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: garymeth5
Reviews.Content: This hotel takes you back in time and demonstrates what hotels 300 years ago must have been like, except in room fridge, hi-speed Internet, and plenty of hot water. This was marvelous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Countrybumpkin94
Reviews.Content: Whilst I really hate to detract from the very positive reviews of the hotel, I have to be honest and report that we were very disappointed with our room. The view from both windows (no. 7) was directly on to a crumbling wall little more than two feet away. I appreciate that this is only a 'standard' room, but it was very dark and cave-like, needing all the lights on - even though there was bright sunshine every day of our four-day stay. Having said that, the location was perfect with plenty of bistros within less than two minutes' walk; the owner and staff very friendly and helpful; the room and bathroom immaculately clean. A couple of tips: try to avoid room no. 7 and bring your own toiletries if you like a little luxury. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent hospitality, awesome breakfast croissants”
Reviews.Author: Elnie L
Reviews.Content: We had a great room on the second floor with a balcony and canal view, plus another window facing the court yard. Room was nice and roomy, with lovely high ceiling. The bathroom was nice, and I love the radiator towel racks. Nothing beats a warm towel when stepping out of a shower in winter. Hotel staff were so warm and helpful. It's also a plus that they carry a range of Venice tourist information books. Breakfast croissant was the best I've ever had. Fresh out of the oven (even though I realize they didn't bake it themselves), hot and bouncy (so bouncy, I had to take a video of my finger pressing it, just to show the bounceback). Great waiting staff who come around offering refills for coffee and/or tea. I'd stay at this place again if I ever visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MelanieB410
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault this hotel. We've been to Venice many times and this is the best hotel we've stayed in in terms of location and value for money. The staff are really friendly and helpful, room was lovely and breakfasts were great. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This place is #1 for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: MaryM1225
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early February 2012. We chose this hotel because of the ratings/reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. This hotel is beautiful, extremely clean, and comfortable. We stayed in the annex and it was perfect and private. The room was spacious and the decor was perfect. It felt like we'd travelled back in time to another era, except with all the modern necessities! The staff was friendly, polite and helpful when we needed recommendations for dinner. The hotel is just a very short walk from the Vaparetto stop, which was fantastic. Breakfast was served every morning at 8 am. The food was fresh, tasty and plentiful. I loved this hotel, and would recommend it in a heartbeat to anyone travelling to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “the best 2 star hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: soceanu
Reviews.Content: if you want a small romantic beautiful place in venice - this is the place for you ! the differnt here is the oweners sandro a walter a staff - they treat you like a familly ! dont miss the morning coffee a croissant- the best in italy next time in venice-only with sandro a walter -the small details are everything ! p.s - the professional photos are not from hotel al ponte mocenigo !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: DeviBabi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 friends for 3 nights and thought it was very good. I was concerned if the room was going to be big enough for 3 people and it definitely was. I didn't sleep on the extra bed but my friend who did said it was comfortable and cosy (important because it was freezing in Venice). The rooms are well decorated and the bathrooms large and clean. We had to change rooms because of a double booking (but I was informed about this well in advance so it wasn't a problem). The room swap was easy, they sorted everything out when we went sightseeing for the day. The croissants at breakfast are to die for and the breakfast buffet is generous. Lots of fruit, pastries, cereals and bread with plenty of Nutella to go around. The staff also make sure you have enough coffee and the coffee is good (but then it is Italy!). The staff at the reception were charming and helpful and made our stay extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a place”
Reviews.Author: 69Calvin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights last September and still talk about it amongst ourselves and to our friends. The hotel is small and quaint and run by the nicest gentlement we met in Italy! We stayed in the secondary building and the room was spacious by Europe standard and was more then big enough for all 3 of us ( my boyfriend and 18 year old son). The best parts of this hotel are nice, spacious clean rooms, scrumptious breakfast included in private terrace, short distance to vaporetto and a very reasonable price. Despite the many cities included in our last trip to Europe , a piece of our hearts stayed in Venice and we have vowed to return to this exact location before too long... Sandro and Walter, as promised, if you ever find yourselves in Montreal please look us up.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: Marie O
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here after reading numerous positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We have to add to their accolades. Perfect spot, well placed for venturing forth around Venice. Beautifully appointed rooms with stellar service and friendly staff who are more than happy to help with everything. Close to the San Stae stop and easy to travel to and from the airport (unless the canals are freezing). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel personifying venetian charm and elegance”
Reviews.Author: billyshirt
Reviews.Content: A very short walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop, we arrived on the Alilaguna boat service from the airport - the best and most economical way (25 euro return ticket) to arrive at this hotel. We stayed in room 10 (junior suite with small balcony overlooking the courtyard), which was extremely spacious, full of fine venetian baroque furnishings - including a lovely four poster (himmel) bed. The bathroom was also spacious and very clean with a hydro-bath thrown in! The staff were extremely helpful, offering a number of restaurant choices when asked - lovely restaurant 'Osteria Mocenigo' on the San Stae main street very close to the hotel. Breakfast was simple but good - apricot croissants and bread rolls with whichever kind of coffee you cared to ask for. Free wifi in your room - a bonus for those who like that kind of thing. Italian three pin plugs were a problem, as euro adapters would not fit, but hotel staff again were extremely helpful having a number of English, european and American spare adaptors at reception if asked for. All in all a very comfortable and relaxing stay - Venice in winter may have been very cold for walking around, but then less tourists made for a more atmospheric and special feeling to the place. The Sante Croce district is well worth exploring and although away from the popular tourist haunts, it was very easy to get to anywhere in the city - invest in a Vaporetto 1/2/3 day ticket and it makes exploring the city all the more easier and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: davidhuerta
Reviews.Content: fantastic find. Mere steps from the San Stae stop. Comfort, Service & Location. Continental breakfast in the courtyard is wonderful. Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: benkrakow
Reviews.Content: A wonderful surprise for our stay in that quite hotel. Our room in the annex (20 meters away from the hotel) was nicely furbished in a totally venician style. The room had a large space, the king sized bed was really comfortable and the bathroom perfect with the bath (really welcomed after a long day walk in freezing temperatures !). The staff was really professional and helpfull. The breakfast was nice and sufficient with caring waitresses. We will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kristy_Steve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the reviews of TripAdvisor - and we are very glad we did. This place is a really small hotel, clean, excellent location and breakfast. But what we loved is that this was not the impersonal hotel experience - we felt welcomed and enjoyed talking to the owner about Venice and his experiences. We felt very much at home and would recommend this to travellers looking for more than just a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: luvdodo
Reviews.Content: Right next to the water taxi, fantastic, service and the best breakfast ever! The room was clean and brand new (renovated). The owners were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable!!!! The Best choice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos d
Reviews.Content: Really impressed by the place, the room and the service. We will come back for sure!!!! Very good situation, the rooms comfortable and beautiful!!!. The situation was great. We spent a wonderful time, the owners were very friendly and helpful....Really the best choice you can do!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kfloCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I changed my reservation to this hotel after it was voted #1 and I read all the hundreds of reviews that travelers made of this hotel. I don't have anything much different to add than all the other travelers noted in their reviews. It is a good value. Very charming hotel. Extremely clean given how old it is. I gave up a free room at the Hilton to stay here, and was not disappointed with my decision. Check-in was pleasant and much closer to vaporetto than expected. Had room in annex. Was a little worried about safety walking through a tiny alley to get to the annex, and my husband was angry with me in that he had to walk up a steep stairway with no railings to get to the room. But room was large and spotless. Service was pleasant. Bathroom is exceptional, except again that bathtub did not have a railing to hold onto and my husband had extreme difficulty with that. I would recommend they add some simple safety precautions (railings), but other than that I have nothing but great memories of this hotel. Breakfast was simple. Nothing special other than warm croissants. I was worried that location was out of the way, but walking to everything was so simple and easy. Vaporetto stop so convenient. I recommend the vaporetto pass. Although everything is easy to walk to, it is a luxury just to sit on the boat and tour around the canal at sunset everyday. Also pays off if you're touring murano and burano. The restaurant Osteria Mocenigo a few doors down from the hotel was exceptional and not over-priced. Had fun eating everywhere in venice. I put my review books down and just enjoyed stepping into any restaurant, and was not disappointed with food or pricing anywhere in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: 146Louise
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite with our two teenage children aged 16 and 14 for three nights in January. The room was huge and the kids both had single beds. The bathroom was also massive and spotless. The breakfast was beautiful with the best croissants I have ever tasted. All of the staff were really friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Loggins11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the junior suite; both the room and bathroom were spacious and clean. In addition to a king-sized bed and tall wardrobe, there was also a writing table, breakfast table and chairs, a chaise longue, and a small TV. The reception staff were friendly and helpful as were the wait staff who served breakfast every morning. We loved the location. The hotel was a short walk from the San Stae water bus stop. Ponte Rialto and Piazza San Marco were about a 15-minute walk away (probably longer if you prefer a stroll to a brisk walk). There were restaurants nearby, as well as a small deli and a wine shop. Highly recommended. Â

Reviews.Title: “Good service & location, cold floors”
Reviews.Author: karnat
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Mocegino was our choice of stay for our honeymoon in Venice. It was overall very nice and we enjoyed staying there. The hotel is very easy to find, it's right by the vaporetto stop, making easy to get to and from. We stayed in the main building, but the hotel also has an annex around the corner. Our room was spacious and well furnished. We had a big double bed, two small couches (each can fit two people), other furniture was made of quality dark wood. All the rooms in the hotel were different and had it's own style, all very pretty. There was apparently a fireplace in our room one day, which was re-modeled to be a spot for the table, which looks very cute. The bathroom was clean and fresh towels and bath appliances were re-stocked daily. The breakfast doesn't include the usual for most travellers meats and cheezes, but the apricot croissants are to die for! All the staff was pleasant and helpful, always giving advice and diretions, etc. They helped us to arrange for the tickets for the concert we wanted to go to, and prepared coffees in the late hours in the evening on our request as well. We were very pleased with the service. There was slow, but free wi-fi in the hotel. What made our stay not so pleasant: the room was VERY cold. Maybe because of the high ceilings, but even when we left the heat/light on for the entire day, it never quite warmed up. So every night we had to use 2 extra blankets we found in the wardrobe. This heat issue was problemtic for us, as we stayed in Venice in late November - and after walking around the city all day, we were craving some warmth of the room when we got back. Another thing was bare floors - there are no carpeting at all, and no rugs. That would be fine if the floor was wooden, but Al Ponte has stone floors - and they are cold. So even in the evening when you're in your pijamas, you had to keep your shoes on (no slippers were provided). The rooms is also very dark, it gets no light at all - but I assume that's a common problem for the buildings in tiny Venice streets.

Reviews.Title: “A great Christmas stay!”
Reviews.Author: Minnamurra2533
Reviews.Content: Another great find from Trip Advisor! I don't know why you would want to be right in the very centre of Venice when you can stay here, at much cheaper rates, and explore Venice as you make your way to the sites. We had a week here over Christmas in the red room (very Christmassy!). It was a wonderful stay and everyone was especially helpful with recommendations & directions. The hotel is very quiet and in a lovely area and even though its not right in the centre of Venice, it has some great restaurants and bars within walking distance to the hotel. We bought a weekly Vaporetto pass but found that we usually walked everywhere. So even though its not in the centre its only about a 30 minute walk through the lovely back streets of this beautiful city. We mainly used the Vaporetto when at the end of the day we couldn't walk another step further. If we every return to Venice we would definitely stay here again. Walter gave us some great recommendations for buying cheeses, bread & meats so we could have a picnic lunch on Christmas Day and I'm so glad we followed his advice! A simple meal sitting in Campo San Giacomo all Orio near by made for a memorable Christmas. Thanks for making our stay and our Christmas in Venice such a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly, not the best hotel in Venice but...”
Reviews.Author: LondonJc
Reviews.Content: Let's get real - this is not the best hotel in Venice. We've been lucky to stay in some of the grandest hotels in the city and this trip thought we'd trust Tripadvisor and try Al Ponte Mocenigo at a fraction of the cost of the Danieli, the Baglioni etc. We weren't disappointed. (Hundreds of reviewers aren't wrong)! This is a very pretty hotel, in a lovely area, with spotlessly clean rooms and friendly, welcoming staff. With the nightly rates a fraction of those that you'd expect to pay at the "Best" in a city as expensive as Venice , it's hardly surprising that this hotel is so popular. I'd recommend it heartily. PS - I'd probably avoid room 2 if returning. We were warned that it would be very small and it is. (It was the only room left when we booked). However, at 125 Euro p.n., still superb value.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ab299
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo was such a fantastic place to stay, we enjoyed every minute of it. We stayed at the beginning on November for three nights (late review - sorry). The room we had was in the annex, it was massive and had a separate sitting room - we couldn't believe how much space there was. We loved the annex as we had our own key to the front door and could come and go any time day or night and the area was so safe. The room was absolutely spotless, it felt like we were the first ones to stay there. Wifi in the room was really fast which was helpful as the tv doesn't have many good channels. We found the hotel to be in a brilliant location right near the vaparetto stop, even though we ended up walking everywhere. The breakfast was fantastic, with fresh croissants and coffee delivered to your table exactly how you like it. Walter and Sandro were such lovely hosts, really friendly and knowledgeable. On your next trip to Venice you MUST stay here, it truly is a hidden gem. I spent hours looking on TA for a place to stay - save yourself the effort and stay here you will not regret it. The only thing that baffles me is that they are only 2 stars - they deserve at least 5! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: BlueSky411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5-6 days in December - my fiance and I. The hotel is a short, enjoyable walk from Rialto and St mark's square. We were in room 1 - right by the reception and it couldn't have been better. The room door, when shut, dried out any noise from the activity outside. We were well taken care of by owners Walter and Sandro (thank you gents...you guys made for such wonderful conversations and set the bar for other hotels we were to visit in Italy and France in this trip), Donatello and his dining recommendations (we really enjoyed all five restaurants - so many thanks), and Carlito (the night porter - thank you for the reservation at Zucca - such lovely people - appreciate it Carlito). Most of all we appreciate Norine and her team's service and Capuccino during breakfast. We aim to see you all again soon. Our best wishes!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: marriedwithkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in late July with our sons, ages 12 and 15. We stayed in a room in the annex which had a queen bed and 2 singles. There was plenty of room. Air conditioning worked fine. The bathroom was very modern and spotless. We requested a shower only as I do not like the Europen bath/shower combos as I always get water everywhere. The hotel was a 15 minute walk to St. Mark's. We loved the location as it was away from the crowds. It was also right off the SanStae stop so you could easily hop a boat. We took the public boat early in the am for our flight. They were kind enough to pack us hot breakfast pastries and provided us drinks to go as we left before the breakfast service. Nowhere else I would stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Staff and Stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Edna_88
Reviews.Content: My Husaband and I stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in end of October 2011 (apologizes for the late review) and loved our stay. Our room was well kept and the daily breakfast (yummy pastries and coffee) was a great start to our day for exploring Venice. This hotel deserves top rating. Very clean and comfortable. The staff is wonderful as well. Thank you Walter, Sandro, Lito and the rest of the attentive staff for a very pleasant stay. We would definitely stay here again and definitely recommend this hotel. We wish you all the best. Edna and David Belove

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved #1 rating”
Reviews.Author: HoppeTrails
Reviews.Content: We stayed specifically because of the #1 rating and were glad we did. They upgraded us, without asking, to a larger room with a sitting room. All rooms are decorated in the Venetian style and very well appointed. The breakfast is very good as is the WIFI. The location is perfect - slightly off the main tourist track but close enough to be there in 3 minutes walk. The staff are welcoming and took time to answer all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location and staff”
Reviews.Author: travelingagain08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with our 2 kids in October and would stay again next time we are in Venice. We stayed in the family suite (room 10 I believe) and it had a large 4 poster bed and 2 twins set up for the kids in a large room that looked out onto the patio. The bathroom was large and clean, but we did struggle with the shower (getting water all over the floor since there is only a small partition), the hairdryer (very weak) and lack of counter space for 4 of us. These are minor issues though and there was plenty of hot water. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to help us with suggestions and an item left on the train. Breakfast area is small when the hotel is full, but gives you a chance to meet others. The food was good, especially the homemade bread. Most ideal was the location, just a short walk from the vaporetto stop but out of the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas. We were able to handle our own luggage from the vaporetto stop to and from the hotel, making a water taxi unnecessary though they have a water door. Worth the cost for the location, cleanliness and nice breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Venice !”
Reviews.Author: Altancan
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel Donatello welcomed us so nice ! He showed us a few rooms and and given us options to choose any of them to stay. After that he has given a map marking all the important points we should be visiting. The room was very comfortable and we did not have any single issue at all ! The hotel has got a great location ! You can go almost anywhere in Venice by walking ! The next morning we wanted to have our first breakfast and went to the ground floor by the reception area. They serve croissant , cream cheese , selection of juice and tea and coffee.. It was simple but lovely ! Day by day we met Valter,Giovanni , Carlito ( those guys are from the hotel ) And each of them were very helpful ! If you have any issue or not happy with anything just talk to them I believe they are always doing their best in order to make everybody's stay so pleasant ! And of course the housekeeping team did a wonderful job !! After we came back from Rome we kindly asked them if they can keep our luggages for 5 hours at the hotel despite we had checked out 4 days ago. Donatello and Giovanni kept them for us. I would highly recommend ! If you guys ( al ponte mocenigo ) are reading this, Thank you again !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip to Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: Nada F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent in all aspects. Room cleanliness, breakfast, location, staff friendliness. The staff was very kind in giving advice and always made time for any questions. In terms of logistics they made sure to assist where possible giving us the best solution for our travel schedule. It was a great 3 day trip we spent in Venice and we owe it all to the staff there that helped us going around to various areas in and out of Venice!! Really, it was a great stay there and if we plan to go to Venice again, we would definately stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Back alley gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mervyn72
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to sing the praises of a 'little gem' of a hotel in a tiny little alley way, right in the middle of Venice. The hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo certainly lives up to its many trip advisor awards. The hotel is in a tiny allleyway literally only fifty metres from the vaporetto stop (or if you want to arrive in luxury, it does have its own water door). We arrived at tennish in the morning and breakfast had been cleared away - however, it was no bother whatsoever for the staff to rustle up coffee, cappuccino, croisants and a very warm welcome while waiting for our room to be prepared. The room was luxurious and grand, spotlessly clean and very tastefully decorated. The staff were really helpful and patient and were happy to make phone calls on your behalf if required. Top quality for 140 euros a night for the double bedroom and breakfast (although we did have a 'superior' room for the price of a stndard one).

Reviews.Title: “best value may 2011”
Reviews.Author: Henry H
Reviews.Content: clean rooom; good breakfast; desk helpfull with advise and direction; just off water stop; good budget resturant 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous friendly and stylish hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Hollyers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my (adult) daughter on a long weekend trip to Venice. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was elegant and comfortable, with a huge bathroom and vast radiator which was useful for drying us out after a day in the rain (serves us right for refusing the hotel's kind offer of umbrellas). Great breakfast. The hotel is only a 20 minute gentle stroll to St Mark's Square via the Rialto, or very close to the Grand Canal for the vaporetto (waterbus). Tip - buy a travel card for the Vaporetti, saves time and hassle. Make sure you validate it before you board. Nice shops and restaurants in the immediate neighbourhood. I liked the hotel so much that i'm going back with my husband for our wedding anniversary in February 2012..

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: victorialad
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel based on the feedback in Tripadvisor and i was not disappointed. I travelled with my two daughters and we were upgraded to a suite for 4 nights due to a last minute cancellation, which was a nice gesture. The room we got for our last night (the one i booked) was excellent and it would not have changed my opinion on the hotel if we had stayed in the room i booked. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, the kids loved the croissants. The location was perfect just a little stoll away from the main places (once you find your way). All in all fantastic, great value for money and a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Another rave review”
Reviews.Author: Alexander6011
Reviews.Content: Like other guests at Al Ponte Mocenigo I found this place a delightful and practical place to stay. It's about 100 metres from a vaporetto stop on a route that takes you almost everywhere you want to go. The location has a number of good osteria, my favorite being Al Forno - hip and hot - with great local fare.

Reviews.Title: “Set the tone for the trip”
Reviews.Author: kellyfreeland
Reviews.Content: Venice was the first stop on our tour of Italy... and the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo spoiled us! The room was a nice size, the bathroom had a huge tub (the only tub we saw in all of the hotels/B&Bs in Italy), and the place was well-decorated. The breakfast was AMAZING. The croissants were still warm from the oven and the cappuccini were perfect. The gentlemen at the front desk (we talked to a few different people) were all very helpful and had great recommendations (BTW- you MUST eat at A Becafico... you MUST). The area was quiet, away from the touristy hustle and bustle, but within a short walking distance of where ever you wanted to go. This was my favorite place to stay in my favorite spot in Italy... it felt so different from the city life at home (or in Rome for that matter)... The food was delicious everywhere and even a little rain didn't dampen the charm of magnificent Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian comfort”
Reviews.Author: mcdodoVancouver
Reviews.Content: Buongiorno all! I just returned from spending 4 nights at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo last week. Really a nice experience and close to the San Stae vaporetto stop so really convenient too. Very welcoming hosts Walter and Sandro are so nice and genuine and the other staff delightful. Breakfast was continental style with nice compliment of breakfast options and wonderful coffee to order :) The croissants are sooo good! My room was spacious, comfortable and sparkling clean....especially the lovely ensuite,,,,very nice. Little ristorante just down to the corner and left on the little piazza was a good find. The hotel is not overtly gay friendly but then neither is Italy generally. Would stay here again without hesitation and would certainly reccommend it to family and friends. The pix on their site are accurate :)

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: holidaytragic
Reviews.Content: We were only staying 2 nights and wish we'd had longer.The hotel was located very close to San Stae vaporetta stop and had wonderful character and ambience. Our room was large and clean. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving first place!”
Reviews.Author: ben78g
Reviews.Content: We were tipped off on this place by a friend (mind you it's the highest ranked B+B in Venice so not too much of a secret). It met our expectations in every way. It was very easy to find (and super close from the train and associated Vaperetto stop), the staff was very friendly, rooms beautiful and breakfast above average. We would highly recommend this place to anyone going to Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: difpics
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony which made our stay really special. Room 5 is spacious and very clean, very comfortable night sleep, an extraordinarily high ceiling, good modern bathroom, antiques, good lighting, good bed, lovely service, cleaners sing as they work! and all staff are very, very friendly and helpful. Plus book library! A very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely, good location”
Reviews.Author: ktheexplorer
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice and took the water taxi from the airport. I had researched ahead of time on which line to take (orange line). The taxi takes about 40 mins to an hour to get to San Stae stop. From there it literally was about 100 steps to the hotel. We stayed in the Little Suite in the Annex. Our room was absolutely lovely. We had a nice sitting area, bedroom and bath. The room was very clean. The staff was very helpful with sightseeing and recommending restaurants, and making us dinner reservations when we couldn't find anywhere available to eat. We walked down to St. Marks Square in probably 20 mins or so. It is not right in the heart of the tourist area (St. Marks) but it is nice to escape from the craziness of that and into the quietness of this hotel. The breakfast was very nice as well. It was a little cold to eat in the courtyard, but we enjoyed our view of it from inside. We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jackwill
Reviews.Content: Location is really close to the canal. But listen carefully to the directions on how to get there from the vaporetto stop. Breakfast on the patio is really good, service is outstanding. Our hosts Sandro and Walter were extremely gracious and helpful. We stayed in the annex and found the room to be beautifully decorated. Not too much noise, good temperature control, comfortable bed, very clean rooms. Good recommendations for where to eat. But watch out for outdoor seating in Venice restaurants as smoking and dogs are permitted!

Reviews.Title: “Very good charmant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauroSantos
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed there for 2 nights on september, and enjoied. It was a good choice, the hotel deserves the good reviews on TripAdvisor. The room and bathroom are confortable. Very easy to find, they have a main building (with the restaurant; prefer this one) and an annex only 50 m away (stayed here) - no inside passage between both, have to walk 1 minute outside. One night we were thristy and asked some bottles of water: have to walk outside to reach the reception, because, of course, the only person could not leave his place. My suggestion to the simpatic owners: just put a fridge at the annex hall. The breakfast is only OK (missed a lot eggs, ham). Location is very good, close to Rialto Bridge, but 11 waterboat stations to Piazza San Marco. Could really come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every moment!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSurferGirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo November 7-10 & 14. It is easy to find and very convenient, right off the vaparetto. The breakfast is so amazing....we were awakened by the lovely smells every morning. The staff was top notch, especially Carlito who works the night shift. We arrived at 1am straight off the Alilaguna. We were tired after traveling from the West Coast and Carlito kindly showed us to our room. He even asked if we wanted anything to eat or drink. Then after a four day trip to Florence, we came back for one night. We had to wake up at 3:30am and Carlito again took care of us. He called to wake us and even packed a small breakfast for us to take on the plane. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice. We stayed in two different rooms and loved them both. We had outstanding meals recommended by the staff at the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly a good experience”
Reviews.Author: LVEC333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for 3 nights. We were put in the annex. The service was exceptional, both at reception and at breakfast. The room was very clean and had everything we needed other than a tea/coffee machine. The television only had about 4 channels that worked but this did not bother us as we did not come to Venice to watch television! Overall, I was extremely pleased with the hotel although there were a couple of things that frustrated me. Firstly, we could not get internet access on out laptop. The only reason we wanted to access the internet was to find restaurants to eat at in the evening and recommendations for particular sights to visit. We were told that other visitors hadn't had any problems accessing the internet but as we managed to get in on the laptop in reception, we think it was the position of our room that prevented us accessing it. The only other negative aspect of the hotel was the street noise outside our room in the access. The room was extremely hot all of the time so we had to open the window as we were unable to sleep in such hot temperatures (despite turning the heating off on day one). However, there was a restaurant directly opposite our room and every night the staff seemed to stand outside it and talk for hours and hours and this made it very difficult to sleep. We would definitely return to the hotel but would definitely ask for a different room in a different part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: misskitz
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here while we were in Venice. I was expecting more from the place because of all the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. I thought we had a good stay but would definitely not call it great and definitely not the best place I have stayed. The location was good, quiet and peaceful at night and we definitely got a good nights sleep. We spent one night in the main hotel and two nights in the annex. The room on the ground floor in the main part of the hotel was very dark and even with the windows open, there was not much natural light. The room in the annex was definitely better. The rooms were off a good size and clean. Breakfast was very simple and basic.

Reviews.Title: “It's #1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: The-4-Foremans
Reviews.Content: This property was excellent. Centrally located, excellent service, smiles all around, helpful staff and an owner with a pride in his establishment. We travelled here with our twin children and the stay was magnificient. The room decor is different in each room and the rooms come equipped with all of the comforts of home. Breakfast was in true Italian style with excellent food, service and choice. The hotel is easy to get to from the transit and even easier to visit the attractions from. I have no complaints with this fine hotel. I chose it because it was #1 and it remains a #1 in my books. Take your kids and enjoy this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “40th birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: EddieWiltshireUK
Reviews.Content: This has to be probably the best place we have stayed, both from a hotel and location point of view. Booking was done online and communication by email was excellent. As it was the wife's 40th birthday surprise I decided to go for the Junior suite as it had a Jacuzzi type bath and knowing how much she likes a nice bath it was a must have and she thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was full of charm and architecture. I also decided to go for the private transfer and Sandro and Walter were very helpful when I asked about arranging this when we landed. Having arrived by water taxi we were guided from the water stop to the hotel (the water level was particularly low so we could not go directly to the door, although this is normally an option). We were a little bit perturbed by the entrance in a small dark alleyway but once inside we couldnâ€™t fault it. It turns out we were actually guided to the â€˜back doorâ€™, rather than the pretty main entrance into a courtyard, so donâ€™t be put off if you end up at the back door! Having wandered around Venice I am so glad that I opted for something away from the main tourist areas and should we go back, which I hope we do, we will certainly be coming back to this hotel. Only downside was the breakfast. Cereals and fruit juice were fine, as was the fresh fruit, but not being one for pastries (not keen on croissants), the choice was limited. It would have been nice to have had a selection of bread other than the small white rolls and maybe some cold meats / cheeses (although the Italian version of a â€˜Dairyleaâ€™ was an option). I'm not one for the traditional full English so was glad not to see that. As for Venice itself; what an amazing place. We are not really into sightseeing and walking but we spend two full days walking around (there is no need to use the water buses) getting lost at will and each new square we came into brought something new. The Jewish district was nice and quiet, with a few restaurants alongside the water (although we didnâ€™t eat there). Eating out was excellent. It's as expensive as you want to make it. Our evening meals varied from 45 to 105 euros (the latter was special for the wife's 40th - excellent meal at Vecio Fritolin). We also ate twice at Muro Pizza - a very place that does excellent food and wonderful beer (not your common everyday stuff). Be warned - it gets very busy even slightly out of season. So overall, a fantastic stay in a great hotel in a wonderful place and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: Felnak
Reviews.Content: We recently just returned from a week stay in Venice at the Al Ponte Mocenigo and must say we had a wonderful time. The hotel is very nice. As someone who travel to Europe regularly, 3-4 times a year, I must say the rooms are very large and spacious. We stayed in the Junior suite and it was just about as large as my first apartment in college. The bath room is very large, the bed was very comfortable was decorated very nicely. The hotel staff are superb!! Anything and everything you might need they were all more than willing to help with. The location is right next to the the S. Stae, Vaparetto stop, but quite honestly a short 10 min walk and you are in the middle of the Realto and another 10 you are in Saint Marks Square. Perfect location!! The breakfast in the morning is very good and we were craving our Marmalade Croissants days after we returned still. Wish we were still on Vacation here. Anyway, I cannot say enough, if we ever are back in Venice we will definitely be staying here

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alli508
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only two nights and wish it had been for longer! Venice is magical and the location suited us perfectly. The area was close enough to everything without being mobbed. In addition to the locale, the thing we appreciated most were the owners. They were extremely warm and welcoming. And the croissants at breakfast were the best I have ever tasted :-). During our first night, the only available room was #1, which is a perfectly nice room but too close to the front desk. The next night we were moved to room #8, which was fine. No view, unfortunately, but nice and big. Our only suggestion would be to upgrade the beds and pillows. They were both a bit hard and lumpy. Perhaps a topping of memory foam? Despite the beds, we get it very high marks and hope to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PegLS
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel that I would recommend without reservation to anyone. We stayed for three nights, and found everything to be as the other reviews stated - spacious room, modern bath, very clean, helpful staff, good breakfast and a very short distance from the San Stae Vaporetto stop. It is difficult to add anything new, but I'll just throw out one thought. Before arriving in Venice, I wondered why a small and somewhat far from St. Mark's Square (good 20 minute walk unless you take the vaporetto) hotel could consistently rank first on Trip Advisor. Now that I've been there, I'd say that being very comfortable at a good price probably provides the basis for most of the reviews, but that it is the location - one that makes you feel like you are really in the Venice that you always wanted to see and not just in a crowded tourist spot - that makes so many people happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Carol E
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel for a 3 night stay on Tuesday. We had just settled into a lovely room (#21) in the Annex and had arrived at dinner when we got a phone call from the US of a death in our family and had to leave the next morning. Walter was SO understanding and charged us for only the night we were able to stay even though we had made a commitment for 3 nights. His compassion was our best experience while traveling all over Italy. The hotel is so conveniently located to the St. Stae vaporetto station. The staff gave us two great suggestions for restaurants very close by. I hope to get back to Venice another time and would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: jolsonsboss
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 21-25 october2011 and must say really enjoyed the stay in such a warm welcoming small hotel. our stay was 3 nights in the annexe and 1 night in the main hotel . we loved the room in the annex more, it was really spacious and had a lovely view over an enclosed garden (34) and very quiet too. our last night we were moved to (8) main building another lovely room but not so spacious. The owners and staff were excellent and couldnt help you enough and the continental breakfast was good. one thing if you need an Iron please take one with you , there is not one available and no tea coffee facilities in the room just a couple of niggles but the overall stay was Excellent and we willl be returning .

Reviews.Title: “Loved Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: TTTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this beautiful property. It is conveniently located a very short walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop which made commuting a breeze while in Venice. We were on abudget during our three weeks in Italy and trying to keep accomodations around the 100 euro a night range. In Venice, we spent 145 per night and were NOT disappointed. Not only was the hotel convenient, but the room was beautiful and spacious and the breakfast in the courtyard an amazing start to each day. We had an electrical adapter, but it bummed out while we were in Venice. Our hosts came through - providing an adapter which allowed us to check with family in Canada via internet. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: AllysonJS
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo - chose it based on the numerous positive reviews on TA. From the initial emails to our arrival - the front desk staff could not have been more helpful or accommodating. They gave us excellent instructions on how to get to the hotel (very close to Vaporetto #1 stop) as well as how to get easily to the airport for an early morning flight. Additionally - they suggested some non-touristy spots to get a drink or a meal which we greatly appreciated. The room itself (ours was in the annex) was huge, nicely appointed with a large bathroom and free Wi-Fi which was great. (As previously mentioned the hairdryer was horrible - a wall unit resembling the end of a vacuum hose). The location was a little bit out of the way but that turned out to be a positive thing because it was less crowded and very very quiet. It was still very easy to walk to the Rialto bridge, the fish market and the shops and sights near St. Marks. Overall the breakfast in the morning was good but the croissants were out of this world amazing! If we ever return to Venice we would definitely considering staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff; Easy to the Airport; Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dwinitt
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice eight times in the last ten years, and this time I was traveling with my son and sought a more reasonably priced hotel. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful, the rooms were very nice (ours was a little less spacious than I was used to, but the rate was reasonable and we were only in the room to sleep). At the end of the street and a very short walk from the hotel, was the boat to the airport (16 euros vs. 105 euros for a water taxi), and the vaporetto stop was also at the same location. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: roboshopper
Reviews.Content: Beautiful quaint Hotel-recently renovated with beautiful furnishings-comfortable beds and bathrooms with heated towel rack and bidet. The owners(english speaking) and staff(some speaking english) very friendly and accomodating-especially when our group of 12 showed up with luggage for 20!! Continental breakfast included the best Canadian style coffee of our 3 week journey (along with delicious pastry fruit salad yogurt cold cereal etc) Short distance to the #1 Vaporetto and shops and good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: cindy l
Reviews.Content: Visited with my daughter late November, 2010. Quaint yes, but incredible service, lots of personal touches, and attention to detail made the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo by far the best hotel experience to date. Awoke each morning to the scrumptious smell of fresh baking. The hosts were so friendly and very accommodating. Absolutely loved, loved, loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovecookie24
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is rated #1 in Venice for good reason! Upon arrival, we were given a room in the new annex â€“ which was wonderful. The room was clean, tastefully decorated, very cozy â€“ and oh so romantic!! As other reviewers have stated, the hotel is conveniently located on the St. Stae vaporetto stop in the Santa Croce district. We absolutely loved this area. The hotel is in short walking distance of, but far enough away from the droves of tourists that pack the Rialto Bridge and St. Markâ€™s Square. There are tons of wonderful restaurants nearby. Breakfast was served in the charming little courtyard. There was a nice selection of cereals, yogurts, warm breads, and the most delicious, flaky croissants I have ever tasted!! In the evenings, after a long wonderful day of exploring and inevitably getting lost, it was such a pleasure to come back and unwind with a bottle of vino in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: S H
Reviews.Content: Like many reviews have said - finding an available room here is not always easy - but with the opening of their new annex if you do get to stay here you won't be disappointed. We stayed five nights in two different rooms in the new annex and both were excellent. The bedrooms rooms have been beautifully renovated and are spacious, well decorated in Venetian style and the bathrooms are spectacular, clean modern and well appointed. Free WiFi worked very well indeed. Breakfast each morning started the day off perfectly and included warm croissants, yoghurt, fruit, pastries and most importantly excellent coffee any way you want it! All the staff are superb and Sandro and Walter worked wonders taking the time to assist each traveller in their individual needs. It is not hard to see why this hotel has been #1 on Trip Advisor for a long time. Close to a Vaparetto stop it is easy to get to with your bags and close to all the sights and sounds of Venice. In addition there are many restaurants and bars nearby yet it is peaceful at night for sleep. Great hotel, great location, and great serviceâ€¦all a great start for a trip to a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel of our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: jaclynmck
Reviews.Content: With just 2 nights at this hotel, it's easy to see why they have such fantastic reviews. I was disappointed to see that they did not have any availabilities when I originally searched online, but sent an email to check just in case. They did have a room available in the annex, and we immediately booked it. I was a little nervous about being in the annex, but it's about a 30 second walk to the hotel (where breakfast is served), someone was always available at the front desk to buzz us in and our room was gorgeous. We were up on the 3rd floor and had high, wood beamed ceilings and a lovely chandelier. There was plenty of space in the room and the bathroom. The location of the hotel is great too. My boyfriend and I walked everywhere in Venice. The only time we took a boat was from the airport (super easy to get to the hotel by taking the orange line on the alilaguna to the San Stae stop) and to get to the train station with our luggage. St. Mark's Square, the Rialto Bridge and all the other sights were an easy walk. Everyone who worked there was incredibly friendly and warm. This was by far the best hotel of our trip to Italy, and I would recommend this hotel to a friend in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints,”
Reviews.Author: sophie8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after 4 nights at this lovely little Hotel, having been to Venice countless times this isw one of the best places we have stayed, I think we might even go back there, something we have not done before, liking to sample different areas, this was so convenient being yards from a Vaporetto stop, we stayed in the annex which was no problem, a sort of mini suite beautifully decorated, a most comfortable bed, good size bathroom, clean towels daily, and plenty of hot water, Breakfast in the main Hotel was really adequate , all round no complaints, even although the room overlooked the main Calle, the noise was minimal,
