Reviews.Title: “High quality, reasonably priced, authentically Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruth1948
Reviews.Content: From the time of our arrival to the time of our departure, we were graciously taken care of by Sandro and Walter. Although our room was behind the main desk, and had windows that overlooked the canal, it was always quiet. We judge the quality of a room by the comfort of the bed, and although we suffered severe jet lag upon arriving and could have slept standing up, we found the bed to be comfortable with plenty of pillows and just the right weight of blankets and covers. The bathroom looked newly remodeled with beautiful green and white marble tiles on walls and floor. Plenty of storage space had been provided for hanging clothes and storing suitcases. Sandro and Walter tirelessly answered all our questions, even though they probably had repeated the same answers and given the same directions 100's of times. A map was wisely provided with a trail drawn in red ink to make the transit of the labyrinth of streets easier. (Yes, expect to get lost even with the best map in hand!) It was easy to make ourselves at home for breakfast. Croissants, cereals, fruit, juice and coffee were available and were served in a charming little courtyard. We were extremely pleased with our experience at Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo, and felt that the cost was very reasonable for security, comfort, and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannymc21
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 5 night stay in the junior suite. It is a fabulous room. Very big, spotlessly clean and the en-suite looks brand new. All the staff were very helpful and extremely pleasant. It may be rated a 2 star hotel but it has everything you need to provide a lovely stay in a great, quiet location. Only 100 metres from the vaporetto step which is perfect. You will get lost in the maze of streets in Venice but having the sanctuary of a vaporetto so close is great. Ten minutes on the vap and you're at the Rialto bridge. Perfect. You've saved your legs and had the unforgettable experience of a trip on the Grand Canal. The breakfast was great with cereal, fruit, juices, croissants and warm bread. Superb. If you want sweeping staircases and Grand Canal vistas there are many lovely, glamorous, facility laden hotels throughout Venice, this hotel doesn't have them but has everything you need and at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a great value. However, my husband and I found the room to be a bit old and musty. We had to leave the windows open to air it out. The location is good- fairly central, and the service was very good. The room was nicely decorated, but the bathroom was very small. It was quiet as well, but the bed was a bit hard. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but I do not think that we would return. I would definitely recommend this hotel for people looking to visit Venice on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: brucetubarao
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive until the time out is just perfect. Unfortunately I can not remember the name of the people who work in the hotel, but they are all wonderful, always concerned about doing the best. The breakfast is great. The croisant warm is a must. The location is great. Quiet place, but close to everything. The room for 4 people is great. I, my wife and two children were very well installed. The only problem I could mention, is that the wifi does not work well throughout the hotel. However, I think I even liked it too: Internet for what in Venice ??????? small and charming. Do not miss.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico ....”
Reviews.Author: rmariff
Reviews.Content: Its hard to find a place to stay in Venice which ticks all the boxes. This place does. The room is beautiful, the location is good and the breakfast is super without breaking the bank. The room - spacious, neat and clean. The price is affordable too. Location - you can get here directly from the airport using the water bus to San Stae stop and vice versa for EURO13.00 rather than taking the bus to Piazzale Roma and then hop on the vaparetto. Rialto Market is just 10 minutes walk away with local cafes worth trying. Breakfast consists of warm croissants, yoghurts and coffee. Overall satisfied with this hotel, the service and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: summerscotland28
Reviews.Content: From coffee on arrival to an early breakfast on departure this hotel could not be faulted. Loved the location, quiet but within easy walking distance of the main attractions. Quiet, clean room decorated in typical Venetian style with a very comfortable bed, large bathroom with a good shower, plentiful hot water and change of towels daily. Served a delicious breakfast each morning in the outside courtyard by friendly, helpful staff. Reasonably priced restaurants close by the hotel where we dined in the evenings after long days spent walking around Venice. We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday in Venice and if we should return would again stay at this hotel. Travellers should take care however and check charges before sitting down at what appear to be little cafes in Venice as we were charged 39 euros for 2 coffees and two slices of apple cake in one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BJDOO
Reviews.Content: The second stop on our Italian adventure was in Venice. This hotel is rated number one for a reason. Rooms (in this case the annex steps away from the main property) are more than adequate, clean and quiet. The staff communicates very well and is helpful. Walter went out of his way to find some utensils we could take on the train. These particular sections of Venice (santa croce and san polo) were among our favorites. Enjoyed just walking, shopping and eating ( in Piazza San Toma). San Marco was interesting and the church beautiful but the crowds too much. One has to get off the beaten path. We went over to the Hotel Ciprioni across from San Marco for a drink in the evening- which was expensive but well worth the effort. Also did the Musica a Palazzo (50E) which was very entertaining and intimate - have to do the opera in Venice - and this is a great way to introduce newcomers. We bought 48 hour vaporetto passes which easliy paid for themselves. I spent too much time thinking about this - just do it. The boats were suprisingly crowded most of the day but we did manage to make our way to the open area at the stern a couple of times. Venice was more than we anticipated and this hotel worked perfectly for us.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than before”
Reviews.Author: dixwimby
Reviews.Content: Since our last visit. the breakfast room has taken over a family room so can either have breakfast outside or inside from the same area. the breakfast has crossants, warm rolls, pate, great freshly made coffee, or tea. cereals, fresh fruit, small apricot pasteries, cheese, fruit juice. the location is down a very small alley big green door. sign now on wall as you come from vaparetto stop on the number 1 line. 4th stop from piazzaile Roma. The staff were again very good with all our requests. the ladies serving the breakfast also clean the rooms. The rooms are arguably for the price the largest in Venice. large double bed, very clean and there always seems to be piping hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wally434
Reviews.Content: Located at the San Stae vaparetto stop, this hotel is easily reached from the airport, train or bus station, without having to cross any bridges. It is located in a typical Venetian neighborhood, close to, but not part of, the tourist area. Rooms are large, clean and well equipped. Breakfast, including fresh fruit salad and warm croissants, is an excellent start to the day. Staff are friendly and helpful, especially Donatello, who made our visit very enjoyable. Michele & Tom, Oakville, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great find. Wonderful atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: aussieastrogirl
Reviews.Content: Walter and Sandro were really nice, friendly and helpful and really care about their customers. Our room was in the annex and absolutely delightful. It was huge and all perfectly decorated and in excellent condition. Friends, who are frequent visitors to Venice and stay at much more expensive hotels, loved Al Ponte Mocenigo and they are going to stay there next time they are in Venice. Breakfast was superb in a lovely courtyard and the staff were wonderful. It is in a fantastic, quiet, less touristy area of Venice close to great shops, fantastic (reasonably priced) restaurants, bakeries and food shops, close to a vaporetto stop and walking distance to everywhere, of course. We were so pleased with this hotel - the atmosphere was wonderful and we just felt like we belonged. It was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Gill T
Reviews.Content: We chose Venice to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. After a little searching we discovered this gem of a hotel. It seemed to have everything we required and we were not disappointed. Initially we had been drawn to the 'glamourous' hotels along the Grand Canal, but what a mistake that would have been - noisy with the constant traffic up and down the canal and I dare say fumes from the constant (though very efficient and neccessary) vaparettos. Some looked a little run down and I would not have relished going out in the morning straight into the hustle and bustle and commercialism of the Grand Canal. The location of Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is perfect, on the edge of the tourist area and in the traditional and very beautiful and peaceful residential area where you will see the real Venice. This meant we were able to venture out on foot and see the delightful ancient piazzas off the beaten track which would not have known were there had we stayed on the Grand Canal. Here you will find wonderful little typically local places to eat, far nicer and much cheaper than in the tourist areas.Very easy to get to from the airport (you will be emailed many travel options when you book. Buy an unlimited travel ticket from the airport when you arrive) It is located a stone's throw from the vaparetto stop and you will be attended to instantly from the moment you arrive. Nothing was too much trouble for Walter, Sandro and Donatello who happily gave us advice on local excellent value restaurants, travel, and even where to get the best gondola rides (without being ripped off! - don't get one in the St. Marks square area) and insisted on carrying all our bags. As it was our silver wedding anniversary, they even treat us to a lovely bottle of Prossecco in the courtyard one evening. Our room was absolutely beautiful, immaculately clean and in the new annex just a few steps over a quaint little bridge. The maids were charming and friendly. Breakfast was gorgeous served in the beautiful courtyard with fantastic coffee, pastries, fruit etc. This hotel is a peaceful cool haven for a wonderful night's sleep after a busy day sightseeing. Venice is a beautiful city to visit and our celebration was made perfect by this hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone and will be returning as soon as possible to stay with our daughter!

Reviews.Title: “5 star service in a charming nook of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last October on our honeymoon (better late than never - I wanted to take the time to write a truly thoughtful review deserving of this gem!) Especially after walking around by St. Marks and the touristy areas, we couldn't have imagined staying anywhere else! This hotel is a little off the beaten path, which is perfect for exploring Venice and seeing the sites, while also being able to escape the crazy crowds. Also, there are so many great restaurants right around the hotel, which are far less expensive and had amazing food! When we originally made our reservation, it turned out that they did not have 1 room for both nights, but Walter offered for us to stay in the newer building around the corner on the 2nd night. They even moved our bags for us while we were out during the day (and our bags were extremely heavy!). Both buildings were quite charming and the rooms were impeccably decorated with different antique furniture pieces. Each room with its own personality was as much beautiful as it was warm and cozy. Walter and Sandro were both extremely friendly and hospitable. They offered great recommendations for restaurants in the area and also let us store our luggage for the day after we had checked out. The breakfast outside in the little courtyard was simple and delicious and a great relaxing way to start our day! We felt right at home here and wouldn't stay anywhere else if we ever go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's all true!”
Reviews.Author: Alexako
Reviews.Content: Perfetto! This gem of a hotel is aboslutely perfect. Wonderful location, incredibly quiet, close and yet away from the madness & crowds of st marks, beautiful and well-equipped rooms, welcoming owners and staff (thank you Sandro and Walter for your hospitality - you really made me feel like a guest and not a customer), excellent value - it's faultless! Oh and so easy to get to and to find. Believe all the good words you read and stop hunting. You've found your Venice hideaway.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews have it down right”
Reviews.Author: bonnie_ds
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Walter and Sandro were great to work with since we preponed our trip, but with the opening of the new annexe they were able to accomodate us. Directions they provide are spot on. It's less than a minute from the San Stae stop - which is the 3rd stop on the aliguana orange line from the ariport. Get off the boat and walk straight ahead and take the first left down a very very very narrow alley.. if you look high up on the wall leading to the alley the sign says the hotel name. Hotel is a few steps down. We used the map they provided and walked everywhere. It was awesome. Walter is warm and friendly and showed us an easy way to walk to Santa lucia train station. Bed is firm but great for bad backs and we loved it. The bathroom is huge, but shower stall pretty small...think NYC shower stalls. Room has a safe which was great. Room also has a phone which is good if you buy a calling card. Note: You may have to work with staff a little bit to figure out how to use the phone with the phone cards since I read a review here with some instructions, but the ones we used for room 41 were different. Staff mentioned they were another setup. Additional information: 1. Location is great - quiet and peaceful but close to everything. We were there 2 nights 3 days, and never used the vaporetto - walked everywhere. The rialto bridge is completely different at night. We love the tourist stuff, but it was amazing to also be able to get away from it and just wander the quiet areas. No cars so the peace was wonderful. We did do a gondola ride. There is one right by the hotel. We took ours from close to the rialto bridge and they offer you 3 prices - 80 euro for short ride; 100 euro for traditional ride ; 125 euro for long ride. 2. It's very hard to find a tabachi store that sells phone cards - we walked into several before finding one but it was worth it. Most no longer sell stamps. We ended up going to the post office - when you enter the post office take a ticket at the door (if you just want stamps take one with the envelope sign). They then call your number - different number ranges for different things. Move pretty quickly though. 3. Either carry a bottle with you (you won't need to buy water at the ariport once you cross security) or hold on to one that you buy. You can refill in Venice and Rome and the many public drinking water places. We drink a lot of water so this was great. Also public toilets are 1.5 euros. If you drink a lot you will need these. Carry change - there's a change machine but if you're a lady then the line just gets longer while you try to get change. 4. There is a bakery quiet close to the hotel - forget the name but they ended up being a chain - it's great for lunches.

Reviews.Title: “It was an amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: greg_salonica
Reviews.Content: This a very beautiful,small,charming hotel!People are doing great job there,all of them..We booked a double superior with canal view but when we arrived we were informed that there was was a problem with the previous guests there,so for 1 night we had to stay in another room.This didn't bother us at all as we felt very welcomed.Our first room(no 8 i think) was big and very beautiful decorated with big bathroom.No view but who cares??For the rest 3 nights we moved to our "original" room(no 5) facing the small canal.It was slightly smaller(i'm not 100% sure though) but again very clean and well decorated.We even had a small balcony with 2 chairs(although little uncomfortable) where we were siiting enjoying the views.Breakfast was served in the courtyard(weather wise) and we enjoyed it every single day.All in all,it was a great experience and can highly recommend it!This is a very popular hotel indeed and you may have to book months in advance to get a room!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: JenniJuniper
Reviews.Content: All the rave reviews are true. This hotel was in a wonderful location on a small, canal with a beautiful courtyard, wonderful breakfast and a perfect room. We had a "small suite" in the newly renovated annex, which consisted of a small sitting room with a daybed and a table with two chairs and a smallish balcony that looked down onto a relatively quiet street and had a slight view of the grand canal, a spacious main room with a wardrobe and a bathroom with bath. The room was decorated in a very tasteful venetian style with fabric walls, brocade curtains and lots of exposed beams. We absolutely loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. We stayed there with our toddler, and the hotel provided a cot for him. It was very nice to have the separate sitting room (with door) so that we didn't have to go to bed when he did. The location was also perfect, just a 2 minute walk to the nearest vaporetto stop but in a quiet, lovely area of Venice. The rialto area, the Frari & the Grande Scuola di San Rocco (highly recommend visiting this lovely church and "Tintoretto's Sistine Chapel") and many good restaurants are just a 10-15 minute walk away. We loved our trip to Venice and would recommend this hotel to anyone who was visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its rating!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysliveinhope
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Walking distance to pretty much everywhere and right near the vaperetto stop anyway. Looked after us in many ways - won't give away all the details though! Perfect place for exploring Venice without breaking the bank. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in quite area of Venice”
Reviews.Author: r0cky88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because it was close, but not too close, to the major attractions in Venice. The water bus stop is just steps from the hotel making it convenient to get around but still be removed from the throngs of people closer to Rialto and St. Mark's Square. The hotel is located on a tiny crevice of an alley, but once you enter you find a comfortable and cozy hotel with decent size rooms and a really lovely courtyard. The bed was firm, but comfortable and the bathroom was spacious, though the shower was quite compact. Our favorite part of the hotel was the breakfast. It was delicious! Warm croissants and pastries with yummy spreads, fruit and good Italian coffee was the perfect way to start a day. The hotel isn't extravagant, but it suited our needs perfectly. Definitely a little gem in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Maxstudio
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the annex and one night in the main building. We actually prefer the annex, although both rooms are equally nice. Beautiful place, easy access to transportation, very quiet yet convenient location. Best croissants we have ever had at breakfast... friendly and nice staff. Definitely would recommend to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: edmontontravel
Reviews.Content: Brilliant in every way. We stayed in the annex and felt like royalty. Beautiful, charming, friendly, and comfortable. Can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and hope I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: smackeyIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Al Ponte Hotel for two nights at the end of August this year. The directions to the hotel were spot on and it was really easy to find. What a little gem - over it's own bridge, nestled in a little courtyard filled with statuary and colourful blobs of geraniums hidden among the masonry. Inside I had room number 3 which is downstairs so it can get a little noisy with breakfast but as I was up early every morning to get out and see the city it didn't really bother me. Lovely room decorated in pale apple green with gold highlights and a really big ensuite. For me as a solo traveller, to get such a lovely room was a big bonus. The owners were lovely and chatty and the hotel was only 10-15 minutes walk to Rialto Bridge and about another 15 to St. Mark's Square. The vaporetto stop near the hotel was very convenient if you didn't want to wander about Venice and also for the airport as it was only a few stops to Piazzle Roma and the airport bus. Overall, I hope I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable little hotel in a historic building in an authentic part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Middle_East_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and paid about $200 per night including breakfast. The hotel consists of two buildings, one around the corner from the other, both in historic old small mansions with high ceilings. The room was lovingly refurbished and had the best of both worlds -- classic decor (old shuttered windows looking out onto the pedestrian street) and modern, well-lit bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable, and wireless internet was free for the whole stay. Breakfast was simple (fresh pastries and fresh fruits with yogurt and coffee and just a few other items) but good, and served in a beautiful small courtyard. The hotel was located in a quiet area only 1 min walk from the San Stae stop, which is used by the regular public transport water taxis (line no. 1) as well as the Alilaguna Orange Line boat which comes straight from the airport. There are good restaurants nearby as well as a Coop supermarket. The area is less touristy than other parts of Venice and it takes a while to walk to the Rialto or San Marco, but it does not take long to walk to the train station and back if one follows the signs carefully. Overall, it was a delightful place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone, unless they wanted the "buzz" of a larger hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the maddening crowd”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSueBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the reviews given on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed had room 8 in main building, which was perfect for our 4 night stay, lovely comfy bed and our daughter had a 'put me up' which was fine for a short stay. We loved the breakfast in the courtyard, perfect start to the day and the Apricot Croissants were lush ! The location by the Water Bus Stop was very handy as we all had 48 hr passes our daughter the Rolling Card for students,both worth having and we opted for Alilaguna water bus for our return to Marco Polo Airport, for 15 Euros each. A big thank you to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “good! perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Em70
Reviews.Content: Ponte Mocenigo is a small hotel in Venice downtown the location is perfect: historical small building 3 boat' stops from Venice train station and 3 from Ponte Rialto. Considering that the building can be considered part of the Venice historic value, you cannot expect modern room or lounge, but we slept well and all the services were ok. WIFI is complimentary. Breakfast was satisfying with some good pastry and italian expresso in the hotel patio. (Safe and hairdrier are available in the room) Expect a lot of stairs! check out at 11am the ratio price/value is perfect

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: flowergal80
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue... we stayed here last october for a couple of days before changing over to a "5 star hotel" and when we changed.. i wanted to come back to al ponte mocenigo. It is such a quaint hotel with great service and i loved the location... it is around a lot of good restaurants and away from the big crowds. Such a great value for venice!! All in all, a great stay in one of my favorite european cities!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely, lovely”
Reviews.Author: Clare A
Reviews.Content: Arriviing at Mocenigo was such a memorable moment. The water taxi drops you at San Stae and its only a few metres to this little gem of a hotel. The management and staff could'nt do enough for us. Breakfast simple and delicious. The room was charming with a lovely large clean bathroom. We had a little balcony where we sat listening to the bells of Venice and soaking up the atmostphere. We wanted to avoid St Marks area and this is the perfect area. Close to wonderful small piazzas and restaurants yet right next to the vaporetti stop. Mocenigo is so reasonably priced I was worried at the time of booking it might not be 'high end' enough, but its a beautiful place and could charge more for such a great location, building and service. Venice doesnt have to do much to impress but finding this lovely hotel and area only added to our time in this magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. incredible Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: treece63
Reviews.Content: As in all the previous reviews this place really hits the mark. The rooms are very well appointed. Great showers. The breakfast in the morning is a great start to the day. The location is so convenient for all transportation options but also away from the maddening crowds with great local restaurants close by. A definite must for a stay in Venice. Thanks Sandro and Walter.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: Truly loved staying here! Clean, fresh, spacious rooms, in a really great area! The staff are so friendly and helpful. Beautiful breakfast area as well. First time in Venice and has become one of our favourite places!

Reviews.Title: “Just the most lovely Venetian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bokim777
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 spent 3 nights here. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room was decorated in gold damask. The bedding, drapes and furniture (as in the photos on the web site) are in traditional Venetian style. The rooms are very large! Since Venice is so small, we walked or took the water taxi everywhere. Breakfast was outstanding. The croissants and pasties were amazing. The cappuccinos are the best I've ever had! The prices are so reasonable, it is hard to believe! Will always stay here when we are in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - fantastic people”
Reviews.Author: Joinvenice61
Reviews.Content: After driving into Venice in a hire car and then realising our motel was only four stops away on the vaporetto at San Stae was wonderful. The location was away from the crowds of St. Mark's square but close to some great places to eat, or to sit in a local piazza and watch the locals go about their business. The Vaporetto stop at San Stae was only a short walk from the motel. Staying here made our first visit to Venice one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay in my memory for a long time!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry C
Reviews.Content: The directions sent to us from Walter/ Sandro to get from the airport to the hotel were spot on and very easy to understand it only took us about 40 mins in all. We got off the water bus at the Stan Stae stop and only had to walk a few metres to the hotel.The attention to detail at this hotel is most apparent, all staff provide an excellent level of customer service.We booked the superior double room which was beautifully furnished with a lovely bathroom. The weather was very hot and the air con proved very valuable.The room overlooked the canal which was very peaceful,only the odd water taxi passed by now and then.Breakfast in the courtyard was lovely, Warm apricot croissants served to the table with a choice of hot drinks and then self service for cereals fresh fruit etc.The hotel is not far from the Rialto bridge and St. Marks Square and signposted clearly to both areas. We decided to take an independent trip to Lido Di Jesolo and Walter helped us with travel information.All in all our trip to Venice was wonderful and will no doubt return to this beautiful hotel in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: Sineaddonnelly
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a quiet area of Venice that is only a short walk or boat trip to many of the sights. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The service is really friendly and helpful and there was a nice, informal atmosphere in the hotel. The standards throughout the hotel are very high and the rooms are beautiful, well designed and clean. Breakfast is served each morning in a lovely courtyard and is delicious. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “BRILIANT!”
Reviews.Author: micknikki
Reviews.Content: How much nicer could it have been? It was already perfect.

Reviews.Title: “So wanted to stay in San Marco, or on the Grand Canal.. and am so glad we didnt”
Reviews.Author: lostinmanly
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Venice, I had all these great expectations, and one expectation was that I HAD to stay in one of the high end hotels at San Marco ...begrudgingly, when I found out the price... I made the decision to opt for the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. I have to say... it was the best decision I made. In walking through Venice, and going to major tourist attractions.. the sheer volume of numbers of tourists took my breath away. I could see the places were beautiful, but I just didnt enjoy it. becuase there was simply sooo many people. Hotel Al Ponte was miles away from the action, one reason why I didnt want to stay there, however, in hindsight, when I say how crowded Venice was.. the fact it was on the opposite side of the Grand Canal made for some beautiful and fantastic memories. The walk from the hotel around Venice takes you thru the quieter alleys, and more scenics parts wihtout the tourists. local little pizza bars, little parks, gorgeous areas. 100 mtrs up from the hotel is a church that sits on the Grand Canal. At 5.30 in the morning, I went for a walk, up to the church, sat there.. and watched Venice wake up. Commercial gondola's deliverying their goods, the sun rising up and over the grand Canal, the lights going out.. and the city waking up. What a treat. and all this a stones throw from this hotel. My room was beautiful. quant, well equiped, the service fantastic.. but it was the sincerity and the honesty in which the owners and their staff handle the guest.. you can tell they know what they have.. they treasure it.. and they want you to see what they see. It was wonderful. My room looked over the courtyard.. which was delightful.. two entrances to the hotel, one, over bridges and up the walkway thru the beautiful door.. the other via gondola to the water doors... its brilliant. This place is.. what Venice is truelly about.. not the overly commercial crowded Venice you see on TV.. but the romantic, gorgeous, historic little city.. that is a gem.. and this is the place to see it from. This city is a great place to walk around. so much to see, so much to do.. you get whiplash from looking at so much... and the great thing is.. if you get lost.. sit down.. have a coffee or get a drink.. and just watch... but a must.. you must try the nougat.. oh my gosh..... Venice.... Al Ponte.....Faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, rooms, we'd come back”
Reviews.Author: paulybear
Reviews.Content: We visited Al Ponte Mocenigo with a 4yr old and 8yr old, and we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel so much, the kids were eager to spend more time in the hotel than in central Venice on some days. It is equally welcoming to romantic couples, singles and families. Thanks for a memorable holiday, we're all hoping to see the Al Ponte Mocenigo again. Lastly, I have no reservations in recommending the hotel for the funny staff at the desk, the lovely ladies at breakfast who made our kids feel so welcome, thank you all, and the air conditioning which is essential for August.

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Bongo60
Reviews.Content: What can we add? All the reviews do it justice so we can only confirm what has been written before. Perfect location and so easy to find from the waterbus stop - aim for the back entrance if you have heavy luggage as the route to the front door goes over 2 bridges. (See previous reviews for instructions). Our room was in the main hotel and although quite small it was very pleasant and spotlessly clean. The breakfast, in the beautiful courtyard, was good especially the fruit salad and the cakes. All the staff were friendly and spoke good English. Would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the most beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: msjCheshireUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything TA reviewers say it is. We booked this hotel purely on the reviews and we were not disappointed. We stayed in this most gorgeous city for 3 days and it was made all the more fabulous by staying at the al ponte mocenigo. Spotlessly clean, friendly, helpful staff and a beautiful decorated bedroom, with all the amenties you could wish for. It more than supasses its 2 star rating. The breakfast is well prepared with hot fresh coissants and rolls, jams and preserves, cereal, fresh fruits and yogarts, all washed down with a delicious cappucino. Breakfast is taken in the courtyard and it is so beauitful and pretty, it really is a good start to the day. The weather was glorious while we were there and we did plenty of fantastic sight seeing. The Rialto Bridge and st marks square is a good 15 min stroll from the hotel but worth taking as the canal streets and buildings are breath taking . The Hotel staff were also very helpful in recommending local restaurants where we had some terrific meals. Its not cheap in Venice, but where in Europe is!!!! Getting to the hotel was easy with the instructions the owners sent us via e-mail. The private water taxis are about 100 euros one way, but we opted to take the bus from the airport, to the Piazzale Roma and from there, the water taxi to the stan stae stop. The hotel is literally a few metres as you get off the boat, it could not have been more simpler. We are now planning our next trip to Venice and would definately stay at this beautiful hotel again.An absolute gem .

Reviews.Title: “Deserving #1 in Venice”
Reviews.Author: krk34tr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this nice hotel a few days ago for a 4-day trip in Venice. It was a wonderful experience with extremely clean room, great location and helpful staff. Our room was a small suite with a tiny balcony in the new annex which is only a corner far from the reception. The breakfast is served in the main building. So you need to walk a few meters for the breakfast which is not a big deal for us. The vaporetto stop is only 30-50 meters away. You need to take #1 vaporetto which is a main line on the Grand Canal. Although the breakfast is sufficient with fresh fruit, creals and hot croissaints, I would like to have some fresh italian cheese and tomatoes as well. The hotel is very quiet. We had no issue with the noise mentioned in other reviews. In fact the location is so quiet. It was great that you are in the heart of Venice and also in such a quiet area after a tiring touristic day. There are nice restaurants near to the hotel suggested by the hotel staff which we were very pleased with. They are not touristic ones preferred by the local people with great food and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dubst3
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in a double superior room in the new flat for 4 nights in July and could not have been happier! We arrived late, around 10pm, and had no trouble finding the hotel. We took the Alilaguna orange line (15 euro one-way) to the Stan Stae stop, walked straight off the dock, took our first left down an alley and arrived at the back door of the hotel. The new part of the hotel is actually located across a small bridge from the breakfast room, but the man at the front desk helped us with our bags and showed us to our room right away. Our room had a small kitchen area & dining area, the main bedroom with a couch and a huge bathroom with a shower, toilet & bidet and large sink. It was decorated in true Venetian style! Some reviews had said that the beds were hard, but we did not have a problem with ours. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly - Walter even gave us a recommendation for dinner (Antiche Carampane) and made reservations for us. Breakfast at the hotel was light, but delicious! When you sit down outside the ladies take your drink order & bring you apricot pastries & bread/cheese, and you can also go inside the breakfast room to choose more pastries, cereals & fruits. A great way to start the day! The area surrounding the hotel is quiet but full of things to do (I highly recommend getting dinner at Muro, just around the corner)! My husband & I walked everywhere on the island, only taking a boat from the airport when we arrived and to the train station when we left. If youâ€™re up for it, I recommend it! The atmosphere around St. Markâ€™s Square & Rialto Bridge is very touristy and crowded, but just steps away it is quiet but just as interesting. Overall, an amazing hotel in a great area!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lorri88
Reviews.Content: We got back from Venice yesterday & i'm depressed to be sat at my desk back to normaility. I booked this hotel on the reviews of Tripadvisor alone.... and i was not disapointed at all. The hotel is perfect for a stay. We were their for my partners birthday, in a double superior room (no 6) it had a canal view - but only if you stood on tiptoes looking out the window - but nevertheless it was there. Location wise, 2 mins walk from Stan Stae Water Taxi stop, but we opted and got a private taxi to the door for 90 euros... well worth it to feel like james bond for 20 mins !! The room was tidy, well displayed, Bed very comfy, bathroom looked newly fitted, mini bar was stacked with the essentials, and very reasonably priced. Walter and Sandro cannot do enough to help you, in fact all the staff are lovely, and really welcoming. If i am lucky enough to go to Venice, i will be staying here. You can get to Rialto Bridge is 15 mins slow stroll.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Regene
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to find place in Venezia but Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is easy to find. Get off the stop of San State and walk within 100M, you will find a small and elegant yard and that is the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. Actually, you can find signs of the Hotel to show u the way. At first, we were a little disappointed with the reception area, a small counter and a few small tables. But the Hotel staffs were very helpful and friendly and once we saw the room, we just forget all the bad feelings we had earlier. We traveled with the family, so there were four of us, including two kids. We were offered a quadruple superior room. The room itself was huge and decorated beautifully and elegantly. Kids had plenty of space to lay out all their shoppings along the way. The floor was so clean that we were all barefooted walking in the room. The bathroom was modern, clean and also big. Breakfast was great and full of selections. We stayed there for two nights and had to leave early in the morning to catch the train on the 3rd day morning. The Hotel Staff kindly arranged an early breakfast for us, which was totally no difference from the one we had before. Moreover, the Hotel staffs were kind and friendly. They would suggest ways to save money and recommended restaurants which were excellent but at a reasonable price level. Overall, it was a very comfortable and warm place and definitely we will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: celoemar
Reviews.Content: The hotel service began a few months before when we received an e-mail from them giving us several tips about parking and especially about the fastest way to access the the hotel. The location is excellent, the rooms are beautiful and breakfast has few options but is very good and the local is very pleasant. We were very well received by Sandro, he was very helpful throughout our stay. The only thing that we did not like was the height of the pillows (too high) and my wife did not like the mattress. Also, I got a little allergic to dust during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent B&B”
Reviews.Author: cmrmells
Reviews.Content: Arrival at this B&B should be easy from all points, it's less than 100yds from the San Stae stop and really easy to find. Would recomend Alilaguna from the airport, a bit dearer than bus and vaperetto but easier as you get a seat and no change with heavy cases. We arrived after 2 weeks camping via vaperetto from Punta Sabioni as recomended by the owners. If you ask them a question they give you very good information and options. It's tucked away down a very (very) narrow passage straight behind San Stae church, there is a sign but its small and about 10ft up the wall. Just get off and walk straight forward and take the first possible left, yes down there! The greeting refelcted our overall final impression of this B&B, warm and very human. We arrived somewhat fatigued due to San Stae stop being closed (first time in 7 years) and having to walk from 2 stops further up with 2 big cases. We were offered water and time to cool down by a very polite lady cleaning the reception area. One of the owners checked us in and helped with our cases to the room. He also gave the kids a business card each and told them that if we get lost or have a problem while we are out and about to ask someone to phone and he will help, nice touch. The room (no.10) was ready and set up with the 2 extra beds for the kids and everything explained. I keep refering to Al ponte as a B&B which I think is the best description, the room however is definately 'hotel' standard and 4 star standard. Tastefully and sympathetically decorated, as is the whole building, using expensive fixtures and fittings the room forms part of the 'Venetian' expeirence. Air-con, TV, mini-bar, hairdryer, power bath and spotless throughout, it is obvious a great deal of care and attention to detail as been used on this building. Breakfast is as everyone says in their reviews a great start to your day served quitely but very pleasantly by the ladies that I assume then go on to clean afterwards. If you want something you don't see ask and they will try their best to find something for you. We found the San Stae area to be a great area to stop in, far enough away from the summer madness of St Marks and the Rialto but close enough to walk, 10 mins to the Rialto and a furthe r10 mins walk to St Marks, all sgned and easy to follow. Would highly recomend a little restaurant just outside the passage called Osteria Mocenigo and the ice cream shop 50 yds past. Once again just ask and you'll be given great advise on where to eat. This is a B&B due it's lack of 'hotel' facilities, the ability to have a drink at night or a snack outside of breakfast would have been useful for us. However, as a B&B it is 5 star and exudes a warm human atmosphere while maintaining a professionaly run establishment. Our stay in Venice was significantly flavoured by our stay at 'Al Ponte' and I wouldn't hesitate in recomending this place without reservation. The 'Al Ponte' expierence is a credit to all involved, thank you very much for a most pleasurable stay, I hope we can return quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In Venice”
Reviews.Author: BonJoviGroupie
Reviews.Content: This is such a good value for Venice. The rooms cute and clean. It is also a great location for the vaparetto. We loved it and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, ideally located & very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: andyrout1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July 2011. I booked online through the hotel website, and found it really easy to use, no nonsense, and very informative. There was a minor mixup with the room I'd booked, and I was notified straightaway by email from the hotel owners. They were very apologetic and we actually ended being put in a superior room as this was the only one left (and at the same rate as the initial booking) - I thought this was great service. The hotel is very easy to find using the instructions they provide. Literally a 2 minute walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop. It's situated in a picture-postcard location, on the edge of a small canal, with the main hotel built around a small courtyard. The building and location really is lovely, and the area is very quiet indeed - very little noise from boats, and not much in the way of tourists in the area either. That said, it's less than a 10 minute walk to Rialto, and about the same in the opposite direction to the train station. Indeed, if you're exploring the city as a whole then this hotel is more or less ideally located right in the physical centre of the islands. We really enjoyed exploring the area and walking right around the islands to all the different areas. Whilst waiting to check in we were offered complimentary coffee and had a little chat with one of the hotel owners. We were then shown to our room in the building across the canal. The hotel consists of the 'main' part, centered around the courtyard, and a building directly across the canal, where they also have a number of rooms. The rooms really are terrific - huge floorspace, high-ceilings, with lovely traditional style furniture and furnishings, rugs, and a sofa in the room too. Felt quite cosy despite the enormous size! Our room had two large windows looking across the canal to the main hotel building, and was lovely and airy. The bathroom was equally cavernous, very well fitted out, and both the bathroom and bedroom were impeccably clean. I did find the bed a little hard at first, however this didn't really detract from the stay. Breakfast is in the courtyard area and it was really nice sitting there in the sunshine, enjoying the pastries, coffee and fruit that's served. The offering is quite simple, however, as with the rest of the hotel, it really surpasses itself for a 2* hotel - simple, fresh and delicious. We spent some time asking various touristy questions of the owners on reception on various days and they were extremely friendly and happy to help at all times. Nothing was too much trouble and we were very much made to feel at home. I gather from other guests we spoke to that this was also the case for them. We were recommended several reasonable restaurants serving very good food in the immediate area, and there are loads more in the more 'touristy' areas, all of which are within easy walking distance. As with the rest of the experience, checkout was a breeze - zero fuss. We stayed here due to the ratings on TripAdvisor, and I have to say it fully met expectations on all fronts - I really wouldn't stay anywhere else if I came back. As a 2* hotel it abviously doesn't offer the full range of room service, restaurant etc., however as a simple, comfortable, elegant, authentic, good value and welcoming place to stay it exceeded all our expectations. A deserved #1 !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellie_11
Reviews.Content: Following good trip advisor advice, we booked for a family of 4, 2 adults, 2 boys (14/10), booked the junior suite. Organised the booking over email, always exceptionally fast and very friendly responses. Their directions on getting there are spot on and easy to follow. Wonderful hotel, staff and management were so helpful and friendly. Our room was really lovely and large enough for the four of us. we had a four posted canopy bed, plus a single bed and a trundle bed, a lovely window and small balcony overlooking the breakfast courtyard. everytime we returned to the room after a long hot day walking our room was always lovely and cool. breakfast was great. the hotel is in a quiet spot, but it feels very secure and we found really easy to get to everything we wanted. some good restaurants close by and reasonably priced. the hotel staff offer some good recommendations. A tip, if you have enough of the people and heat in venice, take a water bus over to Lido, walk across the island (15 minutes) and have a swim in the adriatic sea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ryan4350
Reviews.Content: The staff were amazing, and the hotel is full of charm. Small enough to feel warm and welcoming, yet does not shy away from the comforts. This is a bit far away from the square, and I would suggest walking instead of taking the water. Have and will continue to recommend. One of our top three hotels from 9 weeks travel in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “No door sills at the annex rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mariia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my husband in July 2011. We both travel weekly for business, so it is a bit difficult to write a review and consider only Venetian standards... It is like giving a grade to hotel at Key West, what things you are willing to accept just because of the location. Our room was located in the Annex. Spacious, extremely clean room, with nice decor. We have stayed at Venice before, and the room was bigger than we expected. But without a door sill, which means that noise insulation is a little bit questionable. This was not a problem for us - thanks to an elderly couple who stayed at the next room, but it could have been otherwise... The view was just a brick wall, so there was no point to open the curtains. Another, minor thing was that there was no place to put shampoo/shower gel bottles in the shower except the floor, but that is easy to fix. Other reviewers have appraised the breakfast, and although I have travelled in Italy many times, and I am familiar with the standard ... I really, really would prefer having something a little bit healthier than sweet croissant / pastry. I know, it is a cultural thing, coming from up north we start the day with porridge and rye bread with ham or cheese. On the other hand, I love real cappuccino! So shortly: it is a nice truly Venetian style hotel at not-so-crowded area with friendly staff, with small details you may or may not like.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend!”
Reviews.Author: HardyMarsh55
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a long weekend in Venice in June. This hotel was rated number one on TA and although It ISN'T the most expensive hotel in Venice, the location and the building it is housed in are quite breathtaking. The hotel and the annexe are 15/16th century...the hotel is a former 'Palazzo' and as such has this wonderful sense of history infused into every nook and cranny. The bedroom was characterful and furnished in typical 'Venetian' style without being too twee. The breakfasts are delicious and are served in an intimate open air quadrangle [when the weather allows] I asked the owner for a comfortable bed as a couple of the reviewers had stated that the beds were hard. I have to say the bed was perfect! Full marks to the 'Moncenigo'...it is a unique and special hotel that deserves to thrive.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel- excellent value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: claire738
Reviews.Content: We stayed her in early July and had the most amazing time- unbelievable that it only has a 2 star rating! We opted to stay in the annex which was like an small apartment with small room with a chaise lounge that leads into the main bedroom and a good-sized bathroom. The room is beautifully decorated and has a well-stocked mini-bar and flat screen television. The room was on the top floor and did have a set of steep(ish) stairs leading up to it. The air-con was excellent and much needed in the July heat. The breakfast provided was good (especially the danish pastry) and included cereals, sweet cakes and fruit but could be improved with a selection of cold meats. All the staff were friendly and approachable. Location: At the bottom of the street was the Stan Stae vaporetto stop which is part of vaporretto Route 1. On the street is a Gelto (Ice Cream) shop- the best we went to for taste and price, a bakery, a small shop selling food/drinks, a cafe and an authentic restaurant ran by locals (We went to the restaurant for lunch one day, the food was tasty and a reasonable price for Venice). The Rialto Bridge is a 10 min walk away and 20 min walk from San Marco (St Mark's) Square (Head down the street opposite the Gelto shop and there are directions on walls of buildings to help you get there- if you get lost follow others who look like they know where they are going!) If we ever get round to coming back to Venice, we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: milbyhols
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit, although my friends had not been before. All were very impressed. Like the location, a less obvious part of Venice, very convenient for vaporetto, restaurants etc. Good size rooms, lovely little courtyard, really friendly and helpful service. The rave reviews are well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - Beautiful Rooms - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CasperAdventures
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. We stayed in the Annex, a 1 minute walk to the main hotel for check in/breakfast/etc. No inconvenience at all. Charming, clean rooms with fabulous bathrooms. The staff makes this the only hotel I would choose in Venice. A few notes: the beds are hard! So, remember to ask them for a pillow topper to make it softer. No trouble to get one and then the bed is good. The San Stae vaporetto stop is a minute from the hotel, so you can easily move to St. Mark's Square that way. You can buy a 48 hour ticket that will end up being the best deal for you! If you don't want to do this, you will have an enjoyable walk to St. Mark's Square, over the Rialto Bridge. It is enough of a walk that when exhausted at the end of a particularly long day we weren't willing to walk back to St. Mark's for our favorite restaurant - and chose to eat closer to the hotel. Don't let this stop you from staying!! Just ride the vaporetto if you don't like to walk more than 10 minutes. Breakfast was consistently good - yummy lemon muffins were our favorite. Our 9 year old was able to find food she could enjoy. We stayed in a triple that had a queen bed and an adorable twin bed that my daughter loved. She felt very special. Stay here!! :-) Thank you Al Ponte Mocenigo!

Reviews.Title: “All the great reviews are completely true, it exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mmg23
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel given the great reviews we saw on Trip Advisor and it exceeded our expectations. Incredible location, stunning rooms and bathrooms, delicious breakfast in a beautiful courtyard and the most helpful and friendly hosts. Don't miss this hotel--it really was one of the highlights of our wonderful trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we stayed at in Italy - brilliant”
Reviews.Author: NellyTho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our one month trip to Italy. We only stayed for 2 nights and really regretted it. it is a FABULOUS hotel and we absolutely loved it. Best things: - friendly staff (especially the women at breakfast, but all) - clean and lovely rooms (very Ventian in decor too) - brilliant breakfast - unsurpassed - great location - free wifi - didn't charge for our daughter (4yo) Worst things: - nothing Stay there, you won't regret it. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM FELT PALATIAL”
Reviews.Author: bonbot062
Reviews.Content: The room was opulent and had a little balconette that overlooked the street below. We did not have a canal view but that did not matter to us. The room was on the third floor and was large enough for two adults and two teenage boys. The bathroom was a four piece and it was lovely to soak in the deep tub. The breakfast was served on the strret level in a terraced oasis. The service was wonderful-we truly felt like royalty. This doesn't look like much on the outside but WOW! when you get inside. Very accomadating staff! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “100% PERFECT IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: Bemami
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here after reading all the amazing reviews - and our experience completely lived up to the reviews. The staff are very friendly - Particularly the gentleman who is on for the evening shift! He was soooo lovely and helpful! Breakfast - is served in a gorgeous outdoor area - Perfect way to start the day. and the ladies that serve breakfast are lovely. Location - Is perfect, even more perfect that it is nestled in a quiet little area away from the touristy-hectic areas. And the Rooms - We stayed in one of the New Annex rooms - the size, design, bathroom, sound proofed, everything was so beautiful and perfect! Honestly, I know I have already said it a few times... But.. Everything about this hotel is perfect! I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, you can believe the reviews: Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PraguePoker
Reviews.Content: I found this gem through Trip Advisor, so I thought it only fair I share my experiences, as well. And not surprisingly, I loved this hotel! It's easy to reach by water bus, the owners are incredibly friendly and helpful, the hotel itself is very stylish and well maintained, the outside breakfast area is the perfect place for a coffee in the morning before heading off to explore Venice, and our room was quite large and comfortable. We fit two adults and two children there no problem. It even had a small, adjacent room with a bed and a small kitchenette, although we didn't use it. Overall, this has to be one of the best "value for money" hotels I've every experienced throughout my many travels in Europe. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie11
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed for one night in a junior suite and 1 night in the annex (2nights in the suite had been originally booked but we had to change our travel dates and the suite was not available the second night). The hotel was in a quiet spot and we walked to everything. The decor was lovely in the Venetian style, and the bathrooms were very clean. There was a lot of attention to detail in the decor which shows the owners care (like the wall plug plates printed with the hotel's name). On our previous trip to Venice as a couple 5 years ago we stayed at the Gritti Palace for 3 times the price, this was a far better hotel experience. The ladies at breakfast in particular were absolutely lovely and were very welcoming to our 11 and 7 year-olds. Often the top hotels on Trip Advisor are heavily skewed in favor of cheaper ones and so you don't really know what to expect but this was worth the rating, particularly considering the great value. Having stayed in both parts of the hotel I would opt if possible for the main hotel as the annex feels too removed from the main hotel- there is no internal connection. The suite overlooked the breakfast courtyard so we heard some noise early in the morning- if you prefer to sleep in ask for a room not overlooking the courtyard. Also, no lifts so heavy luggage a problem. The one thing that I felt was not in keeping with the rest of the care shown was the ugly sight of the air-conditioning units in the courtyard, but perhaps a screen can't be erected there for some reason. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, just as expected from reviews”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiPandas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mocenigo, late June / early July and we were very happy with the service, rooms and the breakfast, which has been well mentioned on this site before. Because of our late booking, we ended up staying in the main building for 2 nights and the Annex for 1 - which was fine as both are equally as good, with well appointed and decorated rooms. Location is great, right near the water taxi stop, yet away from the tourist crowd and near some more authentic restaurants. Sandro and Walter were very helpful as were the hotel staff, particularly the friendly ladies helping with breakfast - nothing was too much trouble for them. Overall, a great stay and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay (and breakfast) in Italy so far!”
Reviews.Author: Spankymunky
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights there in a triple room. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Breakfast is the best so far and good location. Rooms are great!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, no disappointments. Magnifico!”
Reviews.Author: 2CAM
Reviews.Content: Helpful, friendly welcome - nothing was too much trouble. Sandro, Walter and their team know what their customers want and go out of their way to provide it. Well appointed room, spotless big bathrooms and delicious breakfast served by delightful ladies. A well situated but tranquil oasis to return to after the buzz and heat of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jodityrer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Italy and loved staying at this Hotel. The rooms were above our expectations as was the service and breakfast. I must mention that the breakfast was the best we had encountered in Italy during our five week trip. It was central and within easy walking distance to the San Stae vaporetto stop. We stayed in the new apartments across from the hotel. They were spacious with huge bathrooms and had a separate bedroom for families. We caught a water taxi to the door and Sandro had given us perfect instructions to tell the driver. we were lucky enough to go to a classical concert that Sandro also booked for us and gave us directions and advice on what time to arrive. We have stayed in Venice before but this time was truly memorable because of this enchanting friendly hotel. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Hope to return someday!”
Reviews.Author: hearttexas
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is very easy to find via water taxi. They give very simple, easy directions which take you right to the front door. In Venice this is truly appreciated. The hotel was very welcoming and accomodating. The service/hospitality was more like that of a B&B. Each morning they serve breakfast in a courtyard which is made up of delicious croissants, bread, cereal, fruit, coffee, and fresh juices. Our rooms were spacious and comfortable with plenty of space to spread out our luggage. Our room was very elegant, with hardwood floors and chandeliers. The bathroom was nice & big for an European hotel and included a tub/shower combo. Note that there is not a lift/elevator. They did carry our bags up to our room for us, which was much appreciated. They do have rooms available on the first floor, which worked out well since my mom had a cast on her foot. After we checked out and were walking toward the taxi station, one of the staff chased me down because I left a bag in the breakfast area. It just shows how great the staff is! Also, the location is perfect. It is close to a water taxi stand and the Rialto Bridge area is in easy walking distance. At the same time, it is far enough away from the crowded areas, which allows you to enjoy the laid-back Venice culture.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Perfection”
Reviews.Author: WootTravel
Reviews.Content: There is a good reason why this has been the top hotel for years in Venice. The location is great as it isn't situated in the middle of the high traffic tourist section however is a very short walk from the vaparetto station. The staff was professional, helpful and friendly. The hotel was very nice, the rooms were large and comfortable. They breakfast they had was the best we had in all of Italy. We truly enjoyed our trip to Venice and to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved to be #1 in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Thomas_UK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Al Ponte Mociengo is well deserved to hold the #1 slot on TA for Venice, not only for 2011 but for previous years which proudly displays its TA awared at reception. Residing in a quiet residential area of Venice it is a delightfully decorated, clean and a very friendly place to return to at the end of a busy day exploring this amazing city. The Hotel has a delightfully peaceful courtyard where a breakfast of pastries, breads, fruit, yoghurt, fruit juices and tea, coffee or hot chocolate are served each morning between 8am and 10am and served with a smile and a happy chat each morning. All the staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and nothing was too much to ask for. Good service costs nothing and the hotel has it by the bucket load. My wife and I stayed in Room #8, a larger room decorated in vibrant reds and goldâ€™s with lovely dark wooden flooring, high ceiling and fantastic Murano glass chandelier. Had a large bed (two singles joined together) that was slightly hard for the first night but this is a personal thought and not derogatory of the hotel by any means. Bathroom is also large and decorated to a high standard as well. Immaculately clean and tidy each day. On a map the Hotel may look to be away from the main tourist hot spots but it is not. Ten to fifteen minutes walk puts you at the Rialto Bridge and twenty to twenty-five minutes walk or water bus ride puts you into St. Marks Square. The water bus stop is ideally positioned approximately 2 minutes from both of the Hotelâ€™s entrances with directions are on the Hotelâ€™s website to find the main entrance from the water bus stop â€“ not difficult to find at all. To get the you can take a water taxi which are private James Bond-esque beautiful craft that can take you directly to your hotel for 1 â€“ 5 persons but they are 100EUR. Alternatively and more affordable is the Alilaguna Water Bus from Marco Polo airport into Venice. At 25EUR return the Alilaguna line â€œLinea Arancioâ€� serves the St. Stae water bus stop which is approximately 4 stops or 50 minutes from Marco Polo airport, which also serves the #1 and N ACTV water bus lines, and is next to the hotel. To eat nearby I can also recommend â€œOsteria Antico Giardinettoâ€�. A small restaurant run by a husband and wife which is very near to the hotel. Go straight out of the hotel and over the bridge, go over two further bridges, then take first right and then second left. It is a lovely and small place with an open air enclosed court yard to eat alfresco. Food is superb, service slow but are you in a rush? Cost slightly more than in town but the quantity, quality and romantic ambiance will surpass anything you will get next to the Rialto!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in all of Italy!”
Reviews.Author: decon
Reviews.Content: We had the best stay at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in the newer Annex. Location of this hotel was perfect, very, very close to the San Stae Vaporetto Stop on Line 1. Be sure to pick up a multiple hour pass, you will like the convenience of hopping on and off the water bus. The hotel was the best one that we stayed in while vacationing in Italy. Walter and the gentleman during the nighttime shift were very professional and friendly. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice. Breakfast was great with the warm bread and croissants. Wifi was very good. FYI Stay away from the tourist trap food places near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Stuart60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary.The hotel choice was a surprise for my wife.Walter and Sandro were most helpful particularly in recommendations of restaurants nearby, all of excellent quality. The hotel certainly lived up to it's trip advisor rating and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. The staff and their attention to detail were faultless. The hotel is located in a relatively non tourist area but close enough to visit all the attractions of Venice. The room was superb. Breakfast quality was excellent, compared with other european city hotel destinations. Many thanks to all at the hotel and particularly Walter in his assistance on our final day. A Water taxi is well worth the expense - what a way to arrive in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Very good in all aspects bar 1”
Reviews.Author: VICTEETH
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel about midway between the the Railway station and the Rialto bridge. It is about 150 metres from the main canal where the water bus stops. The staff are very polite, rooms are clean and well appointed and the continental breakfast of a very good standard. The main downside is the poor free Wifi- very common in the "boutique" hotels in Italy. Yes, highly recommended but if internet is critical check before you book about the current status.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 2calgrads
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Mocenigo is conveniently located in the Santa Croce area, less than 100 meters from the San Stae vaporetto stop (get directions!). In the immediate vicinity are several museums and a number of restaurants. Even so, the neighborhood never seems heavily visited by tourists, yet the residents and over-nighters maintain a lively presence well into the evening. Al Nono Risorto is a restaurant with a large outdoor seating area that is very popular with residents and is quite reasonably priced (for Venice). It was most enjoyable to sit in the Campo San Stae at night, enjoying the balmy air and reflections of the lights on the Grand Canal. We stayed for 8 nights in the 'annex'. Our quiet room was quite nicely appointed and maintained, although the couch was so deep that we had to use all of the extra bed pillows to sit there with any comfort. The mild and dry weather allowed us to enjoy the ample breakfast each morning in the lovely garden/courtyard of the hotel. Staff were eager to please, going so far as to obtain (after a brief wait) some plain yogurt for us one morning. Thereafter, it was always available. Our only trouble was signing on to the WiFi connection, using the free password provided. After several days, we gave up and used the free computer provided in a public area of the hotel. Although rates are not inexpensive and we are not familiar with other Venice hotels, we felt that this hotel provides very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place away from the crowds-research to pick your room to request”
Reviews.Author: Da2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in early June. We arrived on a Sunday and there was a regatta so we walked from the train station. Not recommended due to confusing alleys and bridges. But it allowed us to stumble upon the side alley entrance. It is on a tiny, and I mean tiny as in narrow, alley. We got great amusement from that but rang the bell and went right in! We were given room 8 upstairs in the main building. It was ok, and I think some of my slight disappointment was that it was smaller than the two other hotels we stayed in. It was decorated in red velvet and felt very Venetian. It was clean and well appointed. What turned me off was the bars on the windows and the slight "smoke" smell that I think was from people smoking in the alley outside. I had upgraded to a superior room and not sure it was. I would definitely stay there agin but research other rooms and request one, maybe with a balcony or without bars on the windows. The breakfast was very pleasant and we loved and preferred the little apricot biscuit things they served along with the yummy croissants! And yummy on the cappuccinos too!!! Overall, we would definitely stay again and the San stae stop was SOOO convenient. We also took the alilaguna to the airport right from the San stae stop...soooooo easy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ShowMeState
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ponte al Mocenigo is my favorite hotel in Venice. Sandro and Walter are warm, friendly and helpful. This is my second stay there, and I would not consider staying anywhere else. The rooms are elegant with typical Venetian furnishings. My friend and I stayed in the large room #9 for most of our stay, but, I also stayed in the annex for one night. It too was wonderful. The convenience cannot be beat with St. Stae vaporetto stop just steps away. The area has a neighborhood feeling, but, it is easy to get to all of the tourist sites from there. The hotel is a great treat after touring all day. You won't find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Not the most amazing place - but it's very nice”
Reviews.Author: VTJedi
Reviews.Content: This is definately a Trip Advisor fanboy hotel. I can see why after our stay but I'm not quite sure I'd say it's the best place I'd ever stayed. Still very nice and if you can afford it you won't be disappointed. It's a lovely hotel. We had a Supreme Room "Red Room" which was large by European Standards. The bed was comfortable, mini bar was nice to have, and the bathroom was large and modern. The furniture was nice... but the blood red walls were something else! :-) The internet was the most reliable we encountered in our hotels in Italy. Worked very well! This hotel's popularity means they can charge much higher prices and people will pay. It is not cheap to stay here. It was nice not to have to put down a deposit for a room. Again - with this hotel's popularity if you cancel at the last minute they will most likely be able to re-sell the room. If you can afford this hotel - go for it! We walked to the hotel from the train station. Very easy to do in 10-15 minutes. The vaporetto station near the hotel is nice too and convenient. I love that you are not in the tourist center and more in a residential area of venice. St. Mark's is nice - but go once and avoid it the rest of the time! The rialto is a quick walk... but for a nice meal head south of Campo Santa Margherita and San Barnaba and have a meal at Al Casin Dei Nobili. It is nice that the hotel offers a free breakfast but it is very minimal and basic. The housekeepers will wait on you at breakfast. They are all friendly and nice but there simply isn't enough breakfast tables if all the guests come down at once... especially when it rains and you can't sit outside which happened twice while we were there. It was hard for the 2 housekeepers to continually bring out drinks to people while clearing tables and making sure the juice and cereals stayed stocked. In fact, of all the hotels we went to in Italy - this hotel had the most basic breakfast... cereal in individual pre-packages (corn puffs)... and then 2 croissants and 2 bread rolls for each table... plus yogurts and bananas and jam and those sorts of things. It was nice to have but I must say that I've heard people rave about the croissants (including some of my neighbors who stayed at this hotel a few years ago) and they were not that great in early June of 2011. Filled with a sugary apricot center... not a homemade flake apart croissant as some of the other reviewers mentioned. Twice we were served ones that were stale. That's really the biggest fault I could find with this hotel - and that is getting really nit-picky. While I am not sure if this hotel deserves to be the number one in all of venice... I can say that the men who run the hotel (walter & sandro) and the other men who work at the desk are all nice and friendly and will help with anything. They give you an excellent map at check-in and can help with anything if you need it. We didn't think dinner reservations were needed in Venice if you got to a place before 8PM but if you want, they can make them for you. It's a nice small hotel with nice male staff. Gay Friendly. Very Venetian. We would stay here again in the future - and we'd still sit through the same basic breakfast. It is free after all. Maybe we will just pass on the stale croissants. ;-) You can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay in Venice - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: June-61
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we spent 4 nights at the Al Ponte Mocenigo. We were celebrating our silver wedding anniversary and stayed in the junior suite. This is a lovely room with a little balcony overlooking the couryard garden. Beautiful glass chandeliers and venitian style furnishings and flooring. Only slight critisism was the mattress on the bed was a little too firm. We arrived on the vaporetto late morning at the nearby S. Stae, finding the hotel was easy from the directions emailed with our booking comfirmation. We purchased a 72 hr vaporetto pass but unfortunately they were on strike for one of the days! It didn't really matter because we enjoyed walking, and getting lost, exploring the city. We had a magical time, loved Venice and loved the hotel. Can only agree with all the other positive comments previously posted. Thanks to the staff for making our celebration so special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Perfect Spot Away From The Crowds!”
Reviews.Author: gina-schmitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for three nights in May 2011. We were on the third floor of the Annex. (Not recommended for those who have trouble with stairs, but then again, really Venice isn't a great place for people who can not handle stairs.) The owner carried the majority of our luggage to our room. I have NEVER stayed in a hotel where the bathroom looked like it had never been used before! This hotel has wonderful housekeeping services! The breakfast is average - it served its purpose. (I am not a big fan of breakfast.) The location is PERFECT! It is away from the beaten tourist path and easily reachable from the San Stae vaporetto stop. (When following the directions to the hotel from the stop, be aware that the street/alley is narrow.) There is gelato steps from the Annex entrance. There is a small campiello steps away from the hotel where there is a small little wine bar and Muro San Stae, a delish restaurant (will review soon). The wine bar was nameless, but it was a perfect spot to sit outside and people watch while drinking 2 Euro white wines with some complimentary snacks - every day we returned to this place. I am glad to have found this hotel on Tripadvisor, it helped make our trip to Venice wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: George32655
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was one of the highlights of our recent trip to Italy. We had a great start with this hotel. Space, service, cleanliess, breakfast, reasonable price, and so on. Strongly suggest to stay at this hotel. Caution! If you arrive late at night, take water taxi. It is next to impossible to find the hotel at night unless you arrive at the canal entrance.
