The canal is very narrow. Not all water taxi go into the canal. The hotel recommends a taxi company which will take guests to the canal entrance. However,there were no representatives of the Company at the airport when we arrived. We negotiated with other Company's driver and he managed to sail into the canal. Make sure that he can sail into the canal before boarding.

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved praise”
Reviews.Author: marially
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, I have only good things to say about Hotel Al Ponte. Their reviews are well deserved - there are even awards from Trip Advisor in the reception area. It was hot when we arrived and we were welcomed and invited to sit and cool down with a large pitcher of ice water before checking in. (Getting ice in Italy is not as easy as you would expect!) Our room was small but so comfortably appointed that we never felt cramped. The air conditioning worked like a charm which was a blessing, and the room was spotless. Far enough from the center to be quiet and calm, but close enough to be able to get anywhere you want. I wanted to be nearer the center at first but was out-voted by my husband and daughter and I'm so glad that they persisted. It would have been a much different experience dealing with the crowds. A wonderful value for the money, I recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - recommend this highly”
Reviews.Author: Glencliffe
Reviews.Content: We had read previous reviews and agree with most that this is a wonderful choice when visiting Venice. The delicious apricot croissants are indeed memorable; the staff is very helpful; the location is great for walking or taking the vaporetto. We are grateful to other reviewers for helping us to find the easy entrance without stairs, so I will return the favor and try to help. If arriving by plane, the least expensive, direct route is by Alilaguna, Orange line. Get a cart, go past water taxis, and get on this private line boat. The fourth stop is San Stae (pronounced sty). Go straight - right side of church - watch the house numbers on the right - at 1966 turn left into extremely narrow alley. Go 3/4 way down this alley and there is a bell to ring to enter directly on to the main floor of the hotel. Hope the pictures help. Wi-Fi is available for a few hours - didn't work well all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Far surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Boysens
Reviews.Content: A friend had recommended this hotel and we are so thankful. We stayed in the newly renovated building across the canal and it was beautiful. There was plenty of room for our family of four. It was quiet and a welcome retreat after our full days of sight-seeing. Walter and Sandro were very accomodating and the breakfasts were a delight in the sunny patio area!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, beautiful room and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Janet_Ann21
Reviews.Content: We agree with all the reviews. We stayed in the new annex for 3 nights. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated and well appointed.We particularly loved the gorgeous bathroom. The location is great as you are away from the main tourist crowds and yet a short walk takes you quickly to the main sights that is if you don't get lost. The narrow streets and canals near the hotel are just what you come to Venice to experience.The water bus to the airport from St Stae was very convenient. It was also easy to get to the hotel from the station. We really enjoyed Venice and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “why we have returned five times”
Reviews.Author: Pedeyez
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in the world. Sandro and Walter, our hosts, are warm, efficient, are caring. The hotel is beautiful. Each room is beautifully decorated. We love Venice but not thecrowds; the hotel is located in St.Croce which is far from St. Mark's place. It is easy to get to the hotel by the #1 Vaporetto and then a few yards to the tiny street for the entrance to the hotel. The breakfast is very good. It is served in a garden decorated with stonework and flowers. There is a breakfast room for inclement weather. The people who serve breakfast are delightful and eager to please. There is free internet which works very well. Sandro, Walter, and all of their staff have been helpful with reservations and guidance for places to go.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience! Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lmkusa
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo was a memorable one! Pure delight! From the moment my husband and I arrived at the hotel until our departure, everything was absolutely perfect. Walter and Sandro are terrific hosts! They are extremely courteous and helpful. We stayed at the new annex for three nights. The room was very specious, clean and beautifully decorated. And, of course, who can forget the most amazing part of our stay â€“ having breakfast on the terrace! Al Ponte Mocenigo did not just meet our expectations â€“ it absolutely exceeded them!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderingdancer
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, helpful staff. Great breakfasts and all in a lovely old, lovingly restored house. Out door garden, private entrance and bridge and close to the the canal and transport. Hotel has its own entrance to the hotel so it is possible to get there by taxi for unloading suitcases. We all loved our stay and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations, a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LovingLifexx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here with friends for 3 nights in February. Although cold, the weather was dry and sunny and we got round the main tourist attractions. It was a great time to visit as it wasn't too crowded.The hotel is in a fantastic location a short distance by water bus away from the main areas, but is surrounded by enchanting squares with quiet bars and craft shops. The locals were so friendly, and the Hotel is amazing, the rooms are out of this world! Book to stay here and enjoy what's on the doorstep, it's a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another 5-star review”
Reviews.Author: pats10
Reviews.Content: As others have stated, location is convenient to the vaporetto/train station yet in a quiet area away from all the tourist crowds. Staff was very accomodating and provided great restaurant recommendations. Outdoor courtyard was great for breakfast or for relaxing later at night. By chance we boarded the first stop of the vaporetto and got an outside seat in the front of the boat. I would recommend this to others visiting for the first time as it's hard to enjoy the ride when it's packed with people . Take it all the way to the end and explore the islands. We were in the Annex, room #21, for two nights. The only negative was the AC wasn't working but it wasn't a major issue since it was relatively cool at night.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences in my life”
Reviews.Author: jwilenmann
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best price / quality I have ever been to. It is not at all an elegant or fancy hotel, yet it has an extraordinary service, it is incredibly charming and the staff / owners are really helpful and friendly. Al Ponte Mocenigo is located just three vaporetto stops from Santa Lucia Train Station (that's really close), and yet only 2 stops from Rialto, pretty much the center of the main island of Venice. It is not in the main touristic destinations, so it is much quieter than other places, yet you can reach them in 5 minutes. It is just 1 minute walking from the Grand Canal. This means you cannot have a sight of the Grand Canal from your room. But if you walk a couple of meters you get to it. Rooms are excellent. They are really charming and cozy. The prices are very low for Venice, but you get an extraordinary hotel and room for what you pay. Plus, the breakfast is extraordinary, served by a really nice staff. Both owners of the hotel normally are on the reception. They are really friendly and helpful: they will explain you in no time all you need to know about the complicated system of transport of Venice. If you are a millionaire, who wants to pay a lot of money to have an elegant suite with a Grand Canal / Venice Lagoon sight, then this is not the place for you. For everyone else, this is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: weeboaby
Reviews.Content: Very easy to find, literally 50 yards from the San Stae Vaporetto stop. Centrally located so the Rialto and San Marco are easily walkable. The standard room layout and features were excellent, although the room was very close to the reception area and it did get a bit warm (we couldn't figure out the AC). Breakfast is very good, and the internal courtyard where you can eat is very pretty. All of the staff were extremely helpful and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to complain”
Reviews.Author: Chapmanbilly
Reviews.Content: But it would be futile, erroneous and a complete waste of time. Believe me, all those earlier gushing reviews are correct and maybe even understate how pleasant this hotel is. In terms of criticism, I would describe it as bomb-proof. Location is ace - far enough away from all the tat of St Marks and Rialto, but within 80 metres of San Stae vaparetto stop. For first-timers, disembark and walk due south on right side of church. About sixty metres down, door on right is numbered 1966 (great year for English football) - immediately opposite is narrow (more correctly, tiny) alleyway, and about twenty metres along is rear entrance to hotel. About eighty metres from San Stae and all on the level. Accommodation also serves only to please. We were allocated room in annex - no 31 on top floor. Room was spacious enough and comfortable, bathroom was recently decorated and spotless. Further comment superfluous. Staff can only be described as friendly, attentive and keen to help. Minor issue I encountered with bath plug (honest) was resolved within minutes. My wife ate heartily at breakfast and described the cafe latte as the best of her stay in Venice. And finally, as far as value for money is concerned, not even I as a travelling Scotsman can find grounds for complaint. I cannot force you to stay here during your visit to Venice - but you'd be a fool not to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sgrenter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Al Ponte Mocenigo for a short break last Autumn, lovely little hotel in a great spot, just a 5/10 minute walk from the Rialto bridge and a stones throw from the St.Stae vaporetto stop. Friendly staff, spacious rooms and very nice breakfasts taken in the small courtyard (although perhaps getting a little chilly for this come October). Quite difficult to find if you don't know where it is, we walked there from the Alilaguna Rialto stop (orange line from the airport) and found it reasonably easily, aided by the Iphone GPS. Heartily recommend the hotel and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Planetexplorers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at this hotel and couldn't fault it. Its location is perfect as you're only a 10 min. walk away from the main attractions. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants ranging from informal to fine dining, again within easy walking distance. The water taxi takes around 30 mins. from the airport and if you use a taxi company called ATPV ( their desk is in front of the exit from the luggage claim area), they know the hotel and will take you right to the hotel's water door (some companies will refuse to go down the narrow waterway). The journey will cost around 100 Euros although we paid 140 Euros as there were 8 of us. Our room was a family room, which slept two adults and two children. It was a good size and decorated in an authentic Venitian style. There were two other adult couples in our group and their rooms were also beautiful. My favourite was the green room with a four poster bed and a balcony that overlooks the small courtyard - stunning! Breakfast is basic but enough to fill your stomach. You can expect warm bread rolls, croissants filled with jam, a few cereals, fresh fruit, and some fruit juices. You are also offered a wide range of delicious tea/coffees - the lattes are delicious. We did all the obvious sight seeing i.e. Marco's Square etc. but we also took a public water taxi to the beach (Lido) and had a lovely couple of hours there. I would also recommend visiting Burano (one of the little islands surrounding Venice and famous for its lace). It's very quaint and there are lots of little shops to visit. Murano (famous for glass) is OK but we preferred Burano. It's well worth investing in a public travel pass when you arrive. It means you can hop on and off the water taxis and works out much cheaper than paying for each individual journey. You can get these passes from any Tabac. We all had a really lovely time in Venice and would definitely stay at this hotel again. It really is superb value for money. Feel free to email if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique gem in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: SoonerWiz
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here and can't say enough about the diligence of the staff to make our trip perfect. The hotel is perfectly situated to explore Venice and is located less than 50m from the San Stae Vaporetto stop. As a bonus the Alilaguna yellow line from the aiport now stops at S. Stae making the aiport journey easy and affordable. Rooms were very nice - we stayed in the annex and breakfast was varied and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it, fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ziggysboy
Reviews.Content: Arrived 15/4/11 for 4 nights but room not ready. No problem, left cases and took a look around the local area. Back in an hour and in the room, No 1. Perfect, large, clean and a fantastic bathroom. The staff led by Walter are just so good at what they do, nothing is too much trouble. Hints and tips on where to go as well as eating were given with a sense of pride in their beautiful city. Breakfast was just great and set you up for walking the city and getting lost!! Always had a glass of wine in the courtyard at night on our return from another wonderful day exploring this fasninating city. Loved Venice and Loved the hotel, just perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFussies
Reviews.Content: This proved to be an excellent choice for a short stay in Venice. Close to the vaporreto in a quieter part of town i.e not too many tourists, only a short walk to the key sites. Superb room in the annex with bags of character. The little terrace was a great place for breakfast in the morning. Walter, Sondro and all the staff were always friendly and most helpful especially with any enquiries such as restaurants and water taxis back to airport. Good local maps provided. Thoroughly recommended and will be our first choice when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Im moving in”
Reviews.Author: jlg54
Reviews.Content: Booked for three nights in early April and could have stayed forever. Great room, good location, great hosts. When I return to Venice it will be to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Feels right at home...Simply THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: Kiran_Chan
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon, and spent 3 nights at this GEM of a hotel. First thing that anyone would notice is the world's most friendly staffs (Walter, Sandro, Donatello, Carlito & a 5th one whose name I cant recall) who are more than willing to help you with anything & everything - directions, recommendations of good restaurants, sights to see, etc. The hotel is just 5 mins away from the train station. The whole place smells absolutely divine, filled with the smell of freshly baked pastry. Their breakfast was great too, with fresh baked croissants, muffins, tarts; served at your table. In whole, the experience was trully memorable and simple 'THE BEST'.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, service and would definetly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: hansy85
Reviews.Content: I cannot thank the staff enough for making our time in Venice so special, they were so helpful and friendly. We were in Venice for a family wedding and the hotel was a perfect base for us all. The rooms are gorgeously decorated and really clean. The continental breakfast is wonderful especially when enjoyed outside in the beautiful courtyard . The staff could not have been more welcoming and when some of our parties flights were cancelled they helped change flights and because they had to stay another night (and the room they were staying in was due to be taken by new arrivals that day) they gave them a suite at no extra cost than their original room. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice looking for a charming Venician hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - exactly as stated in reviews”
Reviews.Author: TexasFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Family of 4, stayed in the RED Room in main hotel - everything was excellent. Lovely, high-ceiling room, very nice bathroom, quiet area, close to vaporetto. Owners and staff were all supurb. Nice courtyard, nice breakfast. I believe the RED Room to be one of the largest - double bed with 2 twins for teenagers, large wardrobe and desk area. Plenty of room for our 2 nights. Observations: this is a relatively small hotel, so don't expect all the rooms to be large - but they all are nice (we viewed a couple); free Internet station; no particular view; room was warm / hot, but we opened windows at nite. Walter and Sandro were great! There is an Annex Building - but did not visit. Would stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Pagefamily2plus2
Reviews.Content: Endorse everything all other reviews have said already. Pristine, super location, very courteous staff. They have small hotel service completely sewn up and are very humble about their success too. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RealtyExpert
Reviews.Content: I just came back from staying at this hotel with my two sisters. Every review is correct. The hotel is in a perfect location, super clean and the staff couldn't be more efficient and friendly. Owners Walter & Sandro as well as the other hotel employees were very courteous, and always helpful. The hotel is located right down the street from the San Stae vaperetto stop. Terrific residential area away from the hustle and bustle. Terrific restaurants very close and some good shopping. Rialto is very close. Loved, loved, loved every second of being in Venice as well as Al Ponte Mocenigo. Don't hesitate to book here!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a tranquil neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Skipper050
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for a week at the end of March and were glad that we chose this hotel. Our room was beautiful and very comfortable. It had a balcony that overlooked a small canal and a view of the courtyard from the other window. The location was perfect, in a tranquil neighbourhood just a short distance from a vaporetto stop and a easy walk to all the sights. The breakfasts were of excellent quality. The hotel is very well run and the owners and all the staff are helpful and friendly. The hotel played a big part in making our visit to Venice memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bonita50207
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated. Away from the insane bustle of Rialto and San Marco, but close enough to walk to those areas or, in the other direction, to other less traveled gems. Hotel was clean, beautiful and the staff helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included in the price and I availed myself of delicious cappuccino, hot chocolate, croissants, rolls, fruit salad etc. I liked that this hotel was small, friendly and clean, and I loved the location. Over all, I would say very good value for the price. I heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Venezian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: epicureanatheart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located steps from the San Stae vaporetto stop. We had a beautiful room, # 5. It had floor to ceiling windows and it's own private balcony which looked out over the water. The other large window in our room looked out over the stone terrace. Right outside our door was a computer and desk, my husband used for business. This hotel room was so romantic, everything you imagine when you think of Venice. Venice is unique, where else do you travel solely by water? We found it refreshing to be away from cars and traffic. When we got lost we would just hop back on the vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Small Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Phylmont
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a touristy hotel in the St. Markâ€™s area many years ago, we had a completely different experience at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. This is an off-the-tourist- track hotel with an annex around the corner, where we stayed. The place exuded charm and the owners man the desk much of the time. The other people who worked the desk were also helpful and knowledgeable. The breakfast ladies were kind and welcoming and greeted us each morning with a basket of rolls and fruit-filled warm croissants which were heavenly There was a spread of fruit, cereals, yogurts, etc. and made-to-order cappuccinos. Our room was large and lovely and the bathroom was ultra modern. We stayed for 6 nights, and the weather was perfect, in the 60's and sunny every day. We chose to see one sight a day and then we explored the area around that particular sight on foot. The first day I had booked the Secret Itinerary Tour of the Doges Palace in St. Mark's Square. This tour was great because it led about 15 people to the secret rooms of the palace that aren't opened to the public. The next day we went to the Jewish Ghetto and toured the synagogues, which was also very interesting. We walked to all of these places and never felt the need to take a vaporetto, although the vaporetto stop is right near the hotel. We discovered side alleys and interesting streets. There were always signs directing us to the main areas. If we got too far off the beaten path, we just had to walk a little further and we'd find a sign to Rialto Bridge or St. Mark's. Then we knew how to get back to our hotel. One day we walked to the Peggy Guggenheim Museum which is awesome. I planned our walk so that we would hit many of the beautiful campos. Then we walked the Zattere, which runs along virtually the entire southern shore of the Dorsoduro district of Venice. Around 2 oâ€™clock we would stop for lunch, several days at Il Muro, near the hotel. We loved the lively square near the hotel, Campo San Giacomo. There were children playing, old people in wheelchairs or sitting on benches and people with dogs. There were cafes all around the square. We had a leisurely, unhassled visit in a beautiful city. We saw most of those same sights in 3 days 6 years ago, but never strolled around the different areas of the city. Instead, we rushed from one place to another. Al Ponte Mocenigo is a perfect home base for touring Veniceâ€¦classy, authentic, clean and hospitable. Weâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Completely exceeded our expectations !”
Reviews.Author: leformi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo was the beginning of a great four days in Venice.The reviews were outstanding and I was still amazed that the hotel and it's owners present a stay that went beyond my expectations. I believe Walter & Sandro and there dedicated staff will be able to continue their friendly, efficient, and tireless effort to keep their guests at a level of comfort that is close to home. We had a room that allowed our teen daughter to have her own room with TV connected by a doorway in the annex. The morning breakfast as everyone has written is generous and tasty, fresh fruit, croissants, rolls, cafe, juice, hot chocolate &Tea. The rooms are extremely clean and nicely designed. Also had free WIFI ! We adored the location of the hotel, easy access to the St. Stae Vaporettto stop which made getting everywhere a snap. Fell in love with Venice, the people of Venice and will return and definitely would stay again at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. Molto Bene, Molte Grazie to Walter and Sandro.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Romantic”
Reviews.Author: brammo
Reviews.Content: Went with new boyfriend, so already there on the romantic stakes, but the whole weekend was simply perfect. The Alilaguna stops at San Stae now, so very easy transfer, Venice looks phenomenal as you come from the airport, and would tell everyone to arrive by water, takes your breath away. Hotel beautiful, friendly, welcoming,recommendations for dinner excellent. Breakfast Croissants the best i have ever tasted! We walked almost everywhere ( bar Murano!) and didn't use the Vaporetto, The BEST holiday i have ever had, and i've travelled a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!! Clean!! Beautiful!! Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Familiesthattravel
Reviews.Content: Sandro and Walter Thank you sooooo much for your hospitality!! I cannot put into words how great a time we had in Venice and your superb hotel! The rooms in the Annex surpassed anything we imagined!! Your service at the front desk was excellent, at anytime of the day. We loved the Murano Glass in the rooms, the heated towel bars, the spa shower, the fantastic Crossiants, the list goes on and on! We choose your hotel based on the past reviews and the off the beaten path location. We are certainly glad we chose you! We found the hotel was a great way to see Venice, it was a perfect walking distance to the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square. It gave us the opportunity to take in small squares and quaint shops that we may not have seen if we stayed closer to San Marco Square. My only regret is that we only stayed 3 nights! Venice was the highlight of our holiday and without your hotel and hospitality it wouldn't have been the same. Thanks again Shannon

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Headed4theBeach
Reviews.Content: Overall, we loved our stay at Al Ponte Moncenigo and thoroughly loved Venice. Pros - extremely clean - even teens noticed, quiet location, fantastic croissants - had read reviews and thought, they can't be that good but they are, wonderful and helpful service at front desk and food service. Donatello even played our bartender when we just needed to get off our feet and another gentlemen quickly addressed a hot water issue. Ceilings are very pretty with the old wood beams. Garden is pretty although wet/cold and did not use for sitting but used it as entrance. Cons - a bit hard to find when roaming around by foot, hardest beds of our trip (3 hotels) making all our backs sore, rooms 1-4 on first floor are directly in the lobby so noisy when people checking in or chatting with front desk, you will hear every phone ring, etc. If staying, would ask for 2nd floor or perhaps annex which we did not see but a couple at breakfast told us it was close by. This is a nice location, off the beaten path of St Marks and a short vapretto route from bus, which took us from Marco Polo airport. It is lovely to walk through the various narrow alleys to find places even without knowing where you are going. Everything is within walking distance, although we took vapretto one time to make sure we were at our reserved spots on time for Clock Tower and Secret Itineraries of Doge's palace. The hotel does not reserve for you, so do it in advance. Both were great. Suggestion for hotel - move check-in to current breakfast counter, create a slider door of current breakfast area, so when people are checking in or wanting to have a glass of wine, they are not interrupting the guests. Then use the current check in area for additional tables for breakfast, which would be an issue for late sleepers in rooms 1-4, but better than hearing noise all night long. Also suggest using cordless headset for front desk, so only they hear phone ringing.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardfromwales
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this fantastic hotel from 28th February 2011.We stayed in the large beautifully appointed junior suite.Four poster bed,Jacuzzi style bath, small balcony which overlooks the picturesque courtyard.Impressive murano glass chandelier. We were very comfortable in this lovely room, very quiet ,no noise from rest of hotel or outside.The room was kept very clean by the room maid,the bed clothes were turned over every night.The owners Walter and Sandro, very kindly advised us on which local restaurants to go to and booked tables for us.We particularly enjoyed Zucca and also the trattoria opposite Zucca called Al Ponte del Meggio.The latter was very reasonably priced,excellent service and fantastic seafood. The hotel is close to probably the most idyllic of Venice's campos-San Giacomo dell' Orio.we were lucky to be there during Carnivale time when there were live concerts each evening in the square. We are looking forward to returning to Hotel Al ponte Mocenigo in July with our children( i am sure they will be equally impressed!)

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: sikim69
Reviews.Content: When travelling to Venice its like stepping into another world, no cars, no traffic, every street is an alleyway which opens onto piazza's, history is everywhere and what better place to stay than right in the middle of it all, in a beautiful old building with the kindest, friendliest staff but without the problems you might expect. The setting is just perfect, you get off the vaporetto, walk alongside a small canal for 100 yards, over a bridge, through a wrought iron gate into a picturesque little courtyard (where breakfast can be served when warm enough. The rooms are well-equipped, extremely quiet and comfortable and all individually decorated (whether in the annexe or the main building). The hotel is very clean, well-staffed (easy with maps, directions, restaurant reccomendations) and perfectly situated for access to the main tourist attractions either via a short walk to the Rialto bridge and market or by jumping on the Vaporetto to go around to St Marks square or onto Murano. This is not a highly rated hotel because of its amenities, its so highly rated because the service is excellent, the hotel is perfectly situated and the price is very reasonable for Venice. I am really looking forward to going back there, when i can get grandparents to look after my children for the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly management, good facilities and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LuckyJake
Reviews.Content: We stayed in November for my wife's 60th birthday celebration and were joined by our son and by our daughter with her husband. We were all very pleased with this charming small hotel and it was a great base for heading off on foot to explore Venice. Located only a couple of stops from the station which was convenient when we first arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa1009
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. It is close to a vaporetto station and so it is easy to find and get to. It is located in a quiet part of the city so despite the crowds during Carnevale, we had peace and quiet. We stayed in room 234 in the annex. The room was of good size and the bathroom is spacious compared to other hotels we've stayed at in Europe and spotless. The beds are firm compared to the hotels in the US, but we found them to be very comfortable and had no trouble sleeping. The free wifi was a nice amenity. There was a good selection of food for breakfast. Walter and Sandro were very helpful even before we got to Venice, and the rest of the staff were friendly and eager to cater to our needs. Excellent value in Venice. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flipavocat
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews are true. I'd just like to add that the junior suite in the annex was great, and the service from the owners and the staff was exceptional. We will definitely stay here if opportunity brings us back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat”
Reviews.Author: DeWette
Reviews.Content: It is always good when something works. This did. After the rave reviews, it was difficult to know what to expect, but two areas of our stay came up to those expectatons. Both the room itself and the breakfast were top knotch, We were told at the time of booking that our room was in an annexe, which it was, and that it overlooked the garden, which it didn't. Indeed there was hardly any natural light in the room (no.23) at all; but the moon shone through the window one night and that made up for it all! The breakfast is sublime if you like sweet things and much has been correctly written about the croissants, but little about the small cakes (biscotta??) which were sublime; great fresh fruit salad too. The best thing about this hotel is that is out of the tourist area, and is beautifully quiet. St Stae (pronounced 'sty' ) is the vaporetto stop and the hotel is one minute's walk away. For â‚¬100 per night, this is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, you must stay here”
Reviews.Author: brotherman60763
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to venice from Paris after 4 days of a small Parisian room, we got off the vappareto and walked all of 100 steps to this gorgeous find. We stayed in the annex in a wonderful room, that was spacious but felt cozy at the same time. The quiet was amazing, and the location couldn't be beat (we ate at La Zucca 2 nights and it was amazing. a 3 minute walk). The location is away from all the tourists and in a more local section of venice. This is not to say it was far from St Mark's square. But of course you can walk across venice in an hour so nothing is really far. I would recommend this place to anyone who will be staying in venice. The service was wonderful, as was the free breakfast in the morning. Couldn't have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: pongowaring
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic- super close to the water bus. This is important. We trotted easily to the hotel. So much easier than other travellers staggering around venice hunting for their hotels!The rooms are large, spotless and I cannot believe costs less than 100E a night. The breakfasts are lovely and the staff so helpful. The restaurants reccomended by firont desk were brilliant - we owuld not have found them by ourselves. This hotel deserves it's number one rating

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quiet and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ejstar79
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely thrilled with our experience at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. We arrived jet-lagged and cranky, but the reception staff were lovely and assisted us with our bags and showed us right to our room. The room itself was beautifully decorated - gorgeous wooden beam ceilings, lovely ornate decor, and very clean - and extremely quiet. Without traffic noise, it was dead silent in the middle of the night and we slept incredibly well. The hotel is a little bit outside of the main touristy area of Venice, but it's definitely within walking distance of everything you could possibly need. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby, plus the vaporetto station is only a few steps away. The walk to the Rialto bridge is no more than 10 minutes and St. Mark's Square is only a few minutes past that. It was also important for us to have an internet connection, which was provided to us free of charge (10 hours free wi-fi). No problems with the connection at all. Would highly recommend this hotel to all travelers to Venice - what a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: thehungrymeerkat
Reviews.Content: I had a room in the annex, which had a large, comfortable bed and fantastic bathroom. The breakfast in the courtyard was wonderful, and the service was excellent. Very good value for money - more like a 4 star hotel, given the quality. My room overlooked a street, which was a bit noisy, as it was the main route used by people coming off the river bus, so heard lots of trolley cases going past all night. Wish I had booked a room in the main hotel overlooking the courtyard, as maybe this would have been quieter. Also noisy pigeons on the roof, but probably impossible to get a completely quiet hotel in Venice, so given the fact that it was in a good, central location, and the fact that the room and service was excellent, I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: random_man21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for 3 nights. The hotel was easy to find (great directions) and was greeted with a smile. The staff are polite, friendly and always around when you need them. The rooms were beautiful - we really couldnt believe how stunning our room was when we walked in - very spaceous too! Breakfast had a selection of pasteries, cereals, fruits, yogurts and juices. The location of the hotel was fantastic - a 10 minute walk to Rialto Market or 2 stops away on the riverboats. Despite being close to everything it was also quiet enough to be away from the busy tourist streets. The only problem we had was trying to open the door to the hotel - our key was playing up in the same way as another reviewer has said - but the hotel staff helped up when needed. Really couldnt give this hotel any higher praise and would definetley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Annettie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never traveled outside of the US before, do we weren't quite sure what to expect of hotels in Italy. Venice was our first stop and this place really kicked off the beginning of our trip perfectly. We loved our room, and Walter, Sandro, and Oliver were so accommodating. Most of all, we loved the hotel's location! We stated three nights, and each day we would wake up, enjoy breakfast, and then wander the twisting alleys with our camera. We loved exploring the neighborhoods and just getting lost in the atmosphere and beauty of Venice. Amazingly, we didn't even spend much money, as walking around taking pictures is a totally free leisure activity. Should we be so lucky to return to Venice some day, we wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else. We loved the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good service and less than 1 min walk from Stan Stae station”
Reviews.Author: szhang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid January and got a great deal - 100 euros a night and when we arrived I think we were given a free upgrade to a suite (since our room had a little sitting room attached). Specifics of the hotel: - Rooms: \We were put in their new wing and our room was spacious, the bathroom was modern and everything was very clean. Despite some reviews saying that the beds were very hard I found ours quite comfortable. - Breakfast: The breakfast is included and I thought that there was a good selection of croissants, bread, jams, fruit, tea/coffee/hot chocolate. - Hotel staff service: We found that there is always someone at the front desk - even very late at night. Once we got back and found that our lock was jammed so someone from the front desk came straight away to help with it. We were also able to check out the night before (at 11pm) as we were leaving early the next day. - Location: I think this is the best part about the hotel. If you haven't been to Venice before, even though it is a small place it is very easy to get lost. The streets are rather narrow and twisty and not very well sign posted. The hotel is a straight walk, 30 secs down the road to Stan Stae and we found that this was the best way to get around. We bought a 72 hour rolling venice card (22 euros including tax) which allows unlimited travel on the vaporetti. You get the number 1 line at Stan Stae and it stops at every single stop. In fact the easiest way of getting to the hotel is to go from the S Lucia station, go to the number 1 stand, buy a rolling venice card and get off at S stae (we got lost walking between the train station and the hotel even though it is only a 10 min walk!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TracyEV
Reviews.Content: Fabulous staff!!! Can't say enough of how amazing they were! Great with directions, advice, and just plain nice even after my transformer blew and I blew a fuse:-0 Hotel pretty easy to find if you follow the directions exactly, walked by it once but turned right around and there is was. Warning up a set of stairs, over small bridge, down a set to go through gate and up another into the hotel - however just ring the bell and they will help you; from then on just use the back entrance (a straight shot to the water bus from there) and no stairs! Got the last room in the place (it is small) but it was very nice and very clean - wood beamed ceiling are amazing, great bathrooms. Free Wi-Fi, Free breakfast every morning, great coffee, tea and truly fabulous hot chocolate that wasn't too thick but was really a joy to go with the great pastries. Nice outdoor courtyard that has heaters when the weather is not so great and even being a cold natured person I was fine sitting out there. Again can't say enough good things about the staff - you guys rock!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY, UTTERLY AMAZING! WE LOVED EVERY MINUTE AT THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: LCPinSF
Reviews.Content: Succinctly stated, this hotel was amazing! The staff was delightful, the breakfast was fabulous, the rooms were fit for a king!!!! We were so impressed! The location is perfect for a stay in Venice, easy to get to and easy for walking around the city without getting lost. There is so much charm in the hotel...let's just say they have done everything to perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: DigitisedMe
Reviews.Content: A small and charming hotel in a convenient location, it is easily found from the San Stae vaperatto stop. I chose this hotel for its good reviews and was not disappointed. The room was clean and well appointed and the staff were terrific and very friendly. Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square are an easy stroll away and there are some excellent dinner options close by. The free wi-fi worked seamlessly and breakfast was plentiful, more than enough to set you on the right foot. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess
Reviews.Content: We had a memorable 2 night stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in Dec- TripAdvisor Reviews were right on and I am happily adding another excellent write-up for this hotel! We did not have any problems finding the hotel and we were warmly welcomed by Sandro as we arrived mid-morning on Dec 12. Our room was not ready, but he offered one that was available with no extra charge - Rm #4. It was located at the Lobby area, overlooking the breakfast patio - a very pretty room and surprisingly quiet even if it was very close to the reception area. The bed was by no means a Westin Heavenly Bed, but it was comfortable enough to sleep in. I loved that the bathroom was very new and immaculately clean! And everyone was right about that delicious croissant - wish I could have one every morning here at home. The hotel staff was very friendly & accomodating. Sandro suggested a few good Tratorias & Cicchettis - and we enjoyed each one of them! The pizza place around the corner was excellent and I loved their tiramisu! The night staff, Oliver was very helpful and made sure that our breakfast was prepared a bit earlier the morning we left. We forgot our international plug adapter and it was great that they had a few extra ones to share with us. Location was great - quiet and off the beaten path, but close enough to walk the tourist must see spots. We rode the Vaporretto upon our arrival , but manage to walk to the Rialto, San Marco, and Piazza Roma during our 2 day stay. There were signs to follow to get to these places - but it was wonderful to lose yourself in the tiny cobblestone streets of Venice. The beauty of this ancient city is awesome and coming home to our cozy room at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo at the end of the day was a delight. This 2 star hotel is a 4 star for me! We'll be back! Thank you very much for making my 50th Birthday in Venice a Memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite”
Reviews.Author: danna_alexandra
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the "annex" in September. The hotel had the cutest little courtyard when you walk in and we were lead out the back to the annex portion.The room had tall ceilings, a safe, a lot of room and a comfortable bed. The location was great and we walked every where, a 5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and 10 minutes to San Marco Square. There are signs everywhere pointing you towards the major sites, but be careful because some of the local business owners have taken it upon themselves to put up signs leading you to their stores instead. There were some great little restaurants right off the Rialto bridge with live music.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic welcome & service but sleep on the floor - it's softer”
Reviews.Author: waedywales
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel staffed by the nicest, most accommodating people ever. The only downside was the hardness of the beds - these Venetians must be tough! Or used to sleeping in cells. But fair play, one mention and a padded matress cover was provided but still didn't make it comfortable. I didn't sleep well for the 5 nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...location, staff and service excellent!”
Reviews.Author: robyngc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo at the end of November for 3 nights with my family. The hotel is small and charming and is easily found from the Vaperatto, down a narrow alley. On arrival we were given a warm welcome by Walter and my husband and I were upgraded to the Junior Suite, which was a lovely surprise. The location of the hotel suited us perfectly, as is it just far away from the main touristy areas but also close enough to easily access all the major attractions and must see locations - this is the best of both worlds from our point of view. We visited a number of excellent restaurants in the area by the hotel and Sandro or Walter will recommend and even book for you, that's service! The breakfast was tasty, a selection of pastries and cereals, you don't really require much more. I chose the hotel from reading reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed. It is the value for money, the service of Sandro, Walter and the rest of the team along with the location that make this a great place to stay. I have already recommended it to my friends and will stay here again if I return back to Venice in the future. Thank you very much Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, but could use a few things improved....”
Reviews.Author: phil80920
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the Al Ponte Mocenigo. Walter is amazingly nice, the whole staff couldn't have been nicer to my family. They make the place what it is! Breakfast was very nice as well. But I have a few reservations, also: -The beds were the hardest I have ever found in a hotel. Our backs were aching. -The storage space in the rooms is very limited. Don't go there with a lot of bags. There is a wardrobe, but that's it. No dresser, and not even any significant storage in the nightstands. - The bathroom needs a stand or shelf for your toiletries. - The location is very convenient for the #1 vaporetto. However, the San Stae area where the hotel is located is very dingy (even for Venice) and depressing. (Granted, it was raining during our visit). I'll vote to stay closer to the Rialto/San Marco areas next time, although they are more costly.

Reviews.Title: “This place is heaven....can we live in room 5 forever?”
Reviews.Author: KellyCanada75
Reviews.Content: We based our room selection off of photos seen on tripadvisor. We opted for the room with the balcony view over the canal. The hotel is within very close walking range to the San Stae water bus stop. We arrived early and were able to get settled in right away. When Walter opened the door to our room, the angels sang from the heavens! Beautiful furnishings, murano glass chandelier, fabric walls, wooden ceiling, balcony with beautiful canal view, huge bathroom. The staff were all a delight and were very helpful. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. The croissants and cappuccino was the best part of our morning. We would stay at this hotel again. Thank you to both Walter and Sandro for providing the accommodation that made my Venetian experience even more magical.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: ekay123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night only since we did not have that many days to spend in Italy and we figured one night, two days for a small city like Venice should be enough. We were not wrong. It was plenty of time to explore the city. One of the best parts of our time in Venice was our stay at this hotel. We looked at Trip Advisor before choosing this hotel and the reviews were very encouraging. So we booked one night. The reviews were all true. This hotel was amazing. The people who worked at this hotel were so friendly, warm, welcoming and professional. The rooms were very well decorated (Venetian style) and they were extremely clean. We stayed at the annex and the rooms were brand new. It was such a romatic experience as well thanks to the decoration. The receptionist (migth be the owner of the hotel) was very helpful when we wanted to check in early and when it rained cats and dogs (offered us umbrellas, rainboots etc.) If I go back to Venice, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at and the rate is so affordable for a city like Venice. It did not only meet our expectations, but exceeded them. I highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: Caliguy77
Reviews.Content: Although I did not get a chance to stay at this hotel, yet felt compelled to write a good review. From the review on this site I had decided to book it. The staff Walter and Sandro immediately sent me an email about my booking. I had a few question which they answered upfront and honestly. Due to some change in plans I could not stay at this place, and they were very understanding. The awesome service experience even before getting to the hotel validates their great reputation on TP. I am definitely staying here when I am Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for standard of service and location”
Reviews.Author: HowSueseeIt
Reviews.Content: Chose this for its good reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel is maintained to a high standard, clean rooms (stayed in annex, rm 31) and very friendly staff. Breakfast was good and set us up for the day. My only complaint was the v firm mattresses and pillows, as mentioned in other reviews. I used the cushion instead of pillows provided. On check out, mentioned this and was told they have soft pillows and mattress toppers available. I should have asked them but didn't bother, if you don't like a firm pillow just ask at reception. Location was perfect for the No. 1 bus and it was a very pleasant area to wander around and had lots of dining options near by.

Reviews.Title: “be back again”
Reviews.Author: dixwimby
Reviews.Content: booked this because of the reviews 700 cant be wrong. we have stayed at several hotels and apartments over the years in many different areas of Venice. This by far is the best. the wow factor started with the greeting and it carried on from there. we had 4 rooms all were large for Venice. Junior suites bigger than the hilton, sofitel and many others in Venice at a fraction of the cost. the decor was different in each room. each had a bath shower with piping hot water. being within 100 metres of San Stae vaperetto stop. number one route. very handy. There were 4 good restaurants within 200 metres, one within 60 metres. cant fault the hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JDHelm
Reviews.Content: This is just another personal endorsement for this fantastic property. Unfortunately for us, we didn't get enough time there, but these folks definitely deserve the awards they've received on TA. The next time we go to Venice, there's no question we'll stay here and stay for longer. Just a little tidbit of how the service is, they gave my wife galoshes when the water started rising. Its a simple show of service, but they seem pretty pleased to make sure you're having a great time. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with world's best cappochino”
Reviews.Author: Harlaxton7
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We departed the Grand Canal vaporetto at San Croce (100 yards from the hotel) and entered through the beautiful little courtyard. It is very convenient to everything yet very quiet and not in a touristy section of town. The owner greeted us warmly and had our room ready even though we arrived early. He was always accomodating and helpful with any questions or restaurant recommendations. We stayed in the annex building and found our room and bathroom to be clean and spacious. During the night we had a snowstorm so we were able to experience a magical Venice. When we awoke we found snow boots at our door. We all loved the breakfast, especially the best cappochino in the world. This hotel made our trip to Venice one of our favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelLi
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo - the location was unique & we almost missed it, (it's a very narrow "street"). The service was excellent, the rooms were comfortable, coffee was fantastic, and for breakfast they served the most amazing warm filled croissants...not to mention that Venice is fabulous in November, so we couldn't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Gem number 1.”
Reviews.Author: W-Stern
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons I come to Venice every year since 2007, is, I'm sure, Al Ponte Mocenigo Hotel and the people I met there. Missing the aura of this place and return there again and again. Booked a room for the next June:))) Can't say more than already said about this lovely place. Just one thing you are likely not aware. With December issue Russian ELLE provided its readers a free travel guide to Italy. Al Ponte Mocenigo Hotel is heading the list of 8 places recommended to stay at, when in Venice. Service cannot be better, staff is very friendly, the owners - exceptional. People there, you know - they care. For those, who is now only planning a trip to Venice, I would like to tell that the lighting is breathtaking in early October there. Unfortunately, nobody can guarantee the weather, but if you are lucky enough with it (I mean NO rain/showers), you'll see the unbeatable colours and undertones of Basilica di San Marco. Somehow it becomes airy and almost transparent this time of the year. But HOW?! In May, or in June, in September you get the beautiful views, but in first decade of October - mysterious. This is my experience I'd like to share with the others:)))) Those links you may find useful: - Marco Polo Venice airport http://www.veniceairport.com/core/index.jsp;jsessionid=KV2BHNQOMYBU3QFIAIBCFEY?_requestid=1287&language=en - bus service http://www.atvo.it/index.php?lang=en&area=23&menuid=35 - Trenitalia http://www.ferroviedellostato.it/homepage_en.html Enjoy your time in Venice and, if you stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo Hotel, I hope you will love it as I do. PS And those yummy croissants for the breakfast... You won't forget it!

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel by Venice Standards”
Reviews.Author: PeterBean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November. We booked on the basis of the TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel was difficult to find on foot. We arrived in the middle of the day and the weather was fine so not too much of a problem. In bad weather or rain, an alternative (water bus) to get you in the vicinity may be a better option. It is about a 20 minute brisk walk to St. Mark's which everything revolves around. Saying that it is a pleasent walk during the day and atmospheric at night. Venice (I think) is generally quite safe so although some of the dim alleys may look intimidating, do not be put off. There are not many places to eat and drink before you get to the Rialto area (10 minute walk) which was a shame. There is a water bus stop (Vaparetto) just outside the hotel although we did not often use it due to price and we liked to walk towards the centre. The price was good for Venice. Very reasonable. The rooms were very clean and the service provided was great. Beds a little firm for my liking but we slept well. Free wi-fi internet was available throughout the hotel. I big plus for me! One critisism was the breakfast which I thought lacked a little. After reading the reviews on this, I was left feeling a little let down. There was a good selection but it wasthe same every day and a little bit boring (again, in my opinion). If you don't mind a walk, this hotel will be great. Could be considered a little bit far for somebody who doesn't like a 20+ minute walk to get to the main attractions. We shared a bottle of wine on the last night in the courtyard area which was beautiful (even in winter). In the summer it would be fantasic. The drinks prices were extremely good (Bottle of prosecco for 10 euro!). Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance in Quiet side of Venice”
Reviews.Author: magsygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the hotel! It was easy to find from the San Stae station (just follow the directions they provide), the rooms were spacious (we got a free upgrade!), the service was excellent (helpful, warm, sincere), and the location was perfect (not in the center of the action but in the quiet side of Venice near very good restaurants!) Note that you need to take the vaporetto to get to the main sights which are a couple of stations away, but this was much better for us as we didn't want to go home to a touristy place with a lot of people moving around!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit and Even Better, if That's Possible !”
Reviews.Author: spg888
Reviews.Content: Second visit in the last two years and things have improved. Very relaxing room in the annex. Nice and warm, well lit and very clean, especially the bathroom. So quiet too. Trust me, I am really fussy and I can't fault this hotel. The awards are richly deserved. The management are ambitious and their plans for the hotel are excellent. This is the hotel for us when we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: Zanterocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the reviews on trip advisor and were not dissappointed. Firstly - if you are coming to Venise for the first time - this is how you get to the hotel: Ryanair flight arrived into Traviso (15km from Venice) In the baggage collection go to the ATVO machine and get a bus ticket for a return to Venice (cost 9 euro return) Go outside and get on the ATVO bus - there are people to guide you - very easy. The buses are there to meet the flights so they are always outside. The journey took us 40 mins there (and 1 hr return). Get off the bus at the last stop which is the bus station called Piazzale Romo. From here walk towards the water (opposite the bus station) to the Vaporetto stop (water taxi). Get a ticket at the machine - you only need to get a single ticket each (6.5 euros) and now mostly importantly you need to validate it by passing the ticket front of the validation machine. Get on the vapertto - route 1 and stay on this for about 10 mins. Get off at the 4th stop - called "San Stae". To get to the hotel - walk straight from the vaperetto stop for about 40 metres and take the first allayway (very very narrow) behind the church and the hotel is half way along. Hotel itself is lovely, warm and friendly. We stayed in room 21 which is in the same building as the hotel but via a different entrance. Room was extremley well decorated and furnished, with a separate lounge area. My only complaints about the room was that it was very hot as we couldn't turn off the radiator in the bathroom and the pillows were rock hard - I had to use the cushions inside. You can't really leave the windows open as it is very noisy when anyone walks past because the streets are so narrow everything is louder, there were still mosquitos around in November and the flood siren went off around 4am each morning. Breakfast was a selection of: cereals, rolls, an apricot crossant, biscuits, fruit, juices and a hot drink of your choice. Perfect to set you up for the day. Reception is very helpful - providing directions and a very good map to get around. You can walk everywhere in Venise and we walked back to Piazzale Roma on the way back to get our bus to the airport - takes about 20 mins. Ps. if you are going in the November a lot of people were wearing welly boots as the streets are often flooded in the morning. However - they do put raised platform walkways everywhere too! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely beautiful room, breakfast was great!”
Reviews.Author: cheryltzh
Reviews.Content: The room is gorgeous! Comes with bathtub. There's also free WIFI for laptops. (needs java to "activate" it.) The room is spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: Birene
Reviews.Content: Bliss - six wonderful days in Venice and lucky enough to have chosen to stay at this wonderful, small, family-style hotel. We can confirm all the positives that have been written in TripAdvisor. After wheeling our suitcases from the San Stae vaporetto [water bus] stop on the Grand Canal [three stops from central station] and turned left down the cute, tiny one meter wide typically Venetian â€˜streetâ€™ - we were immediately charmed! We were delighted with the welcome, the accommodation and especially the location even though itâ€™s tucked away. Itâ€™s about 80 meters to the vaporetto stop, with really good restaurants in wonderful squares 5-10 minutes away. Itâ€™s also fun to â€˜get lostâ€™ in the myriad of hidden corners, shopping streets, canals and squares that radiate from the hotel. Beats the tour groups! Quality breakfast was served in the little courtyard and the staff who served their delicious coffee with genuine smiles made a beautiful start to each day. Having been lucky enough to travel independently and extensively for 25 years [all continents, 75 countries and countingâ€¦] we consider this hotel to be a gem. Sure, it doesnâ€™t have the 5 star featuresâ€™ of the international chains - thatâ€™s what makes it unique, welcoming and genuine. Staff are more than willing to provide advice, suggest trips and places to visit and book restaurants for you if your Italianâ€™s a bit rough, all done with efficiency and good humour. On our return to Australia we contacted the hotel to seek their help about a purchase we had made and which had not yet reached us, despite numerous attempts to contact the supplier. In their usual efficient, nothing-is-too-big-a-problem way, they rang the supplier, sorted out the misunderstanding and solved our problem on the day our email arrived - howâ€™s that! To Sandro and Walter - thank you for your valuable help - our package arrived 6 days later, all in order and with an apology for the delay! On our 6 weeks journey Venice and Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo were real highlights. Sincere thanks to all your gracious and professional colleagues who enhanced our experiences. When we return to Venice we will most definitely try to stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed...a real hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: HalifaxWanderers
Reviews.Content: We have just had a 3 night stay and it was just delightful. A really intimate, quiet hotel with staff who are charming and helpful. The rooms are well furnished, great bathrooms, comfortable bed and everything beautifully clean. A couple more english channels on the TV would have been great - but to be honest thats just picky - you don't go to Venice to watch TV! Really well placed for the Waterbus - day tickets the best value - this was a great hotel and a real little gem

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: phxexplorer
Reviews.Content: This review will be redundant to others but I did want to confirm all of the positive reviews. We stayed here for 2 nights, the 11th and 12th of November and loved the hotel. Very comfortable and clean, a highlight of our 2 weeks in Europe. The breakfast was wonderful and the croissants were the best I have ever eaten. I certainly give this hotel an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the staff!”
Reviews.Author: mloz
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel because its was so easy to get to: one ride on the vaporetto from P.Roma (4th stop at San Stae) and 2-3 minutes walk to the hotel and NO bridges to cross!! When you see other tourists dragging their luggage up, over and down a bridge or 2 in the rain, then you will appreciate Al Ponte Mocenigo even more. :-) We had a Junior Suite for my family which included 2 teenagers (16/19) and the room was big enough for all of us plus had extra space for our luggage and a desk and sitting area with large windows and balcony door. The bathroom was also huge with a separate bidet. And free wi-fi, which was a major plus. Breakfast was more than ample with fresh fruits, fresh fruit salad, breads, butter, jams, Nutella which my kids loved, different flavored yogurts, cheese, an assortment of cereals and made to order coffee or Hot Chocolate. The staff were excellent and and made us feel very welcome (thank you Grace and Millet!). They were eager to help and answer any questions too, just like the owners. There are many restaurants and small shops in the area and even a small supermarket in the nearby Campo San Giacomo. We would definitely recommend and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Venice Winner!”
Reviews.Author: pjsd
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay at Mocenigo was too short! This delightful haven to weary travelers was a hit! From the moment we arrived via water taxi and were helped in, we were welcomed as if we were family. We arrived quite early but they had no problem keeping our luggage as we left to explore the city. Several hours and many miles later e returned to foind our luggage delivered to beautifully appointed rooms. We stayed in the "red room" and our friends were in the green room. Each room was wonderfully, tastefully decorated , clean, comfortable and quiet. The bathroom and amenities were more than adequate, I especially enjoyed the heated towel rack. A scrumptious breakfast was cheerfully served from 8-10 am in this small 14 room hotel. The owners Salandro and Walter were gracious hosts, eager to answer our questions, direct us to restaurants and make phone calls to order water taxi service. What a find in this expensive city! Travel agents recommended much more expensive hotels that could not have had the charm and ambiance offered here. We felt this was an authentic cultural experience rather than just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: RinORL
Reviews.Content: When we first checked into this boutique hotel, we were somewhat disappointed and a bit reluctant. Having just arrived from our upscale accommodations in Rome, Florence & Tuscany and not yet having become acclimated to this most unusual city we were taken aback when the desk clerk said he would help us carry our bags up two flights of stairs to our room. The centuries old, plaster, rock & brick walls had character but it all seemed so, so unimpressive. The wooden banister on each partial flight was sturdy and the last finial was not secured and rotated as I held on and made my final turn with one of luggage in the other hand and two small bags on my shoulder. The room was small and as I let the suitcase slip out of my hand, I looked at my wife and thought, â€œThis is a mistake.â€� But she was okay. I looked at the deep green, upholstered walls, the Murano glass lighting fixture hanging proportionately amid the wooden, ceiling beams and the very nice, heavily draped, wooden double paned windows that opened past the shutters and looked out at the tasteful apartments across the â€œstreetâ€�. Aside from the bed and side tables, there was just enough room for a little foyer-type table and ladder back chair that would serve as a mini-desk and luggage stand. Did I mention that it also held a small, flat panel TV? Being an unsophisticated, man, I still cannot understand why European hotels waste precious bathroom space with a bidet. I suppose it is for the women when they are-a-pean. The shower in the bathtub with a half-tub enclosure and large sink were sparkling clean and the towel warmer was very helpfulâ€¦to heat the bathroom on the chilly mornings. Two women who I believe doubled as chambermaids served breakfast and the croissants were by far the best we had in Italy. They even brewed American coffee in an American-style coffee maker, which provided us with the only home style, caffe Americano we had on the entire trip. Unlike Paris, we did not see one Starbucks in the five cities we visited in Italy. My expectation was a grander hotel right on the Grand Canal and near to one of the major attractions. After a day or so, I realized that we were very well located, no more than 150 feet from the Vaporetto (water bus) stop, which made it very accessible. There was a very nice restaurant across the â€œstreetâ€� with a hand-written menu and a lot of charm. We easily walked to piazzas no more than a few blocks in either direction; one, only steps away had the necessary tobacconist, all the gelatto you could ever ask for and a lovely restaurant with wonderful service and outstanding Zuppa di Pesce which was not even one of their signature dishes. In the other direction and a few more turns away, Giacomo dellâ€™Orio was much larger and even had a supermarket. Al Ponte Mocenigo did not end up being a disappointment at all. Instead it was an unexpected treat and a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “tElegant and romantic”
Reviews.Author: estatictravellers
Reviews.Content: We all loved this hotel from the moment we checked in. It was visually beautiful and the owners made us very welcome. I was extremely happy with my room, the decor was warm and romantic. It was huge and had an amazing bathroom, very spacious with great shower. The breakfasts were lovely, with crispy warm croissants, fresh fruit salad, cereal, yoghurt, frothy coffees, everything you need. We loved the position of the hotel as well. Directions were very easy and it is within walking distance to Rialto Bridge, the early morning fish markets, St Marks. The little streets around the hotel are narrow and charming with little surprises around every corner. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Still dreaming about their croissants”
Reviews.Author: ArtistJames
Reviews.Content: I still can't get the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo's croissants out of my mind. Every morning during our six day stay, I would smell those treats baking below our room at precisely 7:10 AM. It was the best alarm clock ever. Beyond that-- LOCATION: Quiet, yet accessible. After a long day sight-seeing in busy Venice, it was a relief to return to our peaceful street and hotel. The restaurants in the area are more reasonably priced since you're off the beaten path a little (ask the hotel for recommendations) but you're still a stone's throw away from the Vaporetto. We found it extremely easy to find the hotel from the Vaporetto stop. Also, if you get tired of navigating Venice's maze-like street, you can just hop on a Vaporetto. I'd recommend getting a Vaporetto pass, by the way--so much easier and a better value than buying tickets individually. ROOM: We stayed in the junior suite that overlooks the little courtyard. What a lovely, spacious room! The bath provided a wonderful way to unwind in the evenings. And mornings. The bed was slightly firmer than we are used to, but we still slept fine. The hairdryer could have been more powerful, but that is a minor complaint. The internet worked great, and you can get it renewed for as many sessions as you want for free. BREAKFAST: Need I mention the croissants again? The best I've ever had. Made to order espresso drinks. (No problem getting decaf i you need it.) I also enjoyed the bowl of fresh cut fruit each morning. Lots of other yummy stuff, too. CHECK-IN: We were able to check in early and also were offered an espresso drink upon arrival. Make good use of the friendly owners for suggestions and advice about Venice. And we got a nice discount for paying with cash at the end of our stay. My OWN VENICE TIPS: Instead of counting streets when walking around Venice, we got less lost if we counted bridges instead. We also found it easier to remember how to walk to the Rialto Bridge using landmarks instead of worrying about street names. Also, get tickets for the Clock Tower. Fabulous. Buy tickets at the Correr Museum for an English-speaking tour. A delightful surprise and one of our favorite sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely! Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Mom_in_UK_and_Oz
Reviews.Content: Thanks Sandro and Walter! Excellent! A lovely hotel, a lovely room, a lovely breakfast setting. The bathroom was fully appointed and spotless, the room was spotless, the bed was too firm for my liking, but just perfect for my wife so I can't grumble! ;-) It was my 50th birthday, and my wife had mentioned this to Walter and Sandro and asked them to try and source a bottle of Dom Perignon on the quiet, for the Saturday. This they did, and it was delivered to the room in perfect style! Just one of those extra touches. Like our arrival; just as we were settling into our room, the phone rang with our host just back from lunch saying "No! We have a better room for you! Come and see!" We were taken to the only room with a balcony, slightly smaller, but more lovely than the first. Excellent! Rather than go on and on any more, and simply re-iterate the thoughts of others below, the only thing that matters to us and to the hotel is whether we'll tell our friends and whether we'll return. The answer is a simple yes, to both, without hesitation. Thanks Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nebulus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is a great hotel to stay at. The rates are quite reasonable compared to other Venetian hotels and the location is good if you tend to do a walking tour of the whole city. It is about a 15 to 20 minute walk from the train station and about a half hour walk away from San Marcos Square. The vaparetto ride from the train station to the hotel initially seemed like a rip-off as the hotel is only the third stop (San Stae) from the train station on vaparetto number one (5 minute ride) as we paid 13 Euro for two people. The hotel is only a few minutes from San Stae station which is a good marker on being able to locate the hotel. After checking in, we were informed that our vaparetto ticket was good for one hour after from the time that it was stamped so we hopped back onto the vaparetto and made our way to San Marcos Square. It was a little confusing at first to realize that you needed to buzz in so that the receptionist could remotely open the gate. All entrances have cameras so that they can buzz you in. Although it is a 2 star hotel, it was better than the other 4 star hotels that we stayed at during our trip so I feel that this hotel is more worthy of a 4 star designation. We stayed in a double superior room which seemed to be quite new and had nice decor. We arrived very early in the morning at 8 am but they tried their best to get us into our room as fast as possible and we managed to check in at 11 am. The receptionist even helped us with our luggage to our room and once we got there on the other side of the building, we were treated to a beautiful room with an 11 foot ceiling. The washroom was very clean and in new condition. The two men that we met at the reception desk spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful and friendly. Wifi is available for three hours but you are allowed to ask for additional time if required. The phone system was complicated to understand as you had to dial 9 to inform front desk to connect your phone to an outside line. Once you were connected, you then dialed 0 and had to wait for a ready tone to dial your number. It was tough to locate a tobbaco shop which provided calling cards but it was well worth it. Our 5 Euro calling card was good for three hours to North America. One complaint that I might have is that you could hear noisy neighbours. The breakfast was one of the best on our 3 week trip throughout Europe and should not be missed. This hotel deserves the top rating available and I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It might not have a view of the grand canal that some other hotels might have but it was in a quiet neighbourhood location. If you are considering between similar hotels, choose this one. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Second Wonderful Stay at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: djhtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed here in November 2008 for two days following a cruise. When we decided to come back to Venice with our 3 adult sons the first reservation I made was with Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. They were almost completely booked but suggested putting all five of us in the two room suite in the annex for one night, then adding a room next door for the next night. This worked out wonderfully. We were a little crowded the first night, but were all so jet lagged that sleeping was no problem. Then we had plenty of room the second night with the suite and an additional room. I was a bit concerned about the annex, but we loved it. On our first stay we had a room overlooking the canal and bridge in the main building. It was lovely, but we thought the annex was even nicer. We felt as if we were in our own apartment in Venice, with a small balcony and a wonderful street view. It was on the top floor and there were steps up but the climb was so pretty that we didn't mind. The breakfast was as wonderful as we remembered, probably the best we had on our trip. The staff there is great, even the ladies who served breakfast and did the housekeeping were so helpful. All of us agreed that we would stay here again if we get to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Windrider40
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Excellent service and fantastic location. This hotel is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the real touristy area which was fantastic. In Venice being off the beaten path means you're still only a block or two away from everything so the location was perfect. 15 minute walk through Venice's beautiful streets to the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks Square...would stay here again and again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious, wonderful breakfast, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: donnafayesc
Reviews.Content: We arrived Venice for one night and left a large portion of our luggage with Walter and Sondro while traveling Italy.
