Upon our return, we stayed two more nights, all 3 nights in different rooms. The rooms are spacious with modern bathrooms and eloquently decorated. The breakfast is wonderful, especially the croissants!! Walter and Sondro are very good about giving directions and the hotel location is convenient to San Stae vaporetti stop and train station and Piazzle Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: Danielarios81
Reviews.Content: You definately get your money's worth at Ponte Al Mocenigo. I was actually surprised to find out the hotel only had two stars because the service, the accomodations and the location could easily pass by as a four star. The rooms are large and gorgeous (venetian style), the bathrooms were recently renovated, and our room looked out into a small courtyard, so it was really quiet. The breakfast area is adorable and the food delicious. I would definately stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing”
Reviews.Author: stduff2
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through this website and my husband, friend and I were so pleased that I did. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the location quiet and convenient, the staff pleasant and helpful, and the croissants were amazing. They are made on site and provide a wonderful start to a day of walking. I would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: stakerk
Reviews.Content: We schedule our trip to Italy all around when we could stay at this great place. This was our second stay. Sandro and Walter are great hosts. We stayed in room 34 in the Annex., about a 30 second walk around the corner of the alley from the main hotel. Marvelous again. Beautiful room. Great food at breakfast. Excellent service from the staff. Marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: TripT0m
Reviews.Content: OMG!! This has got to be the best hotel experience!! Everyone says it! Beautiful rooms and superfantastica friendliness from the owners & staff that made the chilly night feel warm!!!! You've got to stay there to experience it. Oh, and I completely agree with JLambert96. What would we have done without those huge, sturdy umbrellas. That's the kind of thoughtfulness you get here!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: trav4Him
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this hotel 7 months before our arrival and were very happy with our stay here. The room was not only charming, but very clean and well-maintained for the duration of our week-long stay. The service was excellent and the staff were very helpful in not only recommending, but making reservations for restaurants and events, such as Interpreti Veneziani, which all turned out to be good choices. The location was perfect for quick access to the San Stae vaporetto stop, in the quiet neighbourhood of Santa Croce. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Venice. Mille grazie to the proprietors, Walter e Sandro for making our 20th wedding anniversary trip a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place”
Reviews.Author: SBWEOISB
Reviews.Content: A decent place which is a little bit difficult to find as its entrance is actually a small bridge, the sign is so small (and difficult to see over the bridge) and even the young couple who lived about 20 meters away from it didn't know where it was. Other than that, there's nothing exceedingly great nor negative to say. Breakfast is average, served in a small garden outside the hotel. Free internet is available, and our room was really big (for Venice) and nicely appointed. I would stay at this hotel again, now that I know how to find it.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: foxton_russian
Reviews.Content: Booked the 'Al Ponte' after reading the trip advisor reviews and were so glad we did. Conveniently located a minute or so from the San Stae water bus stop this hotel is a little gem. From the secluded breakfast courtyard to the plushly decorated room it's a perfect place to get you in the mood for this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent...”
Reviews.Author: Moka
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay in Venice at this gem of an hotel,it is our second visit in the last couple of years having previously had it recommended by our daughter and son in law who couldn't stop singing its praises. The owners and staff couldn't be more helpful and are always on hand to assist with restaurant recommendations,travel queries etc.Being a minutes walk from St Stae vaporetto stop is a bonus and it was particularly good to return to this quieter area of Venice after a busy day walking and seeing the sights in the busier areas. A first class hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grassgreener
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to stay in this beautiful boutique hotel right in the heart of Venice. The rooms are beautifully appointed and spotlessly clean. The bathrooms are modern and sparkling. A very nice breakfast can be enjoyed inside or out in the pretty courtyard. Owners Walter and Sandro are gracious hosts. This little gem is just a minute from the vaporetto stop in San Stae. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “The Ambience of the rooms and service is Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: rktravels2010
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has it all - we stayed 4 nights in a huge room with brilliant decor On the first floor Then 2 nights in a small room and we loved or to. We Knew When We booked That We Could not Have the huge room for the Whole of our stay. Walter One Of The owners WAS extremely helpful With Everything - Nothing Was a problem, Breakfast Served In The Courtyard By The very friendly ladies was fantastic. The rooms were extremely clean well kept. Will Certainly Be telling all my friends of this brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SimRio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel after a cruise. The location is wonderful. 50 m from the Vaporetto station. The owners are always there and do whatever is possible to please you. The room was wonderful. The croissant at breakfast is the best I ever had. Would definetely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JLambert96
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Mocenigo hotel provided a warm, wonderful stay in Venice! Walter immediately made us all feel welcome. The entire staff was knowledgeable and accommodating guiding us to excellent local restaurants and providing us with large umbrellas when rain was threatening. It ended up pouring all that day so those umbrellas were life savers. Imagine waking up to croissants baking and having breakfast each moring in the courtyard (especially the fresh cappucinos). Our stay at Al Ponte was a true Venetian delight . The rooms were large, updated and super clean. The location was quiet with lots of alleys and canals, one block to a vaparetto stop and a short walk to a major outdoor market. Bellisimo!! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: foomanchufighter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was magical. Just a small little hotel tucked away in the San Polo district of Venice. You are a 10 minute walk away from Piazza San Marco as well as very close to the water taxis. The morning breakfast was wonderful and the espresso was strong and delicious. This was by far my favorite place to stay on my Italy trip. The rooms are the European experience. The room we were in was not spacious but if that does not bother you, it is a wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: ozmatemelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, it was beautiful, friendly staff great breaky and close to everything. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value and surprise”
Reviews.Author: DPTerrell
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Moncenigo was everything we expected and more. The room was large, clean, and decorated in the classic Venetian style. We were able to have very peaceful sleep as the room was very quiet and comfortable. The high ceilings and the room air conditioning contributed to a pleasant experience. The location was outstanding to get to the vaporetto or merely walking to restaurants and shopping. We will definitely use the hotel if we return to Venice and we will recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: wilkinson123
Reviews.Content: Fantastic find in Venice. Away from the noise and crowds, yet very close to San Stae vaporetto stop (only 75 meters from stop to hotel door!). Access to train station and all of Venice's sights is very easy and hassle free because of the vaporetto stop. I suggest taking the vaporetto and not a water taxi- the back door is actually a better way to access the hotel. Very clean, excellent breakfast, good internet in room, soft bed and nice hosts. Only drawback in one flight of stairs to second level rooms. Rooms are decorated on par with the public areas (not always the case with European hotels and B and Bs). At night continue on down the narrow lanes in the area around the hotel to find some great food and amazing sights- the REAL Venice. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: Bojangles99
Reviews.Content: For it's rating, price and size this hotel packs some big punches! Small, but beautifully decorated (and clean!) rooms, simple but lovely breakfasts, free Internet access, close to train station and airport bus routes and vaporetto stop too! Most of the staff are wonderful and more than happy to point you on your way to fabulous local restaurants and experiences. It's not close (by venice standards) to st mark's but we walked there in a very short space of time and enjoyed Venice along the way!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommened.....”
Reviews.Author: Antz42
Reviews.Content: We spent our last 4 nights in Italy in Venice, staying at Hotel Al Ponte Moceniga, and what a great decision it was to book to stay there. Great location, incredible service, clean, and comfortable. Walter and his staff were very helpful, very polite, willing, and when advice was needed, they were always on hand. Breakfast was a real pleasure too, relaxing in the open air courtyard, with pastries, coffee, cereals, fruit and more..... If / when we make it back to Venice, we'll certainly book again the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Content: This review is not about our stay at the above establishment, rather to give credit to outstanding service. We booked a few months ago and have had to cancel for various reasons. We hope to be able to visit at a later stage. From the time of our booking, communication from the owners has been fantastic. They run a very good ship and are extremely good at what they do. You can see that they really aim to please. Hence the good reviews. We wish them well in their endeavours and look forward to visiting Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in the future

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rjparker8
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Al Ponte Mocenigo during out recent trip to Europe and we were very happy with our choice. We were in a room on the ground floor overlooking the breakfast area and were a little concerned it would be loud, but we weren't woken up by noise -- the first morning we actually slept through breakfast by accident, but were still given a tray of fresh pastries and cappucino to enjoy in our room. The location was perfect too, a short walk to all the attractions, but located in a quiet neighborhood. The hotel staff was great with restaurant recommendations too. I definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian gem! Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Chipotle
Reviews.Content: We (i.e. young couple & baby under 2) were truly pleased with our stay. Nice quiet location...off-the-beaten path, but still in the heart of Venezia. Clean, spacious, comfortable room. No carpet!...that's a good thing. New ceramic tile bathroom with shiny clean porcelain fixtures and sparkling stainless Grohe faucets. 1st Floor was an added bonus with our volume of luggage and the baby. We enjoyed the free wireless internet access. The two owners are directly involved (daily) with operating the hotel and it shows...from the cleanliness to the excellent service to the recommendations to the daily breakfast. I had a chance to speak about the business with Walter (one of the owners). They purchased an old home in 2005 and took a year-and-a-half to completely renovated it into this wonderful hotel. They choose to keep it a 2-star, but they can easily qualify for 3-star (or more). This kind of value for money is hard to come by, in our experience, especially in Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Docterloeb
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Nice staff and rooms. Teeming with character. Good location away from tourist hordes but close enough to the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a authentic Venetian honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: chevyole16
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Al Ponte Mocenigo. Everything good that has been said I can attest to. Large, clean, comfortable rooms. Friendly staff at breakfast and at the front desk. Location is perfect for walking to 10-15 minutes to Rialto or a bit further to San Marco. The vaparetto is nearby and one day we bought a one way ticket and used it to go up and down the grand canal. Much cheaper and more satisfying than paying the 70 euros for a gondola to follow another gondola down a well used canal. We used Tripadvisor to find this gem and we were not disappointed. Oh and check out La Zucca nearby for the best meal we had in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights starting August 19. We had room # 21 in the annex. The room had a sitting area with a day bed/ sofa, small table with 2 chairs and an armoire with safe. The bedroom was separate , not that big but adequate. Bathroom was also small. Decor was very venetian, with terrazo floors. A/C was excellent (which was a big plus as weather was very hot while we were there). I was a bit disappointed that the room we were asigned was not the same room they had sent us pictures of. In total the size was probably comparable, however by partioning into two areas it looked smaller. On the other hand an advantage was that there was a TV in each area, so a person could be watching TV/ reading without bothereing the othere person if sleeping. The inkeepers Sandro and Walter , as well as the staff that take care of the front desk at night, are very nice and helpful. The ladies that serve breakfast are delightful as well. Breakfast is simple but enough to give you a good start. Coffee was excellent (expecially the espresso machiato!). I have two (minor) negatives: the hair dryer is the strangest and least effective one I have found in a hotel in Europe. If you have long hair it wil not do the job. Also, the pillows were very uncomfortable. My husband and I used the soft sofa cushions as pillows instead and that worked fine. The bed was comfortable. I liked the fact that the hotel is so close to a vaporetto stop (San Stae). No bridges to cross which is very convenient if you are coming to the hotel with lugagge via vaporetto, which we did. The hotel also has a canal entrance so you can come/ leave easily by water taxi which we did (95 euros to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a little gem of a hotel. This is one of those hotels you want to keep secret. Located just steps away from the Grand Canal and a water bus stop, this botique hotel is just about perfect. Our room (#5) featured a tiny balcony overlooking a small canal and a window which looked down on the tiny courtyard where we enjoyed croissants and cappucinos every morning. The room was decorated with an armoire that looked like it came from a local museum and Murano glass lighting fixtures. The bathroom was large and immaculate. The fixtures looked like they were installed last week. We can't say enough about our host, Sandro. Friendly, warm, open, hospitable -- he could not have been more helpful. Whatever we wanted, whatever question we had, he handled it. Tip: let him arrange water taxis for you. He got better rates than we were otherwise quoted on these very expensive boats. One caveat: there is no elevator. If you cannot handle stairs, you will have to skip this gem. That aside, this is a perfectly located hotel that will highlight your stay in Venice. Don't miss it. Two thumbs up. WAY up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CHICKPEA01
Reviews.Content: I can endorse all the other reviews. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We each bought a 7 day pass at the airport for 50 Euros, and this allowed us to travel on bus 5 into Venice and then on all the vaporetto transport, even out to the islands, Brilliant! Lovely to have a fridge in the room. We had room 5 which overlooked the little canal and the breakfast area and had a small balcony. Quiet air conditioning! Excellent location and we enjoyed searching out little restaurants and bars. The ladies serving breakfast were so lovely and attentive. We will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem, brilliant service & attention to our needs”
Reviews.Author: perdu
Reviews.Content: Location near perfect, easy stroll to Rialto, option of vaporetto from San Stae just a few metres from the hotel door or walk to main train station.Beautiful venetian decor & furnishings in the rooms. Breakfast was plentiful and served in a quaint court yard with very attentive staff. Arriving home each evening, the night manager recognised us and prepared a coffee & pot of tea which was our request on our 1st night. Excellent recommendation of local restaurants for authentic and well priced meals amongst locals. Could no trecommend more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in all respects...highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: mrcrangle
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Al Ponte Mocenigo on the strength of the excellent reviews on tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed! Venice was very wet when we arrived and we made the mistake of taking the Alilaguna waterbus from the airport (take the hotel's advice and use the number 5 bus followed by the number 1 vaporetto!) so by the time we arrived we were wet and miserable. The hotel arranged for us to eat lunch in a local restaurant, even though the restaurant had finished service...excellent! Our room was excellent, too (took us a few minutes to adjust to it being on the ground floor), it was spotless and very well furnished. We were equally impressed with breakfast which was served in a beautiful courtyard with very attentive staff. The location (once we'd worked out the best route!) is perfect; the district is much quieter than San Marco and the restaurants - whilst still expensive - were more reasonably priced and there were some genuine bargains to be had in the local shops (though be careful with opening times...if you find something you want, buy it there and then!). It's rare for us to get a break away without our children and we value every second of that time! It's fair to say that the Al Ponte Mocenigo was a key part of making our trip to Venice special. We would recommend it to you unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hardytours
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo after reading previous good reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor. There are a lot of hotels in Venice and selecting a good hotel at reasonable cost is difficult. We stayed here for 2 nights in mid July. The trip coincided with a particularly hot spell of weather, with temperatures in the mid to high 30's. The hotel is situated in the Santa Croce area which we found to be pleasantly quiet but still close enough to walk to the main sites (approx 5-10 mins from Rialto). Its is easily reachable (50 yards) from the San Stae vaporetto stop by going to the right of the San Stae church and then taking the first left into a very narrow alley. These directions were sent in advance by the hotel and meant luggage did not have to be dragged over bridges etc. We found several very good restaurantsand cafes in Santa Croce, which were recommended by the hotel and even a well stocked supermarket. All within only a few minutes walk, much quieter and less expensive than those in the more touristy areas of Venice which appeared to be very busy during July. The reception was able to give us lots of information about Venice and provided us with a very handy map to get around with. Free Wi-Fi internet access was available throughout the hotel and a safe were provided in the room. The breakfast buffet was served in a beautiful outside courtyard and offered a simple but delicious selection of items. Various freshly made coffees were also offered and made to order. The courtyard was also a nice to place for an relaxing evening drink. Our room (Room 3) was on the ground floor and although small was comfortable, well maintained, nicely decorated in a venetian style and thankfully had air-con. The room, and the hotel in general, was very clean throughout. The hotel exchanged helpful communication during the book process and were very helpful during our stay. Overall we thought the hotel was in an ideal location and a great place to stay during a trip to Venice. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel find”
Reviews.Author: travelcanuck29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August 2010, and loved it, I really liked the location, in direct proximity to a water bus station, and easy walking distance to the San Polo district, and Rialto Bridge. I was looking for a place a little less populated than the San Marco area. Nice breakfast, and good-size rooms. We stayed in the annex building, so I am not sure if the room sizers are smaller in the older building. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maddy27
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice as the first stop on our honeymoon and had been warned that it was expensive. However, after finding this hotel on Trip Advisor and seeing the great reviews, I booked it and it couldnt have worked out better. You dont need more than 2 days in Venice and this place is ideally located, spacious, extremely clean and the owners very helpful and friendly. I have since recommended it to several freinds. Its only a 10 min walk from the Rialto Bridge and about another 5 mins from St Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: CVJim
Reviews.Content: My daughter, niece and I stayed here as our first stop on a 2 week trip through Italy. The location couldn't have been better. It's located just off the water bus stop and is about 200 feet down the street behind an old church. The staff was there to great us and made us feel at home right away. Our room was a decent size and we were quite content with our arrangements. My single bed was a little squeaky but after being up for 37 hours, I slept just fine... Our first order of business was to eat so Walter directed us to a place just a few steps away. The food was very good but the servers were a little unfriendly, no conversation or smiles, just a "prego?" Again the food was good and we did eat here a second time. There is a better place near the local mini market about 5 minutes away. Get directions to the market and as you pass over the 2nd bridge, it's just off to the right... the smells coming from the place were out of this world. The girls called the place "2 sniffs up" as the aromas were addicting. We walked by 2x just to smell the food. Ate here 2x as well. The first time I had lasagna, the second time was the chicken cutlet that was to die for. The location of the hotel is away from the main square but only takes about 15 minutes to walk over to the Rialto Bridge and then on to St. Marks Square. Or you can walk out of the hotel and jump on the water bus and just cruise the Grand Canal. We did that the second night we were there and took it to the end of the line, got a gelato and then strolled back at 10pm, feeling completely safe the whole time. The views from the Canal at sunset were awesome! If you are there for more the 2 days, get a 3 day water bus ticket. Nobody ever checks for it but if you do get caught without one, you have to buy the ticket and pay a fine... it was worth the $11 euro. If you want a place that's away from the touristy areas but close enough to walk to (everything in Venice is close enough to walk to) this is a great place to stay. As for the buffet, the croissants were the best I've ever had but the rest of the breakfast is just cereal and fruit but the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would stay here for sure if I make it back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walker201008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to a water bus station and very close to the train station. The hotel room is beautifully decorated. The breakfast is very good. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is far from the St. Marco Piazza. But this gives me a reason to travel down almost the entire Grand Canel, which is the most enjoyable thing to do in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattandElsa
Reviews.Content: Easily acessible from the train station, warm welcome from super nice, considerate, helpful hosts. Our room was beautiful, comfortable, perfectly clean and tastefully decorated.breakfast in the gorgeous outdoor patio surrounded by sculptures and served by the nicest ladies was an amazing delight every morning. A perfect place for a honeymoon or any romantic occasion. We absolutely loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, a little hard to find but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: veronim
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Was a little hard to find, however, I think no matter where it was we were always going to struggle on our first day in Venice! The little ally that we had to skim down to get to one of the entrances was so small, but what a surprise on the other side! lovely large room, great decor. Excellent service and suggestions for local places to eat. Just step out side the courtyard and there is a lovely little footbridge - away from the hustle and bustle but still easy to walk to other areas of the city. Very happy with our value for money little find. Once again the trip advisor reviews come through with the bargain gems!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: XXL007
Reviews.Content: We stumbled across Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo three years ago surfing the Internet looking for a nice place to stay at a reasonable cost in a city we had never been too. It was our last stop before heading home from vacation. We took a chance, made a reservation and are we glad we did. So much so, that we booked the same hotel three years later (summer 2010). Nothing had changed: the most accommodating staff, very clean well appointed, sizeable rooms, in a great location. The hotel is close enough to all the sites but far enough off the beaten track to enjoy Veniceâ€™s local restaurants. Take the time to find this hidden jewel; a five star hotel at an affordable cost. Walter and Sandro define â€œpride of ownership.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Book it !”
Reviews.Author: Brotherwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a superior double (room 6) the location was perfect we arrived by water taxi altough expensive it was worth it these can be bought and paid for on arrival at the airport and can be paid for by credit card which is handy since the fare is 100 euros. Transfering from the airport is easy by public transport using bus number 5 then water bus no 1 to San Stae which is only 3 stops away. Inclusive travel tickets covering the bus and boat services for the duration of your stay can be bought from the information desk and can be paid for by credit card. There are plenty of good cafes and restaurants offering good food and drink at reasonable prices follow Walters recomendations and explore the San Croce area the squares and alleys are worth exploring on foot. You will not miss the traffic-enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: willsey
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Italy with Friends we stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in Venice. We would highly recommend this hotel. The hotel has been recently renovated. It had a lovely patio area where breakfast was served. Service was very good. We mentioned prior to our arrival via email that one of our friends was glutin intolerant and without our asking each morning, the service staff knew to bring out with her coffee, the glutin free breakfast items that she could eat . We also felt that it was an exceptional value. We would stay at this hotel again the next time we travel to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel - fab location and service”
Reviews.Author: archie027
Reviews.Content: we had a great time staying at this hotel with our twin daughters. it is conveniently located for the water bus and it was a great base. we discovered that you could avoid the queues at the basilica by printing off a 1 euro ticket from their website. walter was very charmimg and took a lot of time to help us print off the vouchers which saved us a lot of time and for which we were most appreciative. we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"The best place to stay in Venice!"”
Reviews.Author: Danno_10
Reviews.Content: We spent seven days here and all the great reviews about this hotel are spot on. Walter, Sandro, and the entire hotel staff provide outstanding customer service and will go out of their way to make your stay quite enjoyable. The hotel itself is a gem. Old Venice charm and in a great location right off the San Stae vaporetto stop. The hotel is about 50 yards straight up from the stop, hang a left down the first tight little alley you see (there is a small sign that points the way). No dragging bags all over the Venice bridges. The hotel is in a residential area away from all the noise and tourists of the San Marco area but still only a short walk away. The Rialto Bridge is about a 10 minute walk and San Marco Square is about another 10 minutes from there. We stayed in Room #5 with the balcony overlooking the small canal outside the main entrance. The balcony was especially nice for enjoying the cool evenings with some wine. The room was always kept immaculate by the staff and the size was more than adequate. There was a computer with internet access right outside our door on the 2nd floor for guests to use. The front desk will provide you with a logon and password at check-in. We always looked forward to the morning continental breakfast in the courtyard. The lovely ladies who make the breakfast make sure everything is set up and make the most delicious jam-filled croissants. There is plenty of juices, fruit, cereal, rolls, and made to order coffee, cappuccinos, espressos, tea or hot chocolate. The breakfast will keep you full for quite awhile why you explore all the sites. There is so much to see and do in Venice, just get a map (one is provided at the front desk) and go out exploring. There are formalized tours that will take you to Murano and Burano but it was just as easy getting there on your own. Walter and Sandro will be happy to tell you which vaporettos to get on. The Venice Jazz Festival was going on while we were there so we spent an enjoyable evening at the Nora Jones concert in the Piazza San Marco. Here are a few my tips: Get the Venice Travel Card at the airport (or train station) for however long you're going to stay. It is the best bargain going as you will use the vaporetto quite a bit to get around the canal. Check out the Bacarro Jazz Restaurant & Bar for happy hour 2 for 1 drinks (4-7 PM), they make excellent bellinis and have pretty good pizza too. Stay away from Harry's Bar, snooty servers and they have a dress code (no shorts). Two of our favorite restaurants were the La Zucca and Osteria Antico Giardinetto, just minutes from the hotel. Check out the Hard Rock Cafe if you want some good old American food. The servers we had were fun (Bea and Mattia) Bring those inexpensive clear rain ponchos in case you get caught in a down pour. Umbrellas are dangerous in crowded areas as we saw several people get hit in the face due to inconsiderate people not caring who they ran into. Get to the San Marco Basilica early because the lines get long quickly with the cruise ship day-trippers. Get lost, that's half the fun of exploring this majestic city. Without question we will stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo on our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, quiet hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: ThetaSigma99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. I originally booked a single room in the main hotel, but then got an e-mail from Walter (one of the owners) informing me that there was an error and there were no rooms available for that night in the main hotel. Instead, he put me in the annex and upgraded me to a superior room (for no additional charge). What can I say? The hotel room was spotless, modern, and comfortable. Walter is the friendliest, most helpful hotel manager I have ever come across. The breakfast outdoors in the courtyard is very nice (yummy jelly-filled croissants). When it came time to check out, Walter actually charged me LESS than I was originally quoted, since I was only one person in a double room. Where do you ever find that kind of kindness in the hotel business?

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM IN VENICE”
Reviews.Author: MsRM
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the instructions e-mailed to my by Sandro and Walter, the hotel was easily found, albeit otherwise hidden. It is about a minute or two walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop. We stayed here 3 nights .The hotel itself is bautifully presented inside with marble floors and nice wood features. The breakfast area (when weather is good) is a gorgeous courtyard outside. Continental brekafast is provided (juices,cereals,bread, cofffee/tea, biscuits,fruit,yoghurt..) Our room was the smallest in the hotel(we knew this and they did tell us when we arrived). The room is around the corner from reception, and although it is very small is is beautifully presented. lovely gold mirror and nice furnishings. it has a small desk and chair but for most of the time you would jsut sit on the bed. Which is fine if youre planning to be out most of the time enjoying the gorgeous sights of venice.The bathroom is a good size and has everything you need and is modern and elegant. the hotel offers a free and very good map, so do not buy one before you come to venice or onenear the train station. The staff are very helpful and the brekafast staff helpful and friendly. i would recommend this hotel to anyone staing in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BuddysArmy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here (room 08) for 2 nights and wish we could have stayed longer! We loved the great location (out of touristy sections [especially when those cruise ships are in harbor], but only a couple steps & turns to all the action), spacious rooms and bathrooms, very quiet, all staff spoke English, Vaporetto (water bus) Station (State) so close (nice for transporting your luggage to and from train station and/or bus station), great continental breakfast (lovely outdoor patio, where every table receives a fresh basket of warm yummy rolls), A/C was controllable, energy efficient rooms, cable TV (CNN International for those â€œonly English speakingâ€�, internet access was easy to login and fast (only 3 hours allowed a day), they also had a guest computer (near all the rooms), the outdoor patio is beautiful (nice place to buy a bottle of wine and plan out your next dayâ€™s adventures), very safe area, and mini-fridge in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! -- charming, clean accommodations with friendly, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: BC5_10
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 consisting of our 81-year-old mother, three siblings aged 49 to 58 and one 16-year-old male. We felt immediately welcomed by co-owners Walter and later on, Sandro, who were friendly, helpful and run a tight ship. We stayed in the junior suite which was clean, cozy, charmingly decorated with perfect, air-conditioned room temperature (very important for us given the heat), a safe and refrigerator. The bathroom was newly-renovated with attractive, modern fixtures and immaculately clean, plush towels. Hotel is located a short, 2-minute walk from a vaporetto stop which made it super-convenient to explore the city by water and is a pleasant 20-minute walk to San Marco square which is the centre of the action. Breakfast was simple but substantial. Apart from the owners, we were also very impressed by housekeeping staff Grace and night manager Lito who went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. They appeared to be genuinely interested in the comfort of their guests and their easy cheerfulness is a reflection of how well the place is run and managed. Our teenager liked the free, high-speed internet access. The only negative was we had to lug our suitcases to our 2nd floor suite via stairs, but given all the pluses, this was a very small minus. We'd stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: martimas
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a good location, and is great value for Venice. The service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ilinda
Reviews.Content: Went here before a cruise for a few days. I was pleasantly impressed with this small hotel. Getting there is not that difficult, you get off on the St Stae water stop. Based on some of the reviews I was a little nervous. I used the back entrance as it is easier with luggage. The front desk is very helpful with our luggage. I was myself and a 13 yr old. We were very happy to have COLD A/C in the room. Necessary in July in Venice. We had a canal view, it is a very small side canal view. Not sure I would pay the extra for the view next time. the bathrooms are large and the room was a decent size. the beds are small, twin sized and on the smaller side. There was a small cafe table in the room. TV was an old type with no english stations. They said they had some, but we were there several days and with a teenager tv is a must. That would be the only complaint we had about this hotel. The breakfast was very nice especially if you sit outside on the patio. It is near a church and a few little places to eat. I cannot recommend any of the places nearby except they have a good gelato stand just past the hotel. Some very good shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little gem of a hotel, beautiful clean authentic Venice style rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelerCumbria
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in June, during horendous rain storms, greeted with hot cappuccino on arrival. Stayed in the annexe rooms beautiful and clean with an excellent shower/bathroom and the room was fairly large.All the staff extremely friendly and helpful special mention for Grace at breakfast who was always cheerful and smiling.Good location only about 100yds from vaparetto stop which made it easy to find,Have reviewed previous comments and I agree with all the positive comments, would certainly recommend to friends/family. Excecellent value for money in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: swimguy818
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently travelled to Venice with our two children (13 and 15) and stayed at this great hotel. Everything about our stay was wonderful. Our room (in the main building) was spacious and very comfortable. The room had a queen sized bed, a twin bed and a pull out bed for the four of us, and there was still plenty of room to move about. The bathroom was updated and very nice. The service at this hotel is great. The breakfast was nice, and served in an outdoor courtyard. The front desk people couldn't have been nicer and offerred great suggestions for restaraunts, getting to and from the airport, etc. We had an early flight to catch, and as a result, were going to miss breakfast, however the staff packed us a 'to-go" bag which was really sweet. In our haste, we also left items in the room, which they gladly mailed back to us in the States. Overall, nice property, very clean, terrific staff, great location. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Comfortable, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TouristeSeattle
Reviews.Content: 1. We stayed for 3 nights in a triple room in the Annex building in June. The room was beautiful, with gorgeous floors and lovely decorations like an elegant glass chandelier and silk fabric covering the walls. The bathroom was very nice, with an exceptionally large shower. The room was extremely clean, quiet, had great WIFI, and at the top floor of the annex. 2. The hotel's location is very convenient for taking the vaporetto water bus or simply walking to all major sights. From the Santa Lucia train station, we used the vaporetto for a convenient and economical delivery to the hotel (be sure to read up on vaporetto passes ahead). We flew out of Marco Polo Airport and the hotel reserved a 95 Euros water taxi for us - this was a fun ride as well as time efficient for an early flight departure. 3. The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful with all questions. English was no problem. The tasty breakfast was in an outdoors patio (no problem for Annex guests - a two minute walk from the Annex room to the patio). These folks make incredibly thick, delicious hot chocolate as well as other espresso/coffee drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to explore Venice.”
Reviews.Author: HaleSphere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in November 2009 based entirely on the reviews the hotel has received on Trip Advisor and we can honestly say that we did not regret it. Our room was in the newer annex part of the hotel and was a good size and was in excellent condition. Breakfast was quite basic but did the job perfectly. On a map the hotel appears to be away from most of the main sites. However, this means that the hotel is away from the usual crowded tourist areas so you get a much better feel for the real Venice and it also means that you will see parts of Venice on your way to and from the main sites that you would otherwise never see. And to be honest it doesn't take very long to walk anywhere from anywhere. Tip 1: Carry a map of Venice with you but don't use it all the time - getting lost in Venice is part of the experience and is to be encouraged, but it is useful to have a map handy so you can find your way back to the hotel eventually! Tip 2: seek out the Al Nono Risorto restaurant, which is east of the hotel within a 5 minute walk - excellent food in a genuine local restaurant as opposed to a 'tourist' restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel you can imagine”
Reviews.Author: Pedeyez
Reviews.Content: Sandro and Walter are two friends who decided to create a wonderful place for people to enjoy Venice. They took an old palace and renovated it with beautiful wood and silk wallpaper. Many of the rooms overlook the canal. We like the suite in the new addition. The breakfast area is next to the canal and contains. many ancient artifacts. The breakfast is great and always delightfully served. Sandro and Walter are very charming hosts, always ready to assist with sightseeing and travel plans. Their front desk staff, breakfast staff, and housekeeping are incredibly helpful and kind. The hotel is located in the Santa Croce district which is a residential area and several minutes from the tourist areas which we really like. This was our fourth stay there in five years and we plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic service, clean with modern bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: AdeleSM
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. The communication before our arrival was excellent, every question was answered promptly and very thoroughly. Dinner recommendations at both local restaurants within a 5 minute walk and those a little father away were superb with excellent directions to each location. Along with all of the others, we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: johl26
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful nights at Hotel AL Ponte Mocenigo. I chose this hotel based on the recommendation of my brother who had stayed here a few years ago and the many excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. All the good reports were true, the room was very comfortable, beautifully decorated. All the staff were friendly and very helpful particularly when we were stressed about our suitcases which hadn't made it to Venice with us. The courtyard was a delightful place for breakfast and for a cool drink after a day walking around Venice. A great place to stay and if we have the opportunity to return to Venice we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and wonderful reception and staff”
Reviews.Author: ucartech
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 2 night at triple room with my wife and two small children. We received warm welcome and in fact all the staff and even the owner was very nice to us, their service was top notch. The room is big enough for us. Breakfast is simple but wonderful especially the croissant and the coffee is one of the best during our long trip to Europe this month. My 5 years old found big bug behind our bed that makes her a little bit afraid staying in the room, but overall we enjoy the stay. The location is on quiet part in St. Croce but easy to reach from water bus station. Free wifi too!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett36
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our Honeymoon and stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo purely because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and I can honestly say it was perfect. We stayed in the Annex and the room was immaculate and beautiful. The service was excellent and the staff were more than happy to recommend restaurants. The location is ideal, really close to the Vaparetto Stop and the directions from the Airport were excellent too. The bathroom was gorgeous, the bed was really comfortable and it was so quiet at night, no noise at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, accommodations and location!”
Reviews.Author: Italia2012
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights in Venice in late May, staying at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. Truly an unforgettable experience, one which burnished our Venetian memories all the more. The location is superb â€“ a few stops past the train and bus station on the #1 vaporetto line. St. Markâ€™s Square is a pleasant 20-30 minute walk away. Or, connect through other vaporetto lines to access all parts of the city or the outlying islands. We stayed in the annex (room no. 34) and found the room very clean, comfortable and fairly spacious (especially for Venice). The bathroom was well-lighted, with all modern appliances. Access to the main hotel through the adjoining street was easy and convenient. Our room was quiet, as it faced away from the street. Breakfast is served in a delightful courtyard, which may be accessed through the hotel lobby or via a separate door from the canal side. The coffee and food are excellent (especially the croissants as noted in other reviews), and the service is attentive without being intrusive. Breakfast at the hotel is a great way to start oneâ€™s day! Finally, a word about the overall service at Hotel Al Ponte Moncenigo â€“ outstanding! The front desk staff was so very helpful to us, recommending a particular opera production to us (Musica a Palazzo, which turned out to be fabulous) and giving us advice and directions to view the Giro de Italia bike race in nearby Mestre. They also made a (successful) recommendation as to where a digital camera battery might be recharged, as I had lost the charging unit on our trip. (for the record, camera stores will often perform this service; the recommended shop charged me 5 Euro to recharge a completely-dead digital camera battery). As many others have remarked on this website, Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is an outstanding hotel, combining location, accommodations, service and value to give their guests a Venetian memory that they will treasure for years to come â€“ or until they return! Bruce, Boulder, CO

Reviews.Title: “We will stay again the next time.”
Reviews.Author: millybess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in May. It was easier to find than we expected. It's very close to the San Stae stop. We stayed in a "little suite" in the annex and were very happy with the size, cleanliness and beautiful decor of the room. We found many very good restaurants and nice shops close by. The hotel provides free wifi with a great connection. A fresh, but limited, breakfast with wonderful cappuccinos is served at 8:00 a.m. in the beautiful courtyard by very friendly staff. If you're up before then, there are places to get coffee, but not in the immediate vicinity, so one drawback would be that there is no coffee maker in the room. The location for seeing the sites of Venice was perfect, guided by the excellent map provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with good restaurants nearby”
Reviews.Author: ali1125
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in an annex room ( a triple) with our 21 yr. old daughter. Plenty of room for the 3 of us. Quiet and very clean. Found restaurants reccommended by tripadvisor nearby. The staff pleasant and service was very good. Loved the breakfast crossoints.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: brian s
Reviews.Content: I am writing this whilst staying here! Free wifi. Absolutely perfect hotel. Location, staff breakfast. Just great. We are here on a bidget and this is perfect. We are in room 2 which is the smallest room right next to the reception. It is spotlessly clean. This is the biggest issue for my wife with any hotel and this passes with flying colours. Its only a 2 star but it is much better than that. Stay here, you will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Weloveholidays040
Reviews.Content: At the airport we bought a 72hr combined bus and water bus ticket - excellent value. Bus drops you off at the bus station, easy to get a water bus direct to San Stae stop. Hotel easy to find using the instructions from the hotel website - a very short walk. We stayed in the annex, which has been well restored, and our room was very pleasant and very clean. Enjoyed the breakfast (esp the jam filled croissants) in the courtyard each morning. Staff were lovely. The location by the waterbus makes it a doddle to get around Venice day or night.

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel, couldn't believe only 2 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Moondog
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is an excellent place to stay. We stayed in the Annex, the room was a chocolate colour, very pretty and cosy with a lovely big bathroom. All very traditional in theme. No tea and coffee making, which was only a very small drawback. The breakfast was great, and taken in the small cute courtyard of the main hotel. Lovely croissants and bread for breakfast, a really good start to your day in Venice. All the staff were very polite and helpful. Great location as well, not far from the number 1 vaporetto line. Very good rates for Venice, I can see why this hotel is booked up, I still can not believe it is only rated as a 2 star hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend this place, for a romantic break in the wonderful city that is Venice.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect small friendly unpretentious hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmacl
Reviews.Content: Its breakfast courtyard with flowers and sculptures and good food (especially the hot croissants and fresh cappuccinos) made us feel good to start each day. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the room was nice. And the wifi connection in the room worked very well. It's a very short walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop, and we enjoyed alternatively walking and taking the vaporetto to Piazza San Marcos.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value for Venice...”
Reviews.Author: pepe_of_perth
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay based on the positive reviews and we were not disappointed. We stayed in the annexe behind the main hotel, which was fine. Rooms were very clean and the view from our window overlooked a courtyard, which was very pleasant. We thought the breakfast was excellent, especially those jam filled croissants! The ladies that served the breakfast each morning were also a lovely start to the day, with their welcoming greeting each morning. The hotel was easy to locate, and we followed the directions given by the hotel. There was free WiFi available. The only negative was our bed, which we didn't find very comfortable, as the matteress sagged. But we would definitely stay here again when we next come to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room, good breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: squeezing
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in a junior suite (green room) -very large and quiet, location was good, not too far from the vaporetto stop and easy to access the main sights by walking or vaporetto. The hotel is situated in a less busy /touristy part of town, close to local fish and vegetable market. The staff were friendly and the 2 ladies who assist with the breakfast make great hot chocolates and coffee. Free internet access on hotel computer A most enjoyable stay overall

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rapp1021
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to when you arrive in Venice, whether by plane or train. Rooms are lovely and kept very clean. Staff is very courteous and cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic small venitian hotel in quiet surroundings”
Reviews.Author: alan848
Reviews.Content: We chose Al Ponte Moncenigo purely on its tripadvisor reviews. We arrived by water taxi from the airport and stepped straight from the boat into the hotel, a really romantic start. We had booked the junior suite, room 10, on the 1st floor, and after checking in we made our own way upstairs to our room. The room was large with a high beamed ceiling and furnished in keeping with the old venitian style, it had a small balcony overlooking the internal courtyard, and a beautiful large bathroom. First impressions brilliant. The double bed was very firm however andf we were woken every morning of our stay at 7 am by noise from the room above , footsteps chairs or luggage being dragged across the floor etc. Breakfast was served in the internal courtyard and was frugal after what we had enjoyed in our previous hotel, consisting of fruit juice, cereals in prepack portions, and a basket containing 2 bread rolls and 1 croisant per person and butter, cheese spread & jam. Plus coffee or tea. A number of good resaurants in the local area provided us with superb food at realistic prices. Overall we enjoyed our stay in Al Ponte Monceigo, but it could have been so much better!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Tulsan
Reviews.Content: The rooms, location, breakfast and service were all spectacular! I cannot think of a single thing that needed improvement. The prices were quite reasonable for Venice. This place is deservedly popular. Book early. Away from the tourist mobs and in the heart of REAL Venice.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel for the price of 2”
Reviews.Author: rcsHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 days before and after a cruise. This is a excellent hotel with a VERY missleading 2 star rating. It doesn't have a spa, pool, or restaurant... but who cares in Venice. This is a 4 star hotel by all other measures (except for the price!). We stayed in the junior suite, and were not dissapointed. It is huge!! Even for US standards. It had a jetted tub in the bathroom, which was very nice after a full day of walking all of Venice. We payed 170 euros after the cash discount, which is amazing considering the room size and amenities. Other hotels similarly rated are at least twice this price. The breakfast is basic... pastry, cofee (espresso, latte, etc...), juices, fruit, yogurt... but sufficient . The staff attending breakfast are cheerful and attentive. The front desk staff are also very helpfull and will do anything to make your stay pleasent. There's a reason this hotel is so highly rated... It's all true!!! (and a great deal).

Reviews.Title: “A small jewel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: georgiagirl777
Reviews.Content: Such a great find, in a quiet area, convenient to vaparetto stop and sight seeing. The owners, Walter and Sandro were wonderful and so helpful for directions, restaurants etc. We stayed in the red room, Very large with a nice bathroom on the second floor. Breakfast was very nice and we had free internet. Betta Morelli is also the best tour guide in Venice. They can put you in touch with her. This is a great hotel and a great value. Will stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: Jaja69
Reviews.Content: Booked our rooms (6 and 10) 7 months in advance based on TA's reviews and was glad that we took the rooms in the main building. In my opinion room 5 (also on the first floor) seems to be most luminous with windows above the canal and courtyard. My sense of smell was evoked, each time we enter the building or leaving our room, from the lingering smell of cappucino and breakfast pastries served daily. There are fantastic choices of restaurants (in terms of food quality and pricing) in close vacinity, we enjoyed Muro and La Zucca the most. The staffs were very attentive and all recommendations we asked for were spot on. Al Ponte Moncenigo will always be our choice of accommodation in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mikeusta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights. I picked the hotel based on the reviews on this site. We found exactly what we expected. The buidling, inside out is charming. Nicely decorated. Roomy and clean rooms. Very quiet. Excellent location near vaporetto stop. Close to attractions either via a short walk or a short trip with vaporetto. Very friendly staff. Totally satisfied. Surely recommended. I will not look for another place next time I visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with charm and character.”
Reviews.Author: ajmiller88
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot in Europe (including many times to Venice) and around the world and always enjoy staying at small B+B's rather than big hotels. I had a meeting in Venice and brought my new wife who had never been to Europe before. I wanted to show her the beauty, charm and character of Venice. I converged on this hotel based on numerous reviews from Tripadvisor and other travel guides, as well as the location of our conference, at the Scuola Grande di San Rocco (near Campo San Polo). It exceeded my expectations, with a big room (number 24) on the 1st floor (2nd floor in the U.S.) annex area. Large comfortable bed with a couch, closet and beautiful spacious modern bathroom with shower; beautiful entry way with a big old door (opened by buzzing the front desk at any time of day or night); beautiful Murano chandelier in room; pleasant view from two windows of a Venetian garden courtyard; hardwood floors; dark hardwood trim around the room. Sterling!! Romantic and comfortable! Breakfast served in the small outdoor courtyard, framed by numerous ancient statues and an iron main entry gate, with choice of coffee, espresso, capuccino (free re-loads), and a nice basket of excellent fresh (filled) croissants and crisp bread, fresh bananas and mandarins, yogurts, plus the usual juices, and some cereals. Front desk service was superb, speaking English perfectly. (I speak Italian but my wife does not.) For 150 Euros per night, this was a great deal! Only drawback was that it was pretty tough to find by walking from Piazzale Roma, even though I've walked the streets of Venice dozens of times over the years. Best bet for newcomers is to use the Vaporetto, where it is easy to find from the San Stae stop. Fairly long walks to most main sights, but of course Venice is a walking city so one expects that from anywhere. There were several wonderful restaurants and bars nearby that I recommend, too. On the same street is the Osteria Mocenigo, where we dined twice, because it was so good and authentic. Also, Muro is steps away, where we ate very well. Only a bit further is Al Prosecco, a great wine bar. This is All-Star quality for a small hotel, hard to beat it in Venice or anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “We heartily recommend Al Ponte Mocenigo.”
Reviews.Author: lwl_10
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel which had been recommended by friends. The owners/hosts were most welcoming and helpful. The staff and service were very good, the rooms well appointed and roomy, the breakfasts delicious - especially the hot chocolate and cappucino. The location, close to a vaporetto stop, was convenient and easy to reach. When we visit Venice again we most certainly would stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo.

Reviews.Title: “Gem”
Reviews.Author: deelynn34
Reviews.Content: This hotel clearly is a winner. The location is fantastic, just far enough away from the craziness of the Rialto/St. Marks area but only about a 15 minute walk from either, or a quick jump on the vaporetto stop right by the hotel. Our room was unfortunately the smallest (Room2) and while neither of us minds a small room, the window overlooking the alley was a big sad compared to the other gorgeous rooms. But really, a stunning hotel and extremely helpful owners. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chavetto
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel away from the hustle and bustle of St. marks Square but only a 10 beautiful walk to the Rialto and Gran Canal. I have to say it is so nice to stay in a hotel that isn't trying to nickel and dime you from the moment you walk in. They even figured out it was my Birthday and gave us a nice bottle of Prosecco to enjoy. We loved the little old lady with spunk behind the coffee bar. We loved eating breakfast on the patio. Fresh hot coffee and pastries, yogurt and fruit was plenty considering the lunches and dinners we ate during the day. They even packed us a "to go" bag because we told them we had an early flight out. We'd be leaving before breakfast was set up and they did this for us out of kindness and out of courtesy for the other sleeping guests. I hope this place never changes because we would love to come back and stay on our next trip someday.

Reviews.Title: “Totally As Advertised ++”
Reviews.Author: Surely_U_Jest
Reviews.Content: Like others, booked this hotel back in September based on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews. The comments are spot on and the hotel exceeded expectations. The hosts, Sandor and Walter were quite accommodating, not only upon arrival, but in advance. Promptly responding to emails with suggestions and arrangements. It was our first time in Venice and we don't speak Italian. They made it all very easy with their perfect English. Arriving by train, made getting to the hotel simple. We took a water taxi back to the airport and the ride was a great experience, well worth the 90 euros. Little in Venice is cheap as you will quickly learn. The rooms are quaint, not fancy, but have enough "venetian" flourishes to give a local aura. They were impeccably cleaned. Not large, but not small. We stayed in the annex and appreciated the quiet. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were just this side of being bricks. I know it seems like a nit, but an slight upgrade would have made a vast improvement to the sleep quality thus the rating of "3." The morning breakfast was tasty, the service attentive and the garden setting pleasant. The cappuccinos flow non-stop. The jam filled croissants are worth the calories. My only surprise was the number of families with children staying at this type of hotel. The children behaved as children do, but unfortunately a few parents were a bit oblivious as to how this was impacting the experience of other guests. I suffered in silence on more than one morning, hoping for silence if you get my drift. Some kid free zones or times would have been a plus. This hotel is actually in a neighborhood which was wonderful. Great dining nearby. A neighborhood wine bar which was very welcoming. Definitely try the pizza's at Ruffalo and the Brioche Creme (Vanilla Cream Puffs) at Majer. One last dining recommendation. Make the trip across the Rialto Bridge to Osteria Alle Testiere. Can't remember the last time we asked for a repeat order of an appetizer, but the scallops served on the shell with fresh orange sauce were superb. The Peggy Guggenheim Museum for modern art is not to be missed. We would definitely make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want and more”
Reviews.Author: traveladywestsussex
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel eight months ago for this April on the strength on Trip Advisor recommendations and location. We were not disappointed with anything. Our little suite which was in the separate annex , consisted of a large room with a king size bed and a smaller adjoining room with a single divan for our daughter. It was quite beautiful and as described on the hotel website with modern bathroom and facilities. Everything was clean and the linen was crisp and comfortable with lots of fresh towels left every day. The walls are hung with fabrics and the very high ceilings were set off by enormous stunning Murano glass chandeliers. The continental breakfast of fresh rolls, coissants, yoghurt, soft cheese, pates, cereals, jams, fruit, sweet biscuits, fruit juice and pastries was perfectly accompanied by fresh cappacinos and hot chocolate made by the very lovely "breakfast ladies". Staff were always able to offer advise about trips, restaurants and places to visit. Our 4 night trip was extended by the recent volcano incident and Walter and Sandro kindly arranged for us to be walked to another hotel for one night as they could not accomodate us, but were able to offer us 4 further nights until we could get a flight home. We then had a room in the main part of the hotel and could smell the coissants and rolls being baked in the morning.The staff were always so helpful and concerned about the situation of their guests that had been "stranded". We loved Venice, who wouldn't of course, and would go back in a heartbeat, staying in the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo . As others have commented before as a two star hotel, it is fantastic, the location is perfect and a very short distance away from a vaporetto stop and we cannot thank Walter and Sandro enough for helping us when we were delayed.

Reviews.Title: “Another world”
Reviews.Author: obama409
Reviews.Content: As per usual we have a splash out on our vacation & decided to stay here on our last night. The place was beautiful with the most amazing views/features every which way you turned. Our room was beautiful & comfortable with antique pieces on show. Just sitting and relaxing in the courtyard among the statues was removed from reality. We both were really happy we chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic, unique, quiet, and memoriable.”
Reviews.Author: oliviababea
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a satisfyingly great place. My husband and I was touring Europe for our 10Th wedding anniversary. We flew into Munich, stayed in Salzburg, also Vienna, and Venice, then back up to Munich. Our actual anniversary was at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. It was very easy to find, even for our first trip to Venice. Venice is actually very easy to navigate once you get the hang of it. And finding this place was very easy. Venice is charming anyway, but walking up to that private bridge, ringing the bell for the courtyard and walking in the lighted entry is spirit stirring. I think our room was the least expensive one, but it was still very comfortable and elegant. The courtyard has statues and tables with chairs and is very pleasant. Inside is the long front desk and a small kitchenette at the far end where they make the morning coffee. All very nice and well decorated. Our room was the only one on the ground floor (I think) and our floor to ceiling window/sliding door was just above the courtyard out side. This didn't bother us or lower the quality of the room AT ALL. Our room was well appointed with satins, silks, and soft sheets. The armoire looked like an antique, it was beautiful. The bathroom had a huge, deep bathtub, which is rare in Europe. And there was marble and tile everywhere. You can tell they have put alot of effort in keeping with the quality of the hotel. There was plenty of room and to spare. I noticed a very old exposed beam over our bed and asked the owner about it. He said it is original to the house from the 1300s. We slept very soundly and well in the bed and all of our comforts were met. We don't not once hear the other guests (and we were told the hotel was booked) even when they were coming down for breakfast. The breakfast in the morning was especially perfect. It is a year later, and I can still taste the cappuccinos and these pastries that were as light as air,but had a surprising taste of raspberry jam inside. In nice weather they serve breakfast outside in the courtyard and every morning that's where we were. White table clothes, spring flowers, cool breezes with hot cappuccino, and my husbands face made this some of the happiest days of my life. The staff were SO accommodating and very friendly. They recommended a great restaurant down the way that had the best steamed muscles. The hotel is well situated in Venice and we got to and from anywhere quickly and with ease. Turns out it was owned by one of the doges before he was elected. Part of the house has been turned into a museum about him. All in all our stay here was amazing. I loved every moment of it and the beauty of such an escape with my Husband lingers in my soul, refreshing me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great hosts. A gem!”
Reviews.Author: JMFSRTN
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel on our trip. Beautiful rooms. Marble bathroom. Great location. Best breakfast served by a very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we stayed at in Europe”
Reviews.Author: mattj9
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 3 week vacation to Europe, including a 4-night stay in Venice. In terms of value for money, this hotel is the best we experienced. We arrived early and were offered a breakfast while they made up our room. The service from the 2 owners was great - very friendly and helpful (they are native Venicians). The rooms were great - well appointed and they have a nice feel. A good location 10 minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge and 15 from St Marcos. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - the secret is out!”
Reviews.Author: ladyhoshi
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be a well-kept secret anymore thanks to Trip Advisor, but it definitely lives up to its reputation. It's easy to find if you use the instructions on their website (we walked from the station but you can have a water taxi drop you only a few metres from the front door, should you desire.) The rooms are beautifully appointed with a very classic Venetian feel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. They recommended a Vivaldi concert to us which ended up being our favourite experience of anywhere we went in Italy! Breakfast in the courtyard was relaxed and delightful. I would absolutely stay here again - it really is a gem, and much better priced than many comparable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lovely staff, but perhaps overated?”
Reviews.Author: poet123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently, and found the hotel to be very clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the location good. Our room was large enough, but had a view out onto a blank wall/ almost adjoining house. The dark decor meant we had to have the lights on at all times, and for a longer stay I fear this could have proved a tad depressing. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, modern and functional, however, the wall hung hairdrier was useless for blow drying your hair, as it could not be regulated, nor manipulated very well. Ladies take note, you will need to bring your own. The small courtyard where breakfast was served was nice, but perhaps not as nice as it appears in the pictures on the website. Basically, you sit on garden furniture under a plastic garden awning, it is heated with patio heaters on cooler days. You can also sit out there at night and have a drink after you return from dinner. Breakfast was filled croissants, cereals, bread rolls, juices and tea/coffee. perfectly adequate but nothing out of the ordinary, and perhaps not quite living upto the expectation generated by some of the glowing reviews on this site. I feel a bit like I am unmasking the Emporer in the Emporer's New Clothes story. I suppose what I am saying is that copmared to the other hotel we stayed at in Venice (The Abbazia Deluxe) the Al Ponte Moncenigo fell short. At the former we had a two room Grand Canal view suite, a much more varied breakfast range, and access to the much larger outside space of the walled garden of the sister hotel next door.for 15 euros less per night. Although the Al Ponte Moncenigo is in a much quieter location, so if that is important to you then the choice is clear. I would stay at both hotels again, but my preference would be the Abbazia Deluxe for overall ambience and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If you visit Venice, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: RobertJP
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with all the earlier positive reviews. The hotel is located about 4 stops from the main arrival point in Venice (Pia. Roma). We found all the staff very friendly and welcoming. We stayed in the Annex which is about 40 metres from the main hotel. Breakfast is taken back at the hotel. Unfortunately it was not warm enough to eat outside but normally that would be a lovely way to start the day. The choice though not exhaustive was perfectly adequate. We had no complaints and the freshly made coffee was excellent. The main guy on reception (sorry can't remember his name) was very helpful with directions, bookings, recommendations etc . Our room was perfect and spotlessly clean. Top tips for visiting Venice: Have a meal in Al Zucca. Its excellent and its very close to the hotel. Visit the Doges Palace. If there is a long queue go to the other museum at the far side of the square where you can buy a combined ticket. Then go back and go to the top of the queue. Visit the Basilica but make sure you pay the extra to go upstairs. Try to time it for when the light up the ceiling. It really makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Carnevale
Reviews.Content: Visited this small hotel on the strength of reviews on this site, & its location away from the most "touristy" areas. The reviewers were not kidding, this hotel rates as one of the best of many we have been to in Italy & the others have all been 3 or 4*. Reluctant to say too much as we will not be able to get in again. They even provided "wellies"which proved essential for the snow & ice! Just a short stride from the San Stae Vap station, so all Venetian attractions within easy reach. Value for money personified.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect city break hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLang
Reviews.Content: Slightly off the beaten track, but still not too far a walk to any of the main sights. The area of the hotel is quieter than the main part of Venice (San Marco) which is far more 'touristy'. But actually having walked around most of Venice over 3 days, we preferred the area we stayed in the most over all the districts. Lots of little squares with a cafe, we often stopped and had a macchiato or a cold beer. Some good places to eat too. Again, stay off the main tourist paths to find the best and more reasonably priced food. La Zucca, 2 mins from the hotel was very nice. Venice is very safe, so dont let the fact the hotel isn't right next to St Marks Square put you off. In fact, that should be an encouragement. We did all the sights, St Marks and the Basillica, Doges Palace, Peggy Guggenheims art gallery, Salute - but the bit we enjoyed most was the walking around. So much to take in, and full of little surprises. The hotel was excellent!! As a 2 star, you're amazed. The rooms are all really well and tastefully decorated, the bathrooms recently refurbed and the beds were very comfy!! And you get a continental breakfast thrown in. The staff are ever so nice and cant do enough. I wouldnt look anywhere else if youre checking out hotels. Thanks for an amazing break in Venice!!! See you next tome

Reviews.Title: “Easy Review to Write!”
Reviews.Author: nire107
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Extremely friendly staff who are eager to help in every way. The front desk folks were very informative and gave us excellent details when explaining directions and how things worked in Venice. Our room was beautiful. Very spacious, well decorated and clean. Also loved the free wifi! Excellent breakfast - really enjoyed the friendly breakfast attendants and how they would personally prepare each persons coffee, cappuccino etc. My husband has specific dietary needs (celiac disease) which I had informed the hotel of before our arrival. Our first day at breakfast, they had gluten free products that they had gone out and purchased specifically for him. He was very pleased. The location is a bit out of the way from the normal tourist locations, but we enjoyed this since the tourist locations seemed crowded and noisy. We used the water taxi to get around and this hotel is VERY close to that taxi stop so it was perfect. Not to mention the quirky entrance to the hotel on a tiny street between two large buildings. We got a kick out of coming and going on this tiny little street. It definitely added to the Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city, beautiful room, helpful & friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: tomgallagher
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Al Ponte Mocenigo for 3 nights in December as a birthday gift from my girlfriend. While we were there we did lots of walking round, coffee drinking and general sightseeing whilst relaxing. The hotel was wonderfully decorated with silk walls, beamed ceilings and original venetian furniture. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and gave us local tips and advice. While we were there we saw a live classical concert in one of the many churches and went to see the history of venice show (which was funny and insightful as we knew little about the history of the place before visiting). Finally we couldn't believe the price, this hotel is fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mailmark1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptionally good value and its staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Our stay was very comfortable and relaxed and the hotel though not pretentious is certainly well above the normal 2 star offerings. The rooms made us feel like we were staying in a small venetian palace. The Hotel is well maintained and the bathrooms immaculate. Breakfast is continental style but plenty of it.
