It is located down a very narrow alleyway just 30 yards from the San Stae Water Bus Stop which has connections on the â€œnumber 1â€� water bus from the main bus station and down to the Rialto Bridge, the Academia and St Marks Square. This an easy and very cheap way to see all the best sites on the Grand Canal !! Try and get a seat at the front of the water bus and just enjoy the sites. The Hotel is also well located for lots of local restaurants of varying style and price (all much dearer than England). It is also located in a quiet area and well positioned for easy walking to the Rialto Bridge passing through the Fish and Vegetable Markets and a vast array of shops on the way to St Marks Square. Our stay was excellent at this Hotel which is a credit to its owners and staff. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: mcnsmith
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice for a long weekend and booked into Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo after looking at previous reviews. Although at the pricier end of the scale it is a beautiful Venetian hotel with friendly, helpful staff. The room was large and spotless. The towels were changed daily and toiletries topped up daily too! (Always a bonus!!) There is plenty of storage space and a safe is also provided. The rooms were quiet and the bed was large and comfortable. The hairdryer provided is almost like a hose which fires out hot air, but served its purpose!! Breakfast is included the price and you have a fairly good selection; croissants, bread, cereal, yoghurts etc served by the friendly staff. The reception staff were helpful and chatty and made us feel right at home. They were very accommodating - looking after our bags on the last day. The hotel provides a map of Venice, internet access and there are various books around about Venice. The hotel is located in a quieter area which we liked - I imagine in the summer it would be good to get away from the crowds. It is 2 mins walk from the San Stae stop regularly served by the No 1 Vaporetto. Realistically you can walk to the hotel from the bus station, but until you have familiarised yourself with Venice it is probably easier to get the no 1 and walk around the corner. We arrived on the vaporetto and walked back to the bus station when we left. It is ideally located to get around Venice - I think we covered everywhere in 2 days!! Easy city to walk around - it's very small and you start to recognise the small streets pretty quickly. There are many restaurants and shops around the small streets of the hotel and these are slightly cheaper than in the touristy areas but just as good - if not better. We ate in the restaurant around the corner and the recommended vegetarian restaurant both of which were fab - with amazing food, great service - one restaurant owner translating the entire menu for us!! - and no separate 'tourist' prices. The cake shops are also well worth a visit!!! We had one day walking and one day boating - which was necessary after the day walking and we are both pretty fit - loads of sights to see and we just wandered around and followed our noses - impossible to get properly lost as the place is so small and you just follow the signs for tourist attractions. All in all we had a great time and stayed in a great hotel - would stay there again and would thoroughly recommend it if you can afford to splash out. A final note would be if you have young children and rely on pushchairs I'd either rethink this until a later date or be prepared to lift your chair up and down every bridge - we felt very sorry for the numerous people we saw doing this!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: roasties
Reviews.Content: We got a taxi virtually to the door, which was a blessing with suitcases as the rest of Venice is a maze of bridges, squares and alleyways. We were led up to the 2nd floor of the annex (no lift). Room very clean and good size, bathroom new. Breakfast ladies a real delight always smiling and made an effort to greet us and ensure we had everything we needed. Found reception staff quiet and only spoke when spoken to, felt a bit isolated in the annex as the entrance was outside and around the corner, we had to ring a bell for the door to be unlocked each morning for breakfast therefore we only ever saw other people or staff at breakfast. It is wonderful to "get lost" but the passages and squares look very different during the day to night time and it can be a challenge to find your way back especially as the street lights are dim and the maps tend have tiny print (especially after a few drinks) It was nice to see umbrellas and wellington boots were available to borrow, only noticed them when leaving! Overall enjoyed our stay, perhaps staying in the main hotel would have been more atmospheric.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Charm”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLooseAbroad
Reviews.Content: I was the leader of a group of 10 girls who stayed in Al Ponte Mocenigo for 2 nights in March, 2010. We found the hotel to be extremely clean, had Venetian charm, and was run by very friendly and dependable owners, Walter and Sandro. Once we learned the route to the Rialto Bridge, negotiating the narrow streets of the city was easy. Walter and Sandro gave us suggestions of unusual Venetian events, such as the Opera performed live in a Venetian Palace overlooking the Grand Canal, of which we would have had no knowledge. Sandro's wife is a tour guide and can offer wonderful tours of the city, such as the night tour of St. Mark's with interior lit mosaics. The owners also conncected us to Destination Venice, an extremely reliable tour and transfer agency, whose services to us were invaluable. I would highly recommend this charming small hotel to anyone who is interested in exploring Venice. Thank you to Al Ponte Mocenigo for a memorable visit. Helen Loch Gainesville, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelcasci
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex around the corner from the main hotel. Room was comfortable and had a view of the street below. Friendly, helpful staff. Good breakfast. Use of the Al Ponte's boots and umbrella came in handy with the snow and rain. Conveniently located, just obtain a "pass" which you can purchase on arrival (we took 72 hours for our 3 night stay) and access to transport is cheaper. Avoid eating and shopping close to main attractions, it's more expensive and take note of the "tourist menus" where all extras are at an additional cost, look for restaurants frequented by the locals. It's quite simple to do a walking tour of Venice on your own, just obtain a map and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Josh13
Reviews.Content: Check in was as simple as the directions from the airport to the hotel. The owner was on hand to greet us, was friendly, and most helpful in pointing out the "must do list" for Venice. He also recommended some great local places for dinner. The room was beautiful with it's green and gold motif, exposed beam ceilings, and upholstered walls. The antique furniture that is throughout the hotel, is a continued theme into the rooms. We had a private balcony that could be accessed by wonderful, oversized wood and glass doors. The bathroom was large, clean, and had all the amenities. The mini refrigerator was well stocked. The staff was ready to help with any request. The hotel was also in a great location. Close to everything, and easy to find. There was a lovely gated, small courtyard just out the main doors. In warmer weather, the perfect place to have a coffee, or just sit and enjoy the old statues. All in all, I don't think we could have asked for a nicer place to stay during our wonderful winter vacation. When we make it back to Venice, we will stay here again! Lisa & Josh WV

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: LindaLee50
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are very nice & roomier than many in Europe. the location is close to many attractions but far enough away to be quiet. The staff was wonderful & the breakfast was tasty. A terrific value-we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect introduction to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: kathyw71
Reviews.Content: Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo was just as nice as everyone else has said--a delightful little historic hotel with lots of "personality" and exceptional service. We paid a little extra for a "canal view room" so that we would have a King-size bed and larger bathroom--which we thought was still a bargain by "Venice standards." The room was comfortable and very quiet and certainly felt "very Venetian" with lovely antique furnishings and a Murano glass chandelier. The bathroom appeared to have been recently updated and had a full-size bathtub, great towel warmer, and nice toiletries. The hair dryer was rather unique but "served the purpose." We were served a delightful complimentary breakfast each morning of freshly baked rolls, cereal, fruit, yogurt, juice, and wonderful espresso or capuccino each morning by the "breakfast ladies." The location of the hotel was great, with the walkway into the hotel probably less than 50 yards from the Grand Canal at the San Stae vaporetto stop. We were glad that we'd been warned that the sign marking the place to turn into the hotel was "tiny" or we probably would have missed it. We asked one of the other guests there what they recommended that we see as "first-time visitors," and they said to "just get lost" and enjoy the neighborhoods and sights of Venice. We found beautiful squares and amazing churches, MANY unique bridges, and plenty of interesting shops and sidewalk cafes by just aimlessly walking in the area surrounding the hotel. Venice is small enough that we were still only 20 minutes or so away from Saint Mark's Square or any other part of Venice that we cared to visit. We found many areas to purchase Murano jewelry (with competitve prices to Murano itself), wonderful leather goods, and amazing pizza and gelato. The staff at the hotel were so accomodating and friendly--we felt more like we were staying in the home of a friend than in a hotel in a foreign country. We would definitely go back to Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo if we're lucky enough to get to return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Around_the_World_165
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel, fair enough away from the busy tourist areas, however close enough to walk to the Rialto, San Marco Square and all the other must see places. The hotel is small, around 10 rooms, fantastically decorated to venetian style and the bathroom was as good as any other 4 star hotel we have stayed in. Breakfast was adequate - breads, cereals fresh fruit and coffee of your choice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Venice, perfect location, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Pitiniaou
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice for a romantic week-end with my boyfriend and we stayed at this hotel for 3 days. We had the room 8 on the first floor, it was absolutely beautiful, big room, all red, very high ceiling, the bathroom was really clean. The breakfast is included in the price and if you pay cash you have a 6% reduction. The hotel is ideally situated near San Stae vaporetto stop, 4 stops from the bus station (bus from Marco Polo and Treviso) and 3 from the train station. The service is excellent and the staff very helpful. I can only recommend this hotel and canâ€™t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JAG458
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a tripadvisor favorite and for good reason. It has a great location in a nice part of Venice just a block or 2 from the vaporetto stop. It then gives you a prime location for touring, either by water taxi or by foot with a map (my recommendation, despite the fact you will get lost many times). The rooms were clean and comfortable, but remember this is a budget friendly hotel for a reason. Our windows faced the building next door (that is the charm of venice) so it encouraged us the explore. The staff were very helpful and friendly and they provided a very nice breakfast in the courtyard. I would definitely recommend this again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing gem in the center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jggirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Knowing how expensive Venice is, we were not sure what to expect for the low price of 95 euros but we were literally blown away. The hotel is located in the center of Venice and is very easy to get to (less than 5 minutes from the San Stae vaporetto stop). Even though we arrived around noon, we were led straight to our room by the sweetest lady. The rooms are beautiful - Venetian style with high ceilings. Ours was red and included a beautiful Venetian glass chandelier. The bathrooms impressive - perhaps better than any 4/5 star hotel I've stayed in - all marble. Breakfast is included and is served in a small room on the main floor. It is a typical Italian breakfast (with cereal which is not so typical). For those who want a great restaurant nearby there is one just around the corner. We had pizza and it was great. I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend”
Reviews.Author: BoyneBhoy
Reviews.Content: highly enough but not sure want anyone else to know. Location is great, just a few metres from Vaporetto stop, quiet location, great hospitality, short stroll to Rialto and on to Piazza San Marco. 4 day minimoon-unforgettable and visiting in in Winter I didn't get sunstroke like I did as a child in 1977! Just don't book the place out when I want to go back. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “REALLY EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Wahaay
Reviews.Content: Ditto all the other glowing reviews of this hotel on here. This was a really excellent example of what a small hotel should be.Superbly appointed rooms and very friendly staff.Quiet location away from the main tourists haunts in Venice but still less than 5 minutes walk from them. There is also an excellent pizza/pasta restaurant less than a minute's walk away from the hotel entrance that was full every night and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “truly recommend”
Reviews.Author: OsloMartinq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. It is suited in a great location, a few steps from the Gran canal. There was delicious breakfast served in a charming courtyard. Warm and welcoming staff. The rooms are nice and large enough with comfortable bed. Come here, experience here, and you may know why there is nearly 100% recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved thisFantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliJAustralia
Reviews.Content: Well everthing you read is true. This Hotel is truely lovely & in a great location. It was very easy to work out how to use the public transport & find our way around venice with the help of the friendly staff. Found booking directly very easy as the owners are good communicators. Thanks soooo much

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: tj_mct
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now. Right near Vaporetto San Stae and very easy access with suitcases if you enter throught the secondary door from the narrow alleyway. Helpful and friendly staff / owners. Really lovely, large rooms, very clean and nicely decorated. Free internet and pleasant breakfast. TV was problematic both times but really no big deal. Unusually bad exchange rate when I paid by credit card (?) , so I will only pay with cash here. In summary, I really like the location, the accommodation and the general good feeling from this place (plus the awesome bathrooms!). I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Fyrishsunset
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in this traditional style hotel. Staff were pleasant & helpful, always happy to spend time giving advice. We agree whole-heartedly with the other good reviews re this Hotel on Trip Advisor so I will use this space to give some advice to people who, like us, have never been to Venice before. It really is a beautiful city - absolutely unique and we will definitely be back . When we arrived, we went out to explore near the hotel and immediately became lost amongst the virtual maze of narrow alleyways that make up Venice . We found it all rather alarming initially as wandering around in narrow alleyways totally goes against all personal safety advice normally given to holidaymakers. HOWEVER, having decided to return to the hotel I picked up a copy of "Italy For Dummies" in the lobby and was so glad I spent an hour reading the section on Venice or I don't think I'd have left the hotel again !! Apparently, Venice is virtually crime free (apart from pick pockets) and getting lost in the maze of narrow streets and alleyways is all part of the fun. As long as you keep an eye open for "Al Vaporetto" signs (found on corners of some buildings) you can always make your way back to the Grand Canal where the Vaporettos (water buses) can be found. The hotel is literally a stone's throw from the San Stae Vaporetto Stop so you should find your way back to base without any problem. After we realised this basic fact there was no stopping us and we were happy to wander round the maze of streets in all the historical areas of Venice, jumping on and off Vaporettos at different stops along the Grand Canal. I'm not really into shopping while on holiday but felt totally different in Venice as the shops are just amazing. Fantastic choice of handmade jewellery, wood carvings, Murano glass wear and all manner of crafts with prices to suit every pocket . The hotel was excellent and Venice was a truly magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “Does not dissapoint !!”
Reviews.Author: injenswetrust
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at the hotel. We booked a standard room number 6, and the size was acceptable, junior suites are much bigger but ours met all our standards. The service is great, everybody is very friendly. You can walk 10 minutes and be at the Center of Venice. If we come back, we'll definitely stay here again. M&J from Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further...”
Reviews.Author: manse_01
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations prior to arriving at the hotel having read such rave reviews and was more than satisfied with my choice to stay here. This is the ideal choice for a comfy and conveinent hotel to experience such a fascinating city. Couldn't agree more with all the 'excellent' reviews listed below and at such a reasonable price I cant imagine anywhere else would compare.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jennenz
Reviews.Content: All reviews of this hotel were dead on. It is a true gem of a place. It is quiet, private yet an easy walk to the Rialto bridge and just about anywhere you want to go. If you wish to take the vaporetto everywhere, it is literally 50 yards from San Stai station. The owners were lovely and gave us great tips on where to eat (we tried 3 suggestions of theres and all 3 were amazing!). Our rooms were elegant and interesting and the breakfast in the morning was just enough to start your day. Can't say enough wonderful things and I will definitely go back when next in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Venice, but shhh - don't tell anybody !!”
Reviews.Author: SetantiiAndii
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo from Monday 16th to Friday 20th November. Venice is my opinion the most beautiful City in the world, simply breathtaking. The problem with Venice is that it is one of the most expensive destinations in Europe - I would say London prices plus 25%.The Hotels and restaurants tend to be very overpriced and the standard not great. What a find this hotel is, it is small, beautifully presented hotel, immaculately clean, contemporary with a dash of traditional Venetian style. It is located a stones throw from the Grand Canal, don't stay on the Grand Canal - the Vaporetta run 24 hours and are very noisy - this location is just perfect. The rooms are of more than adequate size and beautifully furnished with large comfortable beds, the batherooms are very modern and cleaner than my bathroom at home ! Free wireless internet is a real bonus, the restaurant serves a continental breakfast, my wife requires a gluten free diet, the staff had a real understanding of her requirements and had a stock gluten free breakfast items. Sandro and Walter the owners of the hotel are wonderful hosts, nothing is too much trouble and all the staff are very friendly. The quality of accommodation is as high as hotels more than twice the price. Highly recommended - just don't tell anybody, it's a secret.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE GEM”
Reviews.Author: kerryflower
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming,beautiful rooms and excellent staff who would go out of their way to help you.It deserves a 3 or 4 STAR Rating.......thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder they get such good reviews”
Reviews.Author: DelBournemouth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and it was everything that we hoped it would be. We had asked for a room with a shower as my wife has difficulty getting in and out of some baths, recognising this they gave us a room on the ground floor which was perfect. A ready supply of umbrellas for the rain days and even wellies had we felt the need, Perfectly situated in what I think is the best part of Venice, away from the main tourist routes which are pretty horrific, The best part of Venice is S. Croce and S. Polo. One special tip which we discovered purely by accident, we caught the no. 2 vaperetto at the rail station with the intention of going down the Grand Canal, unfortunately it was going the other way and although we enquired whether it was going to S Marco and were told yes, stay where we were, it went out round the lagoon calling at Guidecca. This, althoough the first 3rd of the journey is around the commercial part, then provided the most spectacular longer views of Venice which you don't get simply going down the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - small room and average service.”
Reviews.Author: 22bld22
Reviews.Content: We were excited to visit this hotel after reading all the positive reviews but we were very disappointed. The room we were given was very very small compared to the pictures on the website and we had a view of a very close brick wall. I strongly recommend paying the extra money for a Junior Suite, rather than the Standard Double. We were able to see into other rooms when they were being cleaned, and the larger rooms actually looked really nice, but there are about 4 rooms which are uncomfortably small. Were were on our honey, and so we asked for a larger room, and were told we couldn't have one for our first two nights, but our third night we would be able to move. When we went back to ask when we could move for our third nights stay, we were told we could no longer move. We were somewhat disappointed with the service as well. Once we asked we were given directions and help with public transport which was great, however we felt the hotel was more concerned with getting guests in and out rather than taking the time to make your stay more enjoyable. Perhaps our experience would have been more positive if we'd booked a Junior Suite. On the positive side, the breakfast is fairly good and the hotel is easily accessible by taking the 'boat bus' number 1 from the train station and getting off at 'Stae', walking left across to the farest alley way, turning right and then you will the reach the bridge across to the hotel. However, there is only a couple of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant refuge in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: SJislandgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on past positive TA reviews, and was not disappointed! It was a pleasure to stay in a small hotel in a quiet residential area, away from the hustle and bustle of Venice. Yet we were steps away from the San Stae vaporetto stop, and within easy walking distance of sites on both sides of the Grand Canal. The hotel has been exquisitely restored. We had a standard double room, which was small but nicely decorated and very adequate for the 2 of us, and the nicest bathroom of our stay in Italy. Walter and Sandro and their staff take very good care of their guests and were very helpful. Do not hesitate to ask them for restaurant recommendations. The breakfast was excellent with wonderful cappuccino and lots of choices. Based on past information in the reviews, on arrival we easily found the small passageway to the back entrance, an easier approach with luggage because there are no steps. I would book this hotel on a return trip to Venice in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It keeps on getting better...”
Reviews.Author: Moka
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3rd visit to this delightful small hotel and it really remains a little gem.Perfectly located- a minutes walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop,it really is a delight to leave the hustle and bustle of the busier areas and return to this little oasis.W e stayed in room 10 this time the junior suite-a huge beautifully furnished room with a spotless bathroom and relaxing whirlpool bath (much appreciated after hours of walking round!) Walter and Sandro are perfect hosts and nothing seems too much trouble for them,it was a pleasure to chat with them each morning.The breakfast and cleaning staff are also charming. We dined at 3 different restaurants in the evening, all recommended by Walter and Sandro and we had delicious meals at them all...Muro,Alla Zucca (predominantly vegetarian) and Al Nonos a traditional restaurant serving mainly pizza and pasta dishes. This is one of our all-time favourite hotels and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anybody. Tony and Sara

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was excellent, centrally located, great staff, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: amdromeda2
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a mammoth flight from Australia, the hotel was easy to find, just off the Grande Canal. The staff are excellent and this was the best value hotel we ended up staying in on our 6 week european holiday. It was so centrally located and we just loved walking and exploring Venice. The breakfast was excellent. Our room was on the ground floor, but it was lovely and quiet, the bathroom was very good, very clean, we just loved this small hotel and would definately stay there if we ever return to Venice. Thank you for making us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Mini-Palace”
Reviews.Author: Heraldthewake
Reviews.Content: Very friendly reception and breakfast staff. Its a special B&B. We picked it based on the outstanding tripadvisor reviews and it met all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great people & wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: stanopedia
Reviews.Content: If you want to be away from the crowds and treated liek family, this is the place for you. Walter and Sandro are great hosts and were most helpful with restaurant tips and reservations. Don't worry about being in the annex, as the rooms are large and the bathrooms huge and sparkling. We took the vaporetto from the nearby San Stae stop just about everywhere, and loved riding with the locals.Would definitely return and recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: TCDevon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must! A peaceful and quiet location. Not overly expensive, easy to find being only 40yds from a waterbus station on the Grand Canal. The bedroom proved to be absolutely lovely and tastefully furnished. We arrived very late to a very warm, helpful welcome. All of the staff were most attentive & helpful. A simple but plentiful breakfast in a cosy dining room. The hotel is situated just a few minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge and a little further, is St Marks Square. Many local restaurants - but try to stay away from the tourist hot spots as the prices start to escalate. Again, the hotel staff were most helpful with recommendations and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: HotMama168
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on previous reviews. Everything written is true!! Rooms are gorgeous and it really has a great Old World feel to it but it has all the modern amenities! Rooms are extremely clean too. I'm a germophobe and this hotel passed with flying colors! Carlito was very patient and helped us with a lot of our requests. Thank you Carlito! Will definitely come back. You should book this hotel as soon as you know when you will be in Venice. It's a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: ZVMH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. Spotlessly clean, quiet but you could easily walk to all the main attractions. It was really good value for Venice and the quality of rooms, breakfast and staff were well above wat you would expect for a 2 star hotel. Although they recommend gettting the bus to Piazza Roma we got the Vaperetto from the Airport to Rialto and walked up from there. It was a fantastic way to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: EliBai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for part of our Honeymoon - it was the absolute best choice! A beautiful hotel at a terrific value, I did TONS of research and nothing could beat this. It is about a 15 minute walk from St. Mark's Square, but there are so many great bars, restaurants and shops along the way - you don't even notice. Our room was beautiful - right in front of the lobby and the courtyard for eating - but still not too noisy. The owners and staff were incredibly nice and accomodating - they had terrific recommendations for restaurants in the area. We would MOST definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcreig02
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, beautiful, and charming. It was adequately priced and the location was nice and quiet. The hotel has a boat stop at the end of the street and is equal distance from the train station and St. Marks Sq. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bon2005
Reviews.Content: Charming traditional small hotel offering great service, immaculate rooms and a perfect location away from the crowds but also very conveniently located for wandering through the alleys of Venice or catching water transport. Calm, capable service from hosts . Highly recommended for couples looking for a quiet retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous - a perfect romantic hideaway”
Reviews.Author: NicKimEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: Firstly - our ONLY issue was finding it and this is in no way the fault of the hotel itself - if you book through hotels.com please ignore the map they provide as it will send you to the shipping district!!! The hotel is in fact just steps from the San Stae vaporetto stop in the beautiful Santa Croce district, and extremely easy to get to and central for everything. However, after we did find the hotel we were astounded at the room we were shown to - room 9, the beautiful red room you will see in their photos. Romantic, luxurious, period features and a bathroom with a full sized bath!! The friendly and helpful staff couldn't do enough to help and made us feel really welcome, and free wifi kept my husband happy! The icing on the cake was hearing some beautiful opera being practised nearby - the sound of singing drifted in through the open window as we were getting ready for dinner - simply fab! In the morning, breakfast was served outside in the tiny courtyard garden, a fantastic way to start the day, with patio heaters to compensate for the autumnal chill (not that it was cold!). All in all, the perfect end to our honeymoon in Italy - we have vowed to return for future anniversaries!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: RFX21
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel. Great location a minute from the San Stae water bus stop, away from the main tourist areas. Spotlessly clean, spacious room (in the Annex!) in a beautifully renovated old palazzo. Excellent service in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value in Overpriced Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in September at this hotel. We loved the location, it's in a quiet area but still close to all the major sights. Rialto is only 5 minutes walk and St. Marks Square around 10 minutes walk. Breakfast is plentiful and the croissants are delicious! We stayed in Room 7 (standard double room) which was small but all that was available when we booked. While the room was small the high ceilings gave it a more airy feeling and the rooms are beautifully decorated and extremely clean. We would highly recommend this hotel and found it was excellent value for money in an overpriced Venice. The courtyard is an oasis to come back to in the evenings for a quiet glass of wine and to reminisce on all the days events. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: terrymh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel post cruise based on excellent reviews on various sites. Cant speak highly enough. It was quaint,charming and the staff wonderful. We arrived at 0930 and were invited to leave our cases until our room was ready, we were also offered breakfast on checkin day. We had to leave early for our flight and the staff were most concerned that we would leave without breakfast and insisted on preparing us something Would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tasha47
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. The room was great, the staff was very friendly and helpful and we loved the location. It's located a bit further from the main sites which turned out to be one of the things we loved about it. When in Venice, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best !”
Reviews.Author: lula58
Reviews.Content: Everything has already been said but this hotel is superb. The rooms are large, and tastefully decorated in Venetian fashion. The bed was king-sized and very comfortable. (firm) The bathroom was the cleanest I have ever seen....absolutely spotless. The staff (Sandro, Walter, and others) were so very friendly and helpful. They even insisted on breakfast when we were leaving before breakfast was due to be served. (Warm, wonderful croissants) The best American coffee we had in Europe, I might add. The location is perfect. So close to the vaporatto.. I will not stay anywhere else in Venice. The price is so reasonable for such a perfect little place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Very Friendly & Helpful - Would Definately Return”
Reviews.Author: Squeeky8
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Venice for his 40th and wanted to stay in a traditional hotel. I chose Al Ponte Mocenigo because of the excellent reviews it has on trip advisor and we were definately not disappointed. This is a lovely hotel - we actually stayed in 3 different rooms, my favourite was room 6. All the rooms are gorgeous with lovely en-suite's, high ceilings and lovely decorated furniture. The breakfast is great and so are the waitresses, nothing was too much trouble and their english was very good. Sandro and his staff are very helpful. I would recommend for the ladies that you take a hairdryer - there is one in the bathroom but it is not a traditional one and caused me some bad hair days!!! But just to have one of any type was good..... We went over to the islands of Murano and Burano and I would recommend this, we saw them sculpting a horse in the Murano glass factory which was amazing and Burano is so pretty and colourful. We did pop to the Lido but didn't really like it - it was busy and the beach was segregated, it just did not appeal to us. Venice is gorgeous the architecture is amazing and all the bridges are awesome. You can get various tickets for the vaparettos (water buses), we did get a 12 hour pass when we visited the islands, but apart from that we walked everywhere, the hotel is quite central and rialto bridge was only about 20 mins stroll and the fish market about 10mins - this is well worth a visit! I'd had a knee operation in August and managed the walking ok . There is a coffee shop just up the canal from the hotel but we got ripped off and he charged us double because we sat outside - suprisingly we didn't go back there! Food was lovely, the wine was good too - and the ice cream........need I say more..! I hope that you enjoy your trip as much as we did. We were there tues - sat and this was long enough to see all the sights. We will be back - maybe for my next big birthday!! Thanks Sandro and everyone for making our trip so special, Linda & Antony xx

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, English speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: mamarosa1954
Reviews.Content: I made reservations in early March for 2 nights, September 7&8, 2009. We added a 3rd night 6 weeks later and were told that the main building was booked and we would be put on a waiting list if a room opened in the next 4+months. A reservation was made at that time in the annex for the 3rd night, in addition to the other 2 night in the main building. When we checked in we were told that our 3rd night would be in the annex - there had been no openings to accommodate us. We were given a room on the 1st floor (the 1st floor is like an English basement), by the kitchen for the 2 nights in the main building. The room was small, noise from the kitchen waked us every morning and we went to sleep with the sound of people talking & walking by, next to the small, high window. We packed up our bags in the morning of the 3rd night and we were moved to the annex. In both rooms, the beds are a mattress on top of a plywood base...very hard. With the help of earplugs and Advil we were able to get some sleep. Sandro and Walter could not have been more helpful in suggesting restaurants, and booking tours. We liked the location - off the beaten path. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was about the same as every other hotel we stayed at.The photos show the rooms as a lot grander than they are. I do think the hotel is a good value and the offer a cash discount if you have a Rick Steves book.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: tolistravelers
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and loved the location. People with luggage getting off the water taxi at San Stae--walk to the right side of the church, turn left at the first left which is a minuscule, narrow way that doesn't look like it should be a street (look high up, there is a small brass sign for the hotel) and walk down the little ally to the back door of the hotel (it is marked). You can't get lost as it ends at the canal. If you don't go that way, you have to navigate a few steps up and down at the front entrance and that is not fun with lots of luggage. Charm, charm charm--staff room, servers, rooms etc...all great. Courtyard where breakfast is served is really nice. This hotel is far away from tourist areas (not so far you can't walk to them in 5 min) this is a totally quiet residential area, and wandering and finding shops, restaurants and piazzas where families are gathered is charming and much more interesting than the crowded tourist areas (of course you want to see the tourist sights, but this hotel lets you leave the crowds behind). Everything was total charm here. For those of you who like to go to the beach and find shells, Lido has a ton, and they are beautiful shells.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: Mian82
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews at Tripadvisor we decided to book this hotel for our trip to Venice and we never regret it! The place is excellent, close to Vaporetto stop, within walking distance to main attractions and staff so helpful and kind. We stayed in the new section and our room was beautiful with a small french balcony overlooking the small street outside the hotel. We long to go back again after beeing home only a couple of days and we would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: starward
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! For the money you can't do better. Everyone was very friendly, the rooms were updated and clean, nice breakfast in the courtyard and easy access to transportation. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bouff
Reviews.Content: Having had an offer for some relatively cheap flights last November it was a matter of where to go! Venice was on our list of places we hadn't been to and this seemed like an excellent opportunity. So to TA once again to find the right Hotel! The hotel was booked months in advance which was probably just as well as it is small. All the communication was efficiently and promptly dealt with. We had no problem in locating the Hotel and followed the directions they provided. I think we must have had the smallest room (7). That said there was nothing at all wronmg with it. The bathroom was almost as big! The bathroom was immaculately clean and everything you could have needed was provided. The breakfasts were very good and all the staff were friendly. This is an excellent find in this expensive city; the location is not a problem at all and was relatively peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, fabulous staff and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: beachcomb99
Reviews.Content: I'm just writing a quick review to confirm all the previous ones. There is nothing really to add. The location is great, just a few steps away from gran canal, but still far enough from all the touristy places andvery quiet. The rooms are large enough. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. Having no real experience with other hotels in town i can't really compare, but from what i have been seraching for, it's definitely the best value / money. Do note hesitate, this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: taurus8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our 4 night stay in Venice based on Trip Advisor reviews and certainly was the hidden gem it was reported to be! It exceeded our expectations. We had an absolutely charming room in the 'annex' which was beautifully furnished and very very spacious. The room included a sofa and a small table setting and plenty of spare room. The bed was extremely comfortable (if you like hard beds) and the bathroom was spotless, well appointed with a double sized shower! Breakfast was served in a small but gorgeous little courtyard and those apricot filled croissants for breakfast sure lived up to their reputation! The hotel is less than a minute walk to the San Stae vaporetto stop but Venice is smaller than we thought so walking around was no problem (except for getting lost several times). There are several good restaurants very close to the hotel and each less pricey than those on the Grand Canal. The friendly staff are only too happy to give recommendations and directions. We had great meals at La Mura and at the Osteria Mocenigo (right across from doorway of annex building). Also ate at the nearby La Zucca -great for vegetarian dishes. We really loved and enjoyed our stay at the Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo and would stay there again without hesitation. Will certainly be recommending this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ktimmons
Reviews.Content: We visited London, Paris and Venice. The other hotels were Ok, but this one was Great. I picked this hotel before any of the others because we fell in love with it on the website. After we had been to the other two cities, we were expecting it to be a little less than the website shows. WOW, were we supprised. We stayed in the Double Superior with a Balcony. It was PERFECT. (We sat on the balcony at night drinking our wine and eating goodies from the pastry shops in town while we watched lost people walk by.) It was very roomy with a very big bathroom. The bathroom has a big shower with a towel warmer- so nice! One window overlooks the courtyard. We would wake up to the smell of the fruit filled croissants every morning. Try the blood orange juice, too!! It is delicious! (Just can't seem to find it in small town South Carolina- thought I was going through withdrawl when I got back home). We ate at Nonos, around the corner from the hotel the first night. Had a pizza and a caraffe of Perseco. The pepperoni pizza was spicy and delicious. We were a little tipsy on the way back- that Persecco packs a punch! I wish I could remember all of the restaurants, but honestly we did not eat a bad meal in Venice. We had lost weight from all of the walking in the first two cities we visited, but put it all back on once we were in Venice. I highly recommend this hotel! Follow the suggestions already posted on here about how to get to the hotel. It is easy to find if you go to the back door first! After that, just walk around the city everywhere. We bought a vaporetto pass, but only really used it to get to the other islands and occasionally get home when we walked too far away. The island is really pretty small. They have high speed internet for free upstairs- just ask at the front desk. The front desk staff is exceptional. They will give you maps and suggest restaurants, etc. We talked to Sando and told him we had read on Tripadvisor how good Al Ponte was. He told us he was worried about their high rating, because then people have really high expectations. We don't think he has anything to worry about. They exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's as great as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: USANomad
Reviews.Content: Charming room, very nice people...would definitely stay here again. The bathroom is the cleanest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel; it was absolutely spotless. We really liked the location as well in relation to San Marco and the vaporetto. If you are staying downstairs near the breakfast area you may hear some minor noise around 7am or 8am. Didn't bother us, but if you are a late sleeper you may want to request another room. Fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Book ahead for this wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne09
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and it's as good as what everyone said. The hotel is literally round the corner from San Stae vaporetto station and we had loads of heavy luggage but still managed easily. Room is lovely and clean with a strong shower- they must have made extensive renovations because it's an old building with exposed ceiling beams. Sandro could not have been more helpful and his english is impeccable. S. Croce is a bit away from S. Marco so you get a bit more peace and less touristy feel, yet the hotel is only 5 minutes walk to the Rialto and fish market and about 10-15 minutes to St Marks Square. Would stay there when we go back next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: JonesHouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a couple of days. It was our first stop in Italy so we weren't sure how it compared to other hotels. After traveling to a few more places we discovered just how nice Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is. The breakfast is great, service is fine, rooms are nice and comfortable and the location was wonderful. There's no iron in the rooms and they won't let you use one but they will iron your clothes for a small tip...so not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “venice”
Reviews.Author: RomaNewyork
Reviews.Content: great little hotel two star hotel that gives you five star service located next to the centre we stayed there for a week in august and it was a fantastic little hotel . nice clean

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: AcerLeeds
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon in Italy. It did not dissapoint. The rooms are tastefully decorated and we loved our little balcony facing a small canal. The room was spotlessly clean and the airconditioning was great since it was still quite humid in September. The only minor issue is that there is no iron in the hotel so remember to pack a travel iron! The beds are nice but on the firm side. My wife and I like a firm bed but another couple staying at the hotel commented that the bed was slightly too hard for them. you can use the computer and the Internet for free in the communal area. The best thing about this hotel has to be the service! The owners are very helpful and friendly and everyone working at the hotel seemed cheerful and friendly. It was obvious the staff are treated well here which is a pleasure to see. It's good value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: ssmith9179
Reviews.Content: Steps from the Vapretto stop and walking distance to all of the main sights. The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. We stayed in the anex around the corner from the main hotel. Rooms are good size with modern baths. Will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, well located, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: lordtreefinder
Reviews.Content: Everything just seemed right with our stay here. The staff were all extremely helpful, friendly and accomodating. The place looks great from outside and within, including the rooms. We were admittedly lucky to get a balcony to our room (no. 5) which allowed a lot more light into the room. Breakfasts were really good and served (weather permitting) in the hotel's pretty courtyard (a rarity to have private outside space in Venice from what we could tell). Overall we couldn't fault the place, it's just a shame it doesn't have another star or two!

Reviews.Title: “A truly delightful hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: VALuv2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights prior to and two nights after doing a cruise of the Croatian coast. Hotel is charming, very well located, Staff is very warm, friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: suattulek
Reviews.Content: 27 August 2009, me and my wife, stayed in the new section of Al Ponte Mocenigo, which is in the same building but have an another entrance, for 3 nights. Reception desk and breakfast area are in the hotel. Everything was wonderful. Sandro, Walter and all the other hotel personal are very friendly and helpful. Our room was designed in a very keen fashionable way with the style of classical Venice. Tapestry on the walls a typical wooden beam ceiling. It gives you the feeling of being a real venetian in the Venice. Room includes a superior bathroom, air conditioning and fast wi-fi internet connection. Breakfast is at the main section, in a venetian courtyard. And I must say that the Croissant is delicious. Hotel's location is very good. It's just near to Rialto Bridge, and Vaporetto station is just a few steps away, which makes traveling to every point of Venice very easy. We went there for the Bienalle and we want to go for the latter. From now on, we can't think of any other place to stay rather then Al Ponte Mocenigo. Hope there will be empty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best of B&B styles; Best of Hotel styles...”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasedSoul
Reviews.Content: Almost everything has been said in previous posts I reckon... It's intimate enough for a B&B, but as private and exclusive as a boutique hotel. The 80 cm wide alleyway to get into the place is almost as priceless as the backdoor being a miniscule bridge over a canal. Loved it! Into the hobbit hole we go, to find an auditorium or reds and hosts!!! Rejoice!!! The rooms are impossibly Venetian with 4m high magenta ceilings and modern large bathrooms, and the breakfast is all you could ask for in the 400 year old intimate courtyard. If you love subtle opulance and a place that appreciates being a hidden gem, then you're in a hospitable utopia. However, the overnight attendant was marvellous at providing dead-end Answers; which is never fun when you're an alien on an island. Maybe I was too ambitious to ask the best way to see a glimpse of Da Vinci's work in Venice from someone who didn't seem to care. Nonetheless, at least it made me appreciate that not everyone is related to Da Vinci in North Italy - in fact I may have even found the complete mental polar opposite of the great Da Vinci while gazing into the empty eyes of useless nonchalance. Thankfully, all the day staff redeemed the service in the finest fashion! 9.9 points!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this place is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: SaKi_London
Reviews.Content: Who says Venice is expensive? We paid no more than in Milan, Verona and the Lakes, yet this was easily the best hotel we had, even compared to 4* ones. We stayed for 2 nights with our children (2 and 7) in room 10 which is sold as a suite - it is one gigantic, stylish room with parquet flooring, incredibly high ceilings, a four poster, plush curtains and wall coverings and a brand new luxury bathroom. Including the two extra beds and breakfast in the pretty courtyard (right by the canal with the hotel's own little bridge) we paid â‚¬220 per night which sounds a lot, but most other hotels wanted to sell us two doubles which would have been a lot more. Staff are fab and happy to help you make the most of your stay. We found the location to be just right - easy walking distance from all the key sights and only seconds from the Vaporetti stop, yet far enough from the hubbub to have a bit of piece and quiet after a day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Flapps06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect as a base for our 3 day trip to Venice. The room we had was on the ground floor right by the area where the breakfast is prepared - obviously when we saw this we were a bit concerned! However there was very little noise overnight and only the cappucino machine gave us any real grief in the mornings, and only after 8am. So, this was definitely something we could deal with. The room itself was perfect, I would say it was like that which you would expect in a higher-class hotel, but probably a bit smaller. The bathroom was spotless, and the shower was great. There was no view and in fact the morning light barely broke through the windows. The room could have done with a clock so we could tell it was morning! The staff could not have been more delightful, particurlay the night-porter, who was excellent - friendly and very helpful. The location is great, so easy to find, and perfectly placed for all the sights of Venice. So, if you want a comfortable, friendly hotel but without the "extras" of a bar, pool, gym or lounge, this hotel is for you. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Choice, We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: YaleDad
Reviews.Content: In returning to Venice, my wife and I stressed about finding a hotel for a family of four that was nice enough to match our taste but still minded our budget thanks to the weak dollar and slow US Economy. I turned to TripAdvisor, and it delivered! We compared several hotels and chose Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo over the others. We booked via email with ease, securing a very good rate for Venice that included breakfast. For anyone who wants to sleep a family of four together, you know how hard it is in Venice especially. Look no further! We arrived by vaporetto and rolled our luggage to the back entrance, which is traditional Venice: hidden, close, and just big enough. It really is only 30 meters from the boat stop! Sandro greeted us warmly, checked us in, and took us into the annex to our room with two large windows that overlooked a pretty garden and streamed in moonlight when I opened the curtains during the night. The construction and furnishings are new, the decor classically styled. Our room had a lovely green theme that matches one of the rooms in the Doge's Palace- my children were thrilled at that discovery! In addition to the queen bed, there were two single beds lined up in our room with just enough room for all of us. The room is on par with any major city sizewise- (compact) but these rooms featured beautiful wall coverings, tall ceilings, wooden beams, and murano chandeliers, which equals comfort and luxury at a high level. I was worried about the location being too close to the train station and too far from the attractions we wanted to visit- but it turned out to be ideal and central to the whole city. A five minute walk from the Rialto Bridge, the hotel is literally right next to a wonderful museum, the Palazzo Mocenigo, which is worth a visit for the architecture, costumes, furniture, and paintings, and was a free attraction on our tickets to the Dogeâ€™s Palace. Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo has easy to access all the parts of the city, either by foot or boat. We elected to get 72-hour vaporetto passes and utilized them frequently to tour the city. It is a great bargain. In the past I have always used a water taxi to return to Marco Polo airport traditionally, but not this time at the steep price of 100 Euros. We traveled by bus for ten Euros instead. In addition to a lovely breakfast served in a quiet, quaint environment with great service, I'd be remiss to not thank the additional staff. In addition to Sandro and Walter, the other gentlemen who manned the front desk also knew the vaporetto and bus schedules off the top off their heads, suggested wonderful local restaurants, gave us easy routes to travel, and provided many other details we have not found from 5-star hotel concierges. The waitresses in the morning promptly brought us second cappuccinos, and were the same staff who cleaned the rooms with quiet finesse and perfection. They seem to be long-term employees who are treated by management with the same kindness afforded to guests. It's a rare thing to find a wonderful hotel that treats you better than family, with all the touches of a luxurious home, in a private setting. I can't wait to return. I agree with several previous reviews that claim this hotel is under-rated. It truly deserves four to four and a half stars. We had excellent service on many levels, enjoyed great comfort, and loved the luxury of the room, furnishings, and bathroom. I am telling everyone I know who visits Venice about this hotel, because the great prices can't last forever. Perhaps they are much higher during Carnevale, but we had an excellent value, and we could not have enjoyed the hotel any more. Like Venice, the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo must be personally experienced to truly be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ragingragnar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first point on our honeymoon and couldn't have chosen better. We arrived late and were cheerfully greeted and shown to our superior room where a bottle of Prosecco and a bunch of flowers awaited us. These were from my colleagues but the hotel had arranged it all. So a great start! Our room was lovely, in an art deco style with exposed beams and a cosy bathroom. Breakfast in the pretty little courtyard was nice and fresh with waitress service. The location of the hotel is perfect, being just by a vaporetto stop (San Stae) and just a short walk to nice squares and the Rialto bridge. They also offer free internet - very rare for a hotel! I paid â‚¬168 per night which felt expensive but that is the going rate for anything nice in Venice. I can't believe this hotel is somehow a 2*. It shows that the rating system is flawed as it does not seemingly rate character and atmosphere, instead adding a star for the presence of a Corby trouser press?! So I strongly recommend this hotel and I would definitely consider coming back next time I am in Venice. My top tip for Venice - get off the main tourist streets! Just one or two streets back and you'll have Venice almost to yourself. So much prettier than the the areas thronged with tourists. The Cannareggio area North of the Grand Canal is particularly good for losing crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Charlie-Jos
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem and lived up to all expectations. We had the ground floor room overlooking the courtyard where an ample breakfast was served. Very nice comfortable room with plenty of space. We travelled from Lido de Jesolo for a two night stay. The only recommendation I would make is use the vaperetto to get from St Marks to the hotel. Its not far to walk but finding your way through the tourist hotspots on a hot day with bags is not fun and the hotel is literally a 50 metre walk from the San Stae stop. Once at the hotel its a five minute walk back to the Rialto and 20 minutes to St Marks when its quiet. Leave visiting the Rialto and St Marks until after 4pm when all the day trippers have left. The Doge Palace is very quiet at this time and is much more enjoyable. Use you visit to get off the tourist routes and head towards Academia , its a very pleasant enjoyable stroll through some lovely piazzas. Then once you have finished your walk take the vaparetto all the way from St Marks up the Grand Canal to the hotel. One stop is the same price as ten stops so a cruise up the Grand Canal is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: DASP
Reviews.Content: Just had a 2 night stay here and can honestly say it was just lovely. I think we had the smallest room in the hotel (and therefore the smallest bathroom) but it was still a really beautiful room. Whatâ€™s that old saying? â€œSmall, but perfectly formedâ€�? Well, that was our room. Still beautifully decorated and very cosy. The only other negative thing I want to mention is that our room came off the main reception area (and right next to the back door and the foot of the staircase) so you could hear quite clearly voices and other noises outside the room. Other than that though, everything else was great. The staff were so friendly and helpful with some great suggestions for dinner (try Mura â€“ great pasta & wine!) They were also so helpful when we had some problems logging on to the (free) internet in our room. They sorted it out for us and it was no problem for them (really appreciated that). The breakfast in the gorgeous courtyard was very nice too. Not too much or too fancy but the food is good quality and certainly enough to keep you going. The coffee is really great and again the staff are very attentive and always there when you need anything. Youâ€™re only a short walk to all the action, and if you have difficult or heavy luggage, I would recommend taking the alternative route (to the back door). The directions given by the hotel are very accurate, so follow their directions and youâ€™ll be fine. I would definitely stay here again in the futureâ€¦.but I would just book a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel from entire Italy honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: grendain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in four different hotels during our travels across Italy--this was hands down the best! The room offered traditional Venetian decor and the bed and bathroom were excellent. Breakfast was above average for the free Italian hotel breakfasts, but the best part was eating outside on a beautiful patio. The staff went above and beyond to make recommendations for places to eat and other sight seeing suggestions. Booked through the hotel website with no problems. Look no further--this is your hotel in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel, away from the tourists. Anne Aitken, Southport”
Reviews.Author: AnneAitken
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel in May after reading reviews on Tripadviser. The owners, Sandro and Walter and all the staff were friendly and helpful. We arrived late on our first night as there had been a thunderstorm and the plane could not land. The young man at reception asked us if we had eaten and immediately asked the restaurant opposite if they could cook us a meal. We had breakfast in the delightful courtyard each morning. The hotel is situated in a pleasant area away from the tourists, where the locals live. Also good restaurants nearby Look forward to visiting this hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2MB2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights during a recent family trip to Italy and we could not have asked for a better start to our trip!!! We stayed in a beautiful room in the Annex which was lovely and clean and very quiet. There were three of us (including my 10 year old son) and the room was spacious and well set up for a family with a very clean bathroom and comfortable beds. It was very accessible from the train station (three short vaporetto stops) and in a lovely, quiet part of the city which made for a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the Rialto and Piazza San Marco crowds. We walked all over Venice from our hotel, only using the vaporetto for luggage transport and a night ride to see the city lights and the desk staff were extremely helpful in recommending a number of wonderful local restaurants. The breakfasts (included in the room rate) were delicious and served on a beautiful, quiet terrace.We loved our stay in Venice and it was made that much more memorable by our stay in this beautiful hotel!!! We will definitely stay in this hotel when we return to Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Scubamom33
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels we stayed in on our 3 week trip to Italy, this was the most expensive - but then again, everything in Venice costs more. The quad room (the red room on the main floor - photos are on the hotel's website) was huge, with a large King bed and two twin beds for our teenage sons. very comfortable pillows but typically hard beds.The bathroom was also quite large and looked to be recently unpgraded with new tile and fixtures. The breakfast offered in their little courtyard was very basic...cold cereal, yogurt, pastry, fruit, coffee and juice - and for the price, it would have been nice to have been offerered something hot (ham and eggs or toast for example) - but the garden courtyard setting was very pleasant. The Ponte Al Mocenigo is really tucked away and yes, you will never find it in the dark, but the directions emailed to me by Walter and Sandro, the proprietors, made it very easy to find and only 2 minutes walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop. The staff was also very helpful in recommending restaurants and providing directions on how to reach the cruise ship port.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: HuskerTraveler99
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed in on our trip through Italy. The staff was extremely helpful and the rooms were spacious, clean and charming. The large private bathrooms were a great comfort after a long day of exploring. Breakfast on the patio was a great way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “It feels like home.....”
Reviews.Author: Maddie22
Reviews.Content: I am about to visit this hotel in October for the third time...to me it feels like I am going home. Sandro and Walter offer a hotel experienced that will never be found any where else, in a city that is breath takingly beautiful, they are to be congratulated. Location, elegance, comfort, spaciousness, friendliness of staff as well as their unsurpassed hospitaility means that I will always find an excuse to visit, the only problem is I live a 24 hour plane flight away....oh well !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Traditional charm and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Senior McK.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Al Ponte Mocenigo from the 3rd to the 7th June and were not disappointed. We had pre-booked from New Zealand after having read the positive reviews in Tripadvisor and our emails were responded to promptly. On arrival at Santa Lucia station, we bought a 48-hour ACTV tourist travel card for 28 euros each, which was far cheaper than buying the standard one-way fare of 6.50 euros per person. From here, it was a short vaporetto ride (#1) down the Grand Canal to San Stae (third stop). On arrival and unknowingly, we chose the more difficult route to the hotel (difficult in the sense that we were lugging two relatively heavy cases). From the vaporetto stop, we walked left in front of the church, crossed the bridge (with its steps), then turning right, walked about 30 meters along Fondamenta Rimpetto to the private bridge (more steps) that leads to the hotel entrance with its stunning little courtyard. The easier way, for those with luggage, is to walk straight ahead from the vaporetto stop, then take the first calle left and ring the bell at Number 1984/b, the hotel's secondary entrance. Sandro welcomed us warmly, then took us around to the Annex (a new addition, but decorated in the same style as the main hotel) just around the corner. To gain entry later on, you ring the bell, which is connected to reception and they check your identity visually before opening that door; a very secure system.Our room was up two short flights of stairs, next to a small lobby with a bureau, on top of which were travel books and other reading materials. The room was spacious, having a high stud with exposed beams, a large Murano chandelier and olive-green fabric walls.The only drawback was that the room was slightly underlit, even with the side lamps on. The bathroom, in green and gold marble, and tile, could only be described as well-appointed luxury. Breakfasts (described in detail elsewhere) were always a treat with great cappucino served by the friendly and attentive female staff in a pleasant courtyard with its columns, pedestals, statues and floral arrangements. After having walked and/or taken the vaporetto to Piazza San Marco, we were so pleased to have chosen this hotel as a base; no hassle with luggage on a crowded vaporetto and no traipsing over cobblestones in the Piazza SM, struggling with luggage through crowds of sightseers, which unfortunately was too common a sight. Another advantage of the hotel's position was that it was close to the Cannaregio area with a great Billa supermarket, wine bars and restaurants. To get there, we crossed the canal to the next vaporetto stop (Vap.#1 in direction of San Marco) to Ca'd'Oro, then walking straight ahead to Strada Nova, turned left there, and along over a bridge to the supermarket (on the right at Cannaregio 3659) with its freshly baked bread rolls, meats, cheeses, cheap beers and other provisions. The hotel has details of recommended restaurants etc. From San Stae we took the Vap.#1 to nearby San Toma for the two great, not-to-missed 'art treasuries,' the Basilica Santa Maria dei Frari and the Scuola Grande di San Rocco. Also within walking distance are the wonderful Rialto fish, fruit and vegetable markets and the iconic and very crowded Rialto Bridge. Finally, we have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, based on our own experience there. Sandro and Walter are excellent, informative and engaging hosts, and the hotel itself deserves the plaudits it receives.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, central location, but no view.”
Reviews.Author: kurtedjohn
Reviews.Content: You would never find this place if you did not have specific directions. It is not in a tourist area, (except Venice is not that big and everywhere is a tourist area.) We stayed in a very nice room that appeared to be fairly new (the room was new, the building was old). We had a flat screen TV, mini fridge, and great air conditioning. We were a 5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. The breakfast was served in a very pretty little terrace/patio. The staff was great. The price was great. The only thing it lacked was a view of the grand canal - which you can get somewhere else for an additional $100+ Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, quiet retreat just steps from the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: MtnMama
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at the Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo. It was very easy to locate, just a short distance from the San Stae vaporetto stop. And though it's near the Grand Canal, it is truly an oasis of tranquility on a very quiet calle and canal. The main entry to the hotel is through a lovely courtyard, where breakfast is served in summer. The entire hotel staff is helpful and kind. The front desk is staffed around the clock. One of the two owners, Sandro and Walter, works in reception daily. They're both so engaging and friendly, and they're happy to help with anything -- restaurants, concerts, suggestions for excursions into the mountains or surrounding wine regions. The hotel itself is beautifully restored and maintained. Our room had soaring beamed ceilings, damask wall coverings, a Murano chandelier, and lovely furnishings. The large windows overlooked a small canal. The bathroom was sparkling and the quiet air conditioning was welcome at the end of a hot day of exploring. Breakfast was served in the courtyard and was a perfect assortment of breads, fruits, yogurt, cereals and juices. The breakfast staff was kind and cheerful, always ready to bring a second cappuccino. Our stay at Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo was delightful. We love Venice and never seem to tire of it's beautiful little secrets. As long as Sandro and Walter continue to offer their hospitality, we'll choose their hotel when we return.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an oasis of calm only 70 mtrs from the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: pebbles033
Reviews.Content: We travelled in party of eight & stayed at this hotel for three nights during a European vacation. We had booked the hotel because of Trip Advisor reviews & it did not disappoint. The rooms were spacious & clean & the staff could not have been more helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations etc which were all good. Breakfast staff were great also. The courtyard where you have breakfast or pre-dinner drinks perhaps is like an oasis amongst the hustle & bustle of Venice. Overall a very enjoyable stay & we would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a great location & good value in a city which is always reputed to be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: saintnyck
Reviews.Content: A convenient hotel, just three stops on the public vaporetto from the train station, four from the airport stop. The hotel was a fifteen minute walk from the Rialto Bridge with great restaurants near by. We loved Venice because we could take one turn off the main walkway (aka street) and find ourselves alone in a non-tourist area. The hotel is new (re-built from a private home in early 2000's) and breakfast was served in the beautiful courtyard attached. Our favourite spot to visit was the Doge's Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: r12370
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in early June. The service was great! Everyone at the front desk was happy and helpful. One of the owners helped us lug 4 big bags up to our room (and refused a tip!). The room we had (#5) was quite nice and reasonably large for Europe. It had high ceilings and fabric padding on the wall (kept things quiet). The included breakfast in the courtyard was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “SOOOO Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: smurfette9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in the middle of a 17 day trip through Europe and we couldn't have picked a better hotel! We stayed in the annex, which is not in the same building as the hotel itself, but in another building just around the corner. They gave us a superior room for the price of a regular double room, but the catch is that you have to make a 30-second walk from the annex building to the hotel for breakfast. It was so nice to be able to go back to the hotel in the late afternoon for a nap and feel so good about it too, which says a lot as there is a lot to see in Venice. We would definitely go back to this hotel if we were to return to Venice for a visit (though very likely not as Venice is a biggest tourist trap). We didn't have any problems with the walls being too thin.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: SZB27
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my father 60th Birthday, so he can travel to Venice with her wife and my 11 year old step sister. All I can say is that they were so happy there, that I decided to take my husband and my children to visit the hotel next year!!The staff is extraordinary!!! Friendly, helpful, true professionals!!! The room was clean, nice with great decorations, the breakfast so lovely, and the whole place seems so incredible. Thank you for Sandro and Walter beeing such a great hosts!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: godivap
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for our Venice portion of our tour of Italy & we were absolutely head-over-heels for this lovely little hotel. Not only was the room clean, quiet, cool (air conditioning, yay!), and beautifully decorated, but it was a great value! A very nice breakfast was included in the stay & it was served in their pretty little courtyard every morning. It is very easy to get to from the waterbus station and close enough to take a nice walk past many shops and over the Rialto bridge to St. Mark's square. The staff was friendly, helpful and recommended a few wonderful places for us to eat while we were there. We will defintiely book this hotel again if we are able to return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel, walls are thin though!”
Reviews.Author: eacrites
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Venice is a good deal for what you get, a very large room with air conditioning and we had a nice view of a garden out the back of the hotel. The breakfast is also wonderful and the people are very friendly who assist with the breakfast service. The management of the hotel is really friendly and willing to help you get settled in. However, while the hotel touts its sound proof windows and doors, the walls were a bit thin in the new section of the hotel. Also, come prepared with light suitcases (there are no elevators here) and be prepared for a night on a hard bed.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Amelia2
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice early in the morning and walked through its twisty alleys pulling our luggage behind us to find the Hotel Al Ponte Moncenigo. After our all night flight, we were delighted to find that our room was ready early and we could move right in. We stayed for four nights (too few!) and would rank the Hotel Al Ponte Moncenigo up there with our all-time favorite hotels. We had a large (for a city) room for our family of four. Our kids had chairs that converted to beds, which were fine for them, and our bed was very comfortable. The walls and curtains of our room were red and the windows were oddly shaped and set back into the thick walls; we thought perhaps our room had been a kitchen hundreds of years ago. The room was spotlessly clean and quiet. Venice, of course, is unbelievably romantic, and this hotel meshed perfectly with the atmosphere of the city. It was an easy walk to all the sights of Venice and only a minute from a vaporetto stop, but the hotel, itself, is in a low key area of town. It was wonderful to start each day with breakfast in the hotel's beautiful courtyard next to the canal, looking at the flowers and the statues on the walls and listening to birds singing. The breakfast was delicious, with fresh croissants and bread, yummy cheese and fabulous capuccino. The kids had superb hot chocolate each morning. Lots of people have mentioned the staff and how friendly they were. I'd agree, but I'd add that they were never intrusive.
