They were more than willing to answer any of our questions but they weren't overly chatty. In general, my husband and I often try new hotels if we return to places we've visited. However, if we're fortunate enough to return to Venice some day, I wouldn't consider anywhere but the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. I don't write this lightly: it really was about as perfect for us as we could imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: vandnd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our recent tour of Italy. We know Venice and deliberately chose to stay not too close to St Marks. This hotel is perfect; easy to get to from the Airport or train station and their directions are as easy as they look. It's 50m away from the San Stae vaporetto stop. and so you can get round the city easily...follow the hotels advice about vaporetto tickets.The rooms are excellent with quality bathroo. Walter and Sandro and all their staff are endlessly helpful..nothing is too much trouble. This is the Venice hotel you hoped to find and will exceed your expectations. It is ideal if you really want to see the real city,and not just the tourist spots. It deserves it's Trip Advisor place. We thought about telling you which rooms we prefer, but decided against it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Old Venice”
Reviews.Author: Writer_Traveler2
Reviews.Content: A beautifully restored and decorated 15th century palace. Walter and Sandro are wonderful hosts. Wifi in the rooms, charming courtyard, beautiful furnishings. Well located near the San Stae vaporetto stop in a non-touristy area of Venice. I stayed here for 9 very comfortable days and would stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gladrod
Reviews.Content: Just a short review to add to all the other rave reviews. This hotel was perfect for our stay in Venice. Very lovely, and Walter and Sandro were all you could ask for as hosts. Locaation was great, 50 ft from valporetto stop, (the only way to travel in Venice), and 10 min walk to Rialto Bridge. The breakfast and service were top notch. Thank you again Walter and Sandro.

Reviews.Title: “great value little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyjaneWindsor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in hotels all over the world; we were delighted with our stay at this hotel. Of particular note: *Charming and helpful hotel staff on front desk, and serving at breakfast. Chambermaid folded my nightie on bed - you don't get that in most 5 star hotels! *Breakfasts absolutely perfect for us - juice, yoghurt, fresh fruit, meusli, croissants, caffe latte and green tea - served in pretty little courtyard area *Liked the location, off the beaten track, which encorages you to walk through streets and areas you might otherwise miss. Stone's throw from San Stae vaporetto stop. *Room v. quiet *Spotlessly clean *Guide books/maps available at hotel *Note - although we have given 4 stars for 'Room' the hotel offers excellent value for facilities offered (safe/minibar) - it is afterall a 2 star hotel.. Decor style traditional Venetian ornate style - all immaculately clean/maintained. Note - no shampoo provided in room and hairdryer of the 'air-blower' variety Travellers' tips: *Buy a multi-jouney vaporetto pass at airport (3 day pass costs 33 Euro p.p). Price includes bus journey from Airport to Piazzale Roma ( No. 5 takes approx 25 mins) from there take No. 1 vaporetto to San Stae - whole journey took us just 1 hour from chocks-on at airport to check-in at hotel (note - hand baggage only)! *Buy a chorus pass for Euro 8 which will give you access to approx 20 churches that charge up to E3 entrance *Buy a museum pass for Euro 18 (approx) for access to approx 12 museums (Doge's Palazzo museum a must). *If you're on a budget - why bother with gondolas (Euro 80 ish for an hour - only good value if there's 4+ of you) and water taxis from airport (Euro 95 one way)? Take the bus/vaporetto from airport as described above, and hop on/off vaporettos with your multi-journey pass, whilst a good walk through the city will take you through all the backwaters if you wander off the main drags..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuscan72
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel 20min walking from San Mark Square, clean room with all the state of the arts appliances, venation style furniture, very charming

Reviews.Title: “Another 5 star review”
Reviews.Author: lipaustralia
Reviews.Content: Price paid per night: 150 euros Would I stay again for the price? Yes Would I recommend it for the price? Yes, i already have The good: - staff, nothing is too much in terms of questions or guidance...all so friendly - location, we loved being a little away from the hordes near San Marco and walking distance to the bus/train - strong shower and air-con - breakfast on the courtyard is so nice and romantic you want it all to yourself!! - free fast internet if you need it (shared computer) The bad: - if i was to complain about anything it is that the annex (where we stayed) is actually next to a main walking thoroughfare so you do get some 'street' noise We stayed 3 days/2 nights and did not use a boat at all (except for a half-day trip to Murano which requires a ferry)...Venice is a walking 'city' and Al Ponte Mocenigo is close enough to the bus/train stations that unless you have lots of or big bags you can walk to and from it as we did in about 12 minutes. Dinner at La Zucca right nearby is one of the best meals we had in all of Italy...ask the hotel to book for you at least 1 day prior as its always busy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neachell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. About a 15min stroll to San Marco, 10min stroll to Rialto, so quite a good location. The staff are very friendly, and they advised us on where to visit as it was our 1st time in Venice. The breakfast is quite limited but ok. The rooms are very nice, and quite clean. I would definatly stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in the hotel moncenigo in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AurelMunich
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated: in santa croce near rialto (10 minutes walk), 1 minute to the boot station. 20 minutes to plazza by walk or by boot. Lovely decoration of the room. Very new bathroom. Breakfast outside. Very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place to stay in beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: kevoSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We too have little to add to all the great reviews. We selected this Hotel based on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. Because we were at the end of a 6 week tour we had some heavy bags, so we caught a water taxi from the train station to the San Stae vaporetta stop. Then a short walk to the Hotel. We were immediately made to feel very welcome. The gentleman on the desk took our bags around the corner to the Annex where our room was. And what a lovely room. Spacious bedroom with a separate smaller room where the wardrobes were and also a second TV. There was also a divan which could be made into an extra bed. The Annex building has been beautifully restored. Security is excellent. You cannot enter any part of the Hotel until you press a buzzer at the particular door (either to the Annex or to the main part of the Hotel). There is camera mounted above each exterior door and the person on reception can identify you and then remotely open the door. Makes you feel very safe, not that it appears to be an unsafe area. Breakfast was basic but very nice and served in a pretty courtyard. Again, the staff are very friendly. Yes, it is a short walk to Rialto and St Marks Square, but there are so many interesting shops, canals, and buildings on the way that we never rushed. The 2 landmarks are very well signposted virtually from when you leave the Hotel, so hard to get lost. The Hotel does however, have very good maps. It is also worth an early morning look at the nearby fish markets. Our only very minor complaint was that some of the bath towels and bath mats were worn so thin that they were frayed and one actually tore when used. A pity in such a wonderful Hotel. Unfortunately we only had 2 nights in Venice at the end of a 6 week holiday, but cannot wait to return to Venice and of course stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo. We had to travel to the airport when we departed. After considering the various transport options, we decided to book a water taxi from San Stae to the airport because of our very heavy bags and the difficulty of boarding a busy vaporetta with them. The hotel arranged for this. Not cheap but very convenient. At the last moment the Hotel was told that part of the canal may be closed for the visit of a VIP. No problems, Walter arranged for the water taxi to take us part of the way then we were taken by a hire car directly to the airport at no extra cost. It was worth it. When we went to the vaporetta stop for the water taxi, Walter came to our room and helped take our luggage to the stop and waited with us until the water taxi arrived. Just part of the amazing Hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews- a Bostonian's view”
Reviews.Author: edgiana
Reviews.Content: I relied on the hotel reviews, and they were on the money. It sounds more complicated than it is to find the hotel. When you get off the boat at San Stae stop, there is a small plaza in front of the large church that you face. Walk to the right rear side of the church, and there is an alley (3 1/2 feet wide) on your left with a sign up on the wall for the hotel. Walk down the alley 50 feet, and you are there. If you stay at the Annex (we stayed in Room 31 there, quite nice. but up several flights of stairs at the top floor), you don't go down the alley, but keep going and the door to the annex (part of the row buildings) is on the left. Your choice in the annex, is a room overlooking the busy walkway from the boat, or a back room overlooking a garden. We liked hearing the people walking by and looking down the walk toward the water/landing. Room was nice size, very good shower , air control, and the firm beds we like- pillow was a little too firm, but a minor complaint. All the people we dealt with at the desk were friendly, and helpful- they have very nice maps of the city and made reservations for us (even before we arrived, for dinners). The meal at La Zucca (around the corner near the gelateria!!!) was excellent, and very reasonable. We also ate near the Rialto area at Osteria Alle Testiere, a small, friendly, very good food and expensive restaurant. I had read good things about La Vedova (Osteria Ca'D'oro)- don't believe it- it was very limited in the menu, acceptable food at a modest price, but nothing worth seeking out. Most pizzas we had in our Italy stay were very good (even in the tourist areas), and had the thin crispy crust, not the thicker crust that most pizza parlors have in the U.S. Most pastas were also excellent and appeared "homemade". The bread was, by and large, terrible (the bread at La Zucca was good and the best we had in Italy, and we went to several cities after Venice). The gelati was good no matter where we bought it, and is cheaper, by and large, than U.S ice cream cone charges. By the way, all restaurants charged a cover charge (for bread, etc.) but that means you do not have to tip more than a euro or two in addition. House wines are also very cheap (sometimes same price as a coke) and often you can buy a carafe of 1/2 or full liter for under 10 euros. Venice is very walkable, and we did not use a boat/gondola other than coming with luggage, and leaving with luggage. The boat system provides for buying a ticket, or multi-day pass, then validating it at a machine before you get on. Nobody ever checked to see if we had tickets (we had bought the specific trip ticket- I think 6 euros each), so if you want to take a chance, you might get away with it. From the airport, as others mention, you take an inexpensive bus to the western edge of the city, and get the boat from there. There is very good signage on the sides of buildings for the main areas (Rialto, etc.) and it is fun negotiating these very narrow alleys that pass for main pedestrian throughways. Shops selling glass and masks are everywhere, so don't buy until you've had some time to compare prices and items- prices do vary for the same things, depending on the location of the shop. Be prepared for crowds, and a long wait to get into St. Marks, but people watching is enjoyable. We were able, between 9:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. to literally make the circular walk from across the other side of the canal near the Jewish section, clockwise past Rialto to St. Marks, eat lunch, and down to the Peggy Guggenheim Museum (a wonderful and unexpected number of enjoyable modern garden scultures and Yoko Ono's wish tree, among other installations) and back up to the hotel- you just need good walking shoes. There are a number of restaurants that do not take Visa/Mastercard, so bring/get cash with you. The city felt very safe, even late at night, so feel free to stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: GNTLondon
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a visit to Venice with my husband for our wedding anniversary. I booked the Al Ponte Mocenigo on the back of the reviews I read on Tripadvisor and was very happy that I did. The hotel is extremely clean and the staff and very friendly and helpful - they will even iron your clothes for no charge. The hotel is about a 30 second walk from the San Stae vaporetta stop, and a short walk from the Rialto Bridge. It's just far away from the centre to be peaceful yet close enough to be convenient for all the major sites. There are some good restaurants close to the hotel too if you don't want to venture into the touristy parts of an evening The breakfast is good, unless you have a diary allergy; a choice of cereals, bread rolls with soft cheese, yoghurt and fruit. They also only use full fat milk. It a great budget hotel in Venice and I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “great finish to trip”
Reviews.Author: marcell67
Reviews.Content: this is out second time to stay with walter and sando in venice.we brought 2 mature couples with us to spend three weeks in greece and italy. the other couples were a little concerned when we took them down a narrow alley to the hotel. once inside they fell in love with the rooms and staff. rooms are very spacious with great bathrooms.. breakfast is served in outside area that is very private. great hot chocolate and cappuchino. hot croissants , cereal , fruit and rolls. very close to water taxi . most important it is in residential area of venice. we spend first afternoon in local square where we had good meal while watching children play soccer in street. atm machines and local market very close. gelato and bakeries in abundance. on second day a cruise ship brought large numbers of tourist into venice. where we were , you could not notice crowds that descended on st. marks square. hotel in easy walking distance of st marks square and rialto bridge. good shopping near by and the hotel trecommended three nearby restaurents that we used . all three had few tourist and great food. most important is helpful staff who provided good directions and maps. this is one of best hotels in all of italy. this is our third trip and this remains our favorite hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: webby252
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to what other have said. Great staff, nice room (we were in the annexe and it was nice), good location, reasonable breakfast. We would definitely stay here next time we visit Venice. One thing which people might find helpful, if you pay with cash you get a 6% discount so make sure you have enough!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic gem off the beaten pathin Venice!”
Reviews.Author: CAtakemeonatrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after a 12 day Mediterranean cruise that ended in Venice. All the outstanding reviews on Trip Advisor were right on the money. Excellent value, very, very clean public rooms and hotel room, authentic Venitian ambience. We loved the lcoation - in a quiet neighborhood a little ways away from all the commotion of St. Marks or Rialto. We arrived at the hotel with all our luggage at 8 AM since we had to get off the ship early. We were welcomed as if we were staying at someone's home. Our bags were whisked away, we were offered breakfast in the courtyard, and we immediately felt right at home. We enjoyed coffee in the courtyard before setting off to explore Venice. When we returned late in the afternoon our bags were in our room waiting for us. Our room was very large - we were in room #10 - a Jr. Suite. Very, very happy with the room and bathroom. Very comfortable bed too. This hotel is an excellent value for the price. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot to immerse yourself in the atmosphere of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bombur
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and would have liked it to be longer. Our room had a small balcony on a small canal which was perfect for sitting in the evening. We were in a neighborhood, not a tourist area and it was relaxed and comfortable, but also convenient. I had copied the directions from this column and they were perfect - come out of the railroad station - head for the vaporatta stop to your right - take #1 to the San Stae stop (I think it was the third stop) - walk straight off the boat about 200 feet - look up to the left for a TINY sign, and turn left into a TINY alley (about a meter wide) and the hotel door is about 40 feet down the alley, on your right, well signed, with a buzzer , just push the button(you're on a video camera) and they will let you in. There is no elevator, but our bags were carried up the one flight to our room. A nice breakfast was served in the courtyard, which is full of an eclectic collection of antiques (sculptures, etc.). The staff was extremely helpful and the whole atmosphere was extremely comfortable, but very professional. We had a sparkling bathroom - roomy and well supplied with a great tub/shower - super water pressure (happens to be important to us). We also really appreciated the extremely low priced items in the mini-bar - something we normally don't use, but had no hesitation here because it was so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: 2tavs
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a trip to Italy and the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo was the hotel we stayed in while in Venice. I booked the hotel largely based on the good reviews it has received on Trip Advisor and was very glad I did. Our room was clean and spacious - no view to speak of , but wasn't really expecting one. It was convenient to a vaporetto stop and all the sites. What really makes this hotel so good is the very professional staff, always willing to answer questions and help in any way. Breakfast in the courtyard is delightful - again, thanks to the wonderful ladies who greet you with a smile and a delicious cappucino!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for! Romantic Venitian Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MussiLou
Reviews.Content: I actually squealed with delight when the owner Walter opened the door to our hotel room! I had researched for months the place that me and my partner would stay in Venice & this exceeded my expectations! We arrived by private water taxi to the hotel doors & Walter was there to help us with our bags! All the staff were so friendly and helpful & I honestly can NOT believe that Al Ponte Mocenigo only has 2 stars! This was the highlight of my holiday! Only a short walk from the Rialto Bridge and further on is St Marco's square. They have maps at reception to assist you with the maze of Venice streets! Was even more happy with my choice of Mocenigo after venturing into the centre of Venice as this hotel is in a peaceful tranquil area away from the hustle and bustle of the centre. Breakfast served every morning in the beautiful courtyard. Lots of choice: cereals, fruit, yogurt, freshly baked rolls and croissants, coffee, juice! Even with the courtyard full at breakfast this place feels intimate (unlike big hotels). I do not mean to sound over the top, but this really is a hidden jewel in Venice that should not be missed! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Fudge83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for our Honeymoon. It was PERFECT. Everything about this superb, intimate, friendly hotel was outstanding, The Staff were extremely friendly. The location was great - just minutes from The Rialto Bridge. I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing and enjoyable Italian break in a beautiful city. We hope to go back and stay next year! Thank you to everyone who made our stay so speacial.

Reviews.Title: “A great 2 night stay at a quaint boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruisingjohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights prior to our cruise. Had room # 1 on the first night & # 22 in the annex the 2nd night. We booked a little late in the game, thus the reason we could not get the same room for both nights, but Walter & Sandro took care of moving our belongings while we were out and about. Rooms were very nice, more than adequate with great bathrooms. Convenient to the Vaporetto and also to the main sights. Great restaurant Il nono(I think) nearby. The included breakfast was a perfect start to the day. Would stay here again without hesitation on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMurray
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves the great reviews and awards it has received. Our room was tastefully decorated, sympathetically furnished, spotlessly clean, spacious and very comfortable. When I woke up in the morning and looked around I felt like I was in Venice. The bathroom was, again, spotless. A large shower enclosure with shower head the size of a dinner plate. The staff are welcoming, professional and helpful . Breakfast in the courtyard was a great way to start the day. The location was perfect for us. Steps away from a vaporetta stop and peaceful yet only a ten minute walk or so from the main areas. Several very good restaurants a few minutes walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel and very much hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Tiggy Posted by a Luxury Link traveler
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little hotel - great location, close enough to the canal and the San Stae vaparetto stop, but it's quiet and peaceful too. Walter and Sandro and all of their staff - Donatello and Carlito - are so warm and accomodating. The rooms are wonderful - mine had a balcony and was very spacious ...with a bathtub no less! (both anomolies for Italian hotels). Every day was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent basecamp for exploring the winding streets of Venice”
Reviews.Author: MinnTravelingCouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights based mainly on feedback of others on this website. The stay preceeded a 7 night cruise leaving from Venice. Took a water taxi from Marco Polo airport straight to the "water door" at the hotel. Expensive (95 Euros one way) but most convenient after long travel day from the US. Slightly less pricey alternatives are there, but with lots of luggage, the savings didn't justify the hassle. A room was ready so we were checked in around Noon and off to explore Venice a bit before we crashed and burned from travel fatigue. This 10 room hotel was converted from a large single family home about 4-5 years ago. Our room had a 2 large windows and was on the canal side. We had to lean out a bit to look down to see the canal, but we were out exploring most of the time, so the view didn't matter much to us. The room was large enough (king sized bed, loveseat, small table with 2 chairs, a large armoire, and a small refrig/minibar. Floors were a nice hardwood. We thought the walls were wallpapered, but they were treated with a hanging fabric. Very cool and classy. Our bathroom was bigger and more modern than I expected. As I recall, there are 5 rooms on each of the 2 stories. We were upstairs, which seemed better than the rooms on the main floor which opened right onto the lobby and small coffee/bar area. The place is very secure with a locked gate out the canalside door, and a locked door if you leave on the street side (wow, what a narrow alley leading to this door!! Barely wider then my shoulders.) Someone is at the desk all the time. You'll get valuable exploring tips from any of them (Co-owners Sandro and Walter, or Donatello, or the night man who's name escapes me at the moment.) I can't say enough about the entire staff including the ladies who staff the morning breakfast bar area. The place is clean, safe, right in the heart of Venice, competitively priced, and you'll have a better, more personalized Venice experience here than at some big brand named hotel. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Oldriska
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, absolutely no complains. We stayed for four nights in April 2009 in the Annex, room 34. A quiet, spacious room, great bathtub. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Purple_Monkey_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo for the first three nights of our honeymoon. The entrance to the hotel is off a private bridge, which is a very short walk from San Stae Vaparetto stop. The area feels safe and is surprisingly quiet for the centre of a touristy city. We stayed in Room 1, which was beautifully decorated and had an immaculate bathroom. The only downside to this room is that it's right next to the reception, so we did occasionally hear some talking. There were a few different members of staff during our stay, but all were very friendly, spoke good English, and were pleasantly unobtrusive. Breakfast was really nice and definitely big enough for us: cereals, pastries, rolls, fruit, yoghurt, real coffee, tea, fresh juice. We did wonder whether the milk was long-life, which put my husband off a bit, but it wasn't an issue for me. The location of the hotel is perfect. We walked everywhere, yet the area felt off the beaten track. There were some lovely restaurants nearby, and I'd definitely recommend these over the touristy places on the Grand Canal. Overall, it was the perfect start to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel- we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: janeavril
Reviews.Content: Our stay here had its pros and cons- more pros than cons, however. We stayed in the Annex, which was very nice and very quiet. We had to buzz the front desk to get in the building, which was a nice security feature. The room was nicely decorated and clean- actually it was two rooms, a bedroom and a sitting room, so it was very spacious. The bathroom was small but not uncomfortable. The staff was very helpful- any time we asked them for dinner suggestions or for the best way to get to the airport, whoever was at the desk was quick to help us. Breakfast was great- the outdoor courtyard was lovely and the food was excellent. I loved the filled croissants and the cappuccino. The only real con we had were that for one, the bed was really hard and slightly uncomfortable for us. It didn't stop us from zonking out each night, however. The location was both a pro and a con. Pro- it was a little out of the way so you do get a little bit more of a taste of "real" Venice, as opposed to the crowds upon crowds at St. Marks and Rialto. Plus La Zucca was right around the corner (suggested by the front desk) and I had the best lasagna of my life. The hotel is right down from a vaporetto stop, so it was easy to get on and off, as long as you take the slow #1 boat. Con- I usually prefer to be a little closer to the action. Most of the time I prefer to walk to get to things, and a walk to Rialto was probably 15 minutes at the height of the crowds, St. Marks was probably 20 minutes. Venice is a maze, so it was sometimes a little stressful getting back to the hotel, especially at night when the alleys and streets are more deserted. I think next time I might want to try a hotel closer to the main sights. One other thing- if you can, go out for a walk around late at night. We went out for a last-ditch effort to get in a gondola ride after the rain stopped on our last night at almost midnight. The streets were deserted. There were probably seven people on the Rialto Bridge, and probably 25 in St. Marks Square. It was really wonderful to seem to have the city to ourselves. Venice is extremely romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: B0ST0Ntrvler
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. First off, when they say the entrance is on a little alley on the left once you get off the vaparetto, it is definitely a little alley on the left. The room was very clean and bright. The bathroom was also in great condition and looked like it was redone recently. The staff at the front desk and for breakfast were also very friendly and helpful. As far as location, it is in complete walking distance of just about everything in Venice but far enough away from the major crowds. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: ernestovelasco
Reviews.Content: We went on spring vacations to venice and made reservations via internet. They contacted us because the old area was full and gave us the option to switch to the new bulding: a newly refurbished palace. We accepted and i am glad we did! The architectural interventions is very good and the rooms are decorated in a tasteful venetial style. although not very big, the room had a reception (or second beed room) with tv, the actual room and a new bathroom. all very confortable. The location of the hotel is extreamely good: just half a block from a vaporetto station on the Grand Canal. Very conviniento arrive from the train station and to take line 1 towards San MAarks Square. The owners are very good hosts and were very helpful. This is a good value opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: senic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved every minute. The hotel and staff are exactly as described so many times. We have never stayed in a hotel that was quite so clean and the staff so willing to please. It is a real credit to the owners and the staff. We arrived at the airport and took the bus to the Piazzale Roma bus terminal. There is a ticket machine in the airport terminal (3euros). it is worth the 6.5euros to take the water bus to San Stae. Although it is only 4 stops and only takes a few minutes, until you get your bearings it will save a long walk. We bought a vaporetto day ticket (16 euros for 12 hours) and visited Murano which was very worthwhile. A trip down the lenght of the Grand Canal at night was quite wonderful. A couple of words of caution, don't buy from the street hawkers most of what they sell is a con. Also if you buy a bus ticket to the airport to travel by road, do say so as they will sell you a water bus ticket which you can't use. We were caught as were several others on our bus. We found Venice a wonderful city. Even though we had read about its art and architecture actually being there was infinately better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - no secret now but glad we found out!”
Reviews.Author: KitandL
Reviews.Content: As mentioned, Becca in previous review put it brilliantly. We arrived in early hours due to plane delay etc but were greeted warmly & our bags carried (bless him!) round to beautiful clean annexe room. The whole hotel is lovely - all the staff (especially Donatello who we saw most) v.helpful & friendly and didn't laugh at our silly questions!. The hotel really is about 5-10 mins easy walk to the Rialto & not much more to St.Marks and it's a super walk which may take you longer as you stop on bridges & just keep gazing. The breakfast is fresh & ample to set you up. The vaparetto stop is at the end of the street but it is so quick & great to walk that there is no need to take it, honestly. We also ate at La Zucca round the corner (delicious & reasonable!) & it's also worth stopping for a drink & snack at Paulo's Piccolo bar opposite, tasty snacks & a chance to watch the world go by. It was our 1st. time & in Venice & we will go back & definitely stay here, wouldn't worry about looking for anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as expected”
Reviews.Author: cmiskelly
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four days at Al Ponte Mocenigo and really have nothing to add to other previous reviews except to agree with all the postiive things already said. We receieved a warm welcome and all the help we needed for a first time trip to Venice. We loved the situation, so near to the Grand Canal yet so quiet. Breakfasts were excellent and we never felt rushed. We ate twice at La Zucca round the corner and this was excellent both times. I had the vegetarian platter which was lovely. One small comment is that we found the bed and pillows very hard the first night. We got used to this, and after days of walking were so exhausted that we slept easily. Perhaps Italians like harder pillows than we soft Brits!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay (again!)”
Reviews.Author: bevldavies
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo. We stayed there for our wedding in Venice in 2008 and returned for our first anniversary in 2009. Everything about the hotel lived up to our expectations, the rooms, the breakfasts but most of all the friendly and incredibly helpful staff. Walter and Sandro are the best hosts but they also have a team of wonderful staff who go out of their way to make sure that their guests are looked after and happy. Not something we have ever experienced in big hotels. We were welcomed back as friends by everyone and we can't imagine staying anywhere else in Venice. The Trip Advisor awards displayed on the reception desk are very well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, cosy comfort”
Reviews.Author: TeZela
Reviews.Content: I did it. I went to Venice. I finally treated myself, well I had to find some way to ease the trauma of turning 40!!!! However, Venice did more than that and I didn't want to leave. It was utterly beautiful and surprising, especially when I got my backside groped on a Vaporetto, a bonus at my age â€¦ :o) I read and researched so many hotels via Trip Advisor and finally decided on Al Ponte Mocenigo and am very glad I did. All the photos portray the hotel exactly as it is and everyone is right, it was positively lovely, spotlessly clean and the staff brilliant. It's incredibly easy to find, get off Vaporetto stop San Stae, walk straight ahead and look up a little to your left. Yes the sign is a wee bit small but that just adds to the fun of it all. The alley way is one person wide, brilliant and the hotel is next to a home that provides singing lessons. Quite amusing to listen to the warblings of would be singers, but don't worry it was not at all disturbing in any way. We had room 9, the red room. In the photos it looks a wee bit overwhelming but in reality it's grand. When I lay to sleep I felt like I was in a castle with the extremely high and can I just add here, very clean ceiling, with its wooden beams. Very lovely. Will say also, donâ€™t expect any views in No. 9, but who needs them with all of Venice to explore. My only real gripe, the beds. My friend and I shared a room and when one is use to a king size bed, to suddenly find you are down to a wee 3 footer, if that. Oh my.. once or twice I nearly rolled right off. The floors are all wibbly, wobbly in the old buildings as well and my bed on a wee slant. It was interesting to say the least, but I learnt to sleep uphill, so all was good in the end. One thing I didn't read about in any of the reviews, so I will add it here. Is the â€˜Swayingâ€™. After travelling about a bit on water, you suddenly find yourself in bed, on the wibbly, wobbly floor, trying to sleep and suddenly itâ€™s all moving, bit like tripping I guess without the drugsâ€¦ Brilliant!!! (Joking!!!) :o) But no, I found it really got to me and by my last day I was stood in a shop thinking is it me moving or the shop, most bizarre. It even stayed with me for a day or two when I got back home. So for anyone without sea legs, be warned. Anyway, back to the hotel. It is simply lovely and delightful, oldie worldy and veritably Venice. Dishy Sandro greeted us when we arrived and was warm and friendly with good English. It was quiet and cosy and he helped us with our luggage and explained the room and breakfast and helped with directions and restaurants and just about anything else I am sure. He was most accommodating however, when I, like a donkey forgot to reset my clock and we promptly arrived for breakfast at what I thought was 9.30am but was in fact 10.30am. The shocked looked on my face was obvious and the lovely ladies who do breakfast, got everything out again to feed us. Sandro laughed but probably thought, what strange people these English are. Donatello another lovely person was also very chatty and helpful, as was everyone else, but we didnâ€™t get all their names. I truly would recommend this hotel. Granted different people can have different experiences, but for us it was quiet, clean and lovely. The staff were so lovely (did I say that already) and it showed they enjoyed working there. The ladies that do breakfast were like your favourite Aunty who spoilt you. Oh and their Hot Chocolate is very yummy. So if like me you dither with decisionsâ€¦ Donâ€™t, just go. Take your very best comfy walking shoes and get exploring. Oh and two more things, learn some Italian. Donâ€™t rely on them speaking English. I learnt some basics, very easy, but every time I did ask â€˜parla inglese?â€™ I was greeted with umm small, not muchâ€¦ Do some research into restaurants, everything is very expensive in Venice but we found some good restaurants and one not so good. And lastly (canâ€™t you tell I fell in love with Venice) donâ€™t stick to the tourist areas, wander, go and explore around every corner there is a new view and pretty courtyard, beautiful, romantic buildings and friendly people. Oh and on wash day you walk down tiny lanes with the smell of â€˜Comfortâ€™ in the air. If like us you are staying a few days, venture out of Venice too. We took the train to Verona, well worth a visit, if only to grasp the left breast of Juliet and wish for love. Bon Voyage :o)

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Gottx
Reviews.Content: We've just arrived home from a three-night trip to Venice, where we stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. We booked the hotel on the strength of the reviews on TA, and guess what, they're all spot on, as the hotel was lovely. I can't really add more than the review below (Becca from Seattle in case it's not the one below by the time this gets added!) as she really does sum it all up. From start to finish all the hotel staff were unfailingly polite, helpful and charming, and our room (a triple located in the annex) spotlessly clean. We were even lucky enough with the weather to be able to eat breakfast in the courtyard for a couple of mornings, which was fantastic. Reception staff gave us some great advice on where to eat (La Zucca) and drink, provided us with maps and public transport information, and the ladies at breakfast helped us with our Italian with good grace and humour! I would walk back to this hotel tomorrow if they would have me.

Reviews.Title: “Looked forward to breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Easygoing_Traveler01
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel has a wonderful breakfast staff that adds even more warmth to an already welcoming stay. The "red room" was exceptionally clean and roomy for three, even with an extra bed. We have been to Venice before, and found the location to be quite fine. It entices one to explore and see more of Venice, and if you have ever stayed near the tourist areas you will definitely appreciate its quiet location. An exceptionally convenient vaporetto stop makes it even better! We followed a suggestion from the front desk and attended an opera performance at a 16th century palazzo on the Grand Canal - what a great recommendation!! It was all made very convenient for us, and proved to be an evening we will never forget!!! Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo provides charming Venetian style with good value in this otherwise very expensive city. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankandMabel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this quite, friendly hotel. We paid extra for a bigger room with a small balcony (#10) overlooking the hotel courtyard. Everything about the room and bathroom was clean, well appointed and worth the extra. The staff were very welcoming and nothing was any trouble for them to tell you or find out. The breakfast was simple but adequate and again, the breakfast staff were lovely. Highly recommended if you want to stay in a quiet, small hotel in the San Croce area - very convenient for all the attractions with the owner recommending less touristy restaurants in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookingforlife
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. A little out of the way, but this is a good thing in Venice. All the main sites - Rialto and San Marco were within a half hour or you could take the vaporetto from the Sta Ste stop a few steps from the hotel. The room was lovely, with the most beautiful furnishings and the breakfast excellent with freshly made espresso on request. It was expensive but everything worked and the bed was very comfortable so it was excellent value in the Venetian context.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: fun_food_wine
Reviews.Content: I found the reviews on trip advisor to be spot on. Friendly and helpful staff, clean comfortable hotel with rooms a bit larger than what we had been used to in Europe. We stayed in the anex which was very nice but I can see how some might not like the fact that you are not located directly in the main hotel and have to walk down the alley to get into the main building. Hotel location was a big plus being located 1 block from the San Stre water bus stop as we saw many a traveler lugging suitcases through the busy streets during our sightseeing trips (we were glad not to be one of them). All the main sights were with in a 10 minute walk (unless you take a wrong turn) and those at the desk were found to be very helpful with directions, marking places on the map, making recommendations for dinner as well as reservations. We had a great experience at the hotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VeniceloverYork
Reviews.Content: We have just spent six nights at this wonderful small hotel. It is two minutes from San Stae vaparetto stop, as well as being in a perfect position to explore the city by foot. It is quietly situated with a number of excellent restaurants within a five or ten minute stroll. We had two beautifully furnished rooms in the annex (30 seconds from the main hotel entrance) which were well laid out and spotlessly clean. Sandro and Walter and their staff (including Donatello) were very hospitable and unfailingly helpful in dealing with our numerous requests for information. Breakfast (which is served in the very pretty courtyard in warmer weather) was good and plentiful and served by very friendly staff. Excellent standards of hospitality and cleanliness as well as value for money are the hallmarks of this delightful, unpretentious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: airspeed_69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my wife and enjoyed it very much. This was my first time in Venice and would love to come back and stay a whole week because of so many things to do and see. We came in via train station dragging bags so was not real sure the boat / taxi would be that easy. But coming out of train station the boat service # 1 is on the very right hand side. We purchased 72 hour passes that worked out very well. You want to catch the boat heading to the left with your back to the train station. No problem with all the bags got off @ the San Stae dock and then straight up to small alley on the lefthand side. Hotel sign is on the wall to make left turn down alley. Had a great time and would stay there again. Very nice staff - We had to take an early train so they had coffee and snack already for us in the morning on day of departure.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: sugartee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Nov. and the place was perfect. It was close to the vaporetto stop and the rooms were clean, comfortable and you could see the attention to detail.The staff and owners were great. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Somerset-jim
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - clean rooms with good facilities and friendly staff. For venice the price is very good and we loved it. A shame that the rooms did not have tea / coffee tray but they do have well stocked fridges. Also no English TV channels ( apart form euro sport 2 and CNN). Venice is expensive particulary with the crazy value of the Euro to sterling - a visit to the local COOP and take your own travel kettle and 2 mugs could save you Â£Â£Â£. Beer and wine is cheap in the COOP and very Â£Â£Â£ in the bars. We went into Harrys bar and asked for 2 cups of tea - 16 EUROS !!!!! It really does cost 1.5 Euros to use a WC !!!! Otherwise Venice is beautiful and one of the best city breaks we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: mojohomer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for Valentines weekend thinking it would be a romantic hotel after reading the reviews. Well...there's nothing romantic about this hotel. The staff were extremely nice & helpful and the bathroom is new and clean. Other than that....there's not much I can say about it. Frankly, I'm really dissapointed with the quality of this hotel after reading all these good reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: dizzy_tinkerbell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mocenigo for 3 nights in January and can highly recommend this hotel. It's easy to find from the Vaparetto stop (handy for when you first arrive, particularly if it's dark like it was for us) and you can walk to all the sights in 15-20 mins. The rooms are lovely and breakfast is good. Our only complaint was that we were allocated the room right behind reception which lacks privacy as there is someone sat right outside the door all day & night (not ideal for a romantic break away!). We did ask if we could be moved but unfortunately the hotel was already full (hazzards of arriving late on a friday eve). If I were to stay again I would put in a request prior to arrival to not have this room, although the room itself was charming and extremely spacious.

Reviews.Title: “The excellent reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: Czman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Ponte Mocenigo for 2 nights in early March. We could not have been happier with our choice. Walter and Sandro, the hotel, and the incredible breakfast exceeded the excellent reviews we read before booking. We stayed in the new annex which is literally around the corner from the reception desk and main hotel. The hotel is just a few vaporetto stops from the train station and Piazzale Roma. The Al Ponte Mocenigo is a short vaporetto ride or walk from the main tourist areas which is exactly why we chose it. Easy access to the touristy areas, quiet at night. Note: On our 2nd day I became extremely ill. Walter, Sandro, and the night conceirge (I am sorry we don't have his name) could not have been more helpful to my partner. They are exactly what the word customer service means. When we return to Venice we will gladly stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo...if it is not booked.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous start to a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lwalker01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I cruised the Mediterranean for our honeymoon and we began our trip at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. The hotel was a fabulous was to start! I had never been to Venice and was nervous about finding my way around but the staff was always very responsive to my emails asking a myriad of questions. Our room was very spacious and decorated with such an Old World feel. My husband is a minimalist when it comes to decor, but he also fell in love with our room and the Hotel. The location was perfect for us because the crowds in Venice can be overwhelming and it was nice being slighlty off the beaten path (only by an alley or two). Plus, a vaparetto stop is only a few steps away. We will definitely stay at the Hotel on any return trips to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW rooms”
Reviews.Author: MamaBabaRocks111
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo, it had a painful start as we had huge luggages and the new wing we stayed only have staircases, but once we opened the door to our room, Wow Wow Wow, I liked it so much that I couldn't stop taking photos of our nicely decorated room, like the retro style of it (or Venezian style? I'm not sure) I never like staying at the centre of the town so I'm happy that it's a bit far from San Marco & Rialto, quiet neighbourhood only few meters from San Stae and we spent our days at Venice mostly walking around town and crossing the bridges. Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo offers good value rooms they have, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Can't be better!”
Reviews.Author: 2l0vers
Reviews.Content: What could we say... Of course, all the previous testimonies had made us believe this hotel would be great... Yet, in the end, it was even greater than we expected!! First of all, be aware the pictures you can see on the website are totally relevant, you won't be disapointed and the rooms are exactly as shown in the pictures! About our personnal experience, I have to say that I really appreciated how easy it was to contact the staff and how quick they were to answer my emails... The time of arrival is not a problem at all (as long as you warn the reception) and you won't have any difficulties to find the hotel even in the darkness of the night. Actually the hotel is very close to the Vaporetto station (50m), so don't worry about finding your way! My girlfriend and I had a wonderful surprise when the receptionist told us that a room "superior" was available for us if we wanted (at the same price as the "standard" we had booked for!)... dazzled by the beauty of the room, we totally accepted the very nice and kind offer (even if the standard room was lovely and big as well)... big, clean, calm, red walls, nice furnitures, high ceiling and modern bathroom, the room was perfect for our romantic stay... The next day, we had the pleasure to realize the breakfast was really good in a lovely room with a waitress asking you which beverage you wanted... the choice is varied and everyone will find something he likes. To finish, I'd add that Venice is not a big city so the hotel is very close to the Rialto Bridge and San Marco (7 and 15min) Anyway, this website helped us in choosing this hotel and we warmly recommand it for anyone who wants to have a great room at a quite small price (around 90E per night in january)... Take our word, you won't regret it! :) cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilmishabear
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo was interesting indeed. The good stuff included the breakfast, the service, and the location. The not so good stuff involved our room. Don't be put off by this...read on. I must admit, when booking the reservation, I was told it was the smallest room they had, and I got what was offered. It was on the first floor right next to the reception desk and the breakfast area. The room was small and the bathroom was small. although both were very nice. Our room, however, was located on the alley between the hotel and another building, so when anyone was walking down the alleyway, you heard them. My wife wasn't as bother by it, but it woke me a few times. The internet connection never worked on my iphone, but that may have been my phone and not their service...however, they had a computer that always was free to use and I was able to check my email. The location wasn't bad, but it was a little off the main areas...which can be good because the location is quite...probably a 10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge and maybe another 5-10 on to San Marco Square. It's pretty easy to find from the train station with a vaperetto...oh,fyi, maybe there was another place to buy vaperetto tickets but if you have to buy them on the boat, 6.50 euros PER PERSON...you read that right...not cheap...it's easier and cheaper to walk where you need to go anyway... The hotel was nice and upon leaving, the man working the desk did mention that we go the least desirable room and we should come back and he'd get us a better room...class move indeed...and everyone working the desk were extremely friendly and helpful...another reason we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Supreme luxury at a fraction of the price”
Reviews.Author: CHdCs
Reviews.Content: You know when you look at a hotel website and see the photos and they look pretty good so you base your decision to stay at that hotel on those photos, only to find that the photos must have been taken years ago when to hotel was new because it looks nothing like that. Well, this isn't one of those hotels. Photos don't do this hotel justice! It is a beautiful, boutique type hotel. The hotel and its rooms are immaculate and richly decorated to reflect the city of Venice. The bathroom was beautiful and clean, modern but still true to the character of the building. We were there for our honeymoon, and we couldn't have found a better place to stay. The staff were helpful and clearly passionate about the city as they could tell us pretty much anything we wanted to know; from where the best place is to purchase a train ticket to where the best places are to get authentic, hand-made, hand-painted Venetian masks. The people that looked after house-keeping were lovely and friendly and welcoming. They didn't just make up our rooms during the day and serve our breakfast, they talked to us and made us feel comfortable. They even played with the other guests' children at times so the parents could finish eating their breakfast! Sandro, the manager we had most contact with was also extremely helpful. He always took the time to talk to us and gave us great advice when we asked for it. Most of the staff could speak sufficient English, so communication was never an issue. Breakfast was great. Great selection and the ladies made very good coffee! Our time there was short (3 days), but extremely enjoyable. We look forward to returning there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: chrisfrankfurt31
Reviews.Content: If you want a reasonably priced, excellently-located, friendly, comfortable, clean hotel in the centre of Venice, though away from the crowds of San Marco and the Rialto, you really MUST book this hotel. I am not exaggerating when I say that this place really does live up to the positive reviews it has received on this site - it is an absolute godsend! I have stayed in Venice before and I know that price and quality usually don't go together - in the case of Il Ponte Mocenigo, however, you get MORE than you pay for. The hotel owners are EXTREMELY friendly and helpful, speak excellent English, appreciate and anticipate what visitors to Venice may need (help with finding places, providing guide books, an umbrella, wellies for the frequent acqua alta conditions, maps, advice on where to eat, what to do, what parts to visit, general local knowledge etc.) and make your stay as comfortable as possible. This was our experience anyway and we weren't in the slightest bit disappointed. One complaint I have read on here about Il Ponte Mocenigo is the extent of the breakfast they offer. All I can say is that it is perfectly adequate for Italy and especially for Venice. They offered exactly what you would normally expect in Italy, or indeed in most southern European countries. In any case, for the price, it was fine. The hotel is a little tricky to find at first, though once you get your bearings, you will find it easily. It is no more than a few minutes' walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop, which is conveniently on the vaporetto route number 1 which plies the Grand Canal from Piazza San Marco to Piazzale Roma and back again. It's very useful to get to basically all the important places in central Venice. The area around the hotel is more typically Venetian than around San Marco because it is not a tourist hotspot, meaning that the prices of bars, restaurants and shops are lower than in other places and the atmosphere is a bit more authentic than elsewhere. We would recommend a retaurant on Salizada San Stae (the road behind the hotel, where the vaporetto stop is) called Osteria Mocenigo (not associated with the hotel - the name Mocenigo is derived from the Palazzo Mocenigo, next to the hotel). The food was excellent and the prices were very reasonable - around 20-30 euros per head including a bottle of house red, which was fine. You can get cheaper, but beware of the quality at many places. I really have nothing negative to say about the hotel myself, it was wonderful. The bed was comfortable, the rooms were warm, they had satellite TV (not that you will spend much time in the room anyway, there is too much to see in Venice!), the rooms were fully and newly renovated with modern bathrooms as well. What more can you ask for? So, all I can say is go ahead and book and have a great time in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Nawset
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The location was great - within walking distance of everything (although what place in Venice isn't). The owners were very nice, the breakfast in the courtyard was heavenly. Our room was nice and incredibly clean. The AC was wonderful. We would totally stay here again if back in Venice. Two big thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: markfmw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 3-5 Feb 2009 for 2 nights with my girlfriend. Based on the reviews and the hotel's website, we were expecting a nice and cosy place, probably a 3-star B&B type for EUR95 a night. Firstly, the location is unbeatable. Extremely easy to find once you get off at the San Stae stop and there are 2 entrances. It's also very central to the attractions etc. but Venice isn't very large in the first place so. Walter and Sandro and all their staff are very friendly and you do feel welcomed immediately. We stayed in the new building on the 2nd floor, and apart from the climb with the heavy suitacases, it was a lovely room with ample space. No view to speak of but that wasn't a problem. Free wireless service and breakfast included. The breakfast spread wasn't huge but whatever there was, it was excellent and there's always a ready smile from the staff. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here and I'll not hesitate to be back the next time I'm in Venice. This should be a 5-star B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: kokamura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocengio for three nights in their renovated annex and enjoyed our time there. Good points: 1. Very friendly staff, particularly Carlito who was on at night and was incredibly helpful and made us feel right at home and also the ladies who served breakfast in the morning. 2. Our room was nice and big for the price, with very traditional Venetian decoration. 3. We appreciated little details like the stacks of guidebooks and also the umbrellas by the door that were left out for guests to use - we needed the umbrella while we were there. 4. The hotel is located in a quieter area but the main attractions are still walkable, which would probably be good during the busy tourist season. It was also easy to get to from the airport. Bad points: 1. Bed were very, very hard. I like firm beds but this one was just too hard for me. I had to shift a number of times in the night as my sides would get sore. My husband said he slept fine. 2. Limited hot water. On our first day the hot water ran out after I had a bath so that my husband had to wait to have a shower and it was still just warm. 3. The breakfast is mediocre. They could make a bit more of an effort with it. The warm croissants were nice but the cheese is of the processed triangle kind and the rolls the cheapy white kind. To be honest though it did keep us going for the morning. 4. No Turkish bath. This was broken while we were there and the owner admitted that it had been like that for a while and they didn't know how to fix it. It's a pity as we were looking forward to it (we love saunas), especially after reading about it on their website. In fact it was one of our main reasons for choosing the hotel. Restaurant tips: Go to Pizzeria Ae Oche, it's close to the hotel and has the best pizza we've ever had (and we've eaten our share of pizza!). It was also very reasonably priced. There was a nice buzzy feel to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: berry626
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located away from the tourist traps and will really make you feel like a local. The surrounding campo's have some great restaurants. the rooms are small but very well kept. Breakfast was good and the patio where it's served is even better. I would stay here again no doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL; WONDERFUL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: WindmillMom
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two adults, two young children) stayed here in August 2009. We had a wonderful room with a separate room for the children. Lovely furnishings and wonderful air conditioning. The staff went above and beyond duty -- on the last day of our stay, I accidentally lost an earring in the bathroom sink. It lacked monetary value, but had great sentimental value and I sheepishly asked the manager if he could possibly summon a plumber on a Sunday before we checked out (and I offered to pay for it). He told me that he'd have a look himself and even though it was breakfast time, with guests coming in for the meal, he found an assistant to cover the desk and within 15-20 minutes, my earring was retrieved. I couldn't believe his kindness. There were several guidebooks in the stairwell outside our room and we really enjoyed borrowing them during our stay as well. Breakfasts in their tranquil outdoor courtyard were delicious. While this hotel would make for a great romantic get-away, we felt equally welcome with a 6 and 3 year old. We had an unforgettably magical time.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous boutique hotel - Jan 16 - 20 2009”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: I booked the Mocenigo directly with the hotel on its website in mid 2008 after reading a review on Time Out and checking the TA reviews. I was offered a superior double for single occupancy, at a rate of 115 euros a night including breakfast, internet and taxes. It seemed like a great deal to me and I was not mistaken. The hotel itself is just beautiful; my room had the highest ceiling stud I have ever slept under (18 ft? 20?) and the room walls were covered in scarlet silk, with beautiful murano glass lampshades and chandelier. The bed was, as is normal in europe, twins pushed together, but was very comfortable non the less. the bathroom is marble clad, with toilet and bidet, shower and bath. Basic toiletries (soap, shampoo, shower cap, shoe shine buff) were provided but I had my own so I did not mind the lack of shower gel etc. My room was over the tiny narrow back alley, so nice and quiet. Even though it was freezing outside, my room was too hot - and this with the heating turned completely off. I slept with the window open each night, and with an extra blanket on the bed to keep my shoulders warm, was very comfortable. Location wise, the hotel is a 2 minute walk from the S. Stae vaparetto stop; IGNORE the directions on the hotel website; they had me drag my heavy case over two bridges and up and down the accompanying stairs to go to the front entrance, when there was absolutely no need to do so. I can not understand why the hotel puts this down as its directions. Instead, go to the back door by walking straight ahead from the vaparetto stop about 50 mts, and take the first (and only) narrow alleyway on the left; there is a hotel plaque on the wall as you come to the alley. the back door is down the alleyway by the canal - there is another sign and a door bell. no stairs, no bridges, could not be quicker or easier. Located in Santa Croce, there are fabulous restaurants just moments away (try to get a booking for La Zucca and don't miss the pumpkin flan - it was amazing!) and a mini supermarket on the square just up from La Zucca. It takes about 30 minutes by Vaparetto to San Marco Piazza, and about 10 minutes in the other direction to the train station and the piazza where the buses to the airport arrive and depart. Breakfast is served downstairs from 8 - 10 and is the standard continental breakfast. there are a couple of types of boxed cereal, yoghurt and milk, with a bowl of fresh fruit. 3 different juices, and some baskets of the sweet biscuits that seem popular in italy . on the table are placed two small rolls and a sweet croissant (filled with some sort of fruit paste), with soft cheese segments and butter. coffee or tea of your choice. all served with a smile by the very polite staff. Walter, the owner, is an absolute credit to his profession. He went out of way to correct my rookie mistakes (getting me a dining reservation at the last moment, giving fantastic touring advice) and not making fun of me for my excessive internet usage (I was on my own so keeping in contact at night was important to me). I loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Annexed”
Reviews.Author: MI4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel several months in advance for a trip to Venice in early October 2008. Despite booking early, we found that our only option here was to stay in the annex., which was a newer addition, a one minute walk away. We had stayed in the Dorsoduro/Accademia area previously (probably still our favourite), but wanted to get a different angle on Venice by staying elsewhere and this location proved to be very good also. Upon arrival, the evening front desk manager helped us with our bags and showed us to the annex. It had its own security entrance with a speaker system to identify ourselves to the main reception desk, so we could gain access. This was good, as security was my main concern when you are "off-site". The building was tastefully renovated and the room was large for Venice, set up as a small suite with a sitting room and a separate bed room and bathroom. Wireless internet was provided, which was extremely handy for phoning home. The room decor was olive green and gold and felt very comfortable. The bathroom was similarly clean and fresh. I guess the only downside to our arrangement was that we found it slightly odd to arrive at the hotel proper in the mornings for breakfast. However we were made welcome by the owners and the restaurant girls, who were great fun. The setting in the small courtyard off the canal was probably the best part of breakfast. The attentiveness of the guys at the reception counter was excellent. When I had managed to mess up the room safe and locked it open - don't ask me how - they fixed it for us quickly with no fuss. I can't fault the hotel. It delivered a good quality accommodation for our 4 nights, at a good price and in a good location. We liked it. Perhaps if we had have stayed in the hotel proper, we may have loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kmull3333
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this fabulous hotel was completely satisfying. From the time that we initially booked our room, through our four day stay, we were impressed with the wonderful and attentive owners and staff. We selected this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and we were not dissapointed. We made our reservations in July for our November trip and could only secure a room in the annex at that point. This however was not in any way a disadvantage. Our little suite in the annex was charming and spotlessly clean. This 14th century building has been beautifully upgraded by Walter and Sandro. You will absolutely feel the charm and beauty of ancient Venice and still have every modern convienence. Breakfast was wonderful and made even better because the service staff was always smiling and friendly. Our bed was one of the most comfortable that we experienced during our 16 days in Italy. The bathroom looked brand new and we could tell that the hotel staff makes cleanliness a very high priority. It was such a pleasure to open the beautiful windows in each room of the suite. The windows overlooked a lovely little calle that has the feel of a true nieghborhood. We felt very secure at the hotel. Access to the annex is monitered by camera from the main hotel lobby. Our room was also equipped with a safe and a flat screen tv. The location is terrific. All of the major tourist sights can easily be reached on foot but if you want a vaporetto or water taxi the stop is a one minute walk from the hotel. There were several good places to eat close by and we found that the staff was happy to give reccomendations. The day of our departure was marred by a nationwide transportation strike. Not to worry... Walter gave us a warning a day prior and we went to the train station to make a reservation on one of two trains that were still going to run. He even offered to call our hotel in Florence to let them know that our arrival would be delayed until evening. The staff here is so friendly and accomodating that you will feel like you have made new friends. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and still love it”
Reviews.Author: MikeShaz
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Venice in January in 4 years and our 2nd stay at this hotel. We have always said never go back to the same place twice in case it is not as good and therefore there was a little trepidation with this visit. However there was no need to worry it was as good as we remembered. We love the location away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas and the feeling of being in amongst the day to day living of the venetians. We love walking aound Venice and the location of this hotel means that when you do walk anywhere you get to see many different facets. We stayed in room number 9 and unlike a previous reviewer who described the decoration of the room as a brothal or somewhere a murder had taken place I could not disagree more. It was sumptious and totally in keeping with feeling you were in an opulent venetian palace - yes it was dark, but if you pulled back the curtains, hey presto light shone in. In the summer I would think the ability to keep the room shaded would be a real bonus. Spotlessly clean, friendly helpful staff - can't wait to go again but maybe at a different time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: nenigma2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous Mediterranean trip and Venice was our last stop before returning to the states. Unfortunately, the weather in Venice was colder than we had anticipated (mostly in the 20-25 F range with the wind chill), which put limitations on the amount of walking we could comfortably accomplish. We spent two nights at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. Good stuff: Booking was done directly with the hotel via email and they were very timely in their responses. Hotel staff was helpful and spoke English, but not overly forthcoming. Breakfast, albeit small Continental, was enough to get us going in the morning (yogurt, cereals, and fruit); the cappuccino was delicious. We stayed in Room 5 upstairs which was clean, roomy, and even had a little balcony (although it was much too cold to enjoy it). As others mentioned, the hotel was in a quiet neighborhood and very close to the San Stae valporetto. Not so good stuff: The room was a bit stuffy; the bed was very hard, and we didnâ€™t have any shampoo when we showered in the morning (guess we should have checked before jumping into the tub!). Was not made aware of the internet access. Although the average price listed in Trip Advisor is around $170 USD per night, we paid about 50% more. Iâ€™ve previously stayed at other Venice hotels right on the canal for less than this within the last 2 years. So, I thought this was a bit pricier than originally anticipated. Also, since it was a little off the beaten track, it took awhile to get to the sites or walk (brrrr, cold) to the good restaurants. (There is a restaurant within 5 minutes from the hotel, but the food is just OK.) Bottom line? In general, I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. However, I would try to negotiate a better price and try to go when the weather is a bit warmer (for sure). Other restaurant tips? Used Rick Steves' Venice book and ate at the Salad & Juice Bar Oasis 2000 tucked away around the Bridge of Sighs/St. Mark's Square area. The ravioli, spagetti pomodoro, and salad was fantastic and reasonably priced (for the area). We also tried the Trattoria Ca'd'Oro (about 100 yeards straight from the Ca'd'Oro vaporetta stop) because it was relatively close to the hotel (one vaporetto stop from San Stae), but the food was only mediocre at best. We did have the meatball appetizer, which was very tasty and the house red wine was decent.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: jyliu_co
Reviews.Content: There is only one word to describe this hotel - FABULOUS! The room was absolutely beautiful. Sandro was very friendly and helpful. For the price we paid, you cannot find anywhere better than this. There was a good range of food for breakfast and yummy cappuccinos. But most importantly, the location of the hotel was perfect. We walked everywhere and none took more than 15 minutes. My boyfriend who hates walking gave the thumb up too!!! The nearest number one water vaporetto station - s.stae is literally at your door step. Look no further in Venice!!! Thank you Sandro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: zenveg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and we loved the hotel. We were lucky to be offered a room in a new, adjacent building with an entrance right off the street leading to the San Stae vaporetto, which made it seem like our own private apartment. This may not be for everyone since you have to exit the building and reenter for breakfast, but when you can open the shutters from the 2nd floor in the morning and view the Venetians going to work in the snow, that's something special. The room was immaculate and seemed like we were the first guests to stay there, with an amazing Murano chandelier, cloth covered walls, and a large shower with rain head. Our only complaint was the spotty wifi (though free) and too hard pillows, which were promptly changed for the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gachimai
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this site, we finally decide on Al Ponte. We're glad that we did. We flew into Venice from L.A. through Frankfurt, what a perfect way to start our vacation. It was our first time in Italy. We were so surprised at the size of the room, we were preparing for all our rooms in Italy to be small. The bathroom was perfect and the shower was a good size. Also the staff was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jambc1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located. Bus No 1 will get you to the hotel. However, If they happen to be on strike the night you get in and have no idea where you are. Be prepaired for an entertaning jouney. This hotel is not on the grand canal but, is easy enough to find. Take the way with the 'go over the bridge and ring bell' option. It's easier to find, and you can get to it if you're not a twig. (The other door you almost have to walk sideways to get thought! Haha. But, fun. Florence does flood. And, we happen to arrive on the very day that they're having a major 30 year flood. Oh my. But, the hotel lobby didn't flood !! The room, we book for 90E. A decent rate for city and location and of course trip advisor standing. We had a small room right off the lobby and it was just what we needed. The bathroom was spacious for the size of the room and with a full tub. I'm pretty sure that we did get CNN or at least an English channel. Breakfast was alright. They served you coffee and tea. As well as some rolls with jam and butter. There was a small serving station that you could get milk, juices, yoguart, and ceral. Very adiquite especially when considering price of the hotel. The front desk staff was very curitious, and spoke english well. There is always someone there because you have to be buzzed into the hotel. Which is a nice feature so that no one can just walk in. They have maps, and will make suggestions on where to go to dinner. You can also ask for an internet pass, and you have can have an hour of free internet. And, the do have a luggage room if you are staying beyond their check out time. All in all I like this hotel. And, was very pleased with price and level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowLauraG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our honeymoon after finding it on TripAdvisor. The hotel definently lives up to its reviews. The rooms are beautifully decorated, the bathrooms are well equipped and the staff are very friendly and efficient. A breakfast was served in the morning of rolls, croissants, fruit, etc and was more than enough to fill you up till lunch time. The location of the hotel was ideal - a 10 minute stroll to St Marks square but in a quiet area away from the more touristy areas. There are a couple of restaurants and bars around the corner that served delicious food. The water taxi stop was also just outside and handy for travelling to/from the airport. We are already planning our next trip to Venice and will definently stay at the Al Ponte Mocenigo.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: misswing
Reviews.Content: To say we were pleasantly surprised is a understatement. We spent days in January researching hotels in anticipation of our trip to Italy and we were aware that hotels in Europe are small and the facilities leave a lot to be desired, people may not be that friendly, etc, etc......but I have to say the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is an exception! It is located near a Vaparetto Stop and everything is a 10-15 minute walk if you don't want to take the Water Taxi (St Mark's Square, train station, Jewish Ghetto, etc) Our first room was very small, tucked in behind the check-in desk and was next to one of the doors leading into the hotel, but it was really quiet and cozy - I didn't mind the small space at all, it was actually romantic!
