We spend our last night in the largest room in the hotel which was also a nice treat, the king bed looked dwarfed compared to the size of the room and the bathroom even had a tub! Out of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy, this hotel had one of the best breakfasts included. Lots of variety, specialty coffees made to order and "good" yogurt. Walter is very helpful and a fantastic source of information. Our plane landed in Venice in the AM and our room wasn't ready. We arrived at the hotel in the midst of check out time and breakfast had ended. Walter told us to have a seat and relax while he finished with the other customers and had coffee brought over. He then gave us info about the area, pointed out some great restaurants and a small walking tour that we could go on while our room was being cleaned. Walter gave us great advice and restaurant recommendations daily and always checked in with all the guest to see how their vacations were going. My parents are going to Italy next year and I have recommended this hotel. I know we will stay here again next time we are in Italy. This hotel isn't high end so if you are expecting room service, not for you, but I thought it was great value for the price and exceeded the expectations I had about hotels in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel, exceptional value.”
Reviews.Author: roundtheworldneil
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Venice for 2 nights mid December for her 30th birthday gift. EVERYTHING about the hotel is great. The location, 1 minute walk from the San Stae Vaporetto stop. good when you are trailling a suitcase over cobbles. It is in the north east part of the island which is less busy, there are some excellent value restaurants and wine bars a short walk from the hotel. Getting down to St Marks is 15minute walk. As long as you are on the island it doesnt really matter where you are, you walk everywhere. We had the green suite on the top floor of the annex with a little balcony. We paid 94 Euros a night, booked direct through the hotel. The room quality was exceptional for this price, a good 4* anywhere in the world. Dont let that 2* rating on their website put you off. Breakfast great, continental style, great service. 10/10, book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! #1”
Reviews.Author: brokeguy
Reviews.Content: WOW! We stayed at the Red-Room (ex kitchen), and it was HUGE!!!, it felt like a suite or something. Carlito was great and even offered us breakfast and fruits to pack with us on our last day leaving at 6am. I felt like i was at home years ago with my Mom stuffing food in my backpack heading for school. The guest computer was a lifesaver checking our tickets and misc items prior to our departure. Travel books galore littered thier library as well with new current editions. If you are planning a trip to Venice, don't even bother looking anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TREFANEL
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in Venice, we had only been for day trips before, and selected the hotel based on the reviews on Tripadviser. We were thrilled with our choice and so glad we didn't go for a hotel nearer St Marks. It is so convienient for exploring all of Venice and we feel you really do get a different feel to the city then if you had booked a more touristy hotel. The rooms are beautiful and large, the annexe is lovely and we would actually choose to stay there next time we visit. The staff are charming , friendly and cannot be more helpfull. All in all a gem of a hotel , a real find, we will never stay anywhere else , just loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: libtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my sister for 5 nights in November. What a fantastic property! Spacious rooms, good bathrooms (with towel warmer), great location and fabulous staff. We had a room across from reception and didn't have any problems with noise. Really good breakfast to start a full day in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: beb111
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. The rooms are big, exceptionally clean, and quite luxurious. When you're in your room, you would feel like you are staying in a 4 or 5 star hotel. The staff is remarkable. Sandro, Walter, Donatello and Carlito are always helpful and pleasant. The ladies serving breakfast, Grace and Milette (sp?), always provided excellent service. The location couldn't be better. It is a few meters away from the San Stae Vaporetto stop. It is also a few minutes walk to Rialto. I would rate this hotel higher if not for some billing problems that we encountered. At check-out, we were being charged a higher rate than the rate originally quoted to us. Luckily, we had a copy of the e-mail that confirmed the rate. It was a bit uncomfortable asking them to honor the rate that we were quoted, but they honored it anyway. Apparently, their computer system crashed and lost some of their e-mails that provided this information. Had we not brought copies of the e-mail, we would have paid a higher rate. Despite this problem, I would not hesitate staying at this property again. You can feel that the people here genuinely care about their guests and they understand the true meaning of "customer service". They will do everything that they can to make their guests happy, thus, making it a highly rated hotel on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: mum48londonSW
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone. We were a party of 9 women from London on a 3 day trip to Venice. The hotel was great value, had charming staff, was very well positioned (we arrived by water taxi, and a landing plank was put out for us due to very high water levels), and with very Italian atmosphere. Rooms very well appointed and better than many four star hotels in some cases. Room 5 has a lovely balcony overlooking the canal, but all the rooms we had were quite luxurious. The Proprietors were very helpful and spoke perfect English, putting us all to shame. Will never stay anywhere else when in Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: SisterMargaret
Reviews.Content: I have been putting this off - I don't want everyone to know about this amazing little hotel almost in the heart of Venice. Travelled with a friend and booked this hotel after reading Trip Advisor Reviews - rooms were well decorated and spotlessly clean. The breakfasts were great - not a full English but then we were in Venice and did not expect it. When our 72 hour pass ran out we walked and it was not any more than 10 - 15 mins to St Marks- unfortunately something in Venice always catches your eye and you have to stop and look so it is impossible to be accurate with timings. We became very brave and took the traghetto across the canal - great fun and so cheap. This was my third time in Venice and it is somewhere that I will always return to - I just love its magic!!

Reviews.Title: “Venice the First Time ... But Not the Last!”
Reviews.Author: maidinitaly
Reviews.Content: Our 2-day visit was made more enjoyable by staying at this pretty hotel tucked away in a quiet neghbourhood but with the S. Stae vaporetto stop less than a minute's walk away (15 minute ride to S. Marco). Or, just a 10 minute walk through pretty lanes leads to Rialto and S. Marco. All the staff were friendly and helpful and most spoke excellent Engish. Good sized, well-appointed rooms and bathrooms were spotlessly clean (as we were a party of 9 we all had a good look around each others' rooms! ) Very well priced for such a high standard of accommodation. Staying at the Al Ponte Mocenigo enhanced my first ever visit to Venice and when I return I shall book in again!

Reviews.Title: “Secluded and individual”
Reviews.Author: NickLz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early August for 2 nights with my wife and 2 late-teenage sons while we were sightseeing. Although it is not in the main tourist area, nowhere is very far from anywhere else in Venice. We were very impressed with the rooms (we stayed in the "annexe" which had a separate entrance around the corner), the cleanliness and the friendliness of the owners and staff. My wife left a favourite pair of shoes under the bed when we left and they posted them on to the UK for us. When we return to Venice, we would probably stay here again unless we were looking to move very much up-market.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Off the Beaten Path in Venice”
Reviews.Author: roadwarriorz
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights of our honeymoon at Al Ponte Mocenigo. It is definitely tucked away, and you have to walk down a very narrow alley to reach the entrance. The interior is beautiful. We stayed in the Junior Suite, which was very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was modern and large, although the shower does not have a complete door on it so water can spray out. This room has a small balcony which overlooks the quaint courtyard where breakfast is served. The breakfast was adequate, although it was the only hotel we stayed at that did not include ham and cheese. That would be a nice addition to the breakfast spread! The location has its pros and cons. It is definitely nice to be off the beaten track, as the area around St Mark's Square gets jam-packed with tourists. But at the same time, the vaporetto ride was rather long, especially when the boat is overloaded with people. We found that it's easy to get around Venice on foot so if the vaporetto looks too full, go for a stroll! When you exit your room, all of the power shuts off. So plan accordingly when you need to charge your camera battery, cell phone, etc, because you can only do so when you're in your room. There's a nice little trattoria nearby called Al Nono Risorto. It has a casual atmosphere, a great courtyard for outdoor dining, and is popular with locals. Great pizza! All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Far From the Madding Crowd”
Reviews.Author: spg888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully tucked away in a quiet location. If you want peace you'll find it here. Saying that, you are still very close to the vaporetto stop, 1 minute I'd say, and only a 15 or 20 minute walk to the tourist hub of St Mark's Square. The host that we saw most of, Walter, couldn't have done more to make us feel at home. Nothing was too much trouble. He is a genuinely nice man and his English is excellent. We stayed in room 6. It was gorgeous. I've never seen ceilings so high in a bedroom! It was also very clean. There was adequate bedding and a modern heating system. There was a good selection of channels on the TV. The bathroom was also very modern and exceptionally clean. Lovely soft towels and a very effective shower. There was a bath too. We booked for bed and breakfast and this is served between 8 and 10. It is simple fare but there is a good choice of hot and cold drinks, cereals, cakes, fresh fruit and lovely little warm rolls and fresh croissants. There was enough food available to nicely set us up for the serious amount of walking we did. The serving staff were very friendly and made efforts to speak English where necessary. We only went to Venice for a couple of days but when we return we will definitely stay here again. It was easy on the wallet too which is a bonus in Venice, but that's another story!! Thank you Walter.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: biztravellerBC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in November. We truly enjoyed the hotel, particularly the service. Donatello, Sandro and Walter were most helpful. The room was comfortable ... home away from home. We liked the location of the hotel and loved the city. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: vitaminbee
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, especially those on Tripadvisor, we booked a 3 night stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo directly with the hotel for late October 2008. We were a mother (60s) and son (40s) on a two week tour through Europe, and this was by far our favorite hotel. Our room on the second floor was huge, with two twin beds. As I have back problems, I very much appreciated the firm mattress. The bathroom was huge and very nice as well. I appreciated the free Internet, as every other hotel we stayed in required us to pay for the service. The morning breakfast was lovely. The staff was marvelously attentive and made you feel like you were staying with friends. Location was great (so close to a vaporetto stop), and also within easy walking distance from Rialto Bridge. We fell in love with Venice, and Al Ponte Mocenigo will definitely be our hotel when we next return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kela2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very nice location. Close to a vaporetto stop and walkable to all sights. The room was very large and clean as well as the bathroom which had a bathtub. We stayed in the room on the first floor which opened out onto the courtyard. Was worried if we would have alot of noise at first but it was never a problem. The staff was very nice and helpful for any questions that we had. For the price and location and quality of the room this is the best find. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: MJLAlberta_Canada
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights in October and enjoyed it very much. As many have said, the beds were quite hard for us, but they seem typical of Italy. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast was tasty. Loved the blood orange juice and the plums. Nice location, if you like to walk. If you don't like to walk, don't visit Venice. We wandered towards the train staion and found a lovely square filled with locals. There is a nice COOP grocery store there as well. Only .35E for a small bottle of water!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jubeeTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late October. We had room 10 which is huge and very green! Our only complaint is that it was a little too dark with just the bedside lights on and too bright with the chandelier on (though glad we could switch off all the lights without getting out of bed). The room would have been perfect with one or 2 lamps and maybe a rug on the cold floor (perhaps this isn't a Venetian thing?). Bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was fantastic (had spa bath - bliss after a days sightseeing). We specifically asked for a quiet room (as light sleepers) and indeed this room was very quiet. Not sure if the rooms opening off the lobby/breakfast area would be so quiet, so mention this if this is important to you too. The hotel is about 2 minutes walk to the Ca Pessaro modern art gallery which is well worth a visit (especially if you have overdosed on 16th century art). We have visited Venice several times so glad to be away from St Marks Square hustle and bustle. This hotel was much cheaper than where we have stayed before but standard just as high (if not higher) and the staff are very helpful. Would definitely recommend. I now feel guilty I mentioned about the lights (they would probably have rushed in with lamps if I had said something while we were there!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved all of it!”
Reviews.Author: cafoodie2
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews in multiple sites before making the reservation. I felt lucky to get a room, as the reviews were all fabulous! Yes, the beds are a little hard, but the rooms are beautiful, clean, spacious and the staff excellent! We stayed for three nights and had a fabulous time. Great neighborhood - away from the crowds but easy walking to Rialto and San Marco. We did get a little "lost" but it was fun and beautiful. Venice is quite magical - we went in November. Yes, it rained and there was fog, but that added to the experience. I would recommend Al Ponte and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful beginning to our trip!”
Reviews.Author: upstatenewyorker29
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect start to our 3 week vacation in Italy. We were surprised how much we liked Venice ( especially compared to Rome) We booked based on prior trip advisor reviews though it was not easy to get a reservation! I was booked elsewhere and kept checking the hotel website and switched as soon as I nabbed a room. We loved the location - quiet, but not too far to walk to the major sights. We also loved the area restaurants that the hotel recommended especially Il refolo and La Zucca. We would not hesitate to recommend this to our friends and would stay here if ( when, hopefully)we return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Bonhill08
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo was even better than we had expected even after all of the glowing reviews we had read. We stayed in the annex which is just around the corner from the main hotel and our room was spectacularly fitted out and had a separate sitting room (with its own LCD TV) which made it quite spacious. The hotel location is very close to the San Stae vaparetto stop and is not a long walk to the Rialto Bridge. Breakfasts were very good and a free internet PC was a bonus. However, it was the friendly and helpful attitude of the owners and staff that made the extra difference. Gluten-free bread was provided on our request and they made an effort every day to get something nice when their usual supply was not available. However, the help provided to recover my misplaced sunglasses and the support provided when I had a painful back complaint for a day were things that showed how much Walter and Sandro really care about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NGK123
Reviews.Content: This hotel merits the wonderful reviews already written about it. It is situated in a perfect location, very central yet very quiet. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and clean. The hotel staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful. We had no problem booking our room, and our reservation was honored. We travel extensively and in hotels we look for comfort, cleanliness, good food, friendly service and good value. This is among the best value for the money we have experienced. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venice's hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Racercarboy
Reviews.Content: Loved this perfectly located cozy gem! Booked at hotel's website. Rec'd discount for cash pmt. Owners are friendly, helpful, professional & personable! Room was large by European standards. Full bath was beautiful, spotless and roomy! Morning breakfast is varied & delicious, served by courteous, friendly staff. Affordable, great location! Arrived at hotel's water taxi door....could not have been easier after disembarking from a two week cruise. Our room was quiet, comfortable & immaculate. 10 min. walk from hotel to Rialto Bridge. 15-20 min. easy walk to San Marco. We loved the quiet neighborhood feel & the two minute walk to San Stae Vaporetto stop. Just hated leaving Venice! Highly recommend this charming, small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Venice gem”
Reviews.Author: PeterEloise
Reviews.Content: After 8 visits to Venice and having thoroughly enjoyed 6 different hotels (mostly 3 and 4 star), we came upon this wonderful hotel which was far and away the best we have stayed in. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious and spotlessly clean, beautifully and authentically decorated, the staff incredibly kind, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful; the area ,Santa Croce, the real Venice, quiet and off the main tourist track yet centrally located and only a short walk to San Stae vaparetto stop. There are many non-touristy, authentic good-value restaurant s nearby, while breakfast in the beautiful courtyard was a highlight each morning. Overall a "5 star " hotel in every respect with only an official 2 star rating and price! A real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, caring, comfortable......”
Reviews.Author: DaphneKLondon
Reviews.Content: As reported by other reviewers (our reason for booking this hotel - together with a friend's recommendation) the position of this hotel cannot be faulted, on a small canal just off the Grand Canal within a tiny walk of very good restaurants and a reasonable stroll to the Rialto area and St. Marks. The hotel itself offers comfort and style - large rooms, spacious bathrooms, friendly and efficient service, everything needed for a short break. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, whatever their age, thinking of a trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Al Ponte is a Venetian Charm”
Reviews.Author: klam
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? This was one of the most comfortable and most romantic hotels I stayed at during my trip to Europe. Completely intimate and charming, i was just blown away at the level of service, quality and helpfulness of the staff. It definately met my high standards. Al Ponte is away from the hustle and bustle and completely walkeable to the main tourist area (10mins). Upon arrival the hotel gives you a great "useful" map to get you everywhere. The hotel was so venetian, with great homey charm. The beds were firm and and the washroom was really clean and updated. Tons of books on Venice are provided by the hotel to use at your discretion however, everywhere you go in Venice is walkable, and definately worth getting lost in. Useful tips on getting to the hotel as we sure had trouble: If you are flying into an Airport (we flew into Treviso with RyanAir), as soon as you get out of arrivals, walk to the right and find the ACTV booth. Buy return shuttle tickets to Venice and also purchase a one time use boat/Vaporetto ticket unless you plan to buy a one day pass if you dont wish to walk so much. the Bus is right outside the airport so no need to fret. The bus ride is approximately 1 hour and is the last stop of the ride. When you get of the bus, remember the stop indicator "D2". This is where you will wait for your return. ACTV also gives you a great schedule that coincides with your flight location and tells you which bus time to take. As soon as you get off the bus, walk straight ahead veering towards the water. You will see a big clear bus shelter but for boats instead, like a doc. It will read Piazzolo de Roma, excuse the spelling. This will be in Black wording with a Yellow background. Owned by ACTV, this is the boat you will need to take. NOTE: ACTV has two two lines: 1 or 2. Make sure you take boat 1 and get off at the San Stae stop which is 4 stops from the start. We asked an ACTV representative and they told us to get off at the first stop, big mistake. Even our personal GPS couldn't help us with this one. So remember boat 1, San Stae. As soon you get off the boat walk straight. The directions of the hotel say there is a bridge one the left....YOU MUST look hard enough to see this tiny tiny black metal crossover...looks spooky but they are currently doing construction overhead. Cross the tiny bridge adn follow down the path on the right, keep going straight and follow instructions/directions the hotel gives you on their site. you will see a bridge to the entrance of the hotel. It has a gated door and if you arrive early you will see ppl eating breakfast. NOTE: to gain entrance you much look for the Lion Head and press this mouth to push the buzzer to get in. This is their entrance. Unless you are stupid like me and my boyfriend and stood there staring at the ppl eating wondering what to do. We ended up going thru the back entrance down this narrow creepy yet soon to be "normal" alley way. If you go thru the back, push the door as soon as you hear a click. Once your in your home free. Btw, their free breakast outside on the terrace is marvelous. Great garden and just simple comfort. Couldn't ask for more. We had room #8. Loved it and felt like it really was the epitome of what Venice stood for. Also, no need to take the boat to main stop to get to shuttle bus, you can walk it in 15 mins flat no problem. Equipped with the map the hotel gives you, just go adn get lost. It ended up being so much fun trying to figure out where you were in this city....and if u get frustrated...just look around and remind yourself your in Venice. Do no fall victim to tourist trap restaurants in the St. Marks sq. - expensive, instead go eat elsewhere and then go back to see the orchestras place ....very romantic. Gondolas were quite expensive, about $80Euros for two ppl, 4 kilometers...approximately 25 mins. Worth it if thats what you want, we just talked down the river from the rialto, found an empty dock and sat there watching the sun go down adn the ppl on the gondolas go by....thats my cup of tea. BOOK EARLY!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true”
Reviews.Author: jhasko
Reviews.Content: As you plan your stay at various unknown hotels, you hope they will meet your expectations. The hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo blows you away--it is fantastic. Well appointed super clean rooms ,a charming breakfast courtyard, easy access, quiet surroundings and great owners--Walter and Sandro--it is a dream come true.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattPhLondon
Reviews.Content: The perfect location , lovely hotel and friendly staff. What more could you ask for in the most romantic city in Europe. 2 Star does not do this hotel justice , 4 star would be more like it! Venice has so much to do , a surprise around every corner. Tip - Do not try and clean your shoes on one of the many steps near the canal or you may slip! - Ask sarah Top trip - top hotel - book early

Reviews.Title: “Back again , still perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: GraemeC5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Al Ponte Mocenigo , before and knew it was the only hotel we would ever go back to in Venice. Room 2 is not as bad as one of the reviewers states, it is the smallest room and always the last to be booked out and the owners will always tell you this in advance. The rooms are beautifull and give you a real taste of authentic venice. The hotel is over it's own little private bridge and has a great courtyard, it has the perfect location for meandering through the streets, loads of great little Osteria's and bars nearby. We are already booked to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room for 4”
Reviews.Author: alpenmicho
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 4 for 195E per night. We booked by email and the hotel always responded very fast. We followed the directions to the hotel getting off at the San Stae stop. With our suitcases in tow, we walked across the bridge to the left, walked about 50 m and then crossed the private Al ponte mocenigo bridge on the right. What we wished we would have known is that the annex door was directly ahead of the vaparetto stop. One of us could have gone to check in, while the rest walked straight ahead with the suitcases. No need to cross all those bridges with suitcases. There is also a laneway with a secondary door to the hotel you can access from the road straight ahead where the vaparetto drops you off at. The hotel is beautiful and full of charm. Our suite in annex was even more beautiful and grand than pictures show. The suite had a pocket door separating 2 rooms. One room had 2 single beds and a television. It also had a balcony. The second room had a very comfy queen bed, another tv, a fridge and 2 big windows looking out on the street. The bathroom was very clean, had beautiful modern fixtures and included a bidet, which my son thought was for washing feet in. At breakfast we were given a basket with a couple of fresh rolls and a croissant with apricot filling each. Along with this they provided cheese, jam,honey and nutella. They also had fresh fruit, cereals, breakfast bars and wafer cookies packages. They had very kind and attentive staff who would make whatever drink you wanted along with your breakfast. Front desk staff was very friendly and answered all our questions. They provide you with a map. The annex also had a pile of magazines, guidebooks and even umbrellas to borrow. We liked the location of the hotel. It was in a nice quiet area. The vaparetto passes we bought came in very useful. The Rialto bridge was only 2 and 3 stops away and everything was easily accessible from there. There is a good family pizza place near the hotel called Pizzeria AE Oche. Just ask front desk for directions. An amazing little hotel, also good for families!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful B&B”
Reviews.Author: LionelsMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as quaint and magical as Venice itself. Great location. Wonderful staff. And rooms that are so spacious you forget you're in Italy. We thought the rooms were so precious/cute and had that Italian look to them. Walter greeted us warmly and we were disappointed we were only able to stay one night. Next time we return we are staying here without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have hoped for better....”
Reviews.Author: sf004
Reviews.Content: Along with so many other reviewers, we booked this hotel because of the exceptional rating on Trip Advisor. Our expectations were high, and we were not disappointed. The hotel was small, friendly and extremely clean. A very easy walk from the Water Bus stop and perfectly located for our 4 day stay in Venice. The rooms were decorated in a beautiful Venetian style. We had room 32 on the second floor of the Annexe. The bedroom was large, with a small lounge off of it which had a table and 2 chairs and a day bed with a roll out bed underneath - allowing 4 to stay comfortably. The bathroom was lovely. We had a bath and shower attached. Both the bedroom and lounge had TVs and we had a fridge. The hairdryer, however, was not very powerful. We also had a tiny balcony off the lounge - just enough room to stand. We looked out to the street, just up from the Grand Canal. The location was very quiet, but you were not far from the canal, water bus, restaurants or sights. Breakfast was taken in the main hotel, only about a 50m walk around the outside of the hotel. We ate in the courtyard - though a little chilly, so dine with a jumper and scarf. Delicious couisants, cereals, rolls, jams, fruit, yoghurt, coffee, tea and juice - plenty of all.The staff were happy and very helpful. After an unfortunate incident with the canal my clothes were washed, dried and returned to my room within 6 hours. We ate at restaurants recommended and booked by the hotel, and they were all superb. I would thouroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Can A Stay Get Any Better?”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: Accompanied by two friends, we stayed two nights at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for a weekend. We arrived by a expensive, but fast, fun and convenient water taxi (195 EUR return) pretty early, but we only had to wait a couple of minutes for our rooms, and were invited by Walter to have a free cappucino in the meantime. We had a standard double room (No. 3), our friends a small (but for a weekend stay totally sufficient) double room (No. 2) on the ground floor. Both rooms had comfortable beds, modern bathrooms, free in-room internet access (cable or wireless) and windows leading on the extremely narrow gap between two houses which serves as access to the hotel's main landside entrance (there is a "water door" as well). So, no view at all, but no problem as you wouldn't want to sit in your room in Venice. The tasty continental breakfast, as mentioned, is - weather permitting - served in an inner courtyard by a couple of delightful ladies from 8 to 10 a. m. Our friend celebrated his birthday and Sandro and Walter threw in a free bottle of Prosecco. Walter and Sandro were very helpful before our trip regarding transportation advice as well as during our stay and everyone made us feel as being guests in a private home. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Except for Rock Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: Summer012
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love this hotel for the location and service, and for the neighborhood where it is located. I was concerned at first that it wasn't right near St. Mark's Square, but actually it is an easy walk or short ride on the vaporetto. We liked returning to "our" little quiet neighborhood after a day of touring and crowds. The only reason I would not stay here again though is the beds. It is like sleeping on the floor. I noticed a previous reviewer liked the "firm" beds, well these were more than firm. Venice was our first stop, and after flying in from the U.S. and dealing with jet lag the beds just did not help relieve our fatigue. I am writing this in hopes that maybe the hotel will read this, as again, we really love this place, and would like to return someday. We are in the hotel business, and we felt the beds really needed replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Julie-Newtown-PA
Reviews.Content: Believe all the rave reviews this hotel gets!!! It is a lovely property with very large and comfortable rooms. The bathroom was quite spacious as well. Nice and quite spot in a very busy city. Walter is a true gentleman and a pleasure to talk to. Plentiful breakfast and the best cappuccino in all of Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Again a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mawson
Reviews.Content: Stayed in mid September, as with all other reviews it was amazing. The room was very large and clean all the staff friendly. Walter and Sandro great hosts and went out of their way to be helpful. We asked directions to a friends hotel and after we left Walter rang the other hotel to say we were on our way which was wonderful because we would have never have found it if my friend hadn't been outside waiting for us. The only thing I would have liked is tea and coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: C53
Reviews.Content: What a way to start our honeymoon, this hotel is a little gem. Next to the San Stae vaporetto stop in a lovely quiet area just off the Grand Canal. We stayed in the annex in a palatial room with a small balcony and a bottle of sparkly stuff to welcome us. Alex and his partner in the business were more than helpful and friendly (especially since our airline left my luggage in Manchester for two days), and breakfast in the beautiful courtyard was something to look forward to every morning. There's access to a computer and the internet in the main hotel, but the highlights are definitely the friendliness of the staff, the comfort of the rooms and it's SO close to the bus stop that seeing all of Venice in 4 days was a sinch! Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Add My Name to the Legion of Fans”
Reviews.Author: DlphcOracl
Reviews.Content: You've read it all before in the numerous and well-deserved glowing reviews that precede mine, but it literally is too good to be true. I stayed at Al Ponte Mocenigo from 9/20/08 to 9/23/08 and this is truly a little gem. The location, a bit off of the beaten path, is ideal because it resides in an authentic neighborhood with fine, unfussy local restaurants and shops. The hotel is only about 100 feet from the San Stae stop on vaporetto #1 so the hotel is quite easy to reach and one has quick access to the rest of the city. The entire staff is genuinely friendly and welcoming and everyone I had contact with spoke fluent English. I stayed in Room #22 in the Annex and it was wonderful. The room was excellent size, especially for Venice, and had been recently renovated with quality furnishings and taste. The bathroom was superb with an ample-sized shower stall, beautiful marble walls, and modern fixtures. The bed and pillows were firm --- which I greatly prefer --- and provided a wonderful night's sleep. The neighborhood is also quiet in the late evening so that sleeping soundly is not a problem. Breakfast was fine with yogurt, fresh fruit, juices, cereals, etc., and someone who would serve a fresh jam-filled croissant and rolls, then take your request for coffee, capuccino, etc. Weather permitting, there is a nice outdoor courtyard off of the breakfast room as well. Simply put, this is a fine Venetian hotel that is a great value. I suppose one could spend three or four hundred Euro per day more to stay at Hotel Gritti or Bauer so that one can walk into a grand lobby, but why?? I hope to return soon to Venice for a longer stay and I will undoubtedly make a reservation again at Al Ponte Mocenigo.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in delightful Venice”
Reviews.Author: MMcKellar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days in Venice at the beginning of September and cannot praise the Al Ponte Mocenigo staff highly enough. Sandro and Walter were very friendly and helpful. We had a room in the annexe which was beautiful, spotlessly clean and security was excellent. The hotel is easily found on arriving at the San Stae stop. Walk straight ahead and look up at the wall. You will find a small brass plaque indicating you turn left down a very narrow alleyway to the entrance. Quite novel manoeuvring cases and yourself down towards the door! You would not believe a hotel was located here. We were extremely comfortable, being away from the busy tourist areas. Breakfast was served in the courtyard and we especially enjoyed the apricot croissants, which everyone raves about! It was helped greatly by Grace, our smiling waitress who was so attentive. We did a lot of the tourist attractions but found that it was just as much fun walking for miles, getting "lost" but finding that you are seldom far away from the Grand Canal. We spent many happy hours strolling around the San Stae area, coming across lovely restaurants on the way. On our way back to our hotel one evening we stumbled upon a large group of Italians dancing the tango to very seductive music! My husband and I thought it best to leave it to the experts and merely sat and enjoyed. The Venetians certainly have rhythm in their blood! It was a truly unexpected experience and one we will not forget. I have to say that our time in Venice was magical. There is no place like it. I had always wanted to visit and as this is only our second time away without kids, who no longer are of an age to go on holiday with their parents, it made it even more enjoyable. I also celebrated my 50th birthday in July so it was a wonderful way to finish off the never-ending celebrations. I would not hesitate to stay at this wonderful hotel should I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and worth the recoommendations on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: MRD31
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and well worth the praise heaped upon it from members of this site. Rooms are very nicely decorated, air conditioning is excellent, bathroom was finished to a very high standard and breakfasts were lovely. Location wise it is literally a 5 minute stroll to Rialto, and about 10 to St. Marco. Otherwise it is directly off the S. Stae Vaporetto stop. The restaurants recommended by Walter and Sandro are all good (and nicely priced also). We stayed for 3 nights and loved our time there. We both said we would return. This is an extremely friendly hotel, with courteous staff who are pleased to help with any question you might have regarding the City or the hotel amenities. For the price this is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place Too”
Reviews.Author: StealthTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding small hotel. We normally stay at top rated B&Bs or mid-to-upper range hotels, and the Al Ponte was an excellent combination of both. In general, we would echo the other glowing reviews of this property, as they do an excellent job of describing the hotel and spirit of the people who work there. The location is less than 100 feet from the San Stae vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal, which turns out to be extremely convenient. For example, you can hop on the #1 Vaporetto and get a fabulous cruise of the canal all the way down to San Marco (St Mark's) Square. Or you can go the other direction for about four stops and arrive at the train station or the Plazza Roma bus terminal (to the airport). The Ca D' Oro stop is the next stop to San Stae on the line -- then you have only a 10 minute walk north to the dock for the Murano / Burano vaporetto. Vaporetto passes can be bought at the Rialto Bridge stop, which is only a short 10-15 minute walk away. We bought ours after wandering around the morning produce and fish markets right before the bridge. I would like to emphasize that the hotel is in a truly wonderful area, full of quiet neighborhoods containing a variety of squares, shops and restaurants. We always felt safe -- even after dark. After a while, we almost didn't want to go to the big sightseeing attractions -- since it was so enjoyable to just wander the "local" neighborhoods without all the tourist crowds. When we return to Venice, we will stay at the Al Ponte again -- in a heartbeat. By the way, we stayed in Room #6 which was nice. But if you want to splurge, ask about Room #10 -- it looks to have a 4 poster canopy bed and a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “I really shouldn't share.....”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1962
Reviews.Content: If everyone finds out about this place, it will be too hard to make reservations for future visits. It really is a dream. Very charming, clean and the staff is top notch! We especially love the little breakfast with the jam filled croissants that are to die for, served by the cutest little old woman. We stayed in room # 5 with a private balcony overlooking one of the small canals. It was very relaxing sitting on the balcony on a quiet evening listening to the city settling in for the night. We will be back again as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tradi_travel
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel in a nice, quiet location just off the San Stae vaporetto stop. Cont. breakfast in the courtyard was excellent. 2nd floor room was comfortable and clean, but no elevator, so be aware. After battling the tourist masses all day long, it was a nice oasis of calm.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: WOMBOURNEGIRL
Reviews.Content: My husband booked our trip to Venice to celebrate my 40th birthday. He chose and booked three nights at this hotel because of all the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. Periodically, we would check the reviews and each time we were delighted by positive feedback (we just hoped that the hotel would live up to our expectations). WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED. The hotel is beautiful. It is decorated and maintained to a very high standard. All the staff from the owners right through to the ladies serving breakfast were so polite and attentive. This hotel may be a short walk from the main features of Venice, but after a full day walking around there was nothing nicer than to return to the beautifully lit courtyard, sit, relax and enjoy a drink. Thank you to Al Ponte Mocenigo for making my 40th birthday such a memorable experience and we certainly hope to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SeaFarmGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice quiet location, away from the crowds of the San Marco area. We had a huge room (in the pictures on Trip Advisor, it's called the triple room and it's decorated in red) which was very comfortable overall. The staff was nice, the breakfast was good and the patio area very pleasant. This isn't a high end hotel but it's comfortable, clean and a good value. It's really easy to find, right off a water bus stop. They offer free internet which was a huge bonus for my niece. The only real drawback in my mind was that my bed was very hard. My niece said hers was comfortable but I had a difficult time sleeping mine was so hard. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay. We also enjoyed the restaurant one block away - great mushroom pizza!

Reviews.Title: “Good value that is off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: bdy62769
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Al Ponte Mocenigo during our honeymoon. We generally enjoyed our stay there and particularly liked being off the beaten path. The room was clean and nice but the bed was not very comfortable. We liked the breakfast courtyard. Overall, I would recommend the hotel to others but expect a pretty weak bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarmyEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Al Ponte Mocenigo for four nights in August as part of our honeymoon. We were slightly concerned about finding our way to the hotel as it was our first visit to Venice, but we booked a water taxi at the airport which took us directly to the water door of the hotel - it couldn't have been simpler, and was great fun too! The hotel itself is beautiful. It's typically Venetian from the outside, and has an understated elegance within. Our room (a standard double) exceeded its description. It was immaculately clean, spacious, very comfortable, and was perfectly (and quietly) air conditioned (which provided a much welcomed relief from the August heat). Breakfast is served in a charming coutyard, which also doubles up as a romantic garden in the evening where you can mull over the events of the day with a nice wine. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly, and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The hotel is very well located. It's comfortably away from the major tourist attractions (and the hoards that come with them!) but close enough to take a leisurely stroll to see all of the delights of Venice (from what I can remember, the Rialto Bridge was about a 10 minute stroll, and St. Mark's Square about 20 minutes). We both loved Venice and will definitely return, and there's only one place that we'd stay...

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Gem”
Reviews.Author: DO'H1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night en route to Bologna as the only flight we could get to Italy was to Venice and regretted afterwards that we didn't spend the whole break in this lovely little hotel in this beautiful spot. The hotel is very small, as are the rooms, but the two young owners are very helpful and the property couldn't be more convenient - two stops on the water bus from the main bus station where the Ryanair bus from Treviso airport comes in. The room rate was very reasonable for the standard of accommodation and location and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golfah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at Al Ponte Mocenigo in June. Our flight to Venice was delayed and we did not arrive until late at night. We found the hotel without any problems and were greeted and shown to our room. We were in the standard room which was comfortable and had a good size modern bathroom. If I had one complaint it would be that the wardrobe is a bit small. The staff were extremely nice, breakfast in the courtyard delightful and the position very good. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SebastianReinhardt
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is totally recommended for anyone who loves Italy and wants to have a great Mediterranean experience. Make sure to book in advance. The price is quite reasonable and the service is excellent. I will definitely be coming back next year! Sebastian

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Broken_Iris
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I had a fantastic stay here in mid August. When we arrived we told that there was a problem with our booking, so we would be upgraded to a better room for the first two nights of our three night stay at no extra charge. We had no complaints about that. Then instead of moving us to the original basic double we booked on the third night, they moved us to an even better room than the first two! I can't recall Hilton ever upgrading me during a stay once a better room became available, and I'm Diamond VIP with them. The location is perfect. It's a nine minute ride from the bus depot or train station using the vaporetto system, which runs 24 hours a day so purchase a ticket good for as long as you will be in Venice. The area around the hotel is quiet and felt safe, even after dark when the lonely alleys of Venice can get a little creepy. The only thing I would change would be to make the beds a bit softer.

Reviews.Title: “Book Early”
Reviews.Author: AdvisemeNZ
Reviews.Content: Look no further and remember to take the advice about booking early. My wife and I stayed 3 nights in mid-July. Our room was in the annexe but really I was surprised that the management even mention the 'annexe' because it could easily be seen as just part of the hotel. H Excellent location, easy to find and a bonus being only 3 stops from the train station when both arriving and leaving. Spotlessly clean. Have no concerns if your room is in the annexe, it is really no different from the rest of the hotel. This hotel just added to our excellent visit to the wonderful city of Venice. We would stay again if/when we return to Venice and obviously we would highly recommend this hotel without hesitation. Thank you Walter for your very warm welcome and the sincere hospitality shown by you and your staff throughout our stay. (We didn't get to meet Sandro as he was away on holiday.)

Reviews.Title: “Rated #1, well deserved”
Reviews.Author: SMFToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: This deserves the number 1 rating. Donatello and Walter both went out of their ways, as did all of the staff. Great rooms, with good climate control. Everything was as advertised, and more. In a great location with wonderful restaurants in area. Felt safe and secure, and well cared for. Free internet was an added touch. All in all, a great hotel, and well deserving of the number 1 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Are you being Served? If You're An American in Venice - Yes!”
Reviews.Author: PuterDude
Reviews.Content: We recently went on a European trip that included France, Venice, and Germany and ultimately stayed in a 4 different hotels. None of them came CLOSE to the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in making an American family feel welcome. Highlights: Free wireless Internet. It didn't work initially due to room location so they PROVIDED an Ethernet cable and a power outlet converter so I could wire straight in. What a welcome bonus. So many hotels in Europe say they offer High Speed Internet but when you get there you find out it's often not free (closer to $30 per day) and often only in common areas. The courtyard. Very quaint, clean and quiet. Pigeon free. Don't laugh, in Venice this is an accomplishment. The food is rather pedestrian for breakfast, but the staff is wonderful, friendly and attentive. The owners. They are happy to converse at length with the guests and give well considered advice on what to see, where to park, and just as important, what NOT to do or where not to get ripped off. The staff. The entire staff takes their lead from the owners in making every effort allowed to ensure that those who stay feel fully taken care of. This is true of both the day and the night staff. No drop in quality of care. The temperature. Finally, in Europe, some place willing to cool a room to a crisp refreshing feel. After a day walking venice in 85 degree heat and 80 percent humidity - nothing line a nice chilly room to cool down. Reminded me of home! The cleanliness. Spotless. Everything. 'Nuff said. The price. Given the cost of some other spots within Venice, the rate was quite reasonable and we'd gladly pay it again. The only issue we had with the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo was that we had four days in Venice and they only had 2 nights available - the cost of being the top dog on TripAdvisor, I suppose. So if you're going to Venice, book well in advance and make sure you contact the hotel even if you don't see availability on the website. That's what we did, and the two nights we got to spend there were worth the disappointment of not being able to make it four.

Reviews.Title: “A very welcome experience”
Reviews.Author: muttybok
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice July 21 upon a water taxi and immediately got lost. Seems that the ticket taker on the taxi mixes her left from her right. After asking a clerk in an ice cream store where the Al Ponte Mocenigo hotel was, we were directed to the proper location. Carlito warmly greeted my wife and myself, helped us with the heavy baggage to our beautiful room in the annex and gave us easy directions to a nearby restaurant (Muro) which turned out to be a gem. And it only got better. The next morning we met our daughter at the San Stae dock which is only about 30 seconds from the hotel and the three of us proceeded to have a fabulous time running around Venice enjoying the sights and beauty of this gorgeous city. The breakfast served was perfect with fresh bread, juices, cruissant, cereals, fruit etc. Walter, one of the owners of the hotel was extremely helpful as well and then teamed us up with two other couples to share the water taxi with to the cruise ship port on the 23rd. He did the arranging and bargaining so that we saved some money. One of the couples turned out to be our constant companions for the next 12 days on the cruise - thanks to Walter. In all honesty, this hotel with it's charm, staff and beauty deserves the recognition they receive from Trip Advisor as being a #1 hidden gem hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aly55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights art start of july and it was perfect for what we wanted - a real find. Located in quiet area but a quick 15-20 mins walk to San Marco square. Hotel staff were very helpful and breakfast was lovely (far surpassed expectations, Fruit, croissants, cheese, meat and lovely coffee made fresh from espresso maker) served in the little courtyard. While it has a 2 star rating, its because it doesn't have things like elevators, a big fancy lobby or iron for guests, but everything else about it was 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: crooksy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the final two nights of our Honeymoon and had a wonderful time. The hotel is a little gem - hidden down a back street but incredibly close to the grand canal ferry stop. Donnatello on reception was great, really helpful showing us the best places to visit on the map. The room was lovely, sumptuously decorated and very clean. I'd recommend this to everyone - but beware of the hard beds!

Reviews.Title: “excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kedzie
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful 4 day stay at the Al Ponte Mocenigo in Venice at the end of June. The location is perfect, a very short walk from the San Stae vaporetto stop and one can walk everywhere from the hotel. We had a large room in the annex which was lovely and clean with all modern amenities. We ate in the courtyard of the hotel itself just around the corner from the annex entrance. Breakfast was bountiful with fresh fruit, croissants, cheese, etc. and the serving staff were so pleasant. Sandro and Walter recommended several restaurants nearby and we were delighted with all of them. The area is so quiet and we would go back to the same hotel on a return to Venice. It is a short ride or a walk to San Marco, an area we would certainly not stay in. It's just too busy. One can walk everywhere from our charming hotel and walk we did. We chose the hotel through other reviews we read on Trip Advisor and we were certainly glad we did. Kedzie

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: XOXOMcSorley
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel!! We booked two rooms: A quadruple and a triple, which are a rare find in Europe, especially at this price. We booked 16 months in advance, so the anticipation was incredibly high based on all the previous reviews we'd read. It did not disappoint. Granted, the hotel is off the beaten path in Venice, but that is perfect. It is close to a vaporetto stop and really very convenient. Our rooms were immaculate, the decorations were elegant and the bathrooms are as well appointed as any 5 star hotel. I thought breakfast was perfect. Each morning when we stepped out of our rooms, we were greeted with the magnificent smell of fresh baked bread and croissants. Walter, one of the owners, could not have been more charming or helpful. Our only regret was not meeting Sandro as he was on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Find, Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: johnrd216
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest. This hotel gets great reviews and our expectations were very high. Finding the hotel was very easy. Get off at the San Stae stop, walk to the right of the church, and down the alley where there is a sign for the hotel where you ring the buzzer and get let in. We had room number 3, right next to the breakfast prep area (more on this in a minute). The room was nice. I didnâ€™t find it worthy of praise. It was large, nice bathroom, fridge with mini bar. It was very clean and the bed was comfy. Now, Iâ€™d say that maybe you should ask not to have room #3 if you plan on sleeping much past 7am. We were awaken by the staff coming in and preparing breakfast, making cappuccino, dishes clashing, ect each morning. Not too much of an issue because we got up early to go sightseeing, but maybe a little earlier than weâ€™d have wanted. The breakfast was ok. It was served outside on the patio. In our travels I found breakfast better at cafÃ©â€™s with the locals. This was our last stop on a 14 day trip that started in Naples. Iâ€™d say that it was average compared to the other hotels and B&Bs we stayed at. The rate was great compared to the other properties we looked at booking in Venice, so I guess therein lies the heart of the review. Great rate, easy to find, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: LoneWolf153
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that is away from the hustle and bustle, yet still as centrally located as it is possible to get and within easy reach of absolutely everything, then this is the hotel for you! 60 seconds walk from the San Stae waterbus stop, this is a well appointed hotel on the quiet side of the water. The hotel staff can't do enough for you and there are three excellent restaurants within 2/3 minutes walk and the hotel will make the reservations for you, even getting you in if they are full! The hotel is situated 10 minutes walk to the Rialto bridge and a single waterbus stop over the Grand Canal to the main hotel/shop/restaurant drag that stretches from the railway station to the Rialto and beyond. We were amazed that we were in such a quiet spot yet still so near to the action! We stayed in the annex suite, which was well appointed (if very green!). This separate building means leaving the main hotel building and walking down a tight alleyway, but you feel perfectly safe doing so even late at night. The hotel suited us well and i cannot reccommend the location highly enough. Our room was the one with the balcony in the photo. In an expensive city the hotel offers good value for money...you can pay a lot more in Venice and get a lot less!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AJBGeelong
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good location at the San Stae river stop. We are a family of four with children aged 17 and 14. We stayed in the annex which was beautifully decorated, very comfortable and spotless. Sandro and Walter were wonderful and very helpful with all our requests. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accomodation in Venice. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Virginiaphd
Reviews.Content: The room and furnishings were gorgeous and decorated with the flair of Venice. The bath was beautiful and new. Everyone who worked there was congenial and helpful. We'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Italy!!!”
Reviews.Author: soondix
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in perfect location. Just far enough from the crowds, but was only a 10-15 minute walk to the thick of things. The room was beautiful and the a/c kept us cool in the Venice heat. Sandro, Walter, and their staff are all very friendly and make this place as warm and inviting as everyone says it is. The breakfast here was the best we had in Italy (i miss the apricot croissants already) I feel fortunate to have stayed here during our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is true a venetian gem with great owners”
Reviews.Author: NicknGina
Reviews.Content: We were in the new annex a couple of doors down and it is wonderful. Great restoration job. You feel like you are staying ina house with great room and quality of everything is the best. Not a bad word for it. Easy to get to great location away from the noise but close enough to get to everything. Exquisite decor and furnishings. If you go to Venice stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem that Deserves Its Top Rating”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELWELLALWAYS
Reviews.Content: I have visited Venice ten times and mainly stayed in four star hotels and above.Even before the dollar took its precipitous drop,I was curious about this hotel because of its No.1 ranking on tripadvisor and the laudatory remarks made by numerous travel publications. I could never get a room,even six months in advance,so I booked a room directly through the hotel and was finally able to obtain one. The hotel did not disappoint! It is immaculately clean,well furnished in the Venetian tradition with an extremely large,marble bathroom.The room,by the way,is huge by Venetian standards--and much bigger than the standard rooms in the beautiful five stars along the Grand Canal.The owners are wonderful,warm Venetians with old world charm and civility(even though they are young) !The location is superb---as when you first come in to Venice from either the railstation or the car park,simply get on the correct vaporetto,stay on for two or three stops,get off at San Stae and within two minutes you are at the hotel.The only downside is no elevator so if your mobility is lmited ask for a ground floor room.The breakfast is ample and of excellent quality--cappucino is well prepared.The entire staff is warm and welcoming.The neighborhood is authentic Venice--you will really enjoy the ambiance away from touristic San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place in a Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Al_Q2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in June 2008, 2 adults and 2 teenagers in the annex rooms, second (third) floor. An absolutely beautiful place, clean and new with real Venetian decor (go to the Ca'Rezzonico museum and see the same style furniture you have in your room!). Breakfast was very good featuring home made apple croissants. I am a super light sleeper and on the first night heard noises from the private residence above our room - Walter and Sandro at the front desk contacted owner of the building the next day and immediately resolved the issue, they were super nice and helpful. Not hard to walk to this hotel from the train station - save some money on the overpriced vaporetto tickets and head there on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 49erbacker
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. This is an old building that has been completely upgraded with modern decor and fixtures. Close to the vaporatto and restaurants but not a crowded area. Great little breakfast in nice setting. Helpful hosts. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A place to call home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MTJTraveller
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at the Ponte Mocenigo this week. The location is convenient via vaparetto and walking to/from was really quite easy and enjoyable. It was located in a quite neighborhood, far from the maddening crowd which was perfect for us. We stayed in the small bedroom on the first floor, Room #2. It was exactly as described, small and no view, but the price was great and really we only used our room to sleep in. Venice has so much to offer and the courtyard of the hotel was a great outdoor space to enjoy. The night staff was especially helpful and gracious and made us feel welcome each time we came back after a long day in Venice. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: VT_Professor
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo deserves the high praise it receives here on Trip Advisor. As a solo traveler, I stayed in a generous single room for four nights in early June. The furnishings were elegant, the artwork unique, and the property overall spotless and well-maintained. A hearty continental breakfast (with amazingly good warm croissants) is served either indoors or in the hotelâ€™s courtyard garden. I was equally impressed by the location, just steps away from the San Stae vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal. While I watched a great many tourists heave luggage over the cityâ€™s small canals and bridges, the hotelâ€™s main entrance along Fondamenta Rimpetto Mocenigo required few steps, and the secondary entrance off of Calle dei Preti none at all. Walking to and from the hotel was an equal delight. The immediate neighborhood is quiet, charming, and largely overlooked by the hoards of visitors who congregate in St. Markâ€™s Square, and yet that vibrant piazza, and the Rialto Bridge and market you cross along the way, are just a fifteen minute stroll by foot. It really is the best of both worlds. My thanks go out to Walter and Sandro and the rest of the staff for their warm hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daisy Dee
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on comments on Trip Advisor. and can only agree with the glowing reports. Stayed for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Booked the triple superior (red room) for three adults and found there to plenty of room. Very clean and lovely breakfast in the courtyard. The location is excellent, short stroll to the Rialto Bridge, but should you need it the vaporetto stop is just a minute away from the hotel. Was my first visit to Venice and would stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “we love Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jazzfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in April 2008 in our favorite city in Italy at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo and absolutely loved it. Great location for loading and unloading from the water taxi's. Very clean, big room. The staff made our stay very enjoyable. A big thumbs up !

Reviews.Title: “Annoying”
Reviews.Author: Jackman1
Reviews.Content: Too many great reviews. Really overall excellent experience. Buy the multiday vaparetto ticket-travel everywhere. Murano fun and super lunch at an outside cafe. Walk and boat all over town. Local cafes serving local food at good rates. Easy to find(in daylight), nice staff, room accommodations with style & comfort. 10 min to Realto, 20 to St Marks walking. Supermarket right across canal(vaparetto) for cheap wine & stuff, next stop on the #1 boat. This is a great place to be....

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambiance and Location”
Reviews.Author: Seeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights when in Venice. This hotel is very charming, yet modern amenities and immaculately clean. The Front Desk staffs are very helpful recommending restaurants and providing information on how to get around Venice, which can be a bit daunting at first. The hotel provided your typical continental breakfast with Cappuccino, and the croissants were particularly good. The location was very good for getting around and it was easy to find the as it was a very short walk from the Grand Canal Ferry. If I were to return to Venice, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: psychoteacher
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews indicate, this is an exceptional hotel. Just the right balance of elegance and homestyle charm. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very spacious. We stayed in one of the annex rooms which are just in another part of the building from the main hotel. We were on the second floor with no elevator but Walter helped us get our bags in and it didn't really present a problem for us. The breakfast is served in a courtyard off the lobby in the main hotel. It was a delicious continental breakfast with warm croissants, fruit, cereal, and yogurt. Great cappucino and good service. Walter and Sando lived up to their great reputation for being gracious hosts. Very helpful with restaurant suggestions (go to La Zuppa for dinner--very close to the hotel and wonderful food). The location is great--not too touristy and yet easy to get everywhere. We traveled all over Italy for three weeks and this was our favorite place. We hope to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem - the only hotel for me in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BurnleyDawn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel sept 07. We expected the hotel to be nice but it much exceeded our expectations, the rooms were lovely, the location was perfect, the hosts and other staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our stay was made all the more relaxing by Walter & Sandro who really helped to make our stay special . This hotel is truly a gem and worth its excellent rating on tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city break”
Reviews.Author: sibloo01
Reviews.Content: HOTEL This is a wonderful friendly Hotel based off the beaten track but close to all of the attractions. We stayed in room 2 which was right next to reception.The door lock was a little hard to open and it was perhaps little loud first thing for the light sleeper but nothing that would disturb the normal sleeper. The staff are very welcoming and will do all that they can to make your stay an enjoyable one. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and had everything that you needed to make your stay comfortable. RESTAURANTS Dont bother with the Hotels recommendation of Restaurant Zucchini unless your Italian is up to scratch and you want a limited choice of food options. Instead go just around the corner to Muros.... We both had a fabulous fish meal there and the service is excellent. Dont bother trying to eat around St Marks Square unless you want to pay over the odds for your food. BARS These are very few and far between and it's not Party Central so make the most of the daytime as the evening activities are rather low key. SHOPS Almost every other shop sells glass works (which are truly magnificent) or masks but there are a vast range of high quality designer shops around the Square and Rialto Bridge that would melt anyones flexible friend. PUBLIC TRANSPORT The boat buses at 31 Euros for a three day pass are well worth the money. The service is very fast and efficient and a great way to see the city. The weather wasn't kind to us but we did have one gloriously sunny day. And remember that getting lost in the maze of Alleys is all part of the fun. !! Have fun

Reviews.Title: “The Best...but don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: ginkaNh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful hotel the end of May, 2008. We LOVED it! Our room was No. 32 in the Annex and it was sparkling and brand new. Walter mentioned that it wasn't quite complete as they would be adding pictures to the walls, etc. We loved it just the way it was. Our room had a separate sitting area and both rooms had exquisite murano glass chandeliers and large wood beams. The walls were covered in a soothing green brocade fabric. Wow. The bathroom was also very beautiful and spotless. We waited about 1/2 hour for our room to be ready because they had just that day turned on the new A/C for the season and the one in the sitting room was dripping from its 15 foot ceiling. Walter made sure we both had a glass of vino while we waited. That 1st night, the A/C leaked again and when we told Sondro the next morning he was all apologies. We told him no apology needed. We were more concerned with the dripping water ruining that beautiful floor and the ceiling below our room than anything else! Needless to say, while we were exploring Venice that morning, the A/C was fixed. Our room had a small balcony that could be reached by small french doors from the sitting room area. All of our windows faced the small calle. As I said in my title, Don't tell anyone about this hidden gem! Thanks again Walter, Sondro and your lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice and good value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nokia99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Al Ponte Mocenigo for our first visit to Venice based on Tripadvisor reviews and were very happy. A nice small hotel, just far enough away from the centre of Venice (about a 5-10 min walk) and only three stops from the railway station by water bus. We were in the annex and had a beautiful room with a courtyard view. Our room was clean and well appointed. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Comfortable ... Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 2ndhoneymoon08
Reviews.Content: The maps for Venice are deceiving ... this hotel looks like it's too far away from the action ... I contend it's just the right distance! Especially, if you like to walk and explore the city. Rialto is 15 minutes, St. Mark's is 20 minutes and the walking is wonderful. Shops, restaurants, sidewalk vendors, food markets - blissful! The hotel provides a delicious breakfast daily - the apricot croissants and coffee are divine; security - buzz in/buzz out, comings/goings are monitored by camera; gorgrous accomodations. Our room happened to be in the annex #22 with windows that opened onto the walkway below - nice to hear all that beautiful Italian language spilling into the windows. The bathroom was small, but more than adequate with a rain showerhead I thought I'd only see in the states. And, hot water. I was prepared for small rooms, cold water, etc. in Italy, but I never found that to be the case. We will stay there again next time we are in Venice - just a beautiful hotel and perfect location for us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful repeat visit to Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: travelamalia
Reviews.Content: This was a repeat visit for me, having stayed for 2 nights at the end of August last year. I loved it then and loved it this time when I stayed 3 nights. Last time I was in the main building and this time in the annex which was also done flawlessly well in terms of decor, charm, etc. It was great to see Walter and Sandro again and they were as welcoming and gracious as the last time I came as was the rest of the warm and friendly staff. The first night we ate at Al Ponte. The food is fine there but what is really wonderful is the location---watching the people and the boats going by is a real Venetian treat. Also ate at Il Muro (excellent steak but inattentive waiter) and La Zucca, a very good meal. Stopped numerous times at the gelato place right near the San Stae vaperetto stop and am missing it now. I really like the Santa Croce location, easily accesible to all the sights but not in the middle of the chaos. A good area to explore, especially the campo nearby where families gather before dinner. I'm sure there are other good places to stay in Venice but I'll never find out since this is it for me----can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: oldkenlady
Reviews.Content: Lovely,friendly hotel just off S.Stae waterbus stop. Stayed in annex which was beautifully furnished with venetian chandelier, ornate bed yet modern contemporary en suite. Delicious apricot croissants at breakfast served by friendly staff. A great base to explore venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Enchanting Little Romantic Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AtiyanaNYC
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for our honeymoon this May (2008). Unfortunately, the honeymoon suite was unavailable, but they did everything to accomodate us, even giving us the lovely triple as a large romantic suite. The room was beautiful with wonderful red decor, a beautiful chandelier and a full bath. The location is great, as it is only a few stops on the ferry from the train station. The breakfast was great and the staff gave great directions and dining suggestions. It was hard to think we got such wonderful, five-star service in a charming 2-star hotel. Great bargain, yet not skimpy on the amenities!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCTarheel
Reviews.Content: After spending much time researching hotels in Venice, we decided to spend our 2 nights in Venice here. We could not have been more pleased with the accomodations. Even though our room was on the main level at the registration desk, it was extremely quiet. The room was spacious and immaculately clean. We were about a block or so from the grand canal, in a quiet area but very close to the convenience of the grand canal. The complimentary breakfast contained a good variety of selections. We loved the red orange juice and have been unsuccessful in finding it at home. The entire staff were extremely helpful and friendly. It was a most inviting welcome and a wonderful start to our 10 day Italian vacation. If we get to return to Venice in the future, we'll definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: NW13
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband's surprise 40th birthday trip and my decision was solely based on the tripadvisor reviews - so thank you for that! As mentioned so many times the owners, Walter and Sandro, were very welcoming, helpful and thoroughly charming. The hotel is hidden away but, armed with my tripadvisor advice, we spotted the small sign at the end of the tiny alley which leads to it! Our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable - we were in room 23 on the lowest floor in the Annex. The only slight issue we had was that the room was pretty dark with not much natural light but it wasn't a problem. We had a slight problem on arriving in Venice where, after getting the ATVO bus to Piazzale Roma, we were then told that the ACTV boat service was closed due to a regatta that day - I'm not sure how often this happens but we ended up having to walk to the hotel as it's not accessible by car ! Not good in the midday sun - I would strongly recommend that you obtain a good streetmap before you go - if we hadn't had this we may still be searching for the hotel now ! We ate at some excellent restaurants - Muro, which is literally two minutes from the hotel and is a bright buzzy and trendy place with excellent food; also Il Vagon, which is over the Rialto bridge (about 20 mins walk). It's in a lovely location on a bridge by one of the canals and is a peaceful haven within the buzzing Rialto area. Venice was, as expected, extremely busy so we took in the main sights on Sunday and Monday, and then headed out to Murano and Burano for the Tuesday, loving Burano so much that we went back there on the Wednesday! They really are worth seeing with tiny cafes and, in the case of Burano, a really pretty place with brightly coloured houses and tiny canals filled with fishing boats. We would definitely recommend getting an ACTV pass if you are going to be doing much travelling. We got a 3 day pass on the Monday morning (31 euro which currently equates to about Â£25) and so it even covered our return journey to Piazzale Roma on our way to the airport. We found the vaporetto system really easy to use and a very welcome respite for tired feet - it also helped of course that the hotel is only yards from the St Stae stop! All in all a lovely hotel, we had a great time; not sure when we will go back to Venice, but when we do we would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PDEYES
