Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in the world! Absolutely beautiful rooms, generously sized and amazingly appointed. We stayed here two years ago, were very, very impressed with the quality of the rooms and the amazing friendliness of the staff. This year, we stayed in the "annex" (a misnomer - this is the newly renovated section of the hotel, a 500 year old building with its own bridge off its beautiful courtyard (used for breakfast) over its canal, where the rooms are even more beautiful than in the original section. The owners, Sandro and Walter, are wonderfully friendly and helpful, and seem more like old friends than hoteliers. Especially interesting to me was the quality of their renovation: the wood work (baseboards, moldings, doors, etc., was of such high quality that I despair of ever finding furniture so well finished in the USA, let alone woodworking. The hotel is located within 50 yards of the St. Stae Vaporetto stop, in a non-tourist area (a big plus for us), yet very convenient for reaching all other popular parts of the city. The neighborhood is very relaxing, a good place to go after the crowds in San Marco. Some very good restaurants are located within walking distance, and we were able to walk to several of the Scuolae with the most important art work in Venice. I plan to return to this hotel each time we come back to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: oligarchy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were guests at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo from April 24 to April 26 2008. We were guests in the annex room 2. The hotel has everything going for it, location, service, cleanliness, charm, terrific staff, great morning breakfast especially the cappuccino and warm apricot croissants. Walter and his able staff are very available for giving directions, suggesting restaurants, finding water taxi's and meeting your every tourist need. The only improvement I could think of would be softer pillows. If it at all possible, consider this delightful hotel for your next stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: EllieIndiana
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay and were delighted. Our room, #8 in the main building, had red brocade walls, was very quiet and, although not terribly large, had enough storage space for us to unpack and relax comfortably. The bathroom was modern and very clean. We were fortunate in having perfect weather and ate breakfast each morning in the lovely courtyard. Location could not be better - far enough from the crowds to be a peaceful haven but so convenient to the vaporetto and only a short walk to the Rialto area and other major sites. Another nice thing about the location is that it borders on the Campo Giocomo Dell Orio area which is full of businesses that cater to the locals. If you need a grocery, hardware or drugstore they are all there. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. We had high hopes for this hotel and it exceeded our expectations. That happens very rarely in our travels!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Draupnir
Reviews.Content: Well, if you check all the other traveler's comments on this Hotel, they are absolutely true, this Hotel is a wonderful hidden gem in Venice it has all to be perfect for a stay in Venice.it is: -Easy to get: only a short walk from S.Stae vaporetto's stop. -Rooms: clean and comfortable, nicely decorated and quiet. -Setting: nice entrance with his own bridge and a little courtyard. -Owners: nice and friendly, they are ready to suggest good restaurants off the crowd and easy to get. -Place: 5 minutes from Rialto. -Value for money: a two stars price for a 4 stars staying. We (two adults and a child of 4) stayed there in late January, just for the beginning of Carnevale. When we will return in Venice we definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: barry_bubbles
Reviews.Content: Having booked the Al Ponte Mocenigo at the start of the year we were very pleased to see it slowly climb the ranks of Trip Advisor to No.1. We arrived late at night and found the hotel easily from the vaperetto stop - despite reading of the difficulties other Trip Advisors had. Prior to arrival we had been warned we had a small double room - and that it was. But it was perfectly adequate for our 3 nights, very clean and comfortable and had a lovely bathroom. The furniture was ornate and in a venetian style. Breakfast was good, warm pastries and bread and gorgeous hot chocolate! Sadly it was a little too cold and wet to enjoy the garden and terrace area during our stay. The hotel has a great location, moments away from the Grand Canal, and 10-15mins walk in to the main hustle and bustle of Venice. There are plenly of good restaurants nearby - more choice than you would like when you only have 3days! A really lovely hotel, and good value for a very expensive city. My one minor criticism would be that our room was downstairs by the reception/breakfast area and so people arriving/leaving the hotel or having breakfast could be heard.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven of Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: drkettle
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay 23rd to 26th April 2008 After researching for a hotel on Tripadvisor, we booked this Fantastic Hotel 12 months in advance to ensure we got the room we wanted, we booked the Junior-Suite which was perfect, one note of caution thebeds were a little hard for our liking. The room was comfortable and spacious,the bathroom spotless and the spa bath pure luxury, just what your back and feet need after walking around Venice. The breakfast was delicious and the staff were just wonderful! They are smiling,warm and helpful. Your hosts Walter & Sandro provide all the information and advice, for a great stay in Venice Ideally situated for the Grand Canel , less than a minute away and a short walk from la Zucca a wonderful restaurant, great food and staff One note of caution the beds were a little hard for our liking.

Reviews.Title: “April in Venice”
Reviews.Author: emacv
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice April 1 - 7, 2008 and it was a perfect week. We chose the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo because of Trip Advisor's advice and it was excellent advice. We took a water taxi from the airport and it delivered us right to the door. Walter had given us directions in Italian but our driver knew the location. The location is ideal - quiet but with an opera teacher close by so the students serenaded us in the morning. Breakfasts with the hot apple filled croissants was the most marvelous way to start our day. The local restaurants were delectable and it was nice to return to our room after walking all day, relax for a short time and then walk only a few blocks to the area restaurants near Giacomo Square. The staff at the hotel was always wiling to help us and kept assuring us we could not get lost in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - it's an injustice that this hotel has only 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: WoldTraveller
Reviews.Content: On our trip through Italy this was the first hotel we stayed in. They always had 10 rooms but recently expanded and now have 14. I think we stayed in the "new bit" but that's hard to be sure about. The experience was truly fantastic. From the moment we tried to book, when we arrived, when we were served and when we left it was all wonderful. The rooms are spacious and immaculate. Our room was classically decorated with all the "mod-con's" you could ask for. The hotel is a bit away from tourist centre like Plc St. Marco but you can walk there in about 15 minutes so that's no problem either. We found every member of staff to be as friendly as possible, which actually applied to most of the people in Venice (the only notable exception were the staff at Euro Car hire in Piazza Roma) It's a shame that through Trip Advisor everyone is going to find out about Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo because we can probably never get another one of these 14 rooms again...

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service”
Reviews.Author: l'afrique
Reviews.Content: After a three week trip staying in hotels from Paris to Porto we were so delighted to meet Walter and be on the receiving end of his unfailing courtesy and helpfulness. Never mind that our room was delightful, the waitresses charming and efficient and the breakfast delicious, we also just loved coming 'home' every evening to our quiet and peaceful neighbourhood. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this little gem!”
Reviews.Author: karenw22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming little hotel based upon all the wonderful reviews we read on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The rooms were comfortable,the bathrooms spotless,the breakfasts delicious but best of all the staff was just wonderful! They are smiling,warm and helpful. We will definately stay at this hotel again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “It jst gets better”
Reviews.Author: burtoncle
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to this lovely Hotel Sandro & Walter are always so helpful and make you feel instantly welcome. Nothing seems to be too much trouble to get the answer to any question or query The rooms are spotlessly clean and Breakfast in the courtyard is very Romantic. While we were there it was rather wet so it gave them a chance to try out their new covered area. It worked very well so even if it's wet you can still have their wonderful breakfast outside. I would recommend this hotel unreservedly from our experiences

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place”
Reviews.Author: Puddingclub
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September 07. Found the hotel easily following the directions provided (bus from airport then vaporetto). The hotel is in a great location - easy to jump on a vaporetto and get to places yet away from the touristy busy areas. We had a room with a small balcony overlooking the side canal and it was gorgeous. The room was big and quiet. Staff were lovely recommending great places to eat / visit. Breakfast was lovely however we tended to skip it so we could enjoy the experience of ordering cornetto and coffee standing in the bar with locals! The hotel was just as it appeared on their website and really set the mood for our trip. Cant wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Rare Gem! Clean and cute rooms, nice courtyard, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: jbchristner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for 3 nights while we were in Venice April 9th - 12th. I booked the hotel, as others, based on the positive comments from fellow TripAdvisor reviews. Our expectations were exceeded! The hotel was beautifully decorated, CLEAN!, and the staff was so accomodating and nice. My husband said, "I can't believe this is a 2 star hotel!" The location is great, just off the public water transport stop and the hotel is easy to find (even at night) in a sometimes confusing city! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value - brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline97
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a mini honeymoon after our wedding in Slovenia and couldn't have been more pleased! The room was fantastic with high ceilings and fantastic furniture and the bathroom was large and everywhere spotlessly clean! The location is great - you can walk to everywhere you want to, and the area has some of the best shops and restaurants. The hotel also has a small courtyard garden where you can have breakfast when the weather is nice and the Owners are friendly, helpful and always there if you have any questions. Would definitely recommend this Hotel and would definitely stay there again if we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: NigeH
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the great reviews on trip adviser, and we were not at all disappointed. It is small but cosy, impeccably maintained and very clean. However, the bedrooms are a good size, (we had a large double bed , plus two singles added for two children and still plenty of room). All of the staff, be it owner, chambermaid, or night receptionist are extremely friendly, welcoming, and very helpful. It is in a good location far enough away from the commercialism of the main attractions, but only a short scenic walk when required (10 mins Rialto Bridge, 15 mins St Marks Square).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: DiggoryLondon
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a four day visit to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This hotel was recommended by a good friend who has stayed there 3 or four times. This was our first visit to Venice and we were not disappointed. VENICE do not be put off by the transport system it is very simple. From each airport you catch a blue coach (3 Euros) to the city bus station. You walk 100 metres to the water bus jetty catch the appropriately numbered water bus to the floating & very prominently marked landing station. Then the fun starts finding your way throught the alleyways & over the little bridges to your hotel. HOTEL Booking was simple & easy. Both owners speak very good English & one is always on site. Finding the hotel was no problem. Get off as instructed & walk about 50 metres with no bridge crossings if you go through the back door - look up high on the wall to the left for the small hotel sign at the entrance to the alleyway. This is an excellent location if you have large bags,children or should you find steps & luggage challenging. We stayed in the annex which is four rooms in the building behind the hotel. It was very private & quiet. You will not hear the boat engines here. It was a very quick 1 minute walk to the hotel for breakfast. ROOM was newly fitted very clean & well furnished. En suite was pristine & towels replaced daily. Small fridge in room with space for you to place your own goods in if required. Breakfast was plentiful.(continental) try the hot chocolate to start with & English brakfast tea. There is a guest internet facility available located on the first floor free of charge - handy for flight confirmations. LOCATION - perfect walking times:- Rialto Bridge 20 mins / St. Marks square 25 mins / Bus-water bus station 15 mins / Aresenal 40 mins. There are plenty of good local restaurants - our favourite was the Muro Pizza just behind the hotel (meal for 2 with drinks 28 Euros) Do not be put off by this hotel's two star rating - if you require a good room with a breakfast this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy & enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MadameMonsieur
Reviews.Content: I selected the hotel in Venice purely on Tripadvisor reviews (and subsequently confirming that it met our needs and budget by checking the hotel website). We stayed here for 7 nights (March 2008). Ordinarily, I would not have selected a 2* hotel, but the reviews "sold" it to me. The hotel met and exceeded our expectations - all of the staff were extremely courteous and helpful throughout our 7-night stay, it was a good size meaning that our privacy was respected but simultaneously we were not 'anonymous guests'. The room was modern yet retaining Venetian features, and importantly was lovely and cosy too - Venice was quite cold during our stay, and we particularly appreciated getting back to the warm room in the late afternoons before heading out to dinner. The bathroom was a good size and modern too, and was cleaned with fresh towels provided on a daily basis. Breakfasts were delicious too. Like others' reviews, I cannot understand how this hotel is not 4 star. If I had to be really pedantic, the only improvement which I could suggest would be an extra choice of healthier breakfast cereal in addition to the Cornflakes and Muesli (eg Branflakes or Weetabix instead of CocoPops - but these may not be available in Italy) and a tea-tray in the room to make a cup of tea or coffee (but I think that this is probably a feature of UK hotels rather than a feature of hotels in mainland Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: ysp-ba
Reviews.Content: We took the word of so many of you at Trip Advisor that this was the place to stay in Venice and we were NOT disappointed. We arrived later than planned and so it was dark when we disembarked from the vaporetto. Armed with great directions I took from this forum we found our way right to the front door, maybe 50 yards from the stop. Later we mostly used the back door which was fairly hidden down a very narrow walkway but easier to navigate with our bags and so forth. We stayed 5 nights in the room just off the breakfast nook, RM 4 I think, which overlooks the outdoor patio. This room is pictured in the lower right of their pocket map. It was just right for us - big enough, nice new bathroom with tub/shower, a small table and 2 chairs, a big lounge chair, a mini bar which we didn't use nor did we use the TV. Like another traveler mentioned, you could hear the door bell buzz in the evenings when people were coming back but this small annoyance was totally overridden by the delight of waking up to the entoxicating smell of freshly baked croissants and rich Italian coffee every morning -heaven! Both Walter and Sandro were very hospitable and the lovely ladies in the kitchen were also very personable. But I think what made it for me was the location. It was so convenient to the vaporetto and to wonderful restaurants and gelaterias within short walking distance. Still far enough away from the "madding crowd" that you appreciated the quiet evenings. We did have a special auditory surprise. One evening when we were leaving by the back door down the narrow alleyway, we heard a beautiful soprano voice practicing vocal scales coming from the building right next door. Later, when we inquired from Walter and Sandro who this might be, they admitted the voice belonged to a professional European opera singer but didn't know her name. If we ever go back to Venice we will definitely stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo and if we manage to hear that amazing voice again, I will not hesitate to knock on the door and pay my respects with a "Brava!"

Reviews.Title: “Sorry Folks , Another good review”
Reviews.Author: Startrekers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent four nights at al ponte mocenigo , we stayed in the annex which is in the same building but about a 50 mtr walk to the hotel for breakfast, Umberellas are supplied if it is wet, The hotel is clean and well looked after by very nice people. The only issue we had was that they are renovating the upper floors and the next building which caused some noise and saved us setting the alarm clock,!! having said that it did not really bother us that much as we wanted to be up out anyway. The main peice of advice that I would give is if you are arriving after dark and not sure where you are going pay for a private water taxi 90 euros and it will take you to the door. we took the vaporatto back to the airport for 12 euros each but we would have struggled to do it the other way in the dark, all in all a great trip great hospitality dont stay anywhere else in venice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: swaane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in that hotel last week-end, it was just perfect, even if we had the small room. the hotel is beautiful, confortable, great situation, very nice restaurant nearby. (il muro) Sandro and Walter are very nice, and the ladies at the breakfast are very nice too. Next time we will choose one of the bigger rooms. Only small critic: if you stay in the room on the ground floor, you hear the bell everytime someone is ringing.

Reviews.Title: “Al Ponte Mocenigo was great”
Reviews.Author: mobie0309
Reviews.Content: Two great nights in Venice at this hotel. Walter and the rest of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was quiet and good temperature control, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom very clean and modern. We could not have asked for much more. A very pleasant find!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected and more”
Reviews.Author: Super_Shell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Ponte Mocenigo from Sat 1st March - Tues 4th March 2008. I hardly write reviews but feel I have to add to the already excellent reviews this hotel has. I normally stay in 4 star hotels and booked this because of the reviews on trip advisor. It is my person opinion but this is well worth a 4 star (I know hotels are based on a number of things e.g. what they offer etc). I simply have no negative comments about this hotel. The location is excellent, close to a water bus stop, good restaurants surround it. The courtyard is romantic and beautiful. The room dÃ©cor is wonderful and you feel special as soon as you arrive. The staff go out of their way to assist you. The breakfast is excellent; we had big breakfasts and found they kept us full until dinner. This is also the first place I have stayed at that they have: Not charged for breakfast in your room Not asked what you have used in the mini bar nor checked prior to checkout Actually reduced the rate on check out (we got a discount of 6% but they kindly knocked off 6 extra euros!) We stayed in the small double room, the smallest in the hotel but it was not a problem. After all you are not in Venice for the hotel room! To be honest when we return we will chose this room again because it suited our needs and the price was excellent. We had a double bed, Flat screen TV, Table & Chair, Mini bar, shower (not bath) and wardrobe. I really hope that the hotel remains as wonderful and charming as it is today and favours the more reasonable rates which made me pick it in the first place. This hotel really is value for money and to be honest, donâ€™t tell them but I would have paid double! This hotel doesnâ€™t have the reviews or rating it has for nothing. The only thing that annoyed me if that about Venice was the dog poo everywhere! I was forever watching where I stepped but we had a wonderful break and I would recommend it and more so the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: saadetakcan
Reviews.Content: hotel al ponte mocenigo is one of the best hotel I have ever stayed.The hotel rooms are lovelyI and clean.Decoration is realy very sympathetic.In the morning hotel smells frehs coffee and cruvasain.It is a wonderfull hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem within walking distance of everything”
Reviews.Author: Highpoint1
Reviews.Content: I discovered the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in an article called 'Venice's Hidden Hotels' (Fiona Duncan - 13/3/07) in the Daily Telegraph travel section. It is described quite correctly as a 'cosy bolthole offering value for money', however, there is much more besides for anyone searching for comfort and a little bit of venetian charm. This really is a little gem and definitely made our trip to Venice. It is very easy to get to, only 2/3 stops from Piazzale de Roma to San Stae on Vaporetto 1 and then a 1 min walk to the door of the hotel. We stayed in the triple room on the first floor which was comfortable, spacious and decorated in a simple though almost Palazzo grandeur. The bathroom was warm, roomy, very clean and had a bath and shower. We both slept very well during our 3 nights. Breakfast is simple but yummy - warm croissants, yoghurt, cereal, some fresh fruit, bread rolls, toast and lots of jams etc. Breakfast is served downstairs in the hall way and upstairs on the first floor outside the bedrooms. Its fine if you are downstairs but sitting upstairs on the landing was a little odd. In summer it must be delightful though as everyone eats in the little courtyard at the front. In terms of location I thought it was ideal - close to the centre (10 mins to the Rialto bridge and about a 15/20 min walk to San Marco) and yet far enough away to escape the crowds when you had had enough sight seeing for one day. We walked everywhere only using the Vaporetto to get to the hotel and on our last day to get to Santa Maggiore. I am over six months pregnant and still walking wasn't a problem, nothing is very far and if it is, there are plenty of places to stop and have a drink and rest. We considered getting a 72 hr vaporetto ticket but were glad we didn't. Really not necessary. The hotel staff were excellent in every way - no problem booking with very prompt responses by email, really helpful with restaurant recommendations and bookings and always ready to chat about Venice and the sights. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough. We didn't do gondolas, operas, vivaldi but we did do Florians for tea on our last day and it was a real treat. After a day of sight seeing in rather cold weather it was lovely to walk inside this buzzy tea room full of old world charm. We had tea and scones for two for â‚¬40, expensive, yes but worth it for the experience. And it must be said the tea and scones were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: bk_porter
Reviews.Content: just back from al ponte mocenigo 20th- 23rd feb 08 booked this hotel after reading other reviews hotel location perfect just a short walk or waterbus ride away from the crowds of rialto and marco sq. hotel rooms very plush and comfy ours a standard room 7 hotel staff absolutely wonderful i'll repeat absolutely wonderful !! breakfast = apricot stuffed fresh coussants, bread and cheese yogurts ,cerials, fresh fruit ,cordial drinks,and whichever tea or coffee you like. we bought the 3 day travelcard for 31 euros which gives unlimited vaporetta travel around the grand canal route1 and also to murano and lido islands well worth a visit our first trip to italy and most definetely not our last. will be recommending venice and this great hotel to our friends and relatives and we will hope to visit again soon

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Trips4UsReston_Va
Reviews.Content: Lived up to the reviews! The entire staff was so nice and helpful... a fantastic location. Rooms were great, quiet neighborhood, easy access from the St. Stae vaporetto!

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to impress”
Reviews.Author: huggybecky
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at The Al Ponte Mocenigo. This time it was a surprise for my boyfriends birthday. Walter was very welcoming again, and had arranged for a bottle of my boyfriends favourite wine to be in the room on arrival. We stayed this time in Room 6 - a deluxe room on the first floor with double windows overlooking the small canal that runs alongside the hotel. It was beautifully furnished, with fabric covered walls, heavy duty curtains, and a king sized bed and equally king sized wardrobe with glass chandelier from the very high beamed ceiling. The bathroom was up to the same high specification as the other rooms we have stayed in with bath AND shower, sink loo and bidet. And all of it is so clean! Breakfast daily is a joy - with great coffee (I even skipped my usual cup of tea to have some of that coffee) and a great mix of croissants, bread, yoghurts, fruit and cereals to accommodate all tastes. Walter and Sandro have amassed a lot of Venice travel books over their time at the hotel and they will willingly let you borrow them during your stay. If you do book, try to book direct through their website (or by email) as you will get better rates than through the booking agents I have found (http://www.alpontemocenigo.com) In truth the reason we book here is because we love the place, we know what we are getting, and the service and welcome is great every day, without fail. I look forward to going back in April, this time to stay in the 'annex' which they are renovating in order to accomodate more guests. It is part of what makes visiting Venice so special.

Reviews.Title: “pretty, pretty good....”
Reviews.Author: BobbieDee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early February during Carnivale. It was nice to have a quiet pleasant hotel to return to after the manic craziness of Carnivale! The hotel was absolutely spotless, the staff very polite and friendly and the hotel is really perfectly located only 5 minutes walk from Rialto and right beside a Grand Canal stop. Our only down point was the room location which was directly off the reception/dining area and impeded somewhat on our privacy. No other complaints to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Class”
Reviews.Author: elleandpea
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo and felt we had discovered a real gem. It was a quaint old building with a wonderful courtyard for breakfasts and afternoon drinks. It was quiet and the rooms were very clean, comfortable and well appointed (although, if we were to be particularly picky ours was a little dark as it had very few windows). The staff were very helpful and well informed and we received particularly good recommendations for dining out and very good directions (which are essential in Venice!). It was handy, either by foot or water taxi, to the major points of interest and close to the intriguing maze of back streets and canals which make this part of Venice so unique. We would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good value hotel in a wonderful neighbourhood which gives you the chance to really experience the best of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: BuckBrisbaneAus
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed 3 nights at the Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo earlier this month. We were given room 10 as there were 4 of us and there was plenty of room . The decor is very "shabby chic" with highly decorated furnishings and ceilings. The bathroom was very modern and there was plenty of hot water. My yougest son found the sloping floor highly amusing. The hotel gave us very clear directions and we easily found the hotel from the water vaperetto. Sandro was very attentive and always available with information regarding day trips, restaurants etc. Being winter the courtyard was not used and everyone had breakfast downstairs on up in the first floor. There was plenty of food provided at breakfast with cereal, yoghurt, fruit, croissants, breadrolls, cappacinos and hot chocolate. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: niukeve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Al Ponte Mocenigo after reading the reviews on this website and was not disappointed. Its was so easy to get to from the airport - a coach and a water bus only 9 euros per person in total. The room was fantastic, really clean, quiet and large. We had breakfast delivered to us every morning and staff were really helpful. The courtyard is really pretty and its so close to eveything while being out of the main touristy area. Perfect! Would and already have recommended this place to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: emmaonholiday
Reviews.Content: Book this little gem of a hotel and you won't be disappointed!! On arrival into Venice as you come through customs look left and you will find the ACTV desk which is were you need to purchase your 12/24/48 hours travel pass for the bus/vaporetti you will need for your stay in Venice. Leave the desk and walk outside and take the number 5 bus which is from the second row. The number five bus takes you to Pizzale Bus station which link you up with the popular number 1 Vaporetti which will take you into Venice. The stop you will need for Al Ponte Mocenigo is San Stea which is the fourth stop on the number one. From the airport to the hotel it takes about 40 mins. If money is no object then take the water taxi but it's 95â‚¬ and as the Vaporetti is so easy I would take it everytime. We arrived at the Al Ponte Mocenigo and found it easily after you get off at the stop walk to the left and you will see a little bridge this is the entance. The rooms were lovely and the staff are so friendly. We arrived and I had already asked Sandro to book us a table at a restaurant called the Vini Da Gigio which I heard some great things about on Tripadvisor, he had made the reservation and directed us there easily. What we hadn't known before we went is that Venice is so small and getting about is so easy, The restaurant was excellent and again the followig night Sandro had booked us into another restaurant close by called La Zucca another lovely choice. Breakfast is lovely warm coisants and cereal with gorgeous coffee. Nothing it seems is too much for the staff here and they welcome you to leave your bags with them on the last day after you have checked out which is 11am. Everything is close by even though on the map it isn't it really is only 10 minutes to St Marc square and the Rialto Bridge. I wouldn't stay anywhere else and I am already booking for September. Have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Capejanet
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked two nights at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo, and ended up extending our stay by an extra night. Time permitting, we would have loved to stay longer. Venice's numerous attractions are well known, and you surely can't do much better than the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for its location, good value and general atmosphere. I'm sorry to say that my general impression of the average Italian vendor (be it in a shop, restaurant or museum, etc.) is not positive - the notion that a customer should be treated with at least a sliver of courtesy has apparently not found its way inside the famous boot. However, this can definitely NOT be said of the staff and owners of Al Ponte Mocenigo, who were lovely in every way - friendly, helpful, courteous, and charming. The Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is situated in a quiet spot, yet is still no more than 10 minutes walk to the Rialto and beyond to St Marks. There is a very handy vaporetto stop a minute away too. The superior rooms are spacious and comfortable, the bathrooms are great, and the breakfasts delicious. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nrjones
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel from the beautiful and roomy rooms to the friendly hotel staff and owners. After traveling extensively through Italy, this was by far the best hotel we stayed at. The location is convienient as well (once you are familiar with the area) and very close to the vaparetto stop. If I return to Venice, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant gem”
Reviews.Author: Platinumforests
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I came from exploring Rome to Venice, and the Mocenigo was such an amazing respite from hot, busy Rome. It was quiet and peaceful but located within a short walk to most of the "must-sees". We happened upon a restaurant not far from the hotel, that you would easily miss if not for the little menu table they place outside the restaurant in the evenings. The ambiance of this restaurant had my best friend and I both wishing we had come here with a significant other, instead of a buddy, even more so than the quasi-romantic Gondola Ride. Does anyone who stayed at Mocenigo know which restaurant I found? I never did get the name, and I'd love to recommend it to friends and family. The food and wine were other-worldly. If anyone has any suggestions as to what the name of this gem is, could you kindly send me an e-mail to platinumforests@yahoo.com. Happy traveling!!! Beth~

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis.”
Reviews.Author: Dimarie40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights during our 5 week holiday in Europe. We were delighted with our stay. Our room (number 8) was large, beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The bed was huge and the bathroom spotlessly clean and beautiful. Showering was a little tricky. The Italian showering system is a little different to what we are used to. Difficult to keep from spraying water all over the place! Our hosts Walter and Sandro were exceptional. Walter was very happy to make suggestions and help us in any way he could. The restaurants suggested to us for dinner were wonderful. Location wise Al Ponte Mocenigo cannot be beaten. Close to the vaporetto stop San Stae, within comfortable walking distance of the Rialto and St Mark's. and far enough away from the madding crowd to make you feel like you were in the 'real' Venice. My husband loved the quiet location and the fact the only 'traffic' was on the water. Very relaxing. So much so he is talking of returning one day for a week and staying in our favourite Venice hotel! The included breakfast was great. Those warm apricot croissants are super yummy, coffee was excellent and there were plenty of other choices as well. We loved our stay and cannot recommend this hotel enough. Bellissimo!

Reviews.Title: “we loved our stay there”
Reviews.Author: annise
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in December for our vocation and we had great experience. I still couldn't believe that it's a 2 star hotel: the interior is very well done, the room and bathroom are very comfortable, it's 1 block away from ferry station and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I can't say enough good thing about this place. I am a frequent business traveler so I am very used to 5 star chain hotels, but this hotel is so wonderful and intimate, I would rather stay here. One thing worthy mentioning is a nearby local restaurant called Nono Risorto. It's reasonable priced and offer excellent pasta and Pizza dishes. You should definitely try it. The owners of this hotel is restoring some other units in this building and they are doing a great job. I believe they will continue to be one of the best in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bingerso
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to all the reviews. This was our most comfortable, enjoyable stay of the 3 weeks we spent in Spain and Italy. The location is great - easy walking to most anywhere and close to the vaporetto stop if you want to ride. The room (#5) was sumptuously decorated, roomy and comfortable with magnificent high ceilings and windows, not to mention the great little balcony overlooking the canal. On top of the wonderful facilities, all of the staff, from the front desk to the breakfast crew were extremely friendly and helpful with advice and information about transportation, eating and anything else we needed. I want to mention 2 minor negatives. The first is the shower setup with the small wall near the front of the tub. Not a big deal, but we found it impossible to shower without getting water all over the place. The second is the directions we were given - I think we would have found it eventually, but we wandered a bit before getting help from another client. To be fair, we were given 2 options from the vaporetto stop and I think we used the more confusing of the 2. We will definitely stay here when we return to this wonderful city. Brad

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and well-located; we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tara3056
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in June and absolutely loved it. It was somewhat more expensive than the other hotels we stayed in during our month-long European vacation, but it is reasonably priced by Venetian standards. We loved the location - it's just far enough off the beaten path to enable you to escape the madding crowd, but it's an easy and lovely walk to anywhere you want to go. We had no problem whatsoever walking to San Marco in about 15 minutes and once we saw the crowds and all the kitschy tourist shops along the way, were so glad to be staying out of the thick of it. In fact, to see Venice at her most charming, walk from the hotel in the direction AWAY from San Marco and get lost in the winding alleys and meander through the gorgeous campos. It is a stunningly beautiful place, wholly unique and postcard-perfect. But back to the hotel - the room was nice, clean, modern, and the bed was very comfortable. Walter and Sandro, along with everyone else who worked there, were very friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was so, so good. It was a light breakfast (no hot dishes) but it was definitely a great way to start the day. They had their famous hot apricot-filled croissants, great coffee made the way you like it (cappuccino - so so good - macchiato, espresso, etc), other breads with Nutella and jams, fresh juices, yogurt, etc. The courtyard they serve breakfast in is charming enough during the daytime; when you come back to it at night, dimly lit behind the heavy iron gate, just over an adorable bridge, it feels like something out a dream, like you're coming back to your own Venetian palazzo. In short, it was wonderful and I'd love to stay here again!! (BTW: it's a bit of a hike, but if you're in Venice, don't, don't, don' t miss out on eating at Vini di Gigio. One of the best meals we had in all of Europe!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent smart quiet rooms and hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnCole99
Reviews.Content: Rooms in the Annex were refurbished and finished by April-we stayed in Decmeber. Very smart room, tidy clean bathroom, flat screen tv, draped curtains, chaise lounge, comfy bed, views onto the small garden and canal. Simple Continental Breakfast. It's a 5/10min walk from El Rialto, so reasonably convenient. Right next to San Stae ferry stop. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit to a Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellenem_NYC
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo in March 2006. In my Tripadvisor review, I said I'd found a new favorite Venice hotel. Returning in late November 2007, I was pleased to find the same charming place, the same friendly and helpful staff, the same comfortable, well-appointed impeccably-clean rooms. Splurging on a water taxi from the airport, we were welcomed at the water door by Walter. Since it was so early, our rooms were not yet available, but Walter sat us down with cappuccinos and pastries. Both our rooms were adjacent to the lobby--very roomy with large bathrooms--I think intended to be wheelchair-accessible. All the doors and and bathroom fixtures could accommodate a wheelchair. Guests can reach the hotel itself from the San Stae vaporetto stop without going over a bridge. Even though we were right off the lobby, we were not troubled by noise--the room doors are extra thick. The main part of the hotel has just ten rooms. After two nights, we were switched to the new annex of four more recently-added rooms in the same building. While one must go outside the hotel and around the corner to reach the annex, it was still very convenient. The street door to the annex and hallway is monitored via camera by the hotel desk. Our rooms here were similarly appointed, though the bathrooms were smaller. The annex is one floor up a short flight of stairs. My friends were very impressed with the hotel. It was cloudy and rainy for our entire five-day visit, but the kind helpfulness of Walter, Sandro, and their staff brightened each day, making it an even more memorable visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Latic1
Reviews.Content: What a treasure this hotel is - perfect location which is within easy walking distance of everything, good restaurants nearby, quiet - in fact, just perfect. Everything was spotlessly clean and the breakfast served prepared you for the day of sightseeing. Walter and Sandro were the perfect hosts and helpful in every way possible. A must-stay hotel and one which we hope to re-visit in the near future. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, accessible, and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: shoemaker_2563
Reviews.Content: A Great Hotel, Fantastic Breakfast, and Superb Staff. They were extremely friendly and accommodating. The pictures tell a true tale of what the hotel looks like. Keep in mind its a small hotel with only 10 rooms. We stayed in Number 3, and it suited our need just perfectly. Its easy to get to on the water taxi, and also via foot, once you know the route that is.... We loved every second we were there. Both my wife and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in a beautiful hotel at moderate prices. The hotel is located only 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge, so its location is as perfect as the hotel itself! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HFTSM
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and decided to pick this hotel and we loved it. It was a very short walk from the drop off point of the Vapereto and we had no problem finding it. The location was really great as we were able to walk everywhere we wanted in 15 minutes or less. The room was really nice and the bathroom beautiful. We loved our breakfast in the morning and chatting with the other guests. The front desk service was excellent and we really enjoyed the restaurant they recommended. Our only regret was that we only had one night as would have loved to stay longer. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for the Picky Traveller”
Reviews.Author: KWLover23
Reviews.Content: I'm a picky traveller and tend to research and agonize before I finally select a vacation hotel. We selected the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for our recent trip to Venice and it was excellent. It's a small hotel but clean and comfortable, with a great staff and very good breakfast. The location was excellent. We stayed in Room #5, which has a balcony overlooking the small canal that runs along the front of the hotel and also has a large window overlooking the courtyard where breakfast is served. This hotel is an excellent value and I highly recommend it. Take it from me, book this hotel and relax knowing you made a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K-travel83
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this fabulous little hotel. From the moment we arrived, we received nothing but friendly service, and beautiful accommodations. If you are looking for a big city hotel, this is not it. But if you are searching for a real Venetian experience, away from the hoards of tourists near St. Marks, you will love this place. We especially loved the courtyard where we had a fantastic breakfast each morning. Enjoy your time at this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A so-so Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: Lee G
Reviews.Content: The staff was terrific and location is great. In our favorite part of the city and great for repeat visits when one can just walk and get lost. Although it is a lovely building, we were somewhat disappointed with our Junior Suite. The room was large but quite bare and cold feeling. Also, the lighting in the bathroom was only on the ceiling with no direct lighting on the mirror. It was the only bath in this price range during our month of travel that did not have a wall-mounted magnifing mirror, which would have made up for the poor lighting. The wall sconce lights beside the bed were poorly positioned & had really low lights. One had to tuck in all the canopy fabric situated between lights and bed frame to get enough light to read anything in bed. Hard to find in the dark, so try and arrive early. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of all the praise”
Reviews.Author: glc74
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel is truly worthy of the rave reviews it gets here. Venice is notorious for overpriced, run-down hotels, and the city itself is chaotic and touristy, but at the end of each day of sightseeing, it was so nice to come back to this cozy, quiet retreat. The pride of ownership really shows in this little hotel. It's immaculate, everything is beautifully maintained, and you can tell that the guys who run this place love it. The location is great- right behind the San Stae stop. The convenience of this cannot be overstated. I don't know how we would have found our hotel, had it not been located right behind a vaporettto stop- Venice is really confusing, and not condusive at all for pulling around a suitcase. Breakfast is great, it's served in the lobby (during cold weather) and on the patio- cappuccino, homemade croissants (which you smell cooking duing the day- yum!) and muffins, fruit and yogurt, all arranged "just so" . Don't hesitate to visit this hotel. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: lisa22Boston
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you would want. It is beautifully unique, service welcoming, breakfast plentiful, excellent location, and quiet. Being right near the vaparetto stop makes carrying luggage easy and getting to other places. Our room in the annex overlooked a beautiful garden/courtyard with grapes growing at the window. It was nice to be away from the noise and yet close to transportation, the fish/produce market, and a lot of "local" shops and places to eat. Just don't think the pictures do it justice. It is much more beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: juliew325
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed in the annex and loved it. Great room decorated in luxurious fabrics, day sofa, armoire. Lovely rehabbed bathroom. Main lobby was beautiful great little breakfast area & courtyard. Overall outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Most secerene”
Reviews.Author: Skippy_Kangaroo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to go with Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo based on the reviews listed and we were very happy with the choice. THe breakfast was great, staff were friendly and helpful, making for a most pleasent stay. The room we stayed in didn't have a view and the shower screen arrangment was a little awkward, but the room presentation, cleanlyness and service maked it a great place to stay. I was initally concerned about the location being so far away from the main part (St Mark's square) but the tranquility, ease of getting around Venice and hidden treasures of the area were actually a positive. Very happy with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: Kareb1
Reviews.Content: WOW- we fell in love with this hotel the moment we arrived. It is so convenient to get to. We missed the first bridge and were looking for the alternative entrance, but eventually (only after about 5 minutes - the only time we were ever lost in Venice) found the front gate. What a beautiful place. We stayed in a small double the first two nights and a larger double room the last night. We packed up our stuff and the staff moved all of our luggage to the new room while we were out enjoying the city. The service at this hotel is top notch. They could not do enough for you. Both of our rooms were located right off the lobby but I never heard any noise - not even in the morning when people were getting breakfast ready or eating in the lobby if it was too cool in the courtyard. The breakfast was perfect. We had enough that we did not eat again until dinner. The courtyard was so quiant and lovely. Venice is a very easy city to get around in but if you needed help, Walter and Sandro were always there to help you. In fact, they gave us directions to a neighborhood church so that we could attend mass on Sunday morning. It was very interesting to attend mass given in Italian in a local neighborhood. We cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We stayed there for 3 nights before boarding a cruise ship. After comparing places that other cruisers stayed we had the best deal in Venice. The other people stayed in very nice places and had great service but paid almost twice as much per night that we did. That was the bargain of Venice. One last thing....the rooms and the bathrooms were so clean. Clean bathrooms is a big thing for me and I could have just stayed in the bathroom. YOu will thoroughly enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A big thumbs-up!”
Reviews.Author: cary'n'nancy
Reviews.Content: Not sure what I can add to all the glowing reviews, except to say we stayed here in early October 2007 for six nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We found the location to be perfect. After making the mandatory visits to Rialto Bridge/St. Mark's, I was feeling overwhelmed by the press of tourist humanity. But when we struck out in the other direction we found wonderful neighborhoods to explore. The nearby Campo San Giacomo Dell'Orio -- with its benches, bars and restaurants, along with the beautiful old chiesa -- was a place we returned to many times. [Go a bit further and you'll find gelateria Alaska, with its unusual flavors, reggae music and very friendly proprietor Carlo.] Walter and Sandro gave us a bunch of eating recommendations and the ones we tried were all very good. One had a pesce mixto takeaway -- a big paper cone full of small fried fish, zucchini and a square of polenta -- for 8 Euros. We were thrilled not to have to go through the long-winded and expensive sit-down meal for a change and rated that as our #1 bargain; and with the poor state of the US $ bargains were hard to come by. We took our fish cones back to the hotel courtyard, cracked a bottle of wine and thoroughly enjoyed our meal before heading off in search of dessert. Our original room was dark and my wife felt claustrophobic, but Sandro was graciously able to move us to a larger and brighter one. The ENTIRE staff was delightful to deal with. Since the hotel offered a 6% discount for cash, we hit the Bancomat every day to store up Euros (which were able to stash securely in our in-room safe). This was the final stop on our three-week visit to Italy in celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary and it was a memorable one. Would I stay here again? In a heartbeat, if I can just find a way to teleport myself back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Double_A_71
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be wonderful in Venice. Sandro, Walter and the rest of the staff are wonderful and run a great hotel. It is located in a quiet neighborhood, close to a vaperetto stop and just off the grand canal. It is a reasonable walk to activities around the Rialto Bridge (5 to 10 min) and St. Mark's Square (10 to 15 min). We enjoyed the short walk from all of the crowds of Venice to the quiet of the hotel - it felt like we were on vacation from all of the touristy-ness of Venice. The staff had excellent maps of Venice along with great recommendations for dinner. They were most helpful with reservations. Also, Sandro went out of his way to help us confirm our hotel reservation in the next city that we visited. The service from the staff was top notch. The hotel was renovated quite recently (within the last 3 or 4 years) and it is in very nice shape. Breakfast is in a beautiful courtyard and is a typical European breakfast. Hot coffee or tea are served along with fruit, cold cereals, yogurt, rolls and jams. It was a great way to start our day. We stayed in a standard room for one night (140 euros) and a superior room for two nights (160 euros). The difference between the rooms is the room size and the view or lack of a view. I felt that the superior room was definately worth the extra cost for a bit of a view and the extra room. If possible, I would recommend room #5 (with a balcony), with room #6 being a second choice. Ask about the room views as you book your room. The bathrooms were big enough, but we're talking about European bathrooms. The bed was comfortable and we had all that we needed in the room. I would recommend this hotel for the staff, the location, the rooms and the relative value (for Venice). I would recommend against this room if you feel a need to be located close to the Rialto Bridge or St. Mark's Square (after trying to convince you to enjoy the walk and stay away from the traffic). Overall, we would highly recommend the Hotel al Ponte Mocenigo. We truly enjoyed our stay there and if we go back to Venice, we would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: terrelli
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor comments and were not disappointed. Walter and Sandro run this small hotel with friendly enthusiasm. The rooms are nice and the hotel is very convenient to NR 1 Vaporetto stop #4. The continental breakfast is delicious and the croissants the best ever. Walter and Sandro know Venice and made great recommendations for dinner and also for walks around Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kathryn7
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two adults, two teenagers) stayed here for four nights in late September - I had read about it over 12 months ago on the trip advisor site and booked it based on the glowing reports. It is everything that everyone has already reported on and more! The location is brilliant as it is tucked away from the "tourist" hustle and bustle and yet it is so convenient to get to all the main attractions as the vaporetto stop is right at the end of the hotel alley way. The two rooms we booked (one with the four poster bed (and the other one upstairs and decorated in red) were absolutely gorgeous in terms of decoration, cleanliness and size including the bathrooms! Breakfast was lovely and served in the courtyard. Walter and Sandro were extremely welcoming and friendly and gave great recommendations on how to get to places and where to eat. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesley Davies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocengo from the 27th September for five days to celebrate our Ruby Wedding Anniversay and we couldn't have picked anywhere better in Venice. We can only agree with everyone else who says how wonderful everything is at this hotel and how all the staff are friendly and helpful. Don't stay anywhere else in Venice as this a fabulous place to stay. We were in the new annex and our room had separate room with an extra tv and sofa. All the rooms are beautifully decorated and always kept immaculate. When and if we go back to Venice we will definately go back to Al Ponti Mocenigo - that's if we can get in with all the good reviews they receive and deserve.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as Advertised!!”
Reviews.Author: LUVtheNW
Reviews.Content: It's everything these reviews and the hotel website say it is! We seldom stay twice at the same place, but it will be very hard not to book with Walter and Sandro when we return to Venice. (plus I'd like to explore Canareggio more, just accross the canal. It looked much nicer - meaning less expensive and less crowded - than the Rialto/St Marks area) I could go on and on and repeat all the good things that have already been stated, but I'll just that it is So Great and you can't beat the price! We LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: venices11
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this Hotel, and would highly recommend it. The service is faultless, the rooms spotless and very nicely decorated. Walter and Sandro and all the staff are very very helpfull,and nothing is too much trouble. If you are thinking to stay in Venice, stay here you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, welcoming, cosy & great value!”
Reviews.Author: UKNato
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Oct 2006, and a year on (I'm slow to get around to reviews) still feel this was one of the best hotels we've experienced in Europe. Walter and Sandro were very welcoming and helpful, as were all the staff. We stayed in 2 rooms both of which we're quite small (we had been advised at booking of the size of rooms and that we had to move after 2 nights) but both were equally comfortable, well decorated and very clean. The entry courtyard is very quaint and romantic, the perfect place for breakfast or a late afternoon bottle of wine (or two). The hotel is in my view extremely well placed for Venice. The immediate area is relatively quiet which is delightful after a day of exploring what is a fairly chaotic place even out of season. It is easy walking distance to the Rialto bridge and the bustling fruit and fish markets are not too far away. There are several restaurants & bars within close proximity, but far enough from the tourist catchment. All in all this was a thouroughly enjoyable hotel experience. If you prefer large, impersonal hotels with all the trimmings this may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel! Very romantic”
Reviews.Author: RJB21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights as part of our honeymoon and were very impressed. It was a lovely and luxurious place, ideal for a romantic getaway and definitely the best place we stayed in during our time in Italy -- but also fantasic value for money in Venice. When we tried to book, the main hotel was fully reserved, but luckily they had just opened an annex so we were able to squeeze in there. It had just been refurbished so was of an excellent standard and although you had to leave the annex to get to the main hotel and breakfast etc, this wasn't a big problem. In fact, it was quite nice to have a bit more privacy and sense of space. Breakfast itself was lovely -- lots of choice and also good quality (the two don't always go together as we have found). Our only regret was that it wasn't quite warm enough for us to make use of the hotel's lovely garden, in which you could choose to eat breakfast. The staff were also very helpful and friendly, speaking excellent English. All in all, I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming....Charming.....Charming.....”
Reviews.Author: denise1012
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo was a charming place to stay in Venice. I booked directly with the hotel and Valter and/or Sandro were always quick to reply. I had a little trouble booking for the Secret Palace tour and they fixed the problem. Unfortunately for us, it took longer in the morning for the vaporetto stops and we missed our reservation for the tour. We should have asked someone at the front desk, but thought we would be ok. So make sure you do allow enough time if the boat is full. We stayed in the new Annex and it was lovely and very quiet. When we arrived at the water door of the hotel (a great way to arrive via the airport - a bit expensive but very easy and no dragging suitcases around) our room wasn't quite ready. Walter checked with housekeeping and asked them to get it finished right away. Then Walter gave us directions to the train station as we needed to purchase tickets to Florence for our tirp in two days. We didn't even get lost! Our room was ready when we returned. Taking the Vaporetto from the train station was very easy and quick. Arriving at the San Stae station it is just a few steps to the Hotel and the Annex. An entry way (you get buzzed in) into the annex and a few stairs up to our room. I never heard anyone else, so not sure if the other rooms were booked. My only minor complaint is the tv's volume isn't adjustable and we had a little trouble hearing....but we only watched a little TV upon our arrival to our room after a full day of sight seeing. And the bed (we found this in all our places) was a little too hard for our comfort. Our breakfast was perfect in the courtyard and others have mentioned, they have the BEST apricot croissants, cappuccino and espresso. This was our favorite breakfast during our stay in Italy. The staff were very attentive and asked several times if everything was ok. We will come back to Venice someday as we loved this charming city. And when we do we wouldn't stay anywhere else but the Mocenigo!

Reviews.Title: “our favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: journeymakers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned home after a months trip to Europe. This Hotel was the best of all the Hotels we stayed in! It is beautifully decorated and the location is perfect being a slightly quieter area with good restaurants but easy walking distance to Rialto, markets and other sights. The breakfast was simple and good, and served by smiling staff. Walter and Sandro were really lovely and couldn't have been more helpful. We will never forget Venice or this beautiful little Hotel and it's great owners.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Janeyjaz
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay last September and travelled with our 3 children, who were 17,15 and 9 years old. We decided to celebrate our Silver Wedding with a trip to Venice as we had visited on our honeymoon and had loved it. We arrived at about 11.15 am after a 6.45 flight from the UK, so were feeling very tired, we were shown straight to our room and had a rest for a couple of hours. The room was beautiful and even though it had a four poster bed and 3 single beds there was plenty of room, we also had a balcony overlooking the courtyard and a hydrotherapy bath, which was lovely for sore feet. We stayed for 5 nights and the staff were lovely and the breakfasts were so good, I still think about those lovely warm apricot croissants. This was such a peaceful and quiet spot, it was brilliant to get back after the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas, but within a few minutes were some lovely restaurants and bars. We ate at La Zucca twice and it was great, I must also recommend Al Nono Risorto where the food was really good and very reasonably priced. On our last evening we went into Campo San Giacomo dell'Orio and sat in the square and had some lovely wine at Al Prosecco, my daughter went to the toilet and when she came out she informed us that this was Emma Thompson's local - lucky Emma Thompson. We had a fabulous stay and I was very sad to come home, I would love to go back and I would love to stay at this beautiful hotel again. Thank you to Valter and Sandro and your lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Truely lovely hotel -- don't miss it!”
Reviews.Author: Meritas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel! It is located in a quieter, non-tourist area (relatively speaking), which was perfect for us. You can easily reach the Al Ponte by getting off at the San Stae vaporetto stop. You walk 1.5 to 2 blocks and take a left (youâ€™ll see a hotel sign on the building at this turn) and go down the alleyway to the hotelâ€™s service entrance (back door). By taking this route, youâ€™ll have no steps to climb or bridges to cross, which is particularly helpful when dragging your baggage. Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo has been beautifully restored. In August 2007, we stayed in a double superior room (E145) our first night there (the only room available), decorated in Venetian red. The room was spacious; the bathroom was luxurious; and the beds were very comfortable. Our second night at Al Ponte, we stayed in double room (E130) on first floor room to the right of the desk. My husband and I both loved this room. It was very spacious and quiet and of course, easy to access (no stairs to climb). I loved waking up in the morning to the sounds of fisherman starting their boats outside our window. I knew Venice was waking up. The hotel serves a lovely breakfast outside (weather permitting). Itâ€™s so comfortable and relaxing on their outdoor patio, that itâ€™s tempting to stay awhile and just enjoy a great cup of coffee. You can access the hotelâ€™s wireless Internet for a fee, so if being *wired* on your vacation is important â€“ theyâ€™ve got that covered. Do note that the walls in your room are thick, so you may not be able to access the Internet in your room (which was our experience). Instead, you may need to take your laptop to the first floor lobby or patio to surf the web. (I opted to unplug and enjoy our stay in Venice). Walter and all of his staff are lovely people. Clearly, they love their hotel and enjoy helping travelers experience the magic of Venice. The staff was very helpful in providing us directions to our destinations, using Veniceâ€™s 3,000 alleys. Walter gave us a small fold-up map which you will find in a basket on the check-in desk, which is priceless. While we had had read that Venice is a tourist city, the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo introduced to us to a lovely side of Venice, full of beauty and charm. The hotel made our stay a joy â€“ something not to be missed. Iâ€™m thankful for all the TripAdvisor members, who recommended this treasure. I wouldnâ€™t want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “effortless class”
Reviews.Author: misterniz
Reviews.Content: Only 3 mins stroll from the scrum of the Rialto, here is another world, calm and still. From the brass bell and massive wrought iron gate that open onto the small courtyard, through to all the details of the public areas and rooms, there is an impression of care and attention which must be down to the personal taste and presiding interest of the owners. Don't expect fawning service or overblown breakfasts - this is a place for adults to be treated as such. We usually check out other hotels in town for future reference - in Venice we just didn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, cozy hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: umcariocadorio
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is not far from the train station in Venice, but far enough from the crazy center. The owners were wonderfu and helpful, as well as the staff. Our room was beautiful and totally renovated. A beautiful Murano chandelier hung in our wonderful, soundproofed room. Though the room was small for me and my two children, we did not feel cramped, but comfortable and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Ethelmay
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights here. The rooms were beautifully furnished & spotlessly clean & the staff were all helpful & friendly. The location was surprisingly good, as looking at a map it appears to be quite some distance from the main sights, but the Rialto Bridge is about 10mins stroll & St Mark's Square is another 10 from there. When we checked out, we walked with our luggage to Piazzale Roma to catch the shuttle bus for the airport because the vaporetto(water bus) gets very crowded & it only took us about 15/20mins on foot. All in all, a perfect hotel in a spectacular destination. We WILL be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gmgirl
Reviews.Content: This is such a wonderful hotel. Everything about this place is great. The location was quiet but close to everything. Our room was in the annex. It was beautifully decorated. Iâ€™m looking forward to our next trip to Venice and I will without a doubt stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KMichigan
Reviews.Content: Very charming small hotel! You enter thru iron gates down into a gorgeous little courtyard where we ate breakfast every morning. Our room was elegant and very spacious and the staff was very friendly. The hotel was a little off the main tourist area, but within 5 minutes you're in the thick of it all. We would definately stay there again! One tip we have is to be prepared to get off the vaporetto as soon as it docks at the stop near the hotel. They opened and closed the gates so quickly that we were forced to get off at the next stop. It was a difficult walk to the hotel with all our luggage!

Reviews.Title: “The annex was great!”
Reviews.Author: happytracks
Reviews.Content: I had booked our room at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in the annex before anyone had stayed there, so I was a little anxious. We had never been to Venice before. But there was no need to worry, our annex room was very nice and newly furnished...if not a bit small. We didn't have a view of a canal, the windows looked out onto a small street, but it was very quiet. I loved the location away from the crowds, but close enough to walk to everything. One of the things we most appreciated was the great air conditioning. It was 95F+ the days we were in Venice. Sandro and Walter were, as mentioned on other postings, very helpful. We appreciated that after arriving a bit disoriented after 24 hours of travel. They made dinner reservations for us, helped with directions, and even called to change our car rental pickup time. This is a classy small hotel for such a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “I just can't wait to go back...”
Reviews.Author: donat27
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this page and we were not disappointed. We loved Venice and this hotel made our stay perfect. The staff were fantastic, nothing was too much and they gave great restaurant recommendations. One of the best things about this place is how close it is to the vaporetto stop - no dragging your luggage half way around Venice like every other poor sole... If you are going to Venice book this place, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: connied76
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel inless than a year and we won't be returning. It is still a pretty little hotel in a good location and still is a pretty good value for the price. The hotel is clean and well-decorated. Rooms are fairly spacious. The ac does not work really well and the hairdryers are horrible. Toiletries very poor quality. Most importantly, I think they have gotten a little "full of themselves". Both owners were a little bit snippy at times and weren't very helpful. Upon arrival whne asked for help with our bags, we were met with grumbling and a comment about how he had just hurt his back and shouldn't be lifting luggage- he let my 63 year old mother carry her large suitcase up the steps while he took a small duffel bag. When I saw what was happening and came to help her, he just stepped aside and watched us carry the bags. On check-out day, he just refused to help. On another occassion, we were treated like criminals when we returned from the beach. We had brought towels from the room and the extra sheet with us. He actually yelled at us and called us rude for using the towels & sheet. We didn't see the harm- we brought them back and they weren't filthy or anything- we had shaken out all the sand. The yelling was unnecessary. Finally, upon check -out the credit card machine wasn't working. After 20 minutes of trying, I said that we had to go or we were going to miss our train and could he use a manual cc imprint. He found the request very annoying and gave me a hard time about it saying I had to stay until he got through to the cc compnay on the phone. In general, I found Walter and Sandro to be sort of cold, rude and arrogant during this stay from the moment we checked in. We'll look elsewhere for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Alybyzrp
Reviews.Content: This location in Venice was perfect - the rooms were gorgeous (we stayed on the first floor), the courtyard was superb, the location was far enough yet close enough to the touristy areas! The staff were very helpful and supportive in finding places to eat, giving directions, showing us how to get to where we needed/wanted to be (either the islands or how to get back to the airport) - this was an absolutely wonderful experience and we'd highly recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GDumont
Reviews.Content: Our four-night stay here was great, from Sandro's friendly greeting when we arrived to our last conversation on the morning we left. He helped us find our way, recommended two fine restaurants (the one 50 steps down the street is not to be missed), and answered all of our many questions. We found the hotel easily with his instructions. We highly recommend the hotel. Alf and Lily Winnipeg, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: madmilly
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed in this charming hotel when we visited Venice. The photos really do not do it justice! It is absolutely beautiful, the bedrooms all have high ceilings, lush furnishings and are very cool at night. The bathrooms were spotless and kept clean throughout our stay. The little courtyard where we had breakfast was simply adorable! The breakfast was good, with delicious apple croissants. The hotel owners are extremely helpful and managed to book us a restaurant on the first night. The name was Osteria Mocenigo and it was very pleasant sitting outside by a small canal. After the meal we walked into the nearby square where there were about 25 couples dancing the tango outside. Very romantic! We then found another little restaurant the next night called Trattoria 'al ponte del Megio'. This again was good. Both restaurants were not particalarly expensive, but were good value for money. Overall, an excellent stay in Venice. The hotel is just out of the way of the busy tourists but is still only a 10 min walk to the Rialto bridge. Perfecto!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: jdmiler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after reading all the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor (along with reviews of another 100+ hotels in Venice). The reviews were dead-on as the hotel was perfect for our needs: affordable, well-situated, and very romantic. The owner and staff were quite affable and helpful (we got an outstanding restaurant recommendation from the owner). The breakfast in the courtyard was delicious and the rooms were very nicely decorated and had all the necessary modern amenities. For us, it was wonderful to sit in the courtyard and have a glass (or three) of wine and just enjoy being in Venice while not feeling hassled by all the tourists. We would strongly recommend this hotel and will most certainly stay here again should we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: BarrieBarrie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical European hotel. It seems very cramped but it is not once you realize it has everything you need. It is in a great location (walking distance from everything). The rooms are rich in colour but you have every emenity you need. They are very clean. You have to remember you are in tight quarters anywhere in Venice. This hotel has a lovely breakfast terrace with wonderful food. You eat and get right on your way. There are no lounge areas here. You can walk everywhere or take the valporetta. Remember to eat at the restaurants off the beaten path. They have wonderful food and 1/4 of the price. If you are looking for sun and beach for a day, go to Lido. It's awesome.

Reviews.Title: “I get the warm and fuzzies”
Reviews.Author: Savannah2Manhatten
Reviews.Content: You will not be disapointed. I stayed here just after christmas and Al Ponte Mocinego helped make it an absolutely wonderful experience. The hotel is small, the kind of place where they greet you by name and it feels less like a hotel and more like your'e staying in someone's home (a gorgeously decorated and appointed one at that) and since its tucked away off the beaten track you get a small taste of what venice is really like, small wonderful trattorias down seemingly mundane alley's locals chatting and shopping, you feel like you're the only tourist in the city. I am not exagerating when I say you will not find another hotel like this in venice

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenRen
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for 3 nights of our honeymoon this July and were very pleased. The hotel was very pretty, quaint, and well kept. The inn keepers were very friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and had a private little balcony with flowers on it overlooking the canal (room 5). The bathroom was like new and both the bedroom and bathroom were very clean. They offered unlimited free wireless internet in the rooms (we brought our own laptop). The breakfast in the morning was simple but nice (fresh rolls and pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, hot coffee, juice). It was about a 10-15 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and another 10 minutes or so to St. Mark's Square. It was close enough to the main attractions to walk but far enough away to get away from the crowds. There is a vaparetto stop only a few minutes walk from the hotel which made things very easy.
