I would definitely recommend this hotel to others staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A true Venetian treasure”
Reviews.Author: misslarsson
Reviews.Content: Ponte Al Mocenigo is a gorgeous hotel in a very convenient location. The rooms are beautifully decorated, with silk on the walls, italian marble bathrooms and heavy wood furniture. Our room didn't have much of a view, but rather faced a quite genuine narrow venetian alleyway, which I personally found quite charming. I found the location ideal, with a quick and easy vaporetto link within two minutes walk from the hotel to everything we wanted - and besides, everything in Venice is more or less within walking distance wherever you are. (I especially enjoyed the walk to the Rialto market from the hotel.) The air conditioning was very welcome (and efficient), the tv had a few english speaking channels (CNN etc) and the breakfast in the court yard is a lovely way of starting the day with freshly baked (warm) apricot croissants etc. Sandro the owner was very charming and helped us book a restaurant for a special dinner during our stay, which saved me from trying to make myself understood over the telephone in faltering italian....

Reviews.Title: “Much deserved rating”
Reviews.Author: travellingred
Reviews.Content: We were expecting much after reading the reviews of this hotel and we were not disappointed. It fully lived up to it's reputation among trip advisor travellers. We had our 12 year old grandson with us and he had a single room near reception which he loved. We had room six and it was roomy, clean, and well decorated. The location of the hotel was perfect - just ten minutes walk from the Rialto and a few minutes more to San Marco, yet, it was a peaceful haven from the crowds. I can't understand the few moans about access - you step off the vaporetto, walk a few yards and you are there. The side entrance avoids totally the few steps, but these are not over taxing anyway. It had the most reasonably priced mini bar I have ever seen in a hotel. The staff, including the management were superb. The one small hitch when our grandson was refused a hot chocolate before 11pm by one of the night porters "because the machine is too noisy to use at night" was resolved, although I wonder how this would work in the freezing nights of carnavale in February when a hot drink on return to the hotel is a necessity.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: jRoQuincy
Reviews.Content: I spent hours researching hotels throughout Italy, and we were pleased with all my choices. Without doubt, Al Ponte Mocenigo was the most impressive of all our locations. I initially read about it in Rick Steve's Italy. Then I checked TripAdvisor, and that confirmed my choice. At the time, it was listed as #1 in Venice. I loved the quiet location, the beautiful room (we stayed in the annex and looked out at the street below), the great breakfast, and the friendly staff. I could not imagine staying in the midst of the crowds in the heart of the tourist section. I would recommend this hotel without reservation to anyone. I loved Venice and this hotel was one of the reasons!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: ebusby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo from July 2 through July 6. It was our first time in Venice and we could not have made a better choice! The room was beautiful - even my 10 year old loved the room. We loved having breakfast in the courtyard every morning. The desk is staffed 24/7 with people who are willing and able to assist you with whatever you need - reservations, advice, ... I traveled alone with my 2 children - ages 16 and 10 and always felt safe and relaxed. Venice is a wonderful city. One of the best things about the hotel is the location - the vaporetto stop is just steps away, but you are so removed from the crowds at San Marco and the Rialto that it is very peaceful. You can contact the hotel directly to book and they will make all of the arrangements through email. They were very helpful with my many questions before I even arrived! I agree with a previous reviewer on several points: try Al Nonno Ristoro for a great meal and you should take the vaporetto to Murano, it really is beautiful. Another restaurant worth a try (and a nice walk) is Al Ponte del Megio - you can sit outside right next to a small canal. Another great restaurant choice: Taverna San Trovaso - near Academia - they actually have two restaurants right near each other, good food and atmosphere. I sincerely hope to return to Venice and when I do, I would not consider staying anywhere other that the Hotel Al Ponte Mecenigo.

Reviews.Title: “A center of calm in a crazy city”
Reviews.Author: tsmayda
Reviews.Content: Although the tourist-heavy Rialto is only about 15 minutes from everywhere in Venice, the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo (pronounced Mo-chen-ee-go) is in a wonderful location that is calm and relaxing. There is a lovely, neighborhood "campo" or square nearby with more locals than tourists - - hard to find in Venice. The hotel is only a ten-minute, easy walk to the Rialto area through the twist-and-turn passages you only find in Venice. The hotel itself is in a 16th Century building with original terrazzo floors and high, wooden beam ceilings. There are no "views" from the rooms, but the central location excellent staff make this a favorite stay in Venice. I found the rooms and bathrooms exceptionally clean for those germ-aphobes out there. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fred10Sheffield
Reviews.Content: I heard of the Al Ponte Mocenigo through trip advisor and I have to agree with virtually everyone else - this is a gem of a hotel. All the rooms are non-smoking and are large and beautifully furnished. The hotel is in an excellent location, only about 30 yards from the Grand Canal and a vaporetto stop. In a nice quiet location but with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and about 10 minutes walk to the Rialto bridge and another 10 mins to Saint Mark's. The owner and all the staff are very friendly, speak excellent English and are very helpful and gave lots of clear, useful advice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, bargain price”
Reviews.Author: DreadPirateMo
Reviews.Content: Like many, we found this hotel on Tripadvisor and booked based on the reviews. The hotel exceeded our expectations. It is an easy trip from the train station, away from the crowds, but close to the sights. The building is several hundred years old but the room--second floor with a balcony, ask for it--was beautiful, antique furnishings but a big, modern bathroom. We found the air conditioning to be good, even during a warmer than usual May. I looked at several other rooms and they were even larger and as nice. The owners are great, very helpful with directions. We ate breakfast in the courtyard every morning which was delightful. I checked around and this was a very good rate for Venice. Considering the quality of the hotel it is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: robertbellbrook
Reviews.Content: we are 6 adults who spent 4 nights here in june. the location is very good. it is right off the st.stae vaporetto stop. there are two sets of directions given. the easiest way with luggage is to get off by the church. go down the street to the right of the church as you are facing the church. within 100 yards or less you will come to the first alley on the right. there is a sign with the hotels name on the building at the corner about 10 feet high. turn into the alley and the entrance is about 2/3 down the alley to the right. the other way in involves a bridge and steps. the hotel rooms are large , clean and with a large bath room. we had a triple , single and double and everyone was happy with their rooms. the included breakfast is continental but includes warm croissants , cereal, juice (the blood orange is very good) ,hot chocolate and fresh fruit. it is served in a nice little courtyard. the owners are very helpful and recommended three restaurents that we enjoyed. the favorite was on a bridge and called ponte monegio (or something like that) it was by a canal and you could watch the gondollas go right by your table. more important the food was very good and reasonable. one other restarent specialized in non meat dishes (zuccia) and it was very good and reasonable. all three restaurents were close and in local neighborhoods with few tourists.(mostly locals) . the hotel is in a non touristy area and is quiet at night. we saw both murano (great shops and much prettier town than i expected) and burano(very beautiful with all the houses brilliantly painted in bright colors.) both islands ware less crowded that venice and had many shops. go to st marcos at night to see the church and dodges palace. instrumental groups with vocalist compete at different restaurents for customers. music is great as is athmosphere. beware food/drinks are high but great experience even if you just want to walk around. hotel is in good location for water bus and to walk to all of venice. the owners were great price is one of best in town. double 135 euro triple 155 euros single 100 euros. if staying longer than 2 days get 3 day water pass . it includes trip to islands but not to airport. we took bus (30 minutes 2 euros)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Cycletourist
Reviews.Content: Don't let the 2 star rating fool you â€“ this little gem of a hotel has many of the amenities, atmosphere, client service and location of many 3 and 4 star hotels, at a bargain of a price. We chose this hotel solely on all of the positive reviews we found here on Tripadvisor.com. Here are our observations after our 5 night stay: -The location is excellent, right near the St. Stae vaporeto station and an easy walk to the Rialto Bridge area. We will take quiet over a view any day and the quiet surrounding neighborhood made this a peaceful place to stay. -Our room surpassed our expectations. Nicely furnished in period style, comfortable bed, plenty of storage space and a modern bathroom with a shower with solid water pressure. -Breakfast in the courtyard was fantastic. The quality of the food was excellent; there was a nice variety of cereal, yogurt, fruit, rolls and the apricot filled croissants. Eating in the courtyard was pleasant and we talked to some nice people who were also staying at the hotel. -Walter and Sandro were excellent hosts. Prior to arrival, we had e-mailed a list of restaurants we wanted to try and they arranged reservations at all of them. They were very receptive to our questions and looked up on the various Venice maps some of the more obscure places we wanted to seek out. They were very friendly and helpful with everything we asked them about. All-in-all he positive reviews of Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo were accurate and we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The owners of this hotel are of the reasons i loved venice!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanGirl27
Reviews.Content: What a great place to honeymoon! My husband and i wen there in April after our wedding and it was AMAZING! The owners are just SOOO great and friendly, the capaccino was made to order and the Croissants with Nutella were to DIE for! (apricot filled crossants) You can even request Breakfast in Bed! The Owners were SOOOO GREAT about helping us find restaurants and to get good directions- they were really so accomadating. This hotel is a little farther away from st. marks square, which we liked because it seemed to be in a place more for (the few) locals who live there, so we go to see local italian kids at the nearby piazza and really enjoy the slow pace of life. The rooms were clean and we couldn't ask for anything better. I can't believe it was only 2 stars! i bet it would be rated better in the US. THE ONLY complaint i have was that, though they have "air conditioning", it was barely blowing cool air! This could be because I am from the south and used to REALLY COLD AC, but it did get hot in my room a few times, and this was in april! But, it may be like that in all of italy- not sure. Anyway, this is a great little place and we told Alejandro we would write about it!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PLJDerbyshire_UK
Reviews.Content: I can only endorse what everyone else has said about this wonderful small hotel! The rooms in the annexe are superb, location great, outside dining courtyard beautiful! Breakfast very appetizing, everything you could wish for. Walter and Sandro couldn't be more helpful! More than you could hope for at the price!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Find”
Reviews.Author: doghouse
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews and am so glad I did. It is everything everyone has already written and exceeded our expectations based on our previous experience of hotels in Italy. On the advice of other reviews we took the water taxi from Marco Polo and would not hesitate to repeat the experience if we could afford it. Despite arriving very early, 10.30 a.m., our room was ready so we were able to drop our bags and get out to see Venice. I was a little worried that our room might be noisy as it was right next to reception and to get into the hotel you have to press a buzzer, but we were not disturbed once! The location is terrific - once you get your bearings you can get to the Rialto Bridge in 5 - 10 minutes. Tables were booked for us by Roberto and Sandro at El Refelo, La Zucca and Al Nonno - all were excellent. Breakfast in the courtyard was the best we have ever had in Italy and nothing was too much trouble for the lovely staff. It was very straightforward to wheel our suitcases down the Calle straight onto the vaperetto at San Stae and used the airport shuttle back to the airport - a bargain at 3 euros! If we return to Venice we will not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: T-SGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Al Ponte in April. We stayed in the recently converted annex which is not directly connected to the hotel but it's a minutes walk to the back door entrance. Our only disappointment with the whole stay was the choice of room. We booked early but received the back room on the first floor. This didn't have much natural light making the room gloomy. Rooms are well appointed though and have quality fittings. Location is excellent. As previous reviewers have indicated the ATVO (bus) costs 3 euros to the city bus terminal and from here its an easy 10 minutes on the water bus to the hotel which is 1 minute from the landing point. The hotel is away from the main tourist hordes but is still convenient for all the main sights. Walter and Sando were most helpful giving the lowdown on local restaurants and making reservations on your behalf if asked. Breakfast is lovely. Situated in an old courtyard, which has been beautifully restored. Good choice of the usual breakfast options. The hotel is a super base and aside from the issue with the room would not have hesitated to give this 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1234Alex1234
Reviews.Content: Just like everyone else has said, this is a great small hotel. We stayed in the annex - the rooms were very nicely decorated in traditional venetian style and the bathroom was very modern and had a lovely shower. It is located in a quiet area in Venice away from tourists. This was nice as it's less than a 10 minute walk to Rialto and then maybe an extra 5 to St Marks Square. The Vaporetto stop is 30 seconds away which makes this a perfect location... Breakfast is in the courtyard and was very pleasant. Will stay again and would recommend to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: happygurl
Reviews.Content: We loved venice and were delighted with this choice of hotel. Its exactly as the website and this does it justice. We had the junior suite with little terrace and this was gorgeous however and this is merely from a personal experience I suffered from back pain as the bed was so hard. Ive been to italy before and I know the mattresses tend to be a little firmer but this was extremely firm however dont let that put you off as this was just my own issue. My husband had good nights sleep on all three of the nights we stayed. Anyway, the jacuzzi bath tended to ease the tired feet and sore back....Very convenient to san stae vaparetto stop and I would strongly advice getting the day tickets we purchased the three day ticket and found this great value for money as we used it all the time hopping on and off just with our map and expectations. We walked from the hotel to st. marks on two occasions and found this fine with map from hotel although we had brought our own streetwise map which we used also. Through rialto but the street main ones are highlighted with arrows directing to bridge etc so we only got lost a few times and this was all part of the great experience. The owners were lovely helpful and courteous and booked la zucca for us just a few mins away from the hotel for dinner on our first night. We arrived at the hotel from airport via water taxi and this is an experience I would highly recommend the taxi brought us straight to canal side entrance and worth every penny. Breakfast in courtyard lovely and buffet cereals, bread tea coffe and juices all very nice to start the day. enjoy your stay.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnnKJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for 5 nights in June 2007. We highly recommend this outstanding small hotel if one would like an immaculately clean, attractive and well maintained room, in a good location, at a fair price. We had two rooms, the second room due to a late change in our plans. Both superior rooms were large and elegant, had self-controlled air conditioners, and comfortable king sized beds. The bathrooms and showers were spacious and immaculately clean. We had the large â€œRed Roomâ€� and for the last night the very large â€œGreen Roomâ€� with a balcony overlooking the courtyard. The buffet style continental breakfast (cereals, yogurt, fruits, croissants, rolls, soft cheese triangles, jellies, juices, cappuccino, milk, hot chocolate, etc.) is served in the beautiful courtyard. My wife says they have the best cappuccino in Italy. One canâ€™t help but feel like an old Venetian aristocrat eating in the courtyard. The beautiful flowers and statues made a lovely setting. The hotel is a 1 minute walk from the vaparetto stop. When arriving with luggage, one can avoid carrying the luggage over two canal-staircases by entering through the back door of the hotel. After departing from the vaparetto, walk straight ahead (Salizada San Stae) and take the first street on the left (it looks like a narrow alley). About two-thirds through the street is the side entrance to the hotel. An Internet terminal is available if you request use of one. The owners, Walter and Sandro, as well as the staff, are very nice, extremely knowledgeable, and helpful with sightseeing, restaurants, etc. Great people! We will definitely stay at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: tmack100
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews we chose to stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the New Annex. If you appreciate newly built or newly remodeled hotels, you'll love Al Ponte Mocenigo's new annex. The best part about this hotel is the service. Sandro and Walter are so very helpful it makes your stay spectacular. We also enjoyed that the hotel was a short walk to San Marco square but not dead smack in the middle of all the tourists. We chose to take a bus from the airport to Piazza Roma and then take the Vaparetto (public water bus) from Piazza Roma to San Stae. Al Ponte Mocenigo is about a block from the San Stae water bus stop. Walter gave great restaurant recommendations and directions. The hotel only has about 14 rooms, so book your stay early; it gets sold out quickly. The other great thing about this hotel is the price. The price is very very reasonable compared to the other hotel prices in a high tourist area. The wireless internet signal cannot penetrate throught the solid doors to the hotel room, so you have to bring your laptop to the lobby, or you can borrow a laptop from the front desk. There is a continental breakfast each morning included in the price. It consists mainly of cereal and bread and juice.

Reviews.Title: “The REAL Venice!”
Reviews.Author: SI-Traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for two nights in May 2007. We chose this hotel based on the reviews in Trip Advisor, and thought it was great. Our only disappointment was in the location of our room (I think it was room 2), on the lobby level, right outside the kitchen. Since we spent such little time in the room, it wasn't much of a problem. The room was immaculate, and the bathroom was large and modern. Venice was at the beginning of our trip, and after staying here, we thought ALL the bathrooms would be like this one - no way! What we liked the most about this hotel, and what must be stressed is the neighborhood - by staying here, you truly get to feel what it's like to live in Venice. The people were great, and the neighboring restaurants were all fantastic. As everyone else has said... don't hesitate - just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: ARAC
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel after reading other reviews and would certainly stay there again. It was much better than some 4-star hotels we've stayed in. The alley access is definitely the strangest way I've ever entered a hotel, but very interesting! The only disappointments were that we didn't have a bath tub, the choice at breakfast was a bit limited (though very nice), and personally I go through a lot of coffee first thing so it was a bit of a pain to have to keep asking for refills, but none of these were a big deal. The staff were all really friendly and the rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable. We stayed in the Annexe and having our own entrance door onto the street made us feel like natives, albeit very temporary ones. We got hopelessly lost trying to find our way back from the Rialto on the first night, so I'd recommend keeping a map handy - the "charm" of being lost wore off after the first hour ... .

Reviews.Title: “Thier new annex is very nice”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaTraveller
Reviews.Content: All of the positive comments in the previous reviews are well earned. We stayed in their new annex (a few feet down the street from the main building bu). The room were very nice and they were in a perfect location...quiet at night but just a brief walk to the Stae vaporetto station or a few minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. If you are arriving by air we recommend taking a water taxi direct to their canal side entrance.(the airport docks are a 5 minutes walkfrom the main terminal...try to get one of the classic wood ones). It may seem decadently pricey at 90euro total for the boat (I think up to 6 people) but it is an amazing way to arrive into Venice and it beats transferring your luggage between several public boats.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanDiego3
Reviews.Content: We had just one nite in Venice and were very pleased with our choice of this little hotel. The front desk guys were very helpful, the woman who served us the breakfast was very sweet. It is a cute place, nice courtyard. We had a small room downstairs right across from the bar and I was worried it would be noisy. it was not. Room nicely decorated, very clean. They let you use a hotel laptop for FREE...unheard of. Surprised this is only a 2 star!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: kmcdonough
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the first two nights of our honeymoon and had a wonderful experience. Our room was small, but well appointed and clean. The breakfast in the courtyard was delightful. Walter and Sandro were very helpful in making recommendations for restaurants and even called to reserve a table for us at a popular restaurant. The neighborhood is out of the major tourist areas, but is still within a comfortable walking distance to all the sights. Many of the bars and restaurants in this area are wonderful because they are local places (i.e. no tourist menus) I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Well deserving of top ratings”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small boutique hotel, just off the Grand Canal behind San Stae church. It is in the Santa Croce sestieri or district of Venice, which is not a major tourist area but it is close to Rialto Bridge and access to the Grand Canal makes everything else within quick reach. We had a junior suite and a double superior room. The rates looked like a steal compared to Rome, where we had just come from. The rooms were very spacious, and had a lot of character. They were decorated in 1700s Venetian style. The floor in our junior suite was crazily uneven. When I walked on it, I felt slightly drunk because it caused me to weave. The bed was huge and comfortable and there was a beautiful Murano glass chandelier hanging from the high ceilings. An armoire for our clothes looked like an antique. The room also had a couch roomy enough to sleep on, small tables and chairs and a desk. Off one corner was a small balcony overlooking the courtyard. Bathrooms were very modern, clean, and spacious. Our room had a Jacuzzi tub which we used to treat our tired feet. The hotel is small so does not have room service. But breakfast is served in the courtyard each morning (or by the bar when the weather is inclement). For breakfast, you can help yourself to cereals, granola bars, fruit, juice, and yoghurt and you are served coffee and warm croissants or toast. As well, there is a small bar off the reception area where you can get drinks or coffee in the afternoon and evenings. We sat in the courtyard and sipped on beer one afternoon after we took an unscheduled walk around almost all of Venice trying to find our way back to the hotel. We loved the reception area which has a door which opens onto the canal. One morning, there were deliveries being loaded off a small boat into the reception area. The owners are extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is a wonderful place that deserves the high ratings it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mrawood
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 4 night stay at this fabulous little hotel.previous revievs tempted us to stay here and everything we read was absolutely spot on.walter and sandro were the perfect hosts,more than helpful recommending and booking restaraunts all of which were excellent value.you simply must try AL FONTEGO DEI PESCATORI if you love fish you ll love it.The airport transfer was seemless thanks to step by step instructions but it could not be more conveient for all areas of venice,local and touristy.The housekeeping was superbly spotless and the ladies so very friendly. our room was beautiful and quiet ,a luxury waterfront hotels dont have.all in all we would recommend this lovely little place to any one , no matter what star rating your used to! ps try room 10 it s huge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: M Turner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2007 for 3 nights. Our room was very nice and fairly quiet. The bathroom was a decent size and spotless. The hotel is pretty small (ten rooms I think) which suited us. It has a very pleasant courtyard where you can have breakfast if the weather's ok. Luckily for us it was warm when we were there. The location is reasonably central - about 5-10 minute walk from the Rialto bridge. It's down a small side street but still very close to the Grand Canal. To be honset I thought it was better staying here than somewhere more central given how busy Venice is. I think we had the best of both worlds - not too far from the main sights but still quiet. There are some good local restaurants nearby which I would recommend rather than going somehwere more on the beaten track. Just ask the staff for recommendations. Overall, I thought it was good value in what is often an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Make a reservation, but with reservations”
Reviews.Author: mrsg55
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. Lovely hotel, lovely area, nice neighborhood piazzas, near the fabulous Zucca restaurant, very helpful Walter and Sandro. Be advised however, that not all rooms look like the pictures on the Trip Advisor Web Site. Some are on the first floor, near reception and breakfast area. Some upstairs (rooms 7 and 8) have a view of a wall. That being said, we did not spend all that much time in the room so were able to overlook small rooms and "wall view" and concentrate and all the positive aspects of the hotel. Dinner reservations were made, opera reservations were made. There is 1 laptop for customer use, which is nice to keep in touch. We loved the area and would definitely stay there again. Note: ask for discount for cash payment!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: LizaIreland
Reviews.Content: All the excellent reviews about this hotel are true. We loved everything about it. Its location is perfect only a few minutes walk to the Rialto but far enough away to offer some relief from the crowds. I would recommend it to anyone going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: eric85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo based on the Trip Advisor reviews and we absolutely enjoyed our stay. The hotel is quiet and quaint and away from the hustle and bustle of of the crowds. Upon arrival we were greeted with a warm welcome and immediately made to feel at home. The hotel is also very easy to find. If arriving at Marco Polo airport, exit baggage claim and turn left to purchase tickets for the bus and vaparatto (water bus). You can purchase tickets for both at the fifth window. Take the #5 local bus or the #1 express bus to Venice where you will need to catch a vaparatto to the hotel. Take the #1 vaparatto and go four stops to San Stae. Upon exiting at San Stae, you will see a large church. The hotel is directly behind the church. If our travels ever take us back to Venice, we will definitely stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: RuthLeicester
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on tripadvisor recommendations, and we were delighted with it - we could not afford it in high season, but it was substantially discounted in January. The staff were friendly and welcoming, our room was marvellous - we're usually budget travellers, so the facilities here were completely luxurious - pristine, elegant and comfortable, incredibly spacious. We were even impressed with the breakfast - we usually avoid hotel breakfasts in Italy and eat at a bar, but we got decent espresso and warm pastries. The location was good - in a quiet part of Santa Croce, not far from the Grand Canal - but we walked everywhere. We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Please, don't ever change!”
Reviews.Author: Marcia_Teles
Reviews.Content: Well, what can we say that hasn't been said about Al Ponte Mocenigo? It surely deserves the title "Best Hidden Gem"! For those (like my husband and I) who aren't crazy about those huge, crowded, american-style hotels; who love small, charming, private-almost-secret places; who treasure a personal, friendly and professional service; who desire to get the most for their money - it's impossible to find anything better. We got really surprised (and a little scared too, honestly) when we arrived at Saint Stae vaporetto station and saw that one-meter-narrow street with the sign "Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo - Two-Star" on the left. That was the small back entrance for the hotel - but also the most convenient one. Ten seconds later, we were amazed by our choice - for which we will always be greatful to TripAdvisor.com. The detailed discription of the hotel you can find in the other reviews - they are all true. But we couldn't help saying one thing to the people from Al Ponte Mocenigo: don't ever change! Knowing that a hotel like that can exist makes travelling a better and more encouraging experience. P.S.: Just one thing: if you really MUST be close to Piazza San Marco and other main attractions - this meaning you are not able to take a 10 or 15-minute walk through the narrow, crooked and wonderful streets of Venice - then you should choose something else. Sorry for you...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with lots”
Reviews.Author: SLMaidenhead
Reviews.Content: So much has been written about this lovely little hotel it's difficult to know what to add! For a beautifully decorated, conveniently located, friendly excellent value hotel this is ideal. Perhaps if you are only in Venice for one night and want canal views, see all the sights in one day and need a range of big hotel facilities then I guess you may prefer stay close to St Marks Sq. But if like us you don't want to be surrounded by hoards of tourists day and night, and are happy to walk around and explore a lot of the city then this is a perfect place to stay, still handy for the vaporetto stop and a chance to see the rest of Venice too. All the rooms are beautifully decorated with lovely fabrics and wall coverings and spotlessly clean bathrooms. Couldn't hear sounds of any other guests inside the hotel even though it was fully booked except when we saw others at breakfast. The only sounds from outside were a couple of people who lived in the same alley leaving for work in the morning and when a dog gave a quick bark! We stayed in the large RED suite upstairs (Room 9). Impressive room but unfortunately there is little daylight from outside because of the narrow alleyway so you mostly need a light on even during the day, but was 'cosy' in the evening. The lovely housekeeping lady kindly let us glimpse through the doors of some other rooms upstairs when she was cleaning so thought I would give you a quick summary based on what we saw and from visitors photos already on this website. Hope I have remembered correctly but best to check with Walter and Sandro if you want something specific): Room 10 - Large green suite on website-overlooks courtyard. Room 9 - Large Red suite - small windows onto alleyway Room 8- (didn't see inside) windows overlook alleyway Room 7 - Small but very pretty gold room - overlooks alleyway Room 6 - Green room overlooks little canal at the side of the hotel Room 5 - Green room + balcony overlooking canal (and think also overlooks the courtyard?) Downstairs room 4 is the gold? room overlooking the courtyard ( ut is next to the breakfast area). If we stay at the hotel again then would prefer a room with more daylight such as 5/10 or go for the gold decor in 7/4. Other useful bits: Do book La Zucca in advance - it was already full 2 of the nights we were there so we missed out. The hotel has good 'credit card' sized fold-up Venice maps at reception. There is a little Co-op supermarket in the square Sant Giacomo dell'Orio nearby. .....ENJOY YOUR STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bateacher
Reviews.Content: We (middle aged couple) stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March. We chose this hotel because of the wonderful reviews on tripadvisor. We loved our stay here--it really is as good as people say it is. We contacted the hotel ourselves by e-mail and all our inquiries were answered promptly and professionally. Venice is an expensive city, but we were quite satisfied with the rate we were given and felt we got good value for our money. The hotel is a quick vaporetto ride, or walk to most of the sites. The rooms are beautifully decorated, we had one of the smaller and less expensive rooms right near the breakfast room, but even so, it was roomy, comfortable and very quiet. It even had a small sofa which was a nice plus. The bathroom is completely modern and spotless with thick towels and a towel warmer. A wonderful breakfast is included, that delicious "red" orange juice, coffee (cappucino, Americano, or Italiano) or tea, warm apricot filled croissants and rolls, jam, fresh fruit, cereal, and biscotti. They have a beautiful courtyard for breakfast in the warm season. All the staff were very helpful and friendly, and spoke English very well. They provided excellent directions for finding the hotel and recommended great restaurants that were nearby and within our budget. The owners patiently answered all my questions and were very gracious hosts. My only regret is that we only had 2 nights! I would gladly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kt9
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Mocenigo would have to be the best place I have stayed. I would defiantly go back and recommend it to everybody going to Venice. The service was fabulous and friendly. The rooms were so beautifully decorated and looked after. Breakfast was a lovely start to the day. Location was great, close to train station and public transport. Venice is such a wonderful place and staying at this small intimate hotel made it even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ckthomas00
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. We arrived early (9:00 am) to Marco Polo Airport and took the bus for $12 euro to the Piazza Roma. From there, we took the vaporatto to the St. Stea stop (about 3 stops from the Piazza), walked over one bridge and you are there. Lucikly, a nice local couple helped us find the entrance, as the sign is really small. Walter was very welcoming and our room was ready within 15 minutes even though we arrived very early. We stayed on the second floor and had a balcony overlooking the canal. The room was very clean and nice - huge bathroom for Europe. The bed was a bit hard, but still comfortable. The bathroom had a hair dryer for the ladies; however the air was not hot - more warm. I accidently burned the plastic on my curling iron by using an adapter and plugging it into the 220v outlet - so beware women! The 115v outlet works just fine for most small appliances. Be sure to ask Walter for dinner recommendations. We ate at a GREAT place that was not touristy and very affordable. The breakfast and cappicino were great! The seating area is small, so I told the server what I wanted and she brought it up to the room within 5 minutes. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel - it is a great value for the money and I hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ronda123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the reviews posted on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We had room #10 which is the jr suite. It's beautiful, large and comfortable. Also, very quiet. The hotel gave us directions to their back entrance to avoid bridges when arriving with our luggage. It was great and convenient. Being so close to the St Stae vaporetto stop made it extremely convenient to all the sights, etc. The only thing this hotel lacks is canal views but to be honest I didn't mind one bit because the hotel is so nice. And the price was extremely reasonable for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel away from the city center”
Reviews.Author: KMG410
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite in March 2007 - the room was very large, good deal for the price paid (160 euro), as Venice tends to be very pricey! The bed was very uncomfortable, but we found that to be a common factor in each of the 3 hotels we visited in Italy. Hotel was extremely quiet (we often wondered if anyone else was even staying there!), breakfast was good, staff is very accomodating and very helpful with directions. The only negative to this hotel is that it is a 10-15 minute walk to where all the action is in Venice (if you don't get lost, which is very easy to do!). If we were to visit Venice again, we would definitely stay somewhere closer to the Rialto or Piazza San Marco. But, if you want to save a little money, this is definitely a great hotel to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: lupuscanis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for 4 nights in August 2006. Taking into account the TripAdvisor revisions, we made our decision to stay at this accommodation. We preferred the double superior room with a small balcony overlooking the channel (room No. 5). Booking that specific room was no problem at all. We immediately received the booking confirmation. Getting to the hotel is pretty easy if you arrive at Marco Polo Airport. There are several possibilities to get to Venice from that location. We took the ALILAGUNA boat service to join in the special atmosphere aligned with water-governed cities like Venice. Approaching Venice via Murano, Lido and San Marco is worth a try. We enjoyed it very much. Even though changing to the vaporetto at San Marco we arrived pretty early at Al Ponte Mocenigo. There should not be any problem to find the hotel taking the vaporetto and departing at St. Stae. Even though we were a bit early, it was no hassle to Walter giving us access to our requested room, which already had been cleaned. The room itself was lovely furnished and spotlessly clean with an immaculate bathroom. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony of this room in the evenings, having a glass of wine and recovering from the noise and hassles of the day. The breakfast included was plentifuly and good. Beside the friendliness of the staff and the quality of the accommodation, it is the location in a quiet part of the town of Venice that really makes it worth staying at. It is only a ten minutes walk from Rialto Bridge but can easily be accessed by the vaporetto. We loved the quiet and relaxed atmosphere of this hotel, the friendliness and helpfulness of the owners and the staff. We would like to recommend it to anybody who likes staying in a distinguished and reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Chuzz
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a wonderful city. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel - in fact we have booked it for our daughter's honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “hotel perfection!”
Reviews.Author: SurreySilversurfer
Reviews.Content: Spent four days (3 nights) at this hotel for my husband's 70th birthday. I booked flights and hotel direct from the website and having read all the reports on Trip Advisor 's recommendations, was so pleased that everything lived up to expectations. The owners gave us all details of directions to the hotel from Marco Polo airport which were very precise and also directions to the hotel which we found first time!! There is a small alleyway which takes you to the back entrance but it was still worth the squeeze to the back door and, of course, the hotel was only minutes away from the vaporetto bus stop which was a bonus!! We bought a 30 euro ticket at the airport which entitles you to free bus and water bus journeys so we had our money's worth by jumping on the bus daily to experience the views and culture of Venice. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to friends as good value and we hope to return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HogsBreath_01
Reviews.Content: Like most other people who stay here, I booked this hotel due to the fantastic reviews from other Trip Advisor members. With such high expectation levels, disappointment is always in the back of your mind............but not here. Let's not kid anyone, it is only a 2 star, so if you want and need all the trimmings, you're not going to get them. However, for a 2 star, it is quite simply fantastic. Great authentic and immaculate rooms, a beautifully clean and quite spacious bathroom, a lovely little courtyard and the super helpful hoteliers of Walter and Sandro (we were never sure which one was which), who were as good at providing knowledge and recommendations on the city as they were at making you feel comfortable and relaxed. They've made the hotel what it is and have created a real gem. With the vaporetto (water bus) stop only 100 metres from the hotel, it could'nt be more convenient. Al Ponte Mocenigo is tucked away from the main hustle and bustle of the city, which is lovely, yet it's still only a 5 to 10 minute walk from the Rialto and a 15 minute walk to St Marks Square. Check out the fruit and fish market on the way to the Rialto - definitely worth a nose. We paid 90 euros a night (6% discount if you pay cash), for 4 nights at the end of February in a superior double room. Check out the prices of other hotels in Venice and see how Al Ponte Mocenigo compares - it can't be touched! To sum up; a fantastic place to stay in the heart on Venice, where you are superbly looked after, and it won't cost you a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “so pretty”
Reviews.Author: wannatravelmuch
Reviews.Content: This place is a little hard to find, but then venice is not the easiest place to navigate. the rooms ar beautiful and the owners are very pleasant. the bathrooms are spotless. very impressed. I actually injured myself when I was in Venice and the partner who was present was very nice, helpful and hospitable to myself and my family. this is about 20 min walk from main square. nice place for the price. there are 2 entrances. the one with the gate looks like the back entrance, and the other side is VERY NARROW and ends at a sort of canal. the door is on the side so don't think that it is not there.

Reviews.Title: “Numero Uno hotel, Reasonably priced & Great owners/staff”
Reviews.Author: A-square
Reviews.Content: Walter, Sandro and the staff were very friendly. The service was excellent. On the first night we arrived, Walter personally apologized because the room promised to us was still occupied due to the other guest extending their stay. We're given room no.2 behind the reception counter, small but we're still amazed with the interior - very unique, it's like the venetian decor in the old books, but modern. The next morning, Sandro - the other owner, also came to us and apologize for the room booking problem. We felt that they're really sincere. The next day, we got a room with a bath tub, a rare room in venice and probably europe with the same quality. We liked the interior design, furniture and all the details they put in the design (such as the Al Ponte Mocenigo logo on the light switch). Breakfast was plenty. They serve the croissant warm and crispy. This is not done in other hotels where they will just serve without reheating. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay. We'll definitely come back and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenHorsley
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after 3 nights at this lovely hotel - booked entirely after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We most certainly weren't disappointed and this hotel more than lived up to our expectations. We stayed in the junior suite, Room no 10, with a little balcony overlooking the charming little courtyard. The room was very spacious with a huge four posted bed, sitting area and wardrobe and the bathroom too was huge with beautiful fittings and a very powerful shower. Walter and Sandro made us very welcome indeed and it was nice chatting to them during our stay - they are very friendly and very helfpul. As previous reviewers have commented, the breakfasts were lovely and the smell of warm croissants and coffee in the mornings were so yummy! My only negative comment would be that the bed was very firm and the pillows too but that is just personal and everyone is different. The room was spotlessly clean and toiletries were provided in the bathroom which was a nice touch. We found the hotel easy to find on arrival at Marco Polo - once through the baggage hall turn left in the arrival halls and you will see the ticket windows on the left hand side - we bought tickets for the blue ATVO bus at Euro 3 to Piazzale Roma - leave the terminal building and the bus stop is just outside on the right -you can even buy tickets from a machine there and from the bus conductor - make sure you validate them in the little yellow box before getting on the bus. The journey takes about 20 mins to the bus station. There is was a little more confusing as either we missed the signs or there weren't any! Anyway, make your way to the left of the bus station area and there are some ticket offices. We bought tickets for the no 1 vaporetto at Euro 6 each. Make your way from the ticket office to the right, over a little bridge and down onto the canal front. The stop for no 1 is to the left. Once at San Stae the hotel is just 30 metres from the stop and the directions provided by the hotel were very accurate. We enjoyed being in a quiet part of town after all the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas at Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. The hotel is very conveniently located for walking to the bridge, about 10 minutes looking at the shops along the way! On Sunday everywhere was just heaving with tourists and it was quite a fight to find our way through them over the bridge and into St Marks Square. It was just wonderful though to see so many in costume for the carnival and the atmosphere was so happy - those dressed up were only too willing to be photographed and were terribly patient with all the tourists. Just fascinating to sit and watch them in St Marks Square. There are coffee shops all over the place with varying prices for a cappuccino - necessary stops for a toilet too at times! We had a nice pizza one lunchtime at Il Nono which is very close to the hotel and one evening had a delicious meal at Bistrot de Venise - pretty expensive but excellent food with a very comprehensive menu and we really enjoyed it. We ate a couple of times at restaurants on the canal by the Rialto Bridge - the food was Ok, the service very good but we felt they catered just for the tourists which is hardly surprising. As my husband wasn't well when we came to leave, we splashed out on a water taxi from the San Stae stop back to the airport at a fixed cost of Euros 90 - well worth it and something totally different - it took 20 minutes but there is quite a long walk from the boat to the terminal building. All in all we had a really lovely time and cannot recommend this little gem of a hotel more highly. It is hardly surprising that it is always fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and service exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyloversSmithers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this quiet hotel, off the beaten track in Venice (which in Venice, is really saying something). The owners and staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Walter and Sandro answered any questions that we had, and gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants. The room we had was very nice, with a ceiling at least 15 feet high, and decor to match Venice. A big bonus is that it is one of the few places in Venice with a bathtub. As well, the second cappuccino in the morning was greatly appreciated. A first-rate experience all around. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “great place, fine location”
Reviews.Author: JSMountVernon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in May 2006. Our room and bathroom were very nice, and spotlessly clean, though some Americans may have considered them small. We met only one of the hotel's owners, and had a very good impression of him. Frankly, all of the favorable comments in these reviews seem well-founded. My only addition is that the hotel is a short (and picturesque) walk to the vaparetto station. (A vaparetto is Venice's equivalent of a city bus.) The vaparetto is cheap, fun, and easy to use, even if you don't speak Italian, but watch the signs so that you don't miss your stop. The vaparetto can take you to Saint Mark's Square, to the Gritti Palace for a super-expensive dinner, or anyplace else in Venice. In short, Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pat1252
Reviews.Content: Had a really great stay at this hotel, the owners Walter and Sandro kept the place in top condition and where very helpful Lovely big bedroom and new bathroom. Small bar and breakfast area but you could have your breakfast delivered to your door at no extra cost. The water bus is a 4 min walk and the centre a 14 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews say it all.”
Reviews.Author: shamrocker74
Reviews.Content: Just book it. Location, service, cleanliness all top class. Couldn't imagine a better place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews win out!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy14
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel enough. It fulfilled all our expectations through other reviews. We had 4 nights in the Junior suite, which was lovely. The breakfasts were great; the senora made excellent coffee. Walter & Sandro helped out in every way possible - we even managed to get into La Zucca, which was excellent. The only negative I can possibly think of is that there is a lady who lives above that room who had a liking for walking on her floor in high heels early in the morning & all we could hear was clip-clop above us. Good news for fans of this hotel is that Walter & Sandro are extending (must be in another building) so there will be more rooms available. We didn't have a problem with the night watchman - he was OK. We did have a dreadful meal on our last night at a nearby pizza joint out the back way (some name like Tre Archi) in an alley off the Campo San Giacamo dell'Orio.

Reviews.Title: “If you get the right room this is a gem”
Reviews.Author: blath
Reviews.Content: Having done my research I was delighted to be able to book 2 rooms for the weekend of 26 January 07. We arrived at Treviso Airport at 8.40 pm and reached the hotel by 9.45 pm without difficulty.The hotel location is excellent. It is near to the Vaporetta stop and within near walking distance to Rialto. We had rooms 5 and 8 which were excellent,warm,spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. Sandro and Walter take great pride in their hotel and go to every effort to make their guest feel welcome.They were happy to make restaurant reservations for us and to share their knowledge with us.They certainly added to our very enjoyable weekend.I have no reservations in recommending this hotel and I will look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think of staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: PAX12
Reviews.Content: We researched extensively through Tripadvisor & as such were guided by the comments re this Hotel. You could not ask for better! Great service, awesome rooms, fantastic location, great value. Our thanks to Walter & Sandro for helping to make our stay in Venice truly memorable. If you are visting Venice then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: fawnio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolute perfection. There was an initial problem with our rooms so as an apology the owners put us in one of the hotels biggest rooms at no extra cost, for 2 nights of our 4 night stay. I believe this room was one of the suites and from the pictures you can probably see that it is magnificent. The second room, the canal view, was slightly smaller but it was also beautiful. The staff were so polite and helpful, and I also do not understand what the previous reviewers problem was with the night watch staff. They were all very helpful and courteous, Including the breakfast and cleaning staff. The breakfast was delightful and on one morning we had breakfast in bed at no extra cost! You will never eat nicer croissants for breakfast! The hotel is slightly difficult to find, especially as we arrived at night. When you get off the vaporetto at the san stae stop there is a small bridge to your left which leads to a small alley. This is where the hotel is. The Hotel is perfectly located in a quiet area only 5 minutes walk away from the rialto bridge and markets. You will definitely have an amazing stay at the hotel. Walter and Sandro will do everything in their power to help you with any requests so do not hesitate to ask them. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: fernga
Reviews.Content: We could not believe how beautiful our room was- we booked the triple room (for two of us) and it was beautiful, v. romantic. A little bridge leads over a canal to the hotel which is really cute. it is also max. a 10 minute meander to the Rialto bridge, loads of good eateries and bars nearby. V. handy for the vaporetto stop also, literally 100m away! Really friendly service and would highly, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Giotto'sparents
Reviews.Content: This small hotel exceeded our expectations. The owner is on site every day and is personable and very helpful. Our room was lovely with a tiny balcony overlooking a narrow canal. Room was also large and nicely decorated. The only drawback in the bathroom is the narrow panel that serves as a shower curtain and is not adequate to contain spray from taking a shower. The bathroom was quite large and very new. We were there in December so the weather was chilly, otherwise the outdoor courtyard would have been very nice. The tiny eating area just adjacent to the front desk does not really offer enough space for all hotel guests so some mornings we ate in "shifts". The staff is so nice and the cappuccino so wonderful, that nobody seemed to mind. The owner also has plans for expanding this public area of the hotel and we can't wait to go back to see the results. The location couldn't have been more convenient and directions for entering from the "back door" were helpful and easy to follow. It is a VERY short walk from the Vaporetto stop. It's in a very quiet area of Venice which we greatly appreciated, even during the low season (still many, many tourists). We'd stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: telie13
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stayed in Italy, and it was a lovely place with warm friendly people, wonderful service, and beautiful accomodations. The rooms were spacious, well appointed, and spotless, an excellent value for the money. I still get cravings for the breakfast. While being less extensive than usual hotel breakfasts in the U.S., every item was excellent, instead of having more of mediocre offerings like most US hotels. The staff were helpful and friendly, and went out of their way to make sure we had a good time, they even upgraded our room for two nights at no cost. I don't know what the previous reviewer's complaint was with the night watchman, he couldn't have been more friendly to us. I will be back to Venice, and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: fva17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo for 2 nights in January and we just loved the hotel, the location and the staff. We stayed in room at the first floor, which was very quite, extremely clean and had a fantastic bed. The location of the property was superb. Just a few minutes to walk to the Rialto bridge and a lot of wonderful shops. We contacted the hotel directly for our reservation and had no problems. The breakfast at the hotel is good and convenient. I would highly recommend the Hotel for a great stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. beware night guard”
Reviews.Author: Tonguetwister
Reviews.Content: Walter and Sandro are wonderful. we stayed in the smallest room, but it was still a good size (larger than other places in the 3star category). btw, this is a 2 star hotel that feels like a 3 star. the canal is a bit smelly outside, no problem inside. breakfast great. room great. one complaint is the night watch guy (neither of the owners) is very rude and you should try to avoid him. of course he is nice when owners are around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: swanfall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in mid December. Perfect, spacious room and bathroom. Great shower. Good breakfast. Sandro and Walter were very helpful and friendly. Wonderful time of year for Venice, no crowds, great weather, easy to pretend to be a local. Good location. Close to vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: siida
Reviews.Content: Believe what you read! Don't hesitate to book here. I couldn't wait to get home to write a wonderful review about this quaint hotel with services rivalling 5 star qualities. Since they have FREE internet access, I'm able to write this review. Even if you do not have your own computer, they (Walter, one of the owners and his staff) are happy to supply you with their laptop. The breakfast was more than sufficent, the first breakfast in Italy that actually made me full! (And we've been in Italy for over two weeks already.) The pictures are accurrate, and it could be hard to find if you miss the little sign when you exit the vaporetto, but that is part of the fun. Have a good spirit when looking for the VERY narrow street to the back door. The bathroom is very nice. The bed was comfortable. The shower was big..for european standards. The toilet paper is even soft! And everything is super clean. The staff is the most accomodating and helpful. Truly the BEST place to stay in all of Italy. It looks far from everything on the map, but we wandered the streets and managed to wander right into The Rialto Bridge and even to St. Mark's square in very little time. We really wish we could have stayed longer. I LOVE this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: claire-martin
Reviews.Content: I must say we were a little disappointed with our trip to this hotel. We have just returned from a three night stay in Venice and they were only able to squeeze us in on our last night. The other two nights we stayed at the Residence Corte Grimaldi (currently no. 3 on tripadvisor!) and that was far, far superior for both quality and location. I was very excited about coming to this hotel having read all the reviews on the website. However, after having a whole apartment to ourselves at the Grimaldi with two bathrooms, a wonderful picturesque balcony and a huge bedroom - we were so disappointed to get such a tiny room at the Al Ponte Mochenigo. We stayed in Room 7 which had a great, clean bathroom and nice furnishings but it felt very dark and dingy. Our room overlooked the alley outside and you could almost touch the buildings opposite. We were also woken by workmen at 8am apparently working in the alley. That said, the breakfast was fine, the staff were friendly and the whole place was very clean. I did manage to see inside one or two of the other bedrooms and they looked lovely. So I guess we were just unlucky with the room.

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite gem”
Reviews.Author: TanjaC
Reviews.Content: Having booked a trip to Venice for a rather fastidious (yet handsome ) boyfriend, who has a reputation of saying upon arrival to each and every (4*)hotel room "DON'T UNPACK". I was relived when, on the occasion we entered our room at (2*) HOTEL AL MOCENIGO, his comments were "WOW how wonderful". Previously when on holiday at other destinations, I have wondered passed other hotels and wished i was staying there instead. Whilst in Venice however, I did not wish I was anywhere other than AL PONTE MOCENIGO. Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is truly wonderful. The service is impeccable. The staff are all fantastic, helpful and above all friendly. If you ever get the opportunity to visit Venice, please make every effort to stay at Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo - if you do, then try to arrive, as we did by water taxi, which was absolute fun (although a little expensive)! There are so many sights to be seen, museums to visit, and restaurants to dine at and at the end of each day you can look forward to returning to your temporary home (from home), Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. Thank you Walter and Sandro. Your wonderful night staff and household staff are a credit to you and your hotel. Bravo! Arriverderci. Tanja

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: KC6270
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. Walter and Sandro were fantastic hosts. They provided us with great recommendations for local restaurants that had great food. The hotel itself was so very quaint, romantic and VERY CLEAN! We had two rooms between my family. A small double and a triple superior. Both rooms were very nice and very clean. The triple superior was BIG! We also needed a early taxi to the airport which they arranged for us as well. We can't wait to go back and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location grear place”
Reviews.Author: JamieW
Reviews.Content: Very friendly lovely hotel in great location. Just five minutes from Rialto (or 2.5hrs if you go in every shop in between the hotel and the Rialto !) and plenty of restaurants within short walk too - and vaporetto stop just one minute away. Staff very helpful and accommodated a range of requests, something for everyone at breakfast and lovely room too (although the bed wasn't the largest in the world !!) Would happily return

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MelbinLondon
Reviews.Content: I can only add to all the positive reviews already given for the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. We stayed for 2 nights in a standard room on the ground floor. It was beautifully decorated, quiet and the bathrooms were modern and very clean. Breakfast was very good - warm apricot croissants, rolls, cereal, yoghurt, juice and fantastic coffee. Service was outstanding - Walter and Sandro were really friendly, recommended great restaurants and gave good advice on everything else (quickest walking routes etc). The location is also very good - about 5 minutes walk from Rialto Bridge but the surrounding streets are also great for a wander. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, it really is as good as the reviews suggest and the value (â‚¬90 a night) is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: WHartford
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based upon other Trip Advisor reviews and loved it. As everyone has said, the hotel is charming, the owners (Walter and Sandro) are SOOO helpful, and the price is an extraordinary value! Details: 1. arrival - we took the #5 city bus from the airport and then the #1 vaparetto right to the hotel - took 1/2 hour total. This is all explained on the directions section on the hotel web site - very easy and there are even signs posted for the hotel once you get off the vaparetto so you can't get lost. 2. vaparetto - buy a value pass for 1 day or 3 or how ever long you are staying, as it gets expensive! We bought the orange venice card and got into lots of museums, churches, the casino and all the vaparetto rides we could use for 3 days. 3. hotel - our room (10) was gorgeous and immaculate! You can hear footstep noise from room above (no carpets on these traditional Venetian floors!), as well as the downstairs buzzer, but we did not find it too disturbing. Bathroom was also great - very clear and modern. A little terrace overlooking the courtyard was charming! 4. breakfast - warm rolls, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, cereals...all served in the little side lobby - delicious! 5. the area - the hotel is in a charming residential area and so convenient to the vaparetto - a great combo! You'll get lost a little, but that is part of the fun! 6. little extras - free use of lap top, no charge for a one-time soda from the minibar or to use the phone for an 800 call, guidebooks all around the hotel to borrow, and wonderful advice both pre-trip and during the trip from Walter and Sandro - thank you both so much!! 7. recommendations - bellinis at Harry's bar - expensive but really fun; a visit to St Giorgio Maggiore Island - really cool and a great view from the tower for only 3 euros; dinner at Fischerreria Toscana (sp?) off Rialto - great food!; souvenier glass- reasonable and so prettyl; Frari Church - great art in its original setting; and the Doge's Palace for history! Worth skipping are the modern museum (Ca Pesaro right near the hotel) and the Correr Museum. The city is small and you can really see most everything in 2-3 days if you stay on the main island. We had a vaparetto strike one day and walked everywhere with no problem. We would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “So glad Tripadvisor pointed us to this special place”
Reviews.Author: WyomingFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel Nov. 20-22 and enjoyed every aspect. It is located in a mostly local-occupied neighborhood. We spent hours wandering the beautiful passages in the surrounding area. Our family of 7 occupied rooms #5, #6, #7 which were located together at one end of the second floor. That provided enough privacy that we did not have to worry about our children disturbing the other guests. I would most highly recommend Al Ponte. It is small enough that one feels as though they have a personal connection to the staff and other guests. Every detail is perfectly planned and presented.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: Celestial1
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Venice, you MUST stay here!! It is fantastic in every way and worth far more than the 2 stars it has above the door. AND worth more than the 90â‚¬ a night, although im not complaining!! I originally booked it after seeing the rave reviews on Trip Advisor and am extremely glad I did so now. It is a 5 min walk to the Rialto Bridge and right on the canal near the San Stae Vaporetto (water bus) stop, which will get you everywhere with ease. It is spotlessly clean, very sophisticated and well decorated and cozy. Sandro and Walter who own the hotel were more than helpful when booking restaurants etc and were very friendly. The Turkish Bath was lovely too but was so hot!! : ) The breakfast was yummy, they bake fresh bread and croissants every morning and we had this delivered to our rooms every day along with fresh fruit, teas, coffee, youghurts etc. This was lovely, especially as we spent every lunchtime and dinnertime scoffing big meals - it was the perfect amount. They also kindly lent us a laptop which had wireless internet connection, we just took it to our room until we were finished. I suppose its not just the beautiful hotel but the small things also that made our stay so fantastic. We give the hotel 5 stars and will definitely be back!! When we arrived at Piazza Le Roma, we got a 72 hour pass for a mere 25â‚¬ which lasted our whole stay and got us everyewhere - over to the Islands Murano and Burano and the amazing island of San Michele (an island which is solely a cemetry and church). Might sound a bit sick but its beautiful and very well cared for. Murano is worth visiting to watch how they make the glass etc but Burano was pretty dull and a mission on the boat, so would not have bothered with that looking back now!! The pictures you see on the "Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo" website are exactly what the hotel is like, so I have attached a couple of sight seeing photos instead. Hope this helps you make your mind up because you will not be dissapointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and situation”
Reviews.Author: sgbpillar
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our five days here. The hotel is extremely conveniently situated and offers tremendous value for money. Our room was great, with a lovely bathroom and exciting bits of technology like a key that shuts the lights off as you leave your room. Pluses are the excellent atmosphere and service from both owners and staff; small minuses were that our room was too hot and the breakfast fairly basic. But this is a splendid place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “As good as all of the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: samsonite
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for four nights at this hotel, entirely on the recommendations of tripadvisor reviews. I booked a standard double on the ground floor of the hotel (I think there are about four rooms on this floor). The room itself was quite spacious (room for a desk, dresser, full couch, and large queen bed with headboard canopy) and well-decorated; the bathroom extremely large for European standards. Water pressure and temperature in the shower (no bath) was perfect. Oddly, my bed (two twin mattresses pushed together in traditional style) was a bit uneven. Luckily, I was on my own and could choose which firmness I preferred! A warning about the ground floor rooms - you are right off of the main lobby, near the back door (which allows guests in via an audible buzzer), and next to the tiny breakfast area. My room (#3) was just outside the breakfast nook; in the mornings you could hear the occasional clank of china and silverware and loudly chatting guests. (This didn't bother me, since I was awake and up by 07.30/08.00 when breakfast preparations began, but don't book any of these rooms if you're a light sleeper.) My particular room also did not have much sunlight, which did not bother me as I spent all daylight hours sightseeing. They do have, I believe, upper rooms overlooking the canal. (Definitely book well ahead of time, even in the off-season). As promised by all other reviewers, the hotel is charming with a great location in Santa Croce. It is less than a minute's walk to the San Stae vaporetto stop, which is serviced by the #1ACTV vaporetto (also the "N" service at night). (A note to first-time visitors: the #1 zigzags to stops on both sides of the canal which makes it extremely useful!). With all of the walking you will be doing, the hotel's courtyard is a nice quiet place to seek refuge and read up on your next bit of sightseeing or to write postcards. Another bonus of the hotel's location is how QUIET it is in the evenings and the mornings. I did not hear any delivery boats or working boats going up and down the small canal by the hotel. (Many other sestieres had boats zooming up and down with deliveries starting 06.00 in the morning.) The hotel breakfast service is from 8.00-10.00 which, although limited, is an easy way to get a quick coffee, pastries (very good and large brioches), cereals, biscuits, yogurts, and fruit (these are less than impressive - perhaps the time of year). The rooms also did provide a small mini-fridge stocked with water and soft drinks at very reasonable prices. Both Walter and Sandro (as well as the nightdesk man, Giancarlo) were friendly, helpful, and patient . The value was unbelievable (e90/nt for single guest), especially off-season. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a comfortable, warm and friendly, hassle-free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, high quality inn, clean, clean, clean”
Reviews.Author: pyegirl
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews. This hotel is a gem and is an incredible value for the money. We stayed in a junior suite in late May while we were in town for a wedding (Euros 165/night). We were surprised to find that one has to start early if you want to have a room during a weekend in May. May apparently is high season due to the pleasant weather. We were only able to get one evening at this hotel, and even then I think it was because someone happened to cancel one night at the "last minute" in March. So, we stayed two nights at La Calcina and the last night here. The hotel is very, very nice. The rooms are beautiful and there is not an ounce of wear or tear on any of the decor. The rooms are beautiful--ours had a sort of taffeta-like green wall paper, matching canopy bed, and matching painted wardrobe. All beautifully done in terms of decor. The rooms, including the bathrooms, are immaculate. You could eat off the floors in this hotel. I wish my house were this clean! Our room had a tiny balcony that overlooked the front courtyard where breakfast is served. It was large in size, included a very pretty couch, and wardrobe and a roomy bathroom with all new fixtures (ncluding bidet). As I said, everything was perfect. The management is also very friendly and helpful. I coudln't say enough good things about this property. Its small and cozy and is in a very sweet neighborhood that is off the beaten track. We stayed in the Dorosduro for the other two nights. Although I really adore this hotel and wouldn't change a thing about the property itself, I really did prefer the location of the other hotel better. Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is on a tiny canal (where the water doesn't seem to move very much--if you get what I mean) and the alleyways around the hotel are fairly tight and dark. It's perfectly safe, but is a contrast to our experience at the Dorosduro which is much more spacious and breezy due to the large Guidecca canal. There are very nice "neighborhood" squares near this hotel, so its possible to have an off -the-beaten track experience (if such a thing is possible in Venice at all). Still, you will be very lucky to get a room at this lovely little hotel. I want to only be positive about our experience there and we feel so lucky to have had the opportunity to stay there. Try it. You'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem !!!”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Abroad
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem! My mother and I only stayed one night in Venice at Al Ponte Mocenigo, but it was memorable. Walter and Sandro are outstanding hosts. The room was charming and comfortable, and the staff so welcoming and considerate. Most importantly, both the bedroom and bathroom were extremely clean. And the location was wonderful! Although the hotel is a bit further from Piazza San Marco, it's easy walking distance to Rialto Bridge and Market, and another 15-20 min walk to the square. The location was my main concern, but I was so pleased to be off the beaten tourist track, where the city becomes more affordable and less noisy. We look forward to returning to Al Ponte Mocenigo again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Small and Friendly Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: random_bloke
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a long weekend in Venice, having finally managed to get sufficiently organised to take my Mum after years of thinking about it. I was looking for a small, quiet, friendly hotel and I found it in the Al Ponte Mocenigo. The hotel is nothing too flashy, but at the same time a very pleasant. We took what I think was one of the smaller twin rooms on the ground floor. The room was very nicely decorated and the bathroom immaculate - my impression was that the place has been recently renovated by the quality and condition of the fixtures and fittings. The staff are extremely freindly and helpful - they went out of their way to book restaurants, provide directions, and generally answer any query we had - most impressive! The hotel does not serve evening meals (at least it did not whilst we were there). Breakfast is a continental affair (cereal, breads, fruit, yoghurt, etc) and weather permitting, this can be taken in a the outdoor courtyard, otherwise there is a small indoor area by reception. I think there is also the option of having it in your room. In terms of location, it is literally a minutes walk from the San Stae water bus stop and about 10 minutes walk to Rialto. Nearby there are a number of good restaurants, cheaper than those close to the main attractions. We went with the hotels recommendations are were not dissapoionted.
