The only negative comment I have is that staying in the ground floor room, you do tend to here people arriving back at the hotel at night. There is a door buzzer which is audible from the room, and then the inevitable chatter before folk retire. This did not overly concern me, but if you are sensitive to noise then perhaps you should avoid this room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: adillo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo is very conveniently located right off of the San Stae Vaporetto Stop. It is a charming hotel and the owners are very helpful and pleasant. Beautiful, immaculate rooms with a very large spotless bathroom. Couldn't have asked for more! We stayed in Room Number 6 which has very high ceilings, two large windows overlooking the small canal. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JulieannMc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only two nights September 11th and 12th, which wasn't long enough. Venice was magnificent and the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo was just the perfect place to stay. It was close enough to everything; only a five minute stroll from the Rialto Bridge, and about ten minutes by vaporetto to St. Marks Square. It was situated in a quiet neighbourhood which gave you the opportunity to see the real Venice. The two gentlemen who run the Hotel were very helpful and endeavoured to do whatever they could to make our stay a pleasant one. Breakfast was enjoyable and served in a beautiful courtyard. A perfect way to begin the day. We can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: giulietta429
Reviews.Content: The owners were very responsive throughout the booking process and pre-arrival communications. When we arrived in Venice, all public transportation went on strike, so we had to walk from the train station to the hotel. We called and got directions (excellent, especially since we forgot our map of Venice at home). The room (a triple superior, bright red room pictured on the website) was large, but a bit dark. We knew that our windows faced a very narrow alley (I imagine we would have loved a room with a balcony overlooking the small canal nearby or any room with a bit of a view). I liked the spacious, modern bathroom. I found it a bit strange that we had to turn in our keys before going out. The breakfast, served in the courtyard, was nice. We particularly enjoyed the apricot jam fileld cornetti. Contrary to some other reviewers, I did not find the hotel to be as conveniently located. Throughout our two-day (and three-night) stay in Venice, we almost always found ourselves too far away from the hotel to stop by and change or have a glass of wine in the courtyard. By this point in our vacation, we have seen enough churches and art, and just wanted to wander through Venice, and spend time on Piazza San Marco. Next time, I think we'll try for a property that's a bit closer to the center. It is, however, very convenient to the vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding personnel”
Reviews.Author: kharbour
Reviews.Content: Small w/lots of personality. Walter (co-owner) was extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations, rsvr and directions--even walked us to a restaurant first night there. Met great people staying there in the lovely courtyard for breakfast everyday. Room was very clean and kept perfectly. Very close to the vaporetto and Rialato area. Really a nice place to stay. k harbour, corpus christi, tx

Reviews.Title: “A real find! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: chazuni
Reviews.Content: My partner and I want to express how pleased we were with this hotel. We travel to Europe often and this property is a fantastic choice in expensive Venice. The staff and owners are wonderful and accommodating. The property interior is charming and the courtyard a delight. The location is perfect. It has a vaporetto stop 2 minutes walk away and many good restaurants within walking distance. We found it a real plus to be away from the maddening crowds but just a short walk or vaporetto ride away from the heart of Venice. I am recommending this hotel to everyone I know planning to visit Venice. We hope to return again. Ciao! C& W Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “4 star comfort-2 star price”
Reviews.Author: Maryland_Bob
Reviews.Content: Hands down this is one of the nicest hotels we've experienced in Europe and at a suprisingly affordable price. Inkeepers Walter and Sandro converted a private residence into a charming 10 room hotel in 2005. Everything is totally new and modern, except for the antiques and artifacts left behind by the former owner which have been nicely incorporated into the restoration. There are 4 rooms on the ground floor and 6 on the second. We stayed in Room #4 on the ground floor and found it to be bright and spacious with a well equiped bath. Standard amenities include mini bar, TV, air conditioning, phone, hair dryer, etc. A subsantial continental style breakfast is served in a lovely outdoor courtyard including freshly baked breads. The location is very convient just a few yards from the S. Stae boat stop and within walking distance of Rialto Bridge. For those arriving with luggage there is a service entrance that involves no steps. Simply walk straight ahead as you disembark the boat down a narrow street (to the right of S. Stae Church) and take your first left. The service entrance has a bell. We didn't know that and struggled a bit upon arrival at the main entrance. There are plenty of nice restaurants and bars on the surrounding sidestreets and the hotel itself, being situated just off the Grand Canal, is very quiet. The inkeepers are extremely pleasant and accomodating and speak English well. This hotel is highly recommended in the under $200 price range. In fact, it compares well with those costing much more. We paid E130 a night for a double in September.

Reviews.Title: “The spirit of Venice”
Reviews.Author: elissamae
Reviews.Content: We've been to Venice three times now and this is the best hotel we've stayed in - and it's also in one of the most delightful and buzzy 'real' areas of Venice - a little away from the tourist traps and so much more charming because of that (but there are still some great bars, restaurants and shops). The hotel is lovely - we had the junior suite and it was truly beautiful. Silk lined walls, stunning four poster and furniture, spa bath (and the toiletries handily included bath fizzers for bath fanatic me!), and a tiny but delightful balcony overlooking the pretty little courtyard where breakfast (gorgeous apricot croissants and really frothy cappucino) is taken. The owners, Walter and Sondro, and indeed all of the staff we met, were consideration and charm personified. One morning my husband was 'blessed' by a pigeon whilst we were breakfasting, to my huge amusement of course, but it was almost as though the owners felt responsible, they were so concerned about his shirt! They also gave us some brilliant restaurant recommendations - if it's nice enough to eat outside, definitely try Trattoria Al Ponte del Megio which is quite close by, the staff were so friendly and the food delicious. Also scrummy fritto misto of fish and great service too at Vecio Fritilin. General 'secret' for those who've not been to Venice before (or even those who have) - try to get hold of a copy of 'Chow Venice' (I got mine from Amazon a couple of years ago): it's really handy for finding really special eating places where the Venetians go themselves, and where the food is fabulous and not necessarily 'arm and a leg' prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden secret!”
Reviews.Author: LuBelle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at this quaint, yet chic, hotel off the beaten path in Venice. The crowds were unbelieveable around San Marco, but this boutique hotel, only a few vaporetto stops away, was in a quiet neighborhood with excellent restaurants within walking distance. It's located on a quiet street just a few steps away from the S. Stae stop which made finding it very easy...especially with luggage in tow. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We found the enchanted courtyard a wonderful place to start the day with a light breakfast and ending the day with a bottle of wine. The rooms are FABULOUS! They were the largest we stayed in during our trip, and the bathrooms are INCREDIBLE! The decor of the rooms is in traditional Venetian style with silk fabric on the walls, gilded mirrors and comfortable beds and chairs. The marble bathrooms were very large, clean and modern. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and will stay there everytime I visit Venice. You will be missing out on warm, helpful hospitality in a beautiful, quiet hotel if you don't stay there, too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Arimarc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved this hotel and the service. The owners Walter and Sandro were excellent hosts and really helpful. This was part of our honeymoon stay and everything we read about the reviews is true. The rooms are spacious, clean, and charming. The value for the money can't be beat in Venice and not to mention the location which is tucked away in the heart of a more residential area yet so close to the busy tourist sights and squares. Breakfast was also as good and delightful as we read about. Thank you Walter and Sandro and we look forward to staying with again if we are lucky enough to travel to Venice on another trip. Ari and Michaela

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be top of the table”
Reviews.Author: Mim74
Reviews.Content: We originally booked the San Clemente Palace but after reading reviews on TA decided we would go for this one. Very glad we did. Lovely little hotel.Good size room, well decorated and the bathroom was a decent size, unusual for Venice.A lovely terrace where we had breakfast in the morning and a glass of chilled prosecco in the evening. Good bars and restaurants, lovely pizza place a short walk away. friendly and helpful staff. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JCooks
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such hospitality before by the owners, Walter and Sandro. The hotel itself is small (only 10 rooms) and surprisingly has a rating of only a 2 * but the rooms are more on par of a 4 * establishment. I am sure this will change in the future, as it is well deserved. Breakfast in the morning in the courtyard is a must, and was a lovely start to each day. All the staff on the front desk are extremely knowledgeable and were very helpful in recommending some fantastic restaurants and the journey back via the waterbus and bus was made easy as Sandro found out the times of both which made the return journey stress free. A little tip, take a water taxi from the airport to the hotel (drop off is near the San Stae vaporetto stop) it was a lovely way to arrive, its quite expensive (around 80 euros), but well worth the expense !!! We will definately be returning in the near future !!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves and will soon have 4 stars - don't miss the opportunity!”
Reviews.Author: LisaGoldsmith
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel with the help of TripAdvisor and Venere(--). Reviews indicated that this 2 star hotel (price) is a 4 star experience. The rooms are spacious and well appointed with everything a traveler needs; comfortable beds, excellent linens, airconditioning, etc. The service is personal - you feel like a guest in Walter's house. The breakfast is VERY nice with fresh fruit and juice and nice choice of croissants and cereal and excellent coffee. The highlight of the experience is the setting - behind Chisea San Stae (where the vaporetto stops), down a fun alley (well signed), press the door bell and enter a beautiful palazzo with marble floors, statuary, and art with a canal front entrance and bridge front (note: al ponte) entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Look no further....”
Reviews.Author: Honkycat
Reviews.Content: We also booked on the basis of TA reviews and couldn't have been happier with this hotel. Beautiful room, spotless bathroom, fantastic location near vaparetto stop.... and on and on. The staff are superb. Sandro was extremely helpful and the young guys on the night desk superb... especially Giovani who is a member of one of the ancient original Venetian families and was so helpful. Don't hesitate... it really is the best combination of location, price and service. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “A great respite in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kbaerliny
Reviews.Content: Within a few yards of the San Stae Vaparetto Stop and a 5 minute walk from the Rialto bridge. Welcomed by one of the two owner business partners, Sandro or Walter, this was a lovely hotel in a perfect location. Breakfast in the courtyard from 8:00-10:00 was bountiful with Fresh rolls and croissants, fresh whole fruit, cheese, juices, and cereals with coffee and a smile was perfect. The staff spoke english and were most helpful and knowledgable on Venice. Worthy of more stars!!! Suggest you get up early and walk 4 minutes to the fresh fish and produce market between 7:30 and 9:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Spot - Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: SanRafael2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off the S. Stae vaporetto stop - walk staight off the boat about 50 paces to a very small entry between buildings (see my picture- turn left where you see the building jutting out further on the left side then down the alley to a door on the right). A beautiful hotel with a lovely courtyard. The rooms (I peeked in a few) are all nicely decorated with rich colors and nice funishings, and the bathrooms are extremely large by European standards with contemporary fixtures and tile. The air conditioning was very welcomed given the humid summer weather. All you meet at this hotel are extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast, taken in the courtyard, was standard European fare with the addition of outstanding warm apricot croissants. The hotel also helped us find a dry cleaner, one stop away by vaporetto, and we were able to get our garments back in one day. We loved the local restaurants: La Zucca (absolutely hands down one of my best meals in 3 weeks), and an excellent pizza spot called Il Refolo. We enjoyed hanging out near these two restaurants in a piazza and watching the locals. If you want an outstanding hotel that is away from the maddening crowds -- try this one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jemanchi
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo! It's location is superb - just a few steps from the vaporetto and in a quieter, yet still happening part of Venice. We loved San Marco, but were always glad to leave the tourist droves behind and go back to our neighborhood! The staff was wonderful - great breakfast - beautiful room - and yes, the bathroom is great! I would highly recommend this hotel and would never stay anywhere else if we return (and we will - we loved Venice!). Let the owner make restaurant suggestions - superb! A wonderful start to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Pay no attention to the 2-star rating”
Reviews.Author: Angostura
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is exactly what we wanted in Venice: out of the main tourist areas, in a more residential area, but still only 15 minutes walk to San Marco. We stayed in #10, which was palatially huge, with a four-poster bed, a marble-tiled bathroom with whirlpool tub, and a little balcony overlooking the courtyard. The floor has a bit of a slope to it, but the building IS a few hundred years old, so it's understrandable. We were fortunate enough to be able to enjoy breakfast in the courtyard each of the three days we stayed there, but they'll deliver breakfast to your room if the weather's less pleasant. The area is very charming, and off the normal tourist track. It's only 3-4 vaporetto stops from Piazzale Roma or the train station (yes, you can roll luggage onto the vapo), and about 1 minute from the S. Stae stop. And if you take the back way in (clear directions on the website) you won't have to haul bags over any bridges. The neighborhood is mostly residential (al least by Venetian standards), so you actually stand a chance of hearing some Italian spoken in the nearby restaurants. The area immediately across the canal from here (Canareggio) is also worth checking out. I'd recommend Alla Vedova (in a small alley across the Strada Nuova from the S. Marcuola vapo stop) for some pre-meal cichetti, and nearby Vini da Giorgio for a great meal at reasonable(ish) prices and an excellent wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Italy on our trip”
Reviews.Author: SwedeFinn
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 2 weeks long trip in Italy. This wonderful small hotel was far the best on the whole trip. Its close to a vaporetto stop, its silent, clean, and has wonderful rooms. The breakfast in the morning was fantastic.Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Gem”
Reviews.Author: augieToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel and the two young men who run it. We arrived from Toronto on a rainy afternoon, after spending too many hours dealing with late flights, missed connections, lost luggage and an argument with the water taxi operator who refused to take us directly to the hotel's water gate, although we gave him printed instructions and 90 Euros to do so. We must have looked like two drowned rats when we appeared at the front entrance after dragging our luggage over two little bridges. (We had arranged in advance for the water taxi because after four days in Venice we were going on a cruise which required many different types of clothing, and even with one lost suitcase, we still had way too much luggage to carry in Venice) On arrival, we were met by Sandro who instantly had our luggage in our room, a glass of wine in our hands, a dinner reservation made and a promise to deal with the airline over our missing suitcase. The room was large, elegantly furnished and immaculately clean. The bathroom was wonderful with beautiful marble tiles and very modern fixtures. The hotel is exactly as pictured on the website. The courtyard is a great place to start your day, and the breakfast is good with lots of fresh fruit available. Walter and Sandro could not have been more helpful. One or both was always in attendance during the day. Our weather improved dramatically after the first day, and we had a wonderful time exploring the city. The hotel is locatated within a stones throw of the Vaparetto stop, and close to many fine restaurants. On our departure, Walter and Sandro arranged for a water taxi to arrive at their water door, and take us directly to the cruise ship. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and I hope that I can go back again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel you will find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can only hope that when I am fortunate to find myself in Venice again, I will be lucky to stay at this hotel again! Seems like from the reviews that the word is definately out and everyone knows about it. I am happy for the wonderful owners Saundro and Walter because they are nice, helpful and much deserving of success, but worried that it may mean booking a room here difficult to come by! The rooms are gorgeous, decorated in gilded, glamorous Venetian style of bold colors, Murano glass chandeliers, fabric walls. We had the red triple superior room for 2 nights and it was huge. After some of the smaller rooms we had stayed in Italy, this felt outright decadent! Our last night was in the green superior double room, also wonderfully decorated, smaller but with a great balcony overlooking a canal. Breakfast as reported has great Cappucino, delicious Croissants with melted marmalade inside, all served in a soothing and lovely courtyard. Literally just steps from S. Stae Vaparetto stop (at the stop, go forward about 50 ft. and take the 1st alley on the left - very narrow alley - about 1/2 way down is a buzzer for the hotel and that lets you in the back way which is very helpful with luggage), a blessing not having to go far for one, to find the hotel, and two, for not having to travel around Venice with your luggage. 5 minute walk to the Rialto bridge and 5 more minutes (unless like me you are doing some serious window shopping) to Piazza San Marco. We had an itinerary that we stuck to more or less for our trip to Italy but when we got to Venice, it was thrown out and we just wandered and did what inspired us. We missed going to Murano and Borano and seeing the Accedemia and I hope to do that when we return but honestly Venice is so magical, you can spend your entire time, as we did, just wandering and not be disappointed. And definately splurge on the gondola ride. All I can say is it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Al Ponte Mocenigo”
Reviews.Author: ChiTownSteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the privelege to stay 3 nights late May at the Al Ponte Mocenigo. The hotel is without question as advertised and raved about in all previous reviews. From the time I made my reservation in early Jan 2006 to the time of our arrival I had communicated with them on occassion...and on each and every occassion all issues/questions/concert ticket reservations were handled rapidly and with the utmost professionalism. The hotel itself is absolutely one of the most charming and well cared for small hotels I have come across. The outside courtyard was my wifes favorite outdoor space on our entire vacation, just a perfect place for breakfast or a glass or two of wine after a long day of sightseeing and before dinner. They have wine, beer and other drinks that they can serve you, but also had nothing against us bringing a bottle we had purchased from a local shop, and provided a couple of glasses for us. I believe we had room #5 the double superior with the balcony on the canal. The room was great with what looked like 17-20 foot original wood beamed ceiling, large armoire which easily accommadated our belongings, a comfortable double bed with firm mattress and great pillows, small fridge with minibar, and absolutely huge and modern bathroom(and this is taking into consideration both European and American standards). I would also like to add that the room and bathroom were absolutely spotless....by far the best room service out of the 4 hotels we stayed at during our Italian vacation. Either Walter & Sandro(the owners) were always present during the day time, and were there to answer any questions we might have had. One can tell that they take absolute pride in their business and want to give their guests the ultimate Venetian experience. By the way it was a very easy walk to the main tourist areas of Venice and at the same time very pleasant to get away from the hustle of bustle of those areas in the evening, open up our balcony doors and enjoy the sounds of a side canal in Venice. Cheers to Walter & Sandro and to the Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo....HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “#1 Best Small Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: emma123
Reviews.Content: Forget the rest. This is the secret gem in Venice, and based on the growing list of raves, the word is out. This is a great small hotel with big, beautiful rooms filled with character and taste, very large, spotless and modern bathrooms, all the amenities of a four star hotel, including mini bar, a courtyard on a canal and two charming hosts to help with anything you need. Right on the St. Stae Vaporetto stop 100 feet away down the main street there is a tiny alley with signs leading you to the hotel. Don't let that entrance bother you. It's the back way, but at least you don't have to drag your suitcases up and over any bridges. We booked into room 9, which is a large red bedroom converted from a kitchen. Beautiful and quiet, with a great bathroom. No view, but we didn't mind at all. Venice is so small, the Rialto Bridge is 5-7 minute walk and St. Marks is 5-7 minutes further, if you don't stop to shop. We loved being away from the hustle and bustle. Buon Viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay, and value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a Gem. I will always stay there when I go to Venice. They were complete Gentelmen. A very welcome feel. My teen age son loved this hotel. So easy to get to, and find.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Chippyqueen
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just returned following a 3 day stay and absolutely loved this hotel. I booked it following recommendations on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We booked fairly last minute and subsequently got a room on the ground floor near Reception which I think had been adapted for disabled guests. The only problem with the room is that it had no view and was opposite the area where breakfast is pepared, if you are a light sleeper like myself you could easily be disturbed. The room itself was spotless, modern with a TV, hairdryer, ensuite bathroom (shower only) and a safe. Location wise it was excellent, literally 30 seconds walk from San Stae Vaporetto stop which can have you at St. Marks Square in less than 10 mins. However the best bit is that it was away from the main tourist drag and there were many pretty areas of Venice less touristy but equally as stunning. The hotel staff were very welcoming and couldn't do enough to help. We had fabulous weather and breakfast was served in the courtyard, this consisted of pastries, cereal, yoghurt, fruit and as many Cappucinos as you could drink! Would totally recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Venice - don't be deceived by the 2* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: scott73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May of 2006, actually staying here right now! I have to say that at least up to now, this has been one of the best hotel experiences that i have had. We have just arrived from staying at the Park Lane Hotel in London and Le Meridian in Monaco and this hotel is truly amazing. It is a very short walk from the vaparetto stop and the directions we were given made this place very easy to get to. We arrived at 8:30 in the morning, obviously too early to check in and we were able to leave our bags, which were later brought to our room, given a map of the area (a very nice map showing exactly where the hotel is so that you can't get lost) and given directions to the fish and produce market. This was a very interesting market, which i would recommend that you do not miss. We had lunch and returned at approximately 1:00, our room was ready and our bags were already in it. The bathroom in our room exceeded what we had at both the Park Lane hotel (London) and Le Meridian (Monaco). The room is well decorated and the bed is comfortable. We will be back to Venice, and next time for an extended vacation. When we are back we will be back at this hotel. I will be sure however to book this in advance, because it appears to book up quite fast.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: andasamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in March and loved this hotel. It is close to the Rialto/San Marco area (10-15 minute walk) but in a quieter area of the city. It's also very near a vaporetto stop, so if you've been wandering around all day and don't want to retrace your footsteps, just return by vaporetto! Sandro, Walter and staff were all very friendly. Sandro recommended a fabulous restaurant - Al Ponte del Megio our first night. (We should have asked him where to eat on our second night too - after our Ghost Walk tour, we ended up eating at Antico Caffe Ristorante Al Buso just off the Rialto bridge - do NOT eat there, what a touristy rip-of with terrible food and worse service!) In spite of the one bad meal, we thoroughly enjoyed Venice and the Al Ponte Mocenigo. Our only regret was that we did not have time to stay and enjoy the hospitality longer!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: jamtam
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel. We had one of the suites for two nights and it was beautiful. Very close to the water bus stop which made it perfect to reach all the sights. The courtyard garden is so pretty, too bad the weather was not good. We did not have the opporunity to enjoy our breakfast outside. The staff and owners were very helpful. Definitely will go back next time we are lucky enough to visit Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights , a family with two kids and we found this place to suit our needs perfectly. The size and furnishing of the room was great. The bathroom was quite luxurious. Quiet location but easy to access all the sights. Staff were most helpful and helped out with their local knowledge. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value!”
Reviews.Author: Calliopea
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and simple, in an excellent location with a fantastic staff that was helpful and cared about what they did. Great cappucino too! Plus the bathrooms look new and they have some of the biggest rooms for price. Truly one of the hidden gems of Venice!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Al Ponte Mocenigo
HotelInfo.Address: S. Croce 2063, 30135 Venice, Italy
